Reviews.Title: “25th Anniverssary trip”
Reviews.Author: jyanks
Reviews.Content: Spent our 25th wedding annivessary at what was Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers. Unbeknownst to us, they changed to a Hilton property during our 5 night stay. We felt no effects of the change. The hotel was excellent. We had booked a King studio room. Upon checking in, those rooms were all booked so we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. As soon as we walked into the room, I felt like Michael Douglas in the movie Wall Street! Oppulent! Beautiful! Huge! 2 person whirlpool tub in the bedroom! Full kitchen! Beautiful accent lighting! Walk to PH casino no more than 5 minutes from the 11th floor room, inside the Miracle Mile Shop mall. Very convenient to every where. Highly recommended property.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: Rhino_Labeling
Reviews.Content: A recent addition to the Hilton family and overall was a pleasant stay. Not sure if all the rooms there are this way, but I stayed in a Jr Suite on the 50th floor with an incredible view. The room was recently refurbished and very comfortable with nice amenities. The only negative about this experience was the front desk experience during check-in and check-out. VERY SLOW and under staffed. Also, no coffe shop/kiosks on site.

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby, but good fun!”
Reviews.Author: DBatten121
Reviews.Content: If you want a Vegas party experience with a group of friends, or like a large room to stay in, this is the place for you! We found a deal that upgraded us to a one bed apartment. The place was vast. Full kitchen, breakfast bar that seats 8, corner leather sofa that looks out to the full size windows. Bedroom was big with chaise longue, and jacuzzi. Bathroom was well appointed. The living room window can be covered with an automatic blind which doubles as a projection screen. The hotel is a bit tired and shows signs of wear, hopefully Hilton will sort this as they rebrand the place. It would have been good to have easy iPod connectivity into the sound system, we had to pull the cables apart to sort it out!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Carla T
Reviews.Content: Words to the wise: -Check on your reservation numerous times, the hotel likes to cancel bookings for no reason -Don't expect an email confirmation of your reservation, you won't get one -Get ready to have $100 per room added to your bill in incidentals, front desk & phone reservation operators do not mention this - DO NOT turn on the jacuzzi tub unless you want remnants of the past guest blasted at you - DO NOT try to call housekeeping they won't answer the phone, or the front desk after hours for that matter - DO NOT expect any actual help from the concierge, inept is a kind statement - DO NOT expect to be treated with any level of competence, concern or have a level of effort shown to correct any problem Shame on you Hilton for not valuing your customers, and putting someone off your brand of hotels for life.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, value, and location”
Reviews.Author: LGinMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Elara for the second time. On our first visit, and when we booked this trip, it was called PH Towers, but the ownership changed after we booked the trip. We got a great deal that included an upgrade to a suite--definitely the way to go! The room was enormous, with 5 TVs, a jacuzzi in the room, and a large kitchen. The hotel is located center-Strip (great for if you don't rent a car), very close to City Center, Bellagio, Paris/Ballys, Trop, and MGM. It's a short walk through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the Strip, which I actually prefer over having to navigate through a huge, smokey casino like you do at most hotels. These hotels (PH/Elara) cater to a younger crowd--seemed like most people here and in the casino were mid 20's-30's--and the restaurants/shopping were all more reasonably priced than other mid-Strip casinos like Aria and Bellagio. No trouble checking in early or checking out late, and excellent room service. We would definitely stay here again, especially if we get another good online deal.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites for a pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: Zach989
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party back in February (when it was still PH Towers), and we had the two bedroom suite. Our rate came out to be about $430/nt for President's Day weekend, which didn't seem to bad for how big this suite was. The good: - Full sized fridge with filtered water and ice - A projector that turns the blackout shades into a giant screen - Dishwasher for cleaning cups - Overall a big room. Fits 8 people very comfortably - Some good and inexpensive food options in the Miracle Mile mall downstairs. And ABC stores for buying only slightly overpriced booze The bad: - Two of the four beds are pullouts - They don't give you enough sheets and blankets for all the beds off the bat; you have to ask housekeeping for them. And some of those mattresses are pretty gross - Overall, the room was a little banged up. You can tell it's a party room, and they don't do too much maintenance on them - The granite table is incredibly heavy to move for drinking games. And that chandelier is directly at head level. Ouch - The blackout shades' motor stopped working the last night in one of the rooms If you're going to Vegas with a fairly big group, this is definitely a good option. It only came out to be about $30 more a night than getting two individual rooms, but you get the bigger kitchen. Plus, it's pretty moderately priced for being on the Strip. Oh, and tip: if you unplug the white cord from the wall behind the speaker box, you can plug in an iPod for playing music.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: withni7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elara last week. New to the Hilton family, Elara gets 5 stars from me. Location is great connected to the Miracle Mile shops and walking distance from all the best on the strip (Bellagio, Paris, Aria, Ceasar's). The reveiws that say this is a long walk to the strip are not accurate in my opinion (unless 10 mintues is a long walk to you). I had a "basic room" which include a fridge and microwave and THE BEST view you will get from any hotel in Vegas at such a cheap rate. Typically, you have to pay for a decent view. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows on one entire wall. Just fabulous. The view alone was enough to give it 5 stars. And again, I was in a "basic room".

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Brent R
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are there for any sort of sporting event, you have got to get this suite. When we booked it, we didn't even know that it had a floor to ceiling projector screen.(I'll upload pics) We spent a Lot of time in our room because of this! The bedrooms were really cool. The beds were huge! One of the bedrooms had a couch that could fold out into a bed, and the other had a chaise that at least one of us crashed on at random times, and that bedroom had a giant jacuzzi in it too, as well as a washer/dryer in the bathroom. The main living area of our 2-bedroom suite had 2 couches(one fold out) and a kitchen that was stocked with dishes and silverware. The view was awesome, and at night I could've spent hours just looking out the window. The walk to Planet Hollywood is a little long the first couple of times, but you get used to it, and who keeps track of time in Vegas anyway? This does appear to be a party place, because the people in the room next to ours had music going at ALL hours. We keep such a random sleep schedule when in Vegas though, it didn't bother us too much. All in all, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “top tower”
Reviews.Author: ANDIJIM
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week at the Planet Hollywood Towers (or now know as the Elara). Had a brilliant time. Hotel in an excellent location for the strip. The room was amazing...we had a 1 Bedroom King Suite. Jacuzzi in the room big comfortable bed. The view for the room was incredible, you could see the strip the airport and mountains all from the same window. The room had a washing machine/dryer a microwave a massive fridge with chilled water and ice machine, hairdryer, and 5 TV's.!!!! All mod cons supplied. There was also an iron and ironing board in the room. The hotel pool was also nice although a little windy when we stayed. They also provide towels for the pool area. We were lucky in as much we had 2 brilliant tour guides ...the couple we went with had been numerous times before...they also took us to a new museum in downtown Vegas called The Mob Museum worth a visit. We also flew Virgin Atlantic and they made us feel very comfortable. Vegas is so well worth the trip make sure it's on your list of places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the 2 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: richknebel
Reviews.Content: Short & sweet review: -BIG room -Great having the kitchen to sit & eat/drink at -High end feel, fancy rooms & bedding Cons: Still a long walk to the strip compared to Planet Hollywood (have stayed in both now) only downside, is a 10 minute walk to the strip.... if that is an issue. Didnt bother me this time that much, because this was my 7th stay in vegas and we didnt hit the strip as much as someone coming for the first time would be.

Reviews.Title: “First night was the worst night I've ever spent in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: katdav4
Reviews.Content: Be ready to party if you are staying here! We came here on a business/leisure trip.We decided to book because the towers have been converted to Hilton. My husband had to sleep because he had to work some while we were in Vegas. The first night after returning to our room we returned to a very loud neighbors so we decided rather than ruin their party we would just switch rooms! BIG MiSTAKE!!!! We got moved to a "non smoking" room that smelled like an ashtray! I felt like I had my face in an ashtray all night! Then the party started at 1 a.m. and did not end until 5 a.m.I think they called the 1-800 girls to your room! Uggh!!! It was the worst night sleep I had ever experienced. We even called security twice, apprently security doesn't care! We did go down and complain the next morning at 6:30 a.m. They immediately switched our room and upgraded us to a huge suite, which was really good with beautiful views of the Belliago fountains and of the Paris. I recommend if you stay here go for the suite in the beginning!!!! The regular rooms all have paper thin doors in between them and you can hear everything!!!! I will not stay here again even though they upgraded us! Stay at the Belliago or Caesars (they both were beautiful).

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great views”
Reviews.Author: Pghproud412
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Planet Hollywood Towers. The huge projector TV is great and having the kitchenette and table was extremely useful. This is a great location, just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: castro_boom
Reviews.Content: the room was very comfortable and had really cool decorations, the service was whatever. I was offer an upgrade to the top floor for a chance for a better view but 15% of the view was blocked by other buildings and 50% of the view was to parking structures and back streets. It does not have a casino or restaurants but is connected to the miracle nice which makes it nice because it sort of gives it direct access to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Planet!!! Will return!!”
Reviews.Author: Diorgirl71
Reviews.Content: On arrival approx 7pm on a Wednesday, we walked straight to the desk, where we were greeted by Carlos, very cheerful helpful and courteous. My husband explained that it was my birthday and our 1st Anniversary (it genuinely was), we had booked the 1 bedroomed suite, he had a look and got us an amazing room on the 28th floor, with fabulous views over towards, Paris, Bellagio fountains, Wynn and Encore. The suite had everything...immaculate, luxurious, accommodation. We spent 3 nights here, great access immediately from miracle Mile shops, which has lots of shops and eating places..Great location, central strip, has the perfect mix for a great stay...A special thank you to Carlos, who helped us sort out a problem we had with our cards and was extremeley professional!!! Would highly recommend PH Towers/Westgate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: NorthTXCouple
Reviews.Content: We booked several rooms at Planet Hollywood for a guys weekend in Las Vegas. The location of the hotel is great. It's a very nice property, but there are a few drawbacks. The rooms are sizable, but are showing some wear & tear (cracks, broken window blind, peeling, etc.). My shower head was damaged, sending water in every direction. Check-in & Check-out is average and there's usually a line...sometimes it's long. The casino is one of the loudest in Vegas. I also found it to be smokier than most of the newer casinos. Some or our group complained about their rooms being loud from the casino and/or street noise. I really didn't appreciate some of the extra charges. They tried to charge me the $13.99 wireless fee twice for each day, since they charge it for "each device". So, if I use the wireless for my laptop and phone, I'm paying $27.98/day. Please! The $25/day fee for using the gym is very unfortunate, although I'm sure I could have researched that before travelling. It being a guys trip, we really enjoyed the racy approach to the hotel & casino. PH employs dancers as entertainers throughout the casino. The dealers at PH are also dressed to really play up the T&A factor. Cleavage is pushed in the casino as much as the drinks. One of the restaurants, The Strip House, is decorated with photos of naked women. PH definitely has a club scene style. All in all, an enjoyable place to stay. But, it's not one of the elite properties of Las Vegas. Like all Vegas properties, price varied greatly depending on when the rooms were booked. I may stay at PH on another guys trip, but I really doubt I'll be staying there with my wife. Bringing the kids to PH is not happening.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, although the deocr felt a little dated. The kitchenette was nicely equipped. We had a nice view of the pool. The lights were not working well and the sound-proofing between rooms could be better. We were informed upon check-in that it had changed ownership to Hilton. While we were given the chance to sign up for HHonors Rewards, we did not get any other discounts or coupons that other hotels offer. The staff (both desk and housekeeping) were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: gthomas108
Reviews.Content: Stayed Valentine's weekend. Staff was great, Terry who checked us in was awesome. Room was unbelievable 1br suite with a view that was breath taking. We definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: shadowsjc
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 3 night stay at the Hilton Elara (formerly PH Towers). I had booked a deal on the old PH Towers website: pay for a Studio Suite (standard room) and get a free upgrade to a 1 BR Suite. At present, the Hilton website has a similar deal, but the upgrade is only to a Junior Suite. I was a little worried that my reservation would get mixed up due to the PH -> Hilton switchover, but luckily those fears were unfounded. Arrival I arrived in a rental car, and there was free parking adjacent to the lobby. As you enter from the bottom floor, you take an escalator up to the 2nd floor which is where the lobby is. The hotel has a sleek/modern decor (compared to some of the more "luxury" decors at Venetian/Wynn). Check-in was easy and we were able to get our rooms at 1pm even though check-in was at 4pm. Rooms - 10/10 We had two separate 1 BR Suites; one on the 19th and one on the 20th. Both had nice views; one faced south towards the pool area and the MGM Grand, and the other faced north towards Paris, PH, and Ballys. The rooms were GREAT. Spacious living room and kitchen area, complete with a big leather couch, full sized fridge, and a table with seating for six with a flat screen TV on the wall over the table. The living room had floor to ceiling windows, another flat screen on the wall, and shades that came down at the push of a button. The real kicker was the HD projector mounted on the wall that used the shades as the screen. In essence you had your very own mini theater right in the room! We watched various sports games on this screen, and it's something I've never seen in any other hotel room. The bedroom was also spacious, with another flat screen TV, ample closet space, and a mini jacuzzi in the room. Finally, the bathroom had two sinks, a separate toilet area, and a shower stall. The bathroom was connected to both the living room and the bedroom, although there were two doors. There was even a washer/dryer in the bathroom under the sink. The rooms were large enough to easily accommodate 4 people, although we only fit 3 and 2 in the rooms. Facilities: 8/10 There was a gym which members of our party used (I did not); they mentioned it was sufficient, but lacked things that you would find at a larger fitness facility (such as an ab machine). The pool area was nice, but not as "fun" as other Vegas pools I've visited. They also had a bar out near the pool area which I didn't try. The lobby bar was also pretty nice, and I caught glimpses of a few sports games as I walked to other parts of the hotel. Location: 9/10 The hotel is adjacent to the Miracle Mile shops, which is an assortment of clothing and food stores between the Elara and the Planet Hollywood Casino. We had lunch in the complex a couple of times and it was pretty convenient. The Planet Hollywood casino is about a 6 min walk through the indoor mall. The hotel itself is across the street from the Cosmopolitan, although it's a bit tough to get there directly due to the Strip crossings (you have to go up escalators, then walk across, then down). It's easier to walk north towards Ballys and cross the street there. Other thoughts The listed checkout time is 10am. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I expected to be able to check out a little later, especially since we checked out midweek when there's less demand. However, it was a bit of a struggle to get the checkout moved; we were asked to call the front desk at 7am, which would have defeated the purpose. Eventually we did get the checkout moved, even though it took a little back and forth. There was a hotel worker by the elevators checking room keys. It was kind of annoying at first but I guess they want to keep the rooms safe. Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel for a younger crowd (Spring Break / Bachelor / Bachelorette / Bday party. It's in a pretty central location and good for a younger crowd. Fun times and I would consider it next time I'm in LV

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family and we were so shocked with the size of the family suite as it was amazing. The view is excellent and the location is central to everything you are minutes to the strip. I would recommend this hotel for a family as we hired the adjoining room which opened into our suite and we had loads of room. We had a full kitchen and really big fridge so we could put anything we wanted in there. I would recommend this hotel definately.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas in the Springtime”
Reviews.Author: Janice V
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had bought into the Planet Hollywood Towers before they opened in 2010. This is the first opportunity we had to go and found out just before we left that the property was now managed by Hilton. Arrived on Friday at 11 and told to come back at 3:30 as there were special floors for the owners and nothing was ready yet on those floors. We went over to the Planet Hollywood casino and had a quick lunch at PF Changs and when we got back there were lines, separate for Hilton Honors club holders, they went pretty quickly and when we got up to the desk they were very helpful and gave us lots of information on what was going on with the change. He has a one bedroom suite and studio suite connected and we booked the entire unit thinking some friends might join us but didn't at the last minute so we had the whole place to ourselves. Wow, when we got to the rooms,they were spectacular! Full kitchen with a sit down table for four when you come into the one bedroom. A great view out of floor to ceiling windows with a leather sectional that you can watch one of the many flat screen televisions that are everywhere or choose to put down the shade that doubles a projection screen (15'x10') in the living room. The bedroom is spacious and has a large jacuzzi tub next to the bed as well as separate stalls for the shower and toilet. Also a floor to ceiling window for great views from anywhere in the room. There is a small washer/dryer built into the vanity in the bathroom for underwear or small items (if you can figure out how to use it) also the standard hair dryer and magnifing mirror mounted to the wall near the sink. The studio had a kitchenette with a small refrigerator and microwave when you walk in, large closet with safe same floor to ceiling windows with view, very spacious bathroom with separate toilet stall and a jacuzzi tub and shower combo. In both rooms there was a blender and toaster in the kitchen as well as stocked cabinets with anything you could need to cook in the rooms. It was decadent but nice to have both units to spread out in. Very deco/Hollywood vibe furnishings and artwork but comfortable and great mattresses but terrible foam pillows. The pool area was open and the pool is heated but we didn't have time to enjoy it this trip. Overall, great location, accommodations and service. The down side was a very young, hard partying group when we were there (the larger suites are perfect if you want to have parties or are staying as a group) so the halls are full of noise all night long. We were told that there are special floors for owners that have special amenities (like the fully equipped kitchens) so ask what is included if you are a "transient" as they call anyone who is not part of the timeshare staying there. I would recommend it highly! We had a great time, now if only we could have won a jackpot or two that would have made it perfect! One other thing, there is no affiliation to any casino now so that means no comps from the Planet Hollywood casino can affect the rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: englishteacher_11
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas in January for a wedding. We made a reservation for the Planet Hollywood Towers through a travel website that we had never used. We were cautiously optimistic. We had visited the Strip several times and knew that the location of the Towers would be perfect for this trip. The room was as good as the location! Although we did not have a Strip view, the floor to ceiling windows still provided a good view. The room could have used a thorough cleaning, but it was neat and well equipped. It even had a small kitchenette with dishes and utensils. We would probably stay at the PH Towers again and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: James133
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PH towers 2/9-2/12. In the past year I stayed at Harrah's and the Flamingo. So my review is partially in comparison to those two stays. I thought the PH towers were very clean. This was a nice characteristic in comparison to my last two stays. I did however think the rooms were small. We stayed in the studio condo floor plan. I guess I didn't do as much research as I should have but I assumed that a condo would have a bedroom. I booked through a third party and didn't realize that a studio condo was an option. I had just saw the one and two bedroom condo floor plans. Just incase anyone else has any confusion on what a studio condo is, it is a hotel room with a few plates and bowls, a tiny fridge and a dishwasher. The location of the PH towers is ok. It is a little further south than I like but I like to be next to O'shea's and Casino Royal where I can play some table games with lower minimums. The food is was pretty good. It was a little chilly for the pool but one day it was in the 70's and seemed like it could be a good time in a few months. I did learn that you can't use the Planet Hollywoods pool if staying at the PH towers since they are two seperate entities. My favorite attribute of the PH towers was the convenient shop down in the miracle mile mall. You could get decent priced bottles to cut down on your liquor bill for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “impressed overall with the towers”
Reviews.Author: ADT1983
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here because we had some business to take care of in Vegas. Check in was quick and easy and all the staff we encountered during our stay were friendly. The room was also awesome. The only thing that disappointed us was the parking situation, which sucked badly. I wish they divided up the parking garage into an area for guest of the hotel and another area for the general populace looking to visit the miracle mile shopping area. It is also quite a walk from the parking garage through the shops and finally to the hotel. That is our only complaint with the place. We liked the fact that there was a guard stationed at the elavators that lead to the tower keeping out people that don't belong. Thanks for making this trip a pleasure ya'll.

Reviews.Title: “Forget The Rest Stay At The Best (part 2)”
Reviews.Author: funtime_frankie_11
Reviews.Content: This is the second review i have wrote in six months about ph towers. This time i had a 2 bedroom suite on the top floor. OMG! My friends were blown away on just entering the room straight infront full view of the eiffel tower of paris and beyond the bellagio fountains. The room had a projector tv and 4 other large screens, jacuzzi, 2 bathrooms and it was immaculate for the whole six days we spent there as room service did a great job. Not to mention the kitchen and large fridge that dispensed ice and refreshing cold water ideal for a hangover. Ph towers may not have a casino but this is the best thing about the place no smelly cigarette smoke and drunk people as you attempt to go to your room and there are plenty of casino's within a stones throw if you enjoy a flutter. The nice walk through the miracle mile shopping centre to the strip is immaculate and offers some lovely food. I can not fault this place at all! Do not stay anywhere else in vegas as I will stay here every time I visit this fantastically mad town.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious hotel with easy access to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler00
Reviews.Content: The Planet Hollywood Towers is a very nice hotel with easy access to the strip. The Towers are connected to the Planet Hollywood Resort by the Mircle Mile Shops which is a mall of sorts. A 6-7 minute walk from the Towers puts you on the strip. We were in the Two Bedroom suite which is really a one bedroom suite with a connector room. The rooms are extremely spacious and well appointed. The highlight is the humongous projector screen in the living room. Check in/check out was quick and easy. The pool at the Towers is very nice and was packed during the day. Overall my stay here was a great experience. My only complaint would be with housekeeping. The room was not very well cleaned prior to our check in. Some left over trash was in the cans and several items left by previous guests remained in corners or sides of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Kalby10
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on March 1st (1st day Hilton took over the PH Westgate Towers) for a 3 night stay. Our flight landed in the morning and made it to the front desk around 11am, when I spoke with the girl at the reception area she informed me that check in was at 4 and they didn’t have any open rooms at that time. We were able to check our bags at the bellhop and venture around the strip waiting to check in. I arrived back to the front desk around 2PM and approached the same girl at the check in, she was polite and remembered me from earlier that day. As she checked her computer for open rooms I explained to her that we booked a 1 bedroom suite but was hoping to get into a 2 bedroom since there were 3 of us staying. As she looked I handed her my ID and credit card with a $20 in-between. Without saying anything she took the 20 and pocketed it. After a few more minutes she asked if the 2 bedroom penthouse would be okay! Getting off the elevator we had a long way to walk because our room was at the very end of the hall. After opening the double doors to the penthouse we were greeted to an amazing view from the floor to ceiling windows in the living room. Both master and the 2nd bedroom were huge and offered plenty of space for 6-8 people. The master was situated on the corner of the building and offered floor to ceiling windows on 2 walls. The bathroom had an amazing Jacuzzi sitting right on the windows over looking the strip. This room was so nice it made it hard to leave (not bad for under $200 a night). We called for our bags when we walked in the room, they were delivered within 10 minutes. Maid service was also very good, they came every day and even asked every time I saw them in the hallway if they could get anything for us. The hotel itself is situated perfectly just off the strip but connected to the mall. This allows guests to walk to the PH casino or the strip without having to exit the hotel. We didn’t use too many of the hotels amenities but we did sit by the pool on 2 afternoons. The staff was very nice, offered us towels, and checked a few times to see if we needed anything additionally. The only negative thing I can even think of is all the furniture is black and shows a lot of dust even if its is cleaned every day. All in all this was a great place to stay and next time I am in Vegas I will be staying at the Hilton Elara.

Reviews.Title: “More pros than cons!”
Reviews.Author: lovesusa
Reviews.Content: Was slightly apprehensive about this hotel as there are quite a few bad reviews on TA but decided to go from a personal recommendation from someone I trust as we really needed a 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms - not easy to find at all! From the start our experience here was mainly very good. Check in midday on a Thursday was quick with no queue, although I noticed a lot more people waiting later that day. The room - 3915 I think-was very impressive- modern and glam- we had floor to ceiling windows in the (very large) sitting area and 2 glass walls in the master bedroom. The kitchen was great - we only used it for making tea and coffee and, unlike a lot of reviewers, we had a large coffepot. Only a small window in the 2nd bedroom and a much smaller bathroom but plenty of room for 2 people just not quite the same wow factor. We specifically went for a mountain view rather than a strip one on the grounds we would spend so much time out there! This particular room has helicopters coming towards you from the executive airport at the end of the strip which is quite a dramatic experience and large planes taking off left to right to the international airport. Nothing close enough to be a nuisance or noisy but the view in the morning is great - one day we had 3 helicopters at various distances away from us and 2 planes going across them! Thanks to jetlag we were all up early and as our room was so great the 4 of us ended up having early coffees there -two of us stretched out on a very dramatic zebra print chaise lounge, the other 2 propped up in a huge, very comfy bed and we never tired of the view which also included MGM Grand, Excalibur and the Luxor-lovely at night too with all the lights. Luggage took 4 phonecalls and just over an hour and a half to arrive but I rang for more coat hangars and they arrived virtually straight away as did a maintenance man when we were unable to work out the lights or aircon - instructions in the room would be nice . The wardrobes were surprisingly small - I'm presuming most people have short stays (we had 5 nights) and there wasn't a full length mirror in the place. The hallway cupboard had some broken glass in it - not a good housekeeping start but we had maid service every single day without having to ask which I know has been an issue with some guests. Basically we loved the place, we didn't have enough time to use all the facilities-probably wasn't quite hot enough for the pool and everytime we looked at it it was in the shade- but we would definitely stay there again. The location is brilliant, just a 10 minute walk through the Mall which was interesting every time as we window shopped the whole way! You come out onto the strip very close to the Paris hotel - breakfast on the Mon Ami terrace is great- and just across the road from The Bellagio. We were really disapointed that the Monet exhibition at the Bellagio was in the process of being set up so we couldn't see it. Security at the hotel is very good, lots of people were trying to convince security to let them go to the room elevators with no joy if they didn't have their room card. Taxis are very easy to get on the lower level and I noticed that they also had an airport shuttle arriving on a regular basis. We used Presidential Limos for our return trip to the airport and they were fantastically well organised - another great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at PH Twrs, now Elara”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights (in Sun, out Thu) with the pay-for-studio-get-a-one-bedroom deal. Was assigned 21st floor facing north. Wouldn't want much lower - since you look down on parking garages. However, the view was hotels including Paris and a glimpse of Bellagio fountains. We checked in at 11pm Sunday; no problem. Room didn't have sofabed sheets - but those arrived within 10 minutes of a call. Next day, we called because the safe was locked (by previous guests). Security had that resolved quickly. Also got quick service when we couldn't find any dishwasher soap. Our kitchen had a setting for 4. A can opener; no other utensils. No toaster. Called about the toaster (since another TA review mentioned one), but found out that's not standard. Microwave is a challenge to program until you get the hang of it. Seems it's also functions as standard oven. Pool is more for show than swimming. Parts are labelled as 9" deep. Looks like it was built to generate money; there are two floors of cabannas. There is one hot tub. I'd agree with the reviewer that the fitness room (4th floor) looks like they ran out of money. I walked around - but didn't use. A few flat panel TVs, but I didn't notice any screens built into cardio equipment. Changeroom has one shower. No sauna or hot tub there. Liked - projection TV, music stations through TV - dishwasher - buttons for privacy, cleaning service - double bathroom sinks - spacious living area - modern lighting and decor throughout - security checking for room cards by elevators Didn't like - no bathroom fan; black toilet - sofabed mattress is basic quality - no pots/pans (although no pots/pans was identified in the PH Twrs website) - cabbie taking us for a ride (via hiways) $25 before tip from LAS - all the salespeople approaching you when you walk through the mall March 1 2012, this property became "Elara, a Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel".

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's Opinion - Huge Rooms, Limited Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: The Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino has followed the lead of many luxury resorts on the Las Vegas Strip by adopting an adjoining sister hotel. Unlike others, however, the hotel includes residential timeshare condos and was built in partnership with Westgate Resorts. This marriage has resulted in the only timeshare-slash-hotel in the world directly linked to a luxury hotel and casino. What does this mean for you? If you have your eye on a Vegas vacation, it means choosing ph Towers Westgate guarantees you will have the space of a condo with convenient access to a lively casino and all that Vegas visitors expect from that particular experience – the restaurants, shops, spa and shows. If you are considering a timeshare in Sin City, it means much closer proximity to the action than was previously available. Because ph Towers is a condotel, every room is a suite. I have stayed in many suites, some that I feel took a lot of liberty with the “suite” definition (i.e. the existence of a two-person couch at the foot of the bed and a mini-fridge in the closet does not make the room a suite) and some that truly have a residential feel to them. This hotel falls into the latter category with suites that could be lived in, even on a permanent basis. In fact, I have never stayed in a Vegas hotel with larger standard rooms. I always pay particularly close attention to room design. To me, a room needs to be beautiful, functional and have homey comforts in order to impress me. Ph Towers’ décor is, fittingly for the Las Vegas locale, ultra modern. Rooms are decorated in tuxedo black, lipstick red and bright white in a particular style of beauty best described as glamorous. One-bedroom and two-bedroom suites have a full-size and fully-equipped kitchen with a table that seats six. Roominess aside, stand-outs for this property are the projection screen theater in the living area and the hot tub next to the bed. Another plus good enough to mention are the mirrors. They are everywhere. The hotel compensates for the areas in which it lacks by giving their owners and guests complete access to the amenities of Planet Hollywood. For example, although the hotel has a beautiful and sunny pool and cabana area, guests looking for a spa treatment need to visit Planet Hollywood. For guests who crave casual shopping, the Miracle Mile shops are ultimately well-positioned practically in the lobby. To give you an idea of shop proximity, while taking a self-guided tour of the main level of the hotel, I found myself suddenly (and happily) in the middle of the mall. Ph Towers Westgate is making its mark on the Vegas luxury hotel market because of its unique features. I recommend it for travelers who want room to spare without giving up casino action. Its glitz and reasonable pricing also make it extra appealing to a younger crowd. My husband and I have a YouTube channel of luxury hotel video reviews. Visit YouTube.com/TravelbyLori. Read more of my written reviews by visiting Examiner.com and searching for Lori Metze.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Kkimi
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel as friends of mine stayed here on there honeymoon and had all good things to say. Unfortunatly that wasn't the case for us. It was my 21st birthday and it took 2 hrs to check in with only 2 people on the reception. Once we finally checked in we were given the wrong room and when I explained to the staff that was not what I booked they were unfriendly and unhelpful telling me there were no rooms avaible as to what I had booked. So not only did I not get the room I had booked I was 2 hrs late for my dinner reservations due to the long wait at reception then it took an extra 40min for my luggage to be brought to my room. The room was clean and nice ill give them the credit for that but my disappointment was topped off with the fact we were double charged for Internet and again were faced with unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Condo Comfort. Sort of on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: valu8or
Reviews.Content: We picked this property for its central location on the Strip. It was the only property with a two bedroom suite, living room and kitchen option available through WestJet vacations that would allow a family of three adults to vacation together. We paid for an upgrade to a higher off strip view floor and it was worth it watching the Strip light up at night and seeing all the air traffic from high up. The elevators to the 51st floor are a bit trippy. The quick elevation change can make your ears pop. The decor was dramatic with full condo kitchen, a spacious big dining table, comfy oversized sectional sofa for lounging, TVs in everyroom, electric black out blinds and huge windows with fantastic views. The lighting options in the condo are worth mentioning as well. There were plenty of recessed lights and lots of options for bright to night. The unit had everything we needed for our family vacation - namely a full size fridge to put our restaurant left overs, beverages and snacks. And most importantly a coffee maker. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms were contemporary spa-like with lots of room. It's a walk off the Strip - but isn't everything. No complaints because it was through the always interesting Miracle Mile. There was a always a security guard on duty checking room cards. One guard even caught a fellow trying to sneak into the tower elevators with our group which was assuring.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck!!”
Reviews.Author: NanNanSF
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to stay in when I go to Vegas because you can fit 12 girls comfortably in a 2 bedroom suite. Suite has a living room which has a sectional that pulls out into a bed. Two bathrooms which is a MUST HAVE for 12 girls! Kitchen, which you don't really need but it's good for storing leftovers. One drunken night, we stumbled into a washer and dryer that was in our suite. I'm going to say that's a plus! Service was great! I arrived with a friend at 8am, and she was able to get us a room at 10am even though the check in time was 4pm. Another plus is, they have a pool! Also loved the fact that a bunch of restaraunts, shops and the ABC store was just downstairs. Perfect for when you don't want to walk in the summer heat just to get food! Pluses: - Jacuzzi tub -Four TV's with a projector screen - Washer/Dryer - Kitchenette with utensils and all - Ceiling to floor scroll up windows -pool!! -Right in the smack middle of the strip, great for walking to Marquee at night -shops/restaurants in the actual hotel Cons: -Possible LOOOONG check in lines between 10am-12pm..PREPARE TO WAIT!

Reviews.Title: “For the amount of money we pay for this timeshare - not good.”
Reviews.Author: Kenna H
Reviews.Content: Had to wait FOREVER to get checked in. only 2 people at the desk and they were so slow. The service there is not very good. And not very friendly. I do not reccommend Westgate timeshares to anyone. It has been nothing but a problem/ The room was not that clean and there was hardly any hot water. and no shower pressure! Very dissatisfied. This is the 2nd time I have been. Last time there was makeup all over the pillow. I would rather of stayed at PH Totally regret buying into this timeshare!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “YES!”
Reviews.Author: Theyarv
Reviews.Content: Yes yes yes yes yes! I'm generally a cheapskate (though my previous hotel reviews may appear to say the opposite). I was hesitant to book this but my rich let's live it up friends insisted. I'm glad they did, though i wish i had upgraded too! The beds are excellent - this is the main thing i always notice about a hotel. The bathroom is standard - shower is a bit disappointing but generally looks nice. But let me tell you, you will not be disappointed if you got yourself a suite - they are double in size and the 8 foot projector screen is awesome....not to mention the hottub! I would never have dreamed of bringing my gf to Vegas, but i'm very tempted to bring her here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: moononk
Reviews.Content: After leaving the cosmo we decided to try PH Towers for our last night. PH towers was a pleasant surprise. The kitchen was stocked with dishes, silverwear, toaster & coffee maker. PH has the same service level as cosmo at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: Don't bother, no matter how good the room might be, if you have to wait more than an hour to check in. Never ever see a so badly managed hotel like this. Loibby is noisey than a cancelled flight airport, people sitting, laying everywhere for hours just to try to check in. Run as fast as you can away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: 154913Tracy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from planet Hollywood west gate towers. The service is great, location is amazing. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite it was perfect the view was stunning and the room was clean and comfortable. We will go back without hesitation. The hotel is attached to the miracle mile and all amenities are close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one bedroom suite - free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: KazWilson
Reviews.Content: We were Blowen away with our one bedroom suite which was a free upgrade on booking, huge room amazing views of the strip and mountains and very central. The staff where great and very helpful. Will recommend to everyone also olives resturant at the Bellagio is a absolute must!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT ROOMS FOR A GROUP!!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey C
Reviews.Content: I will start off saying that I had never been to Las Vegas before and neither had 2 other people in our group, and 2 had.The bellhops who were extremely friendly upon our arrival and departure. We waited about 10 minutes to check in and were in our room 5 minutes after that (with our luggage). We found the hotel very easy to manage. The room itself was awesome, we had a 2 bedroom suite on the 18th floor. The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, plates and etc. We did actually use the washer/dryer, which was a nice convenience. The beds were so comfortable that I actually called once I was home and was given the brand and model number. (THANK YOU for that PH TOWERS) We did not find the walk through the mall and casino to be very far to the street as there is so much to see and do. I would 100% definitely stay here again. Also, when we checked out, the hotel staff printed our boarding passes for us. Our group consisted of 3 men and 2 woman, ages 28-38. We were there Super Bowl weekend Feb 4-7, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “If you want service, don't go here”
Reviews.Author: rimkokr
Reviews.Content: Much confusion upon arrival and only 2 bellmen, not seen when we arrived. Finally one told my husband where to park and said we had to check luggage there as our room would not be ready. In this confusion, we forgot to tip so the bellman said in a voice loud enough for all to hear" guess I am working for free today" One person in our party immediately ran back and tipped him. At check in we waited in line for an hour and then another 15 min to check in. They charge your credit card with $50 ( just in case). It is taken off once you leave and all is OK, but they have that charge for 3 or 4 days. Once in the room, we called for luggage, a half hour later we called to find out where it was and were told" we are very busy and you will get it when you get it. NIce room but absolutely no service at all plus a bad attitude to go with the no service. We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: aimeejoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over President's Day weekend and loved it. We got a great rate from Priceline.com and were upgraded for free at check in to the one bedroom suite with the huge tub. The location of the towers is great on the strip. The room itself was wonderful. From the huge projector tv to the full kitchen and filtered water from the fridge, the washer/dryer in the room, this room had it all. It was clean and quiet. It was a chilly weekend, so we didn't try the pool, but it seemed nice. All of the employees we dealt with were pleasant and helpful. It is a quieter property since there is no casino attached, but you can easily walk to whatever you want. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite- TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: Toni W
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the PROs: the hotel is in a great location, you can get great views from your room/suite, the 1 bedroom suite is great (spacious, love the jacuzzi tub in the bedroom, floor to ceiling windows) Onto the CONS: you have to walk through the mall to get to the hotel, TERRIBLE service... so bad I wouldn't book here again despite how much I loved the 1 bedroom suite It all started with waiting in line for over an hour to check in and being told that they overbooked and did not have a 1 bedroom suite for us... they didn't even have a room for us. They wanted us to transfer to a regular room at Planet Hollywood with no compensation or refund of any sort (we did pay for a 1 bedroom suite you know). This happened to a number of people that day and 1 group packed up their things and headed over to the Venetian (which was probably a good choice). After some negotiating, we reluctantly hauled all of our stuff over to Planet Hollywood to wait in another (shorter) line. We checked into a room there for the night with promises that we could transfer to a 1 bedroom at PH Towers the next day. Fast forward to the following day, there was no room available to so had to wait again. Not only that, I realized that I was overcharged for my stay (they neglected the fact that in order to reserve my room I had to pay a deposit of 1 nights stay- they charged me for that again when I checked in). After a long wait and trying to explain to an incompetent employee about the overcharge, we agreed to just go into our suite and to deal with it all the next day with a manager. The suite was great; however, at a very random hour a maintenance man came in saying he needed to look at the circuit breaker for the suite next to us (all 1 bedroom suits have a connecting door the the suite next to them which is not ideal when situations like this happen). In the end, the only thing that slightly redeemed the poor service was the manager understanding their error and simply refunding me for all charges and then charging me again for the correct price. I just wish the staff was a little more understanding of my anger and frustration. I didn't fly across the entire country to have to have dealt with that. As nice as the suite is, I would book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jjtamayo
Reviews.Content: We got the 2 bedroom Suite and we loved it. It had a full kitchen and a nice living room. With floor to ceiling windows that have curtains that turn into a movie screen with a projector was a nice touch. It is connected to the mall which gives you access to shoping.

Reviews.Title: “Ruthless”
Reviews.Author: wow445
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 2 bedroom suite over the President's day weekend. We arrived and had a late check-in without any problem, but problem starts when we got to our room. Right when we got to our room, we noticed that the room looked a little odd, and realized that the room wasn't really clean. It just looks like it wasn't cleaned up well by the housecleaning staff. We started setting up the beds, and when we popped out one of the sofa beds, we found a bunch of the porn cards they hand out on the strip all stuck in the sofa bed! We also found a few glasses from the kitchen area that were not clean. Needless to say we were very disappointed with the room, but we were way too tired to make a complaint that night and went to sleep. In the morning, we called front desk and informed them of them problem. However, they kept on giving us the excuse that we should've called yesterday rather than the next day. I've never ran into this sorta problem before. We also asked if it was possible to change rooms, and again, we were giving the same response. In the afternoon, my friend that booked the room decided to go downstairs and make a complaint in person. They did offer to discount a certain amount of the rate for our 2nd night and provided $50 in-room dining credit. When my friend tried to ask for more credits for our troubles, it was then we found out that the front desk staff that answered our call had a left a note in our account that we were using heavy profanity, which is just an absolute lie! My friend that made the phone call was stern and impatient throughout the call, but never used any profanity. The front desk staff at the time also somewhat threatened to call security if we provided even more trouble. Straight up ridiculous. Out of all the Vegas properties I've stayed, Caesar/Harrah's properties have always been alright, but there's a reason their service is not at the level of Wynn and Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chapmanberkshire
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before booking this hotel and it really paid off, personally I think that the location is one of the best in Vegas, close to all the action and the casino and shopping centre for this hotel are much more modern than others. Our room was amazing - huge with a large kitchen area, huge window overlooking the strip, a jacuzzi bath (massive) in the bedroom and the most amazing bathroom. The sitting room area also had a projection screen that was amazing. It was great having the the fridge in the kitchen as we bought our own champagne & beer and had pre dinner drinks before going out. My only gripe would be that trying to find the parking for the hotel was virtually impossible to find and the staff at the Planet Hollywood Hotel were very unhelpful. When we did find the parking there was no one to help with our bags and the actual reception for PH Towers is not very well signed. That aside when we went into other hotels we realised how lucky we had been as our queue to check in was very small and reasonably quick, whereas, at most other hotels there were 30 - 40 people looking to check in. The room was very clean and we were given fresh coffe everyday - I would recommend this to anyone and will definately stay there again if we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Great Location--Cannot Understand the Negative Reviews by Others!?!”
Reviews.Author: sd2734
Reviews.Content: Planet Hollywood Towers is located just off the Strip and we found the location and premises to be simply terrific! We were there on a week timeshare exchange and we chose PH Towers because we wanted to be virtually on the Strip but without having to go through a casino to get to our room. Casinos are naturally noisy and full of people and we thought that it would be a hassle to wrestle with crowds to reach our accommodations or to simply rest since we planned sightseeing at the Grand Canyon and Death Valley, besides hitting the Strip. We stayed in a one bedroom suit with another couple on the 33rd floor overlooking Paris Las Vegas and Caesar’s Palace in the distance and other friends staying in the Excalibur. Getting to the Strip is very easy-- just walk thru the Miracle Mile Mall which is also connected to the PH Casino. The types of people who frequent this hotel are timeshare owners during the week and young crowds including bachelor/ettes parties on the weekends. Hotel security is on the money and we did not witness things getting out of control during our stay. Yes we saw people being somewhat intoxicated especially on the weekend, but this is Sin City after all!! Check-in was a breeze and we found the Front Desk to be efficient, organized and helpful. The room was great just as per the description and pictures. Everything was well appointed and thought of. We requested additional pillows and blankets and Housekeeping delivered very quickly. However, they delayed our luggage by 45 min and brought it up only after I called the Bell desk second time. About Cleanliness. We found the room to be clean and well prepared and stocked with all necessities and toiletries. PH Towers were built recently, I think 2009, and so far the premises appear to be well maintained with minimal wear and tear showing. Sometimes it makes me wonder when other travelers comment on the amount of dirt/dust etc. under a bed, behind furniture, on top of cabinets etc. Do they go to hotels to perform a thorough property inspections or visit a particular destination to have good time?!? With our extensive hotel experience, both international and domestic, we are inclined to conclude that US hotels (even high end ones) when compared to hotels in other Western Nations appear generally dirty and in various states of disrepair and neglect. Over many trips we have observed that a significant number of hotel patrons visit a motel/hotel with the purpose to destroy property and leave the rooms in such a state that it will take an army to clean and put back in order. These folks demonstrate an arrogant and self-entitlement attitude with absolutely no regard for the property or respect for other guests. For example there was this individual, dressed in gym attire, in the PH Towers Lobby who was munching on sunflower seeds and spitting the peels on the floor!!! The Staff. We found the staff to be polite and genuinely interested in making our stay pleasant. One day we had to leave early for the Grand Canyon and during our absence housekeeping came for our midweek (we were on a timeshare stay) cleaning and upon our arrival later on we found the dirty dishes from breakfast to be washed! Also, I had to print and fax some work related docs and the Concierge did not hesitate to do this complimentary for me! During the weekend the Valet parking spots (which I think are reserved for Owners only) fill up pretty quickly so we had to self park Sunday. The Valet attendants were professional and quick and asked on several occasions if we needed directions, which we found to be a nice touch. We did not use the Room Service during our stay. Overall we found the hotel to be a great value and a pleasant surprise, especially when other travelers rated it low or complained from rowdy crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, great view”
Reviews.Author: IAmABabyCow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the week of Valentine's day and it was amazing! Doesn't have the best places to eat but it was right in the middle of the strip and a good place to eat is no more than a ten minute walk away. The view was amazing from the 52nd floor, could see everything! The full kitchen is nice but you have to pay extra for pots and pans. The Jacuzzi was nice but our jets weren't working, still very nice way to unwind after a day of walking. The projector was very cool, the shade doubles as the projector screen. No real complaints, enjoyed the stay! Definitely make sure to specify to your taxi driver that it is ph Westgate or they will take you to planet Hollywood on the other side of miracle mile.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top, but not without some faults.”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: The 1 bedroom suites here are nothing less than amazing. Full kitchen? Check. Full bathroom with washer and dryer? Check. Separate living room area with HD programming, projector, and sound system? Check. Separate bedroom with HD programming and jacuzzi tub? Check. I would describe the room as over the top. I ran into a few issues the first night due to it being Super Bowl (Stupor Bowl?) weekend, but they were quickly resolved by Scott at the front desk. A few issues I feel are worth mentioning: - If you self park, you'll probably use the PH parking garage, which is the weirdest parking garage I've ever used. I can't describe it because I still don't know how it is laid out, but basically it is easy to get confused when you go beyond the 3rd or 4th level. - I don't particularly care for hotels that give guests the means to be inconsiderate, and the rooms here include a "audio cube" below the living room TV that I think has a subwoofer. Let's just say that you'll hear when your neighbors decide to crank it up and party into the early morning hours. - The HVAC system seems to only work in the main room, not in the bedroom. Vegas gets chilly during the winter months and it would be nice if the heat blew into all occupied areas. Would I return? Yes, but not during any major event like the Super Bowl or NYE. Also, soon this property will be under full ownership by Hilton/Hilton Grand Vacations Club and no longer Westgate. Expect the WESTGATE name on the building to soon change to "Elara".

Reviews.Title: “Great trip even better hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ChristianKent
Reviews.Content: On arrival (15.30) our room was ready - check in 16.00pm We had a 2 bed suite which was more then enough, only two of us staying there. Could sleep 6 easily. Room is fantastic, great views, floor to ceiling windows and view. Reception a little rude but wont moan too much. Pool : great pool, not too big but enough loungers to go around. Great music and a great bar. There is no casino but if you walk through the Miracle mile there is one, 2 mins walk. Planethollywood casino. overall a great stay and a fantastic hotel. Would defo return !

Reviews.Title: “great room in the heart of the strip - not the best in Vegas though...”
Reviews.Author: tgendorf
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for a 3 day stay on priceline, so I gave it a try after staying in many hotels in Vegas. I upgraded to a top floor room with a strip view at the check-in desk, which was well worth it due to the low price I paid initially, however it was a bit of a disappointment as it was mainly the back of hotels and parking structures... The rooms were very modern and good size. The bathroom had separate shower/ toilet however I was missing a descent sized bath tub. Access to the Hotel from/ to the strip is through the Magnificent Mile shopping mall which also features plenty of eating and shopping opportunities. The hotel is located in the center of the strip so north and south strip are within a few minutes walk. There was plenty of parking and the hotel was accessible quickly via stairs. If you have luggage you might want to take a detour and use the escalators for the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Planet Smellywood Towers at Westgate in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Brenda N
Reviews.Content: My first date with my future husband was in Las Vegas, and we have come back every for his birthday/ Valentine's Day. This year we decided to stay at PH Towers instead of Bally's (North Tower) February 11-15, 2012 To begin we made reservations online.. The first sign of a disater was that they charged my card more than the email said.. But I thought okay, that is less money I will need for room when I get to Vegas... Yeah right.. Not only did I call to confirm that we can have early check in but I called twice to confirm it. We arrived at 12:30 check in after being up since 3am for flight... Were we unable to check in until almost 5pm sitting in the lobby watching people get key after key after key... Come to find out they were timeshare owners so forget that I made a reservation just like they did... Next, finally getting into the room.. The room was beautiful, but once in there you find this incredible dusty like film all over the place... I laid my phone on the nightstand and it was covered in dust just over night. The service from the front desk to housekeeping was poor.. There was an old dirty black footie in the hall the entire weekend, I dont believe they even vaccuumed the 5 days we were there.. On the last day we saw a stain under the bottom right corner of the bed... And nervous that we been sleeping on used sheets the entire time... The entire PH hotel, mall and casino had this stinch of sewage that drove me crazy.. EVERYDAY, ALL DAY YOU SMELLED STANK SEWAGE! Oh yeah how in the world would valet parking be full everyday! The Casino is a good 10 mins from the towers, no night life on the property unless you wanted to go to a bar every night... Luckily the shows were good but nothing to do with the Towers. I was extremely unsatisfied and very very dissappointed in this hotel... I will never pay them one red cent. Terrible customer service, terrible smell, terrible everything.. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME, MONEY AND VACATION MEMORIES ON THIS PLACE...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: michael s
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend Planet Hollywood. We stayed in the hotel over the Superbowl weekend 2012 and were not at all impressed with the accommodations or service. Over the weekend, we had very limited hot water and no water pressure from the leaky shower . Instead of letting us know that there was a hotel-wide issue with the hot water pumps, they kept offering to send up maintenance, who never came. Additionally, the mattress was very uncomfortable and the bedding cheap. The fitness center looked like they ran out of money. Cell phone service was non-existent. Overall, a C-grade experience. To top the weekend off, our room was robbed during the Superbowl game! The door lock was faulty and did not latch correctly, giving the thief easy access to our laptop, jewelry and cash. The security staff was a joke and we were subsequently shuffled from one department to another (none of which are actually part of the hotel), before being told there would be no compensation to us. However, they did offer us a free room upgrade on our next stay (very generous of them!). Overall, I would say stay away from Planet Hollywood. There are much more friendly and service oriented hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “terrible personal. not 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnDee07
Reviews.Content: the room and location is good. But not such amazing like really 5 star hotel. Nothing spesial at all. They made a mistake with my card and accept twice more, than they should. When we asked to solve it somehow manager Sam Merhabi (maybe i am mistaken in surname) told us that it is not his problem! This is impossible service for 5 star. We should ask another manager Mr. Leach to help us and he did. Thanks him. But impressions after staying in PH was not nice at all. I hope they will explain to Sam that client is always right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms but Lousy Housekeeping & Service”
Reviews.Author: baileysmom536
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to PHTowers. The rooms are lovely although the housekeeping was terrible and also the cleanliness. We stayed a week and never got clean towels & refresh service when we asked for it. Walls are so thin you can hear everything in the next unit. Cell phone & internet reception was non-existent in that building unless we went to the lobby. Would stay again, however, hated the lack of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: decoydonna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for a conference. The front desk staff were pleasant. We were upgraded to a high floor room with a great view for no extra cost. The room was a king studio that was very adequate and clean. Kitchen was convenient for breakfast. This is a reasonably priced hotel in a great locations. Although it was a little chilly for swimming, we did sit by the pool area which is very nice. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things, some not so much”
Reviews.Author: normandog
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the PH Towers on Monday, Feb 6. We booked 3 rooms through Expedia, getting a free upgrade to the one bdrm, 98.00 per night. When we arrived we were all quite impressed. I loved the large open feel of the lobby. I felt when we checked in that their front desk staff was more annoyed with us. There was no one else in the lobby, and the attitude of the front desk person was less than welcoming. Customer Service is very important to me, and it will determine whether or not I revisit a property. We had asked for three rooms on the same floor, not only were we told no, but two of our rooms were accessed by one set of elevators, and the third room used another set. While I understand that keeping us all on the same floor might be a problem, I did not understand why she chose to put us in different towers. We also told her that we would wait for rooms to be availble, and still no luck. The rooms were lovely. There did seem to be some housekeepig issues, but for the most part we did enjoy all the ammenities. My room had a Las Vegas phone book holding the bedroom door open, thought that was a little tacky. The daily hoisekeeping was spot on, and our rooms were always clean, new towels, and beds made up. The jetted tub is lovely, but does take a while to fill up and can be a little trouble getting in and out of it as it is very deep. Would I stay here again? yes, if the price was right. I feel the deal we got was great, but if I had paid the rates on the Westgate website, I would have been very disappointed. Way to many other better options for that price. It was also really nice being connected to the Miracle Mile shops. The dining choices were endless and the ones we dined at were quite good. Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms... If U can get a suite!!”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: Went in Oct with my faincee and four friends and ended up booking a 2 bed suite. 2 spacious sized rooms with a living area and kitchen facilities. One of the rooms came with a jacuzzi and large TV plus in addition a projector TV too. It is not far from all the action in vegas. Underneath the hotel you have the usual malls and casino, access to pool and short walk to most of the shows etc.. Beware of taxi drivers attemting to rip you off when U landed at the international terminal. The journey should take no more than 10 mins and we were given an "unexpected tour" of vegas by our driver who took us on to the freeway before taking us to our hotel.... So if they ask you if u been to vegas before, just say YES and avoid the double the taxi charge... Apart from that, Vegas is great place to chill out with friends but mainly to party...

Reviews.Title: “Get a suite with the giant projector!”
Reviews.Author: jvmoney
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stayed here at the Towers. The rooms were extremely clean and we got the King Suite, which had the jacuzzi in the room, along with a GIANT size projector screen tv. My best man planned my bachelor party here and it was a great location and setup. I especially loved having a fridge and microwave bc as a group we drink a lot and it was nice to have plenty of room to pre-game before heading out into town! A couple of folks had rooms closer to the strip, but ended up crashing on our floors bc the room was that much nicer and surprisingly convenient to a lot of things! The bed was extremely comfy and it included a pull out bed in the living room. So you could easily sleep 5 or so with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: wonkle
Reviews.Content: Our room was a one bedroom suite, on the 53rd floor facing North. I had to pay a 10$ fee per night to get the higher floor, but it was well worth it. We walked in, and my wife loved the room, and the view. If the wife is happy, then a vacation goes so much more smoothly! We loved the view of Vegas, especially at night, and the suite is huge. We used the kitchen during the week, mainly to keep water and beer and wine and resto leftovers cold in the fridge. The microwave was used a few times, but it was a freakin' puzzle to figure out. It was the most confusing microwave I have ever used! Ah well, a minor thing. The only real complaint I had about the room was that the shower water pressure was very low. I understand the whole water saver shower head thing, but man, it has to be enough to feel like a shower. Other than that, the washroom was great. Front desk was great, housekeeping came every day and cleaned the room well. Lobby huge and impressive. Too cold to swim, but the pool looked very nice. Having all the Miracle Mile shops at the bottom of the hotel was helpful, especially for coffee in the morning, and using the coffee shop's free wifi. The best coffee shop was not the Coffee Bean over by the Casino, but another one (d'italia?) just a bit to the right when entering the mall from the lobby. Good coffee and easy to use wifi. The ABC stores in the mall (two of them) were very useful to us during the week. Yes, it's a bit of a hike to the casino or to the strip, but a 10 min walk is not that bad. I find everything in Vegas takes a while to walk to. For the 100$ or so a night I paid for this suite, it was totally a great deal. One of the best hotel rooms I have every stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Joplin1990
Reviews.Content: It was an ok place to stay. Not on the strip, but not far from it. Connects to the miracle mile shops so it is a short (about 10 min)inside walk from the strip. Some of the people were very helpful but there was a few the we're very unhelpful. The concierge desk was pretty good depending on who was working. Room was nice, good veiw of the MGM hotel, and very spacious. When I had a problem with the room I had to call three different people to get the situation corrected and it took them awhile to get around to it. I guess the bottom line is if I ever go back to Vegas I won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KEJ2
Reviews.Content: We were at the Towers for two birthdays, and we were treated like royalty. The one bedroom was fantastic; the proximity to the Miracle Mile shops wonderful (right there); and housekeeping was attentive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “PHL Towers - well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Jetatrent
Reviews.Content: Great location - awesome room - couldnt have asked for a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....but”
Reviews.Author: Gustypants
Reviews.Content: If you want to do the strip in Vegas then there is no better place to make your base. The location is perfect. It is in the middle of the strip, no more than a 10 minute walk from all the main attractions and a reasonably good mall on site. The rooms are modern and reasonably spacious with a built in kitchen if you like your food radiated. But what started out as a great resort was then spoilt by basic lack of service. If you need anything then be prepared to wait on hold and listen to the hotel answer machine (repeatedly) tell you how much they value your custom. Do Not Order room service, it takes forever, tastes like cardboard and costs twice as much as the less cardboardy food downstairs in the mall. Eat out. And be aware that what goes on in Vegas does not necessarily stay in Vegas - the walls are paper thin and if the folks next door want to wake before you do the alarm will penetrate the paper. We had a great time, loved Vegas, and loved the location, but it could have been perfect with just a minimum of quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Joshandsam
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this hotel for my son's 21st birthday. After checking on Trip Advisor we knew to upgrade to a one bedroom suite and our first impressions on check in were WOW!! My son didn't want to leave the room, there was a full sized kitchen, a gorgeous bathroom and best of all a huge cinema screen with projector to watch tv or films - Sam was in heaven:) If you are looking for a more traditional style of hotel then go to the Bellagio or the Venetian. If you are looking for something a little more trendy and funky then definitely try the PH Towers. There is a short walk through the shopping mall to the strip but it is not too bad and for the price we paid through Virgin Holidays we were extremely happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly Gross Hotel Room, filthiest property ever!”
Reviews.Author: MorganSM
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review in response to a perplexing reply from PH towers corporate office and to make you aware of the unbelievably poor customer service we have received at the PH Towers in Las Vegas and unfortunately feel they are not taking the complaint seriously. My two friends and I travel frequently to Las Vegas and have stayed at The Bellagio on the three previous visits. We have become accustomed to receiving top-notch customer service at the Bellagio, but the PH Towers, Las Vegas hotel appears to be quite the exception. We stayed at the PH Towers, Las Vegas hotel for eight days from the 5th Jan 2012 to the 13th January 2012 and their housekeeping, front desk and cleanliness leave a lot to be desired. On phoning their front desk, they assured me that the room would be cleaned, bins emptied and towels replaced on numerous occasions. Upon checking at the front desk one particular evening at 9.30pm on the 11th January 2012, the same night I had phone at 8.30pm for towels to be changed in the room, which never happened. In fact, they assured me that they had a log on their screen and on our return they would have replaced the towels, unfortunately the cleaning of the room seemed to be out of the question? More than 24 hours had elapsed and the room yet again was not serviced and the towels still required changing! Astounding! The front desk said they would send housekeeping with clean towels, after I made a phone call again to them in the early hours of the morning and took no responsibility for the debacle. I also noticed that housekeeping was waiting for a tip as they delivered the towels, which felt very strange and disingenuous. Having to make numerous phone calls and also approach the front desk as the phone calls did not improve the service is unprofessional and really, quite embarrassing. Their electronic “do not disturb button” on the door was not pressed on all day and I made the phone calls and also approached the housekeeping staff on the floor on numerous occasions. They never suggested or advised that the button was on? I understand that people sometimes make mistakes, but the fact we made numerous phone calls to their front desk to have the room cleaned and we also pushed the housekeeping button on beside the door, we are sure the front desk was aware as they admitted to logging some calls. I’m not sure how many times housekeeping attempt to clean a room each day but I’m really shocked that no one had the awareness to wonder why the refuse bag from the kitchen and bathroom we left outside the door, did not move from its spot for two entire shifts more than 24hs. Not one person made an effort to provide that basic level of a housekeeping service to our room over a 24 hour period on a few occasions. Housekeeping is a standard hotel service – the button I assume is provided for each customer in every room. This is not some extravagant perk that is only provided to Vip guests or on request? This is a basic service which I expect from any hotel that we stay at and is essential for any customer to enjoy their stay. I feel this company is not taking this serious and regarding “Our electronic door system tracks do not disturb status on our guestrooms, and we note that both on January 9th and 11th their do not disturb light was activated” we did not have this on 24hrs and did not explain why I made phone calls and also approached their housekeeping staff and I was standing waiting in the room with no light activated. Their response “I personally followed up with our Front Desk Agent, regarding your check out experience. Unfortunately our large arriving guest reservations necessitated us regretting your request for a late departure at which point you expressed your frustration for cleanliness issues in your room. (Had I not made numerous phone calls and approached the front desk?)
