As a gesture of goodwill I do show that our Front Desk Agent removed an internet charge of 9.95 dollars from your room and you did check out at 12:30pm which is an hour and a half later than posted check out time” Can I ask any customer seriously do they think this is a satisfactory response to complete and other rudeness over the telephone from one of their staff. We phoned as customers and the reply from their front desk was offensive. Their gesture of goodwill is an insult and should not warrant an approval from a customer. I have requested that they please advise us on the following as they seem to have brushed over the fact that Room 704 was unhygienic, the besides lockers covered in dust, the three glasses and cups came out of the dishwasher filthy, when the housekeeping decided to actually turn up. I had an encounter with one of the housekeeping staff on the floor and I would say she was not friendly at all, I returned to the room about 3 o’clock on Friday the 6th January 2012 to go to the gym within the hotel. I received a knock on the door and explained to housekeeping I was leaving in 5 minutes as I was getting my gym gear. I went to the gym for 2 hrs and on returning to 704 and opening the door I looked in disgust dirty towels, unmade beds and could not believe my eyes. Every time we opened the fridge THE SMELL! It smelled like milk had sat in there and gone off and was never cleaned. Filthy rooms, a layer of dust that is horrendous for people with Asthma or any respiratory ailments, my friend attended the doctor on our return and was diagnosed with respiratory infection and she had a rash and bites on her body. She was certified unable to work for a week and a half. The bathroom was unclean and the bath/shower was very dangerous, the height of the bath and no rail to hang onto to assist you in and out. When the towels had not arrived I nearly slipped on the floor trying to put my foot out on the bathroom floor. The railing on the curtain, the bath and walls were grubby and the sink was gritty and encrusted with dirt. The room was not up to our hygienic standards as we all received rashes on our bodies and bites which later my doctor diagnosed as bites from bed bugs. My doctor informed me to wash all the contents of our suitcases in hot water on return to my house, in case we had bed bugs within the suitcase and the contents. I have to send 6 dresses to be dry-cleaned also. I was prescribed a cream for a rash on my face and body and I was diagnosed with stomach virus and swollen glands, which was down to the dirt in room and the filthy cups, glasses and cutlery. I was prescribed antibiotics, tablets to stop nausea, Buscopan for the cramps and Dioralyte sachets contain rehydration salts for dehydration due to the stomach virus. I have lost 7Ibs since returning home due to the illness and all three of us are bed ridden for more than a week. The third person was also diagnosed with a stomach bug and also bites on her body and a rash on her face. I have photographs off the bites on my face and cannot forward them or the doctors charge plus medication charges as they will not supply an email that accepts attachments please? I have also requested that they forward a report from the professional bedbug exterminator company they ordered to check the beds and room for the bedbugs that infected us when we stayed in your hotel please The standard plays an important role in the reputation of the hotels. One feels comfortable only in the environment which is clean and well ordered, so cleanliness is important for health foremost also for well being. Their accommodation is far from the standard we expected and we are appalled and exasperated regarding the dirt within the room, lack of housekeeping and the manner in which their front desk addresses their customers. We took a vacation and the last thought on your mind would be to expect to arrive home in need of medical assistance. They have greatly disappointed us with their reply Because of this, we are not sure that Casers Entertainment, PH Towers, Westgate is capable of providing basic services while staying in their hotels and we have already considered never staying at Casers Entertainment properties altogether in the future. We believe the only fair remedy for this unfortunate situation is to provide a refund of our total price of our stay, which they have declined.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious is an understatement...”
Reviews.Author: Trina-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel/condo that I have every stayed in since I started travelling at 5 years old! WOW! The staff was great, the pool area was live everyday, and you walk right outside and you are on the main strip near all of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Location, Non-Smoking!”
Reviews.Author: SaskWolfhoun
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for our first trip to Las Vegas because it was one of the few non-smoking hotels we could find. I believe the Towers is actually a time-share but they rent out rooms when the time-shares are not being used. Check-in was fast and efficient and we got upgraded at no cost to a one bedroom suite. The suite was fine although starting to be a bit worn in places. We appreciate having a fridge and a microwave and the view was very nice, looking north towards the Paris hotel and casino. We liked the room and the security. We liked the easy access to the Miracle Mile mall and to the strip through the mall. Housekeeping was fine and did our room every day with no problems. Any annoyances were minor - don't use the phone to make long distance calls - very expensive (but I had to, my cell phone was not working), cleaning the bathroom sink could have been a bit better and some instructions on the strange openings in the bottom of the windows would have been useful. Overall, a very pleasant experience and I would stay there again. We paid something like $100 a night (it was part of a package so a bit hard to break the price out separately).

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajesmujer25
Reviews.Content: I was a recent guest at the PH Towers and I must say my expectation were not met! The lobby was great very vibrant, and clean (doesnt smell like smoke) the bar had some good drink specials and was open late. They have security at the front of the elevators whom which you must show your key to inorder to enter the elevator hall. My room was average king bed, couch, small kitchenette with basic amenities, forks, spoons, cups ect. Bathroom was nice had a jacuzzi tub and a door that separates the latrine from the rest, but no fan. Our view sucked when we asked if we could switch they explained we'll see the parking garage so its not any better. Well I guess thats what they give you when you purchase the room on a specia rate!! AWESOME!! No Free WiFi they charge you 9.95 per day if you don't want to use their internet the hotel provides a kiosk in the lobby where you can print/surf the web if you need to at a rate of 5.00 for 6 mins. Its slow as dirt so if you don't have to print pay the hotel to use their's. The pool was beautiful sits right in front of the lobby so everyone and their dog can see what your doing if your not a shy person this should be no problem. The upside besides the pool is their workout facility was basically a full gym and theres no fee to use it. Also this hotel has an awesome shopping experience so if you like to shop and have no desire to walk to far this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A standard hotel; good value for money but dirty”
Reviews.Author: nonabidut
Reviews.Content: I really question the occupancy rate of this hotel. Having failed to identify the amount of rooms, I would say that there are quite a lot of rooms. But I doubt the hotel to be full all time, why else would it be so dirty. It's been a long time so I don't remember everything any more, but I remember my first impression upon entering the room. The design was chic and modern, although the colour dominance was dark and screamt gloomy. One thing that bothered me the most was how dirty the room was, made me feel that the room had not been occupied for weeks. I also did not like super aggressive people nearby the elevator entrance trying to sell time share properties. I know they are just doing their job, but still...

Reviews.Title: “Not Everything That Happens In Vegas Stays in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OCLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWESOME!!! When I first walked into my room from my short flight from L.A. the blinds open automatically letting the sunlight in. Looking down below was the massive pool that I must say was nice when I finally went to visit it on my last day in Vegas. The room comes with a small kitchen area with refrigerator, microwave and even the kitchen sink. The bathroom has a lovely jacuzzi with bubbles and all. The shower is excellent too instead of sprinkles of water from the shower head it's like rain. My friends were staying in suites. And you can imagine if the rooms were nice then the suites were UNBELIEVABLE. Full kitchens, excellent entertainment center for music, watching movies on a projector -- yeap a projector. These rooms were outstanding. One con but I heard this about all hotels in Vegas it has very poor wireless signals unless you go by the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Planet Smellywood - Stay away unless you like sleeping in filth”
Reviews.Author: Nikita G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the PH Towers resort for 8 days between the 5th Jan 2012 to the 13 Jan 2012. Where to begin on arrival the reception area looks very promising we had initially booked and paid for the studio apartments consisting of one bedroom separate bathroom living area and dining area. When we arrived at our room we were shocked to discover our room was the sandbox in the corner. There was three of us staying together the room had 1 bed and a sofa that folded down into a bed. The room was no bigger than your average box room. The bathroom was hazardous itself wherein the bath tub was very high and the shower was in the bath itself plus there was no handrails a major health and safety concern there. The room was absolutely filthy it was covered in dust, the carpets were filthy. The fridge smelt like milk had spoilt and it was just left there it was absolutely disgusting. No matter how many times we requested room service i think they only showed up a total of 3 times and we were staying for 8 nights, it was impossible to try and get clean towels. The air conditioning unit was broke so the room was always freezing. The walls are literaly paper thin you could hear the guests in the next room conversations. We had asked front desk for a bigger room and was told we would have to pay an extra 500dollars on top of what we had already paid, on our last day we discovered we were charged for the larger room (although we did not have this room) apparently no matter what you book it was subject to availability. This was a disgrace. The hotel is in a good location but there is no casino and it's a ten minute hike to the casino which has free wi fi in lots of places the hotel charges its guest 10dollars a day to use internet. We had bites all over our bodies/face from the bed bug investation that was in our room, we all contracted gastric virus as well as one of us having a severe chest infection from the dirt and dust in the room. All three of us missed 2 weeks from work due to our illnesses. I have stayed in Vegas five times, i have stayed in The Bellagio four times and have never ever experienced anything like this, Bellagio staff would bend over backwards for their guests. I have also stayed in the MGM and again no problems. So word of advice do not stay here unless you like being eaten alive by bed bugs and want your lungs to be polluted with dust and dirt. PS our view was also overlooking a parking lot! I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the trip”
Reviews.Author: Theodore M
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for 3 days, 3 nights. I went with 3 other guys my age (late 20s, early 30s) and we split the 2-bedroom suite in the Tower. The room was excellent. The look was excellent. There was no bed sharing required because there were 3 couches (2 of which were pull-out beds) and 2 beds. Several tvs throughout, two bathrooms, two kitchens and a large common area. The gambling was good and the dealers were very well-attired. There was a good selection of table games and a good sized poker room that had at least a few tables going, no matter what the hour was. The drinks came fast and frequent. The sports lounge was comfortable but maybe not enough seating for Sunday. The restaurants were all very good and there was a wide selection of everything in the mall. You didn't even have to leave the hotel complex if you didn't want to. There are fancier hotels on the strip but I doubt you'll get better value elsewhere, in terms of hotel location relative to the strip, room quality, and other services. It was a very good time for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you are travelling with a young crowd or a friend and want separate rooms and two bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many different hotels in Vegas we decided to try the relatively new PH Westgate. Key reason was the twin bedroom suite since we were two colleagues staying in the hotel it was nice to be able to have separate bedrooms and baths. First off: The setting. I would place this hotel in the category “party hotel” It was mainly filled with younger crowd (21-30’ish) and they all looked to have a pretty good time. It did not bother me and we could not hear it while in the room, but if I were to bring my kids, I would have picked another hotel. The décor of the rooms are a bit different. I presume that either you think it’s tacky or you think it’s really cool. I would categorize it as very masculine, rough and a bit extravagant. Personally I think it was cool. In the twin bedroom suite I counted 9 screens (LCD’s and projectors) and it was pretty huge. The first word that usually came out of people who came to the room was “wow!” View overlooked some of the Bellagio fountains and the Paris Eiffel Tower. Stunning at night! Full kitchen, Fridge with ice cube machine and the whole-shabang! All in all a great room! The hotel is not ON the strip, but you can walk thru the Miracle Mile mall (even at night) so it really don’t feel that far away.. A good 5-8 min walk and you are dead centre on the strip. The mall also has whatever you need in terms of shopping. Also plenty of stores that are different than the usual mix you find at the malls. Only downsides I would say is: For some reason the cleaning in the weekend we stayded there was really poor, but on the weekdays it was very good. No casino directly at the hotel (I would say this is a plus) but you have a great casino at PH in the mall only minutes away. All in all some small room for improvement, but I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room, View, Service, and Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jrjl2002
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. It was just my husband and I on a Getaway for a week stay. We are timeshare owners so I researched all the places we could exchange. When I saw this one-bedroom suite online and knew it was where I wanted to stay. I had high expectations and without a doubt, all of them were met. Just a note, this is the Westgate Planet Hollywood Towers not Resort and Casino they are different places, but they are connected by the Miracle Mile Mall and both are awesome! We checked in and out on a Sunday. Both went super fast and smooth. (Fri-Sat lines looked long but to be expected) They have a separate line for owners, which was nice to see. We were met by Jolie (a spunky little woman) She was great we saw her a few times during the week. I always ask for the best room, immediately I was told I would get it. We were sent upstairs to Room 3917. There is a guard at the elevators that you have to show your room key to go up which is nice. Lightning fast elevators to hallways that were a bit dark but clean. The room looked just the way I expected. The Suite had floor to ceiling window views in both Living room and Bedroom. It was an awesome view of the North End of the strip (Caesar’s,The Bellagio & fountains, Paris) and the mountains all around. The night view was lit up beautifully everywhere. I saw some reviews of the view below (being the top of the mall and parking lot.) I found it great for people watching, if you don’t want to see it don’t look down then. You’re going to get that anywhere you stay. There were 4 flat screen TV’s in the suite and the window shade comes down into a full screen overhead projection TV. It was cool but hard to watch because the couch was too close, if the couch were back 4 more feet it would have been better. Big leather sectional couch which was very soft and comfy for being leather. The windows in both rooms had small vents you could lift up for fresh air, which was refreshing. The heat in the room sometimes worked too well. The Kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, pans, flatware, blender, coffee pot, coffee, dish soap, dishwasher soap with top end appliances and granite counters. Nice big granite counter/eating area. Very big closet for storage of just about anything including a Vacuum, broom, and dustpan. The Bathroom was also stocked including blow dryer (not a wall mount). Everything was clean. Tons of towels for 2 people and enough for 4 if needed. On the first day we discovered out shower drain was clogged, I reported it and it was fixed within an hour. Great shower head and water pressure. The toilet was in a separate stall which was nice but no exhaust fan. MY ONLY MAJOR COMPLAINT: Beware of the 2in1 washer/dryer in the bathroom. Once you start a load you cannot stop it and it takes FOREVER. My clothes never came out dry. I put them in to get the wrinkles out and even on the just dry setting the water always seemed to turn on. It also has to cool down also before the door unlocks. Approx 3-5 hours! The Bedroom was awesome. Dresser, big closet, desk area w/ internet access. (Internet is not free unless you are an owner I asked Jolie a few days later she said to sign on and it would be taken off my bill at check out, which it was) Otherwise, it’s 10/day, 3/20, and 40/week. Bedroom had a King size bed with big comfy pillows and big fluffy comforter. Honestly the best bed ever. I usually cannot sleep in another bed but this one I slept like a baby in. Nice chaise to relax on and view the strip. Lots of lighting options. Nice solid doors. The shade came down and made room very dark for sleeping. The Jacuzzi was nice even though we never used it. We did fill it though, took a while and even though there was enough hot water it still did not get hot enough for us. Minor disappointment. Once again pleased with Westgate accommodations! 9 out of 10! All week we went without any noise from anywhere, when Friday rolled around the place filled up and you could sometimes hear people in the hallway. As far as room noise it was maybe a bump here or there and very faint voices. On the weekend the elevators were crowded with lots of young people but hey it’s Vegas. Nice location right on the 50 yard line of the strip. Great bar usually a 2 for 1 special. Nice lobby w/comfy seating. You can also print boarding passes in lobby computer. Too cold to use the pool in December but it looked very nice and spacious. The Lobby bathrooms were unbelievable. Very Clean. There was always someone cleaning everywhere we went. PH Casino ia a nice Smaller Casino. There is a great restaurant in the mall to the left called Ocean One. Good food, Great Prices, Great Service, we ate there 3-4 times during the week. Great Salmon, Filet Mignon, and breakfast. The PBR was also good place to drink and eat (during the week only though). You can’t tour the PH Towers, but if you do Timeshare presentations for anywhere else (there is a Kiosk at every exit to the strip from the mall). Beware of free slot money they offer. You can spend it but not win anything off it unless it’s the jackpot and you can’t switch machines. Boooo… Go for the (big) show tickets but be sure it’s a deal where you get your deposit back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Service - Be careful of the SPA”
Reviews.Author: GCPurple
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing room on the 31st floor and as we had a suite we had a spacious apartment with full kitchen and bathroom. The views were spectacular and loved the fact that you had a safe passage back to your hotel via the miracle mile shops and right in the middle of the strip so saved heaps on transportation costs and time. We were pleasantly surprised to get into our room early which was appreciated as we had flown 13 hours from Australia. However during our 5 night stay we were not able to get a second coffee cup - yep a full kitchen with 1 coffee cup, multiple calls to front desk and housekeeping - still no coffee cup. We we went to have a spa in our room - awful muck came out of the jets, after emptying and filling the bath 3 times - we called housekeeping who were not able to explain and no apology from management - for the cost of this suite - we expected better service and a high quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: NRHVancouver
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay in one of their one bedroom suites. It was at least as good as their hotel website claimed. I had read some of the negative reviews and was not expecting anything near to this. I am left wondering if some of these people stayed in the same hotel. I stay in hotels more than 100 days each year and considering the reasonable price ($99.00) this is probably the best value that I have had during the past 12 months and I wish I could have stayed longer. The suite was very modern but quite tasteful. I am guessing it was around 1200 square feet. It included a large fully equipped kitchen with granite counters, decent eating area and a huge living room with comfortable leather sofas. The bedroom was large and well laid out. The bathroom included a huge jacuzzi tub, large separate rain forest shower and a good double sink. Other room features included electic blinds, a projector, great TVs in the bedroom, bathroom and living room, washer and dryer and just about everything else one could ask for. It was extremely clean and the furnishings (although a bit too modern for my tastes) were fun and elegant. The towers area is attached to the main Planet Hollywood hotel and casino by a shopping mall which also contained several good dining options. The rooms at the towers are far better than those at the main Planet Hollywood hotel and the short walk was worthwhile. We found that the casino at Planet Hollywood was one of the better ones - friendlier and simply more fun than at some of the other casinos. All in all, it was a great choice and we will stay there again the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TikhonSm
Reviews.Content: Very good quality, especially if you take an apartment! Not as chic as Ceasar's Palace but very good if you go for business

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sakari81
Reviews.Content: We got such a cheap deal for this hotel we were not expecting much. This place was amazing, we stayed on the 55th floor in a King suite with a huge spa, we felt like celebrities, there was 4 tvs including one in the bathroom and a huge projection screen that came down in front of the window. Amazing views out to the strip and great location. Loved every minute of it and didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-best weekend in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte H
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 30th birthday in November at the PH Westgate. We had a two bedroom suite for 5 of us. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi in the room and a large king bed plus en suite with separate bath and shower unit. In the living room was a large sofa which turns into a huge sofa bed. Kitchen with fridge, freezer, ice maker, etc The second bedroom had another en suite bathroom with large king bed as well. The location is brilliant, you are within just a few minutes from loads of shops, casinos and bars. There is no smoking in the rooms though so you need to go downstairs. This is very much a young persons hotel and it's very sociable. Wasn't sure whether a couple of us got bed bugs thought, we had some bites on the last day and following morning and I reported this to reception. They said they would carry out a deep clean of the room but no apology or anything... Hey-ho, would still stay there again on our next visit as the rate was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, service kinda sucks though”
Reviews.Author: Rob W
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay but the service was mediocre at best and when I pay $1800 to stay somewhere I expect the service to be spectacular, they should be waiting on me hand on foot. This was not the case. The front desk made us wait in line and let all of their "timeshare" customers go first. But other than that and the maids being extremely rude I can honestly say that it was the nicest room I had ever been in. The pool party was great and the mile shops made it easy to get breakfast and a screwdriver without going to far away from the room. It is also in a great location although since it is attached the the PH casino and hotel it was somewhat confusing finding our way back to the room once we were severely intoxicated. Instead of getting a cab if you have more than one stop I recommend getting a limo, it sounds crazy but it is actually way cheaper and since you pay by the hour where as a cab is by the mile a limo driver wont rip you off. I did this to get groceries to stalk my room with.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: TechProf676
Reviews.Content: The room was very noisy. Windy weekend in Vegas. Wind whistled through the windows loud enough to keep you awake. If that was not enough, along with the sirens on Vegas Blvd., you could hear the couple next door. Wow, they had a fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Great hotel. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: BMGC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at one end of the Mile Shops, which always was a very safe way to get back to the hotel. Less crowded than the streets. Superb property. Awesome staff. Great pools. Quiet. Easy to upgrade with a tip to front desk staff. Highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: edwod
Reviews.Content: The rooms are excellent, the hotel is well located, the facilities are new and very nice pool

Reviews.Title: “Didn't match our expectaations”
Reviews.Author: Gunning4it
Reviews.Content: Purchasing a timeshare at the hotel two years ago, i was sold the promise of how luxurious the hotel would be and i was very impressed with the show room we saw. On arrival, the hotel desk staff and the place itself was nice, but my rooms were not cleaned to satisfaction. Dust was found on the head board of both beds, bed tables and counters. The place felt like it needed a good clean and evidently hadn't been cleaned in a while. More alarming was the confusion on how often the room was cleaned. No cleaner was sent for 3 days and getting the room cleaned the day before we were due to leave just didn't make sense to me. In addition to this my daughters bed sheets weren't even changed, we know this because the dust contributed to her nose bleed and the bed sheets were stained. As a timeshare owner i am appalled by the lack of cleanliness and this is not what i expect from a 4 star hotel. Internet is fairly slow and annoying if you have more than 3 devices being wireless connected as you had to continually login with a code. and floor must have been the worst. Walking through the mall to get to the casino and strip is also a pain. This place can do much better with the maintenance and customer service as it over shadows all the good they have done with the rooms size and amenities. I will be writing them a personal email to express my feelings.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, but my room and floor must have been the worst. Walking through the mall to get to the casino and strip is also a pain. I was on the 14th floor and my entire floor smelled like raw sewage. I had to hold my breath to use the bathroom. I asked to move rooms but of course they were sold out. The shower had absolutely no water pressure and made washing my long hair a chore. Water temp was warm at best. Never hot. The rest of the room was nice, mini bar, sink, microwave, dishwasher and fridge. Nice couch and comfy bed. Good selection on the TV. You have to pay for internet and it is slow. Room service wash horrible! All they did was make the bed...bathroom was half done. No new shampoo or soap. left with a few pieces of toilet paper. This place can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer!! Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Krystal R
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Vegas & we were thrilled with this hotel. We stayed in the studio suite and it was huge! A kitchenette with a mini fridge, microwave, real dishes/glasses, and even a dishwasher! The bathroom was a good size with a seperate toilet from the shower/sink area. The shower had a rain head which was a relaxing way to end the day. Big flat screen TV with plenty of good channels and VERY comfy bed not to mention a comfy couch and automated screen to cover the enormous window. The staff was very friendly! PH Towers is connected to the Mircle Mile Shops so you have plenty of quick and affordable food options which also leads to the strip. Hotel is next to the MGM and I had a chance to see a MGM hotel room... trust me it was only decent. Nothing compared to the PH Towers room we had and ours was way more affordable! You can't go wrong if you stay here... great clean condition and convienent location only miles from the airport. ($11 taxi ride!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: phishinau
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of our vacation and it met all of our expectations. We paid $10 extra per night to be on a higher level room and it's totall worth it to have the view, believe me. The room was very clean, large, and had everything we needed. The hotel is in the middle of the strip which is fantastic, but it's still a LOT of walking to get anywhere so wear comfortable shoes unless you're going out at night trust me. We're not pool people so we can't rate that but people seemed to be enjoying them. The PH Towers has the mall connected so pretty much anything you want to shop for is right there, and it's no sweat to step outside and hit the next place either. I would reccomend hitting a convenience store or something before you arrive so you can have some booze to walk around with and not have to pay an arm and a leg for. Vegas is a cool town, and we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not well maintained. NOT A 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: theocanada
Reviews.Content: This does not meet standard 4 star criteria. There is no onsite restaurant or spa or anything. The hotel seems like it was nice when built but has not been maintained well. Room was grimy, several burnt out lights (not side ambient lights either, things like bathroom lights), and the shower arm was broken so it just bent down unless you held it up.

Reviews.Title: “A Great 21st Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bartman51
Reviews.Content: We hosted a trip to Las Vegas for my daughter's 21st. PH Towers was a great place, because the size and comfort of the suites, and the desireable location. We had 3 studio suites booked, but upon arrival they were unable to find 3 on the same floor. The reception agent (Tek) upgraded us to a 2-bedroom suite and an adjoining studio suite, which was a perfect arrangement for my wife and I, and our daughter's crew. The 2 bedroom suite was very nice - full kitchen, well appointed bedrooms and bathrooms, spacious, and even a little laundry washer. The studio suite was also nice but definitely a bit lower on the amenities in comparison to the 2-bedroom suite. This hotel is in the Miracle Mile Shops location in center strip, so the location was great. Everything about our experience was very good at PH Towers. We plan to stay there for our next LV trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort & Facilities!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie_0
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in one bedroom suite with a FAB view of the strip - large open plan lounge/dining kitchen with all facilities you need. High floor gives good view of the strip. Blind in the lounge is the screen for large projector - impressive & you have 4 other TV's throughout the suite. Large bathroom with double vanity & large shower, bedroom with large spa tub overlooking the strip - BLISS!! Check in/out can be difficult, often with long queues & only a couple of clerks on duty. Concierge helpful. Pool area good although they are very strict - have security at the entrance & they check bags to ensure you can't even take a btl of water out with you (so you have to pay the inflated resort prices) and it closed way too early in the evening! Security at elevators to ensure only residents can access the rooms which is good also. Connected to PH hotel & casino through miracle mile with plenty of shops & eateries. Good location on the strip. Loved Las Vegas & if (ok when) returning would def consider this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Non-Service”
Reviews.Author: jrad0mski
Reviews.Content: Although we were satisfied with the accomodations for the two rooms we booked bor two days during Christmas week, I am concerned about the information that I received from the concierge during my stay Dec. 27-29. I feel that I was either ignored or downright deceived by the concierge on three separate occasions. Her rudeness and lack of concern, if not demeaning treatment, was uncalled for. It is not as if I would retaliate by not staying at your hotel again, but I feel that the responses I got were mildly insulting and unnecessary when the the person responsible was being paid to be helpful. I was essentially lied to on three separate occasions. First, when asked about any good values for dining on Tues. eve., she recommended the Buffet of Buffets which would cost about $45 and I could get about four meals out of it. When my family and I stood in line at the Spice Market Buffet for over an hour and a half, we were told that the total cost for four of us would be $216. Needless to say that after all that waiting we were exhausted and decided to pay it. If we were not deceived intentionally, we were deceived by neglect in this instance. The same cavalier attitude on the the part of the concierge was felt the next day, Wed., when I asked for two different driving instructions. First, I asked for the cross street on Spring Mountain Rd. for Chinatown where we wanted to eat breakfast. At first the concierge acted as if she didn't understand what I meant by "cross street,' and after I explained what it meant, she said that I should just keep driving west on Spring Mountain, that Chinatown continued for miles and miles and I would eventually recognize it. This is, of course, not true. It was evident that the concierge was either too lazy or too disrespectful to help me out. The same is true when I asked her how I could get to the North Outlet Mall near Charleston. I'm sorry that I couldn't be more specific than that, but I think anyone would know which mall I meant. The concierge, however, didn't seem to know and rudely handed me a map of Las Vegas with two malls indicated at either end, north and south, and persisted in trying to get me to go to the one on the south end. When I asked her how to take the 215 freeway to the north mall and did not want to take Los Vegas Blvd., saying that I always get confused on Charleston, she told me (for the second time) to just take Las Vegas Blvd. and that I can't miss it. As anyone who has been to Las Vegas knows, the traffic on the Strip is horrendous and it would have been out of the way to double back to the Strip from Chinatown. These instructions were spurious to say the least, if not misleading. I feel that there was absolutely no reason for this kind of treatment and that it was mildly abusive. I don't know what might have led to her attitude; perhaps it was my age or race. At any rate, I feel that I will be more careful about asking for directions from concierges in the future. P.S.: I also remember asking for directions to Red Rock Canyon; she handed my a map and went over it which got me only to the 215 freeway but did not tell me where to get off, what direction to go, and how long it would take. We got there because I had an old Las Vegas map in the car; the visitor center doesn't have an address so I couldn't use my GPS device.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather stay here then main Planet Hollywood hotel!”
Reviews.Author: postcardsfrompeta
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, i sell this hotel the most, people would prefer their on private suite than a hotel room. Rooms are fantastic and aren't too expensive!! Perfect location even though you have to walk through miracle mile to get to the strip! Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: julia687
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Saturday 17th December for 4 nights and really enjoyed my stay. The taxi from the airport cost $20 incl tip. Checkin was very quick and service was helpful, I asked for a quiet room as I was really jet lagged and wanted a good nights sleep & the response was a chuckle and I can't promise that on a Saturday night! However I had room 645 and I didn't hear a peep at all while I was there and had a great view of the Eiffel tower and if you looked at the right time you could catch a glimpse of the Bellagio fountains! If you looked to the right the view was not as glamorous and you looked at the parking lot - see my pics but this was fine as my bed was positioned to look at the Eiffel tower. The room its self had the facilities listed with a studio but actually had a separate bedroom which meant it was a really big room (not sure if this is normal!).The room has a free safe which is not huge but you would be able to get most laptops in to it. Kitchen facility wise there is a fridge, kettle and microwave what more do you need! I know some have commented on finding the rooms dirty but I found everything to be very clean both in my room and in public areas. I liked that 24hours a day there is a security guard checking that you have a room key before they let you in to the lifts which is just an extra piece of mind which you don't get in most hotels. Location wise I was very happy with it, yes it will take you about 10-15 mins from leaving your room to get on to the strip but this is common in Vegas due to the size of the hotels. There are restaurants in the Miracle Mile so you don't have to go far to find food any time of the day and Fat Tuesday frozen cocktails were super yummy!! The hotel does offer a limited room service menu if you don't want to venture far. I had read previous comments to say that taxis don't wait at the hotel but this was not the case, I needed a cab back to the airport just after 7am and there were about 10 waiting and they seemed to have been there for awhile. I travelled solo and felt safe all of the time. I would definitely return, I found it to be a nice modern hotel that was comfortable with a great location in the middle of the strip and although there were groups drinking in the lobby on Saturday night it was not rowdy and my room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “LUCIOUS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UKX
Reviews.Content: We opened the door to our hotel room, and a blind at the end of the room automatically went up, showing us an AMAZING view of The Strip. That whole end of the room was a massive window and it was jsut amazing. Beautiful bathrrom, the toilet room had a phone in there! The kitchen was small but had everything you needed (including a bottle opener). Shower was amazing, bed was so comforatable, and when you turned the TV on it said '' Welcome (and my name)''! You could turn lights off, and close blinds etc using the TV. It was so much fun, and a very good price. The rooms were completely sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cosworth3
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for 3 nights during the New Year's day weekend. This is a timeshare and I exchange mine thru Interval International. The location is great. It is in the center of the strip, across the new City Center and the new Arias Casino and Cosmopolitan and a very convenient walk to the other casinos. The towers are attached to the Miracle Mile shops and to the Planet Hollywood casino. Security is strict and you will need to sow your hotel cards to get into the elevators. We felt very safe specially on a very crowded and busy weekend. We stayed in a studio room with a floor to ceiling window. The only drawback is there is no daily maid service because it is a timeshare. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “3 and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: Veronica667
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for big groups, young people, those looking for a room with a kitchen (but don't get too excited, they don't provide you with things like a frying pan or a pot) and washing machine/dryer, or those wanting a room with a separate living and sleeping space. We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment and the spaciousness of the room was much appreciated after 2.5 weeks in regular hotel rooms. I'd stay here again for the location and the luxury of having a kitchen and washer/dryer (which is good after some time on the road) Pros: - Great location - Nice new Casino (which didn't feel tired like Luxor or the MGM Grand) - Gorgeous floor to ceiling windows (we could even see the Bellagio fountains from our room) - 24 hour concierge - Connected to some nice food places at the Miracle Mile Shops - try the mexican place and pink's hotdogs - Comfy Bed Con's: - Cleanliness is not their strong point - Housekeeping never replaced the complimentary coffee, tea and washing powder after we used it, so we were always calling up reception for more

Reviews.Title: “Front and Center”
Reviews.Author: LBTBOONIE
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay here over Christmas-New Years. Clean and comfy suite with a great view from the 26th Flr. I preferred the southern view so I could see the majestic mtns in the distance to remind me of the true gem of the LV area - Red Rock Canyon/ Mt Charleston. Parked valet fist couple of nights but after that was nixed by the owners all being in town. No problem though to find a very convenient spot on level 3 of the shared parking with MM shoppes. MM was really nice and had all the food varieties I could want. Those that complain about the walk from the Towers to the Strip or the casino should consider working out a bit more - it's so easy that even my heart patient guest had no problem making any journey. Taxis await in abundance at valet so those complainants must not realize that either. Housekeeping was there every day too despite the reviews to the contrary (do you know to set it on your in room TV? worked for us). Maintenance was there in minutes but seemed deficient in knowledge so we had to figure out the washer/dryer and projector TV on our own. The main jetted tub was a minor disappointment as I could blow bubbles through a straw faster than the jets pushed. The junior jetted tub would put you to the other end though if you didn't hang on. Pool was not heated but the spa was open and that was great. Enough sun to lay out in if one chose as well. PBR bar, Cabo, Fresh, Oceans, and Earl of Sandwich offered great fare within steps. The house gaming crew was not overly friendly but maybe because they were so packed and busy? Still though, a smile is not that hard - is it? Being front and center for midnight was the bomb. Easy in and out with the room key as a pass - we were easily the center of the big show which did not disappoint. I'd stay here again but will likely opt for the surrounding beauty of the desert southwest resorts - having now lived la vida loca once in this center strip gem.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW!”
Reviews.Author: jadeblevens
Reviews.Content: WOW! We have just arrived home from a 6 night stay in a 2-bedroom Penthouse at Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers. Our room was absolutely incredible! THe master was HUGE and had floor to ceiling views of the strip. The kitchen was perfect with a full size fridge with and ice maker and filtered water and the kitchen was stocked with everything you would need (glasses, cups, coffee maker, post and pans etc). I loved the black out blinds too, its made sleeping in perfectly dark luxury! We held a small NYE party and all watched the most spectacular view of the fireworks of the strip. All of our guests agreed it was the place place for NYE. I LOVE the fact the you can walk right downstairs to the best shopping in Las Vegas and a very short walk to the strip. This hotel is perfect. Sleek, modern, central location, great shopping and great restaurants. I would recommend this hotel a 1000 times over! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xmasgirl75
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with beautiful rooms. Modern contemporary style. Awesome pool with ample space to take in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Djackson111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at planet Hollywood westgate tower for nye and loved our 2bed room suite !! The front desk was nice but could use a little more help with people skills. Cab you blame them though I can imagine what they see on a daily. We called down for extra blankets n pillows for the pull outs and waited an hour. Besides all of that I'll deff be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty !”
Reviews.Author: flaredblond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Westgate owners . We decided to stay at westgates Hollywood Towers for our yearly trip to Vegas . The Room are gorgeous ,however the room we stayed in was very dirty ! Lip stick still on the glasses , torn sheets and found bodily fluids in the shower , ( GROSS !!! ) I have stayed in motel 6 's that were nicer and cleaner . A very dissappointed owner :(

Reviews.Title: “"This is Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: tassie4061
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (family of 5) after two nights at NY NY. this was our first trip to Las Vegas and when we arrived at NY NY we were impressed (booked two rooms deluxe). We made the decision to move so we could have kitchen/laundry facilities as after 6 days of hotels I needed to cook for my family and the dirty laundry was getting to critical stage! Booked via phone direct and checked in at 10am to a 2 bedroom 6 TV, full kitchen, large projector screen, jacuzzi in the main bedroom, full bathroom with separate toilet and shower ( i think the 2nd room shower was over the bath?). We were not super high up I think 27/28 maybe so we could see the pool and the MGM grand. This was not an issue for us as my kids only wanted to watch the big screen anyways! Location was great, no smokey casinos and I was comfortable letting my two older daughters (16 & 18) wander down to the magic mile and shop to their hearts content after a full day of family tourist activities whilst I relaxed with my younger daughter watching a movie on the big screen. To quote my youngest when we first arrived at PH towers "this is Vegas baby!!" I would stay here again and had no issues with kitchenware or flavour of the coffee. The washing machine was a front loader washer/dryer which took me a a few loads to get use to, but it worked a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room/Great views”
Reviews.Author: Suska13
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 36th floor and had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and half of the Bellagion fountains. Plenty of space with a gallery kitchen (nothing to write home about) and a living room with a huge projection tv. I wouldn't think you could do any major cooking there but for mixing drinks and reheating pizza, it worked just great! The tub in the room was the best especially after walking 6 hrs without sitting down once! Location is great being in the middle of the strip and being attached to the Mall, you could easily get to restaurants and the ABC store. Also several theaters available in the mall- Vegas- The Show was a great one to see for less than $50 p/p

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovejonesin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great view, great location, wonderful stay. I visit Vegas often and have stayed here twice. I love bed, it is very plush and the room is trendy and has a nice touch. From the jacuzzi, to the floor to ceiling windows, to the drop down projector screen, it is awesome. We stayed here with friends, and it is a good thing we are all couples because there are only king sized beds and a pull out sofa. I love that this hotel is connected to the Miracle Mile Shops and in a great spot on the strip. The check in process could be a little faster, but hey, its Vegas and super busy. Also, it is somewhat hard to get a taxi from this hotel because it is a little off the strip. It did have a lot of people in the lobby one night, and a couple guys tried to hit on my friend and I. But, once again its Vegas, and we were looking good. It was just a little annoying though. They don't clean the room everyday because this is a timeshare. Overall, great stay and if you visit Vegas, you won't be disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Unbeatable Location!”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 53rd floor. What a view! We looked out over the MGM, Excalibur and Mandalay Bay Hotels. Location was great. Center strip across from the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan Hotels. Great for first timers to Vegas like us as we wanted to see both ends of the strip. Once you leave the hotel you are in the Miracle Mile Mall. Its a nice upscale mall to walk through. Only about a 7 minute walk at the most to the strip. Closer then most of the huge casino hotels. Room was very nice. Went Christmas week. We had a one bedroom suite, which has a large sectional sofa that pulls out to a bed, where my kids slept. Had a kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, shades that turn into projector, beautiful bedroom with a Jacuzzi. Then a large bathroom with a large walk in shower. You feel like a movie star when you first see the room. That OMG factor. Got a great deal for $119 a night for the one bedroom suite. Thought when I checked in I would have to pay a surcharge for a view, but was told I had already been given a room with a view. Great hotel for a family. This was my bargain of the year. Would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “No 5-Star that's for sure - terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: joseph d
Reviews.Content: I booked 2-bedroom suite facing Las Vegas Blvd to view the fireworks show. Paid over 1000.00 per night for 2 night stay and what I got was a 1-bedroom suite facing Koval St. with a connecting room. WHAT A JOKE will never stay there again Caesars here we come

Reviews.Title: “Grrrrrrrrrrrrreat !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovenygiants
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love going to Vegas, we wouldn't mind going every year because there's so much to do, you can't get bored and it's more fun with family or friends. We went for our Anniversary. My sister Lisa and my BFF Pam came also. My husband and I stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers in one of "Time Shares" the suite was beautiful, we could've spent the entire week in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Too many little annoyances”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over Christmas. While it had many positives, there were several little annoyances that made me question if I'd want to stay there again. First the positives: - Great location at the back of the Miracle Mile shopping center. There are tons of restaurants and great shopping locations just outside the hotel lobby. Also, the Planet Hollywood casino is a 5 minute, indoor walk away. This casino is very nice with high ceilings so it doesn't smell smoky. Also, PH is right in the middle of the Strip, in easy walking distance to other must-see resorts. - Self parking is shared with Planet Hollywood. The garage is huge and has access directly into the PH Towers lobby at Level 3. - Rooms are very new (the resort has only been open about a year). - Each room (Studio or Suite) has a small kitchenette with refrigerator (small), sink, microwave and dishwasher. Also, a few dishes, glasses and utensils are in the drawers. Although, why would you need a dishwasher? Not like you could make Thanksgiving dinner with that kitchenette. - Floor to ceiling windows. No matter which side of the tower you're on, you'll get a great view above about the 15th floor. Below that on the North side, you'll have a lovely view of the parking garage and/or the back of Planet Hollywood. - The bed is VERY comfortable and pillows are firm (which I happen to like). And the not-so-positives: - This hotel does require a lot of walking. Just to get to the Strip, you have to walk through the Miracle Mile Shops from the very back. If you're not accustomed to a lot of walking, this could be a negative. - Valet parking prioritizes time share guests. This property was built primarily to be a time share, but they clearly need to still book as hotel rooms to fill it up. As soon as the small valet lot is full, and if you're not a time share guest, you have to self-park. In ANY other hotel, as long as you're a paying guest, valet is never "full." Self-park here is fairly convenient, but sometimes you just don't want to deal with it.....if you're a hotel guest, you'll have to deal with it. - Housekeeping during my stay was inattentive. They didn't replace the bath mat. They didn't give me any drinking glasses. They didn't give me new toiletries when they ran out. They're little things, but they add up. - The rooms lack that extra something you'll find in other new hotels on the Strip. Furnishings and decor are kind of sparse and gaudy (a lot of glitter in art on the walls, the toilet is black, the sofa is a not-modern style in red leather). - The bathrooms overall are pretty small. They have combo tub/shower and no separate stand-up shower (standard in most newer Strip hotels). They also have those gross plastic shower curtain liners which just look and feel cheap. The tub is plastic. - The upkeep seems shoddy. In the first room I was given, I woke up to take a shower and the fixture came off in my hand as I tried to turn the water on. They gave me another room (upgrade to a corner suite, which was nice, but I still had to pack up and move when I just wanted to take a shower!). Even in the new room, the shower curtain rod was falling off the wall. I happened to get a pretty good package deal that included this hotel. But their prices can usually be beat at other Strip hotels that are nicer and don't have the time share element. If you're considering PH Towers, I'd suggest looking at others, too. You may get a much better experience elsewhere for the same or better price.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to do a lot of walking!”
Reviews.Author: geekymom
Reviews.Content: We are staying here for Christmas as I write this. The room is very nice, but chilly. The thermostat says its 72, but there is a definite draft. We checked in late on Friday night and when our daughter tried to make up the sofa bed, there were no sheets or pillows for it. We called housekeeping, and the sheets were promptly delivered but no pillows. We had to ask for another blanket after the 1st night, and we will ask for a 3rd, since the room is so cold. As was mentioned in a previous review, the ice dispenser in the fridge freezes up, so when I opened the freezer door to figure out why it wasn't coming out, it fell all over the floor. We had a lottery the 1st morning to see which of us would get to drink the only packet of regular coffee in the place. Why only one packet of coffee for a room that sleeps 4? Turns out the coffee itself wasn't such a prize after all. It tasted like soap. Sadly, the nearest coffee shop is almost in the casino. All in all, it is very nice, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: asiancanadian2009
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Sat. hotel lobby was busy with party groups of young 20's. desk clerk was going to charge $10 a night more for a higher level room if we wanted to have rooms on the same floor with our friends. we ended up on 29th flr anyways. they were 13 flrs below in a separate elevator access so wasn't convenient to visit each other. view was overlooking a parking lot. auto closing opening blinds were neat. water wasn't very hot and actually ran out in the morning. the overall room looked nice and clean. a bit dark. a little runned down for a 2 yr old hotel. toilet didn't flush. saw worker on the floor & told them which they fixed right away while we went out. walls were thin as paper!! got woken up at 5am with female screams of "oh yes, baby. oh yes!" Wasn't amused & quite unhappy we were woken up. it sounded like they were right in the same room as us!!! I've stayed in the TI, Paris and even though older hotels, i enjoyed them both much better than this expensive hotel! Location was good i'll give them that. Right on the strip. it was right across the street from the Cosmopolitan, which is 1 yr older than PH. that hotel was a little fancier & nicer than the PH.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: buzz101
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many times, and after the first few we decided to stay off-strip in timeshare places - we usually stay for a week or longer and enjoy the pool/sunshine and having our own kitchen. This trip was a bit different, was end of Nov, too cool for pool and we added time on to a conference (we stayed at CP for that). So was looking for Fri-Mon stay - found a great rate on bookings.com -first time I booked through them, so was a tad worried when I couldn't find the rates I paid anywhere else, but everything was perfect. Check-in was fast, received a free upgrade to a jacuzzi-room on the 35th floor, with stunning views over the Paris and the rest of the strip north (even a peakaboo view of the Belagio fountains!!). Loved staying there and having quick access to shops, the casino and a short walk to the strip. Will definitely check prices here first before looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room,but things are missing with hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelerchiq
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying the room is fantastic! From the full kitchen to the drop down wow factor movie screen , the automatic closing blinds and great tub in room,,these rooms are extraordinary! We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and looked at a 2 bedroom (the 2 bed room had a view made for king) ,but decided for the price the bedroom was pretty darn awesome. Everything was looking to be a great hotel until we got settled in. As I have said in my last review at a different Las Vegas hotel I travel quite often and work in hospitality so I am used to certain "standards". The one thing I found very odd was there was no Hotel Directory or area guide whatsoever in the room! I thought this had to be a mistake since we obviously booked a hotel room and were in one of the most traveled cities in the world,so I called the front desk and asked if they may have forgot to replace one. Nope. Second I was on a phone call and needed to write a quick number down so I looked EVERYWHERE for a pad of paper and pen...wrong again not in this hotel. Speaking of cell phone reception was HORRIBLE and could not get a signal of any kind unless I was pressed up against a window. It could have been due to my cell company which is large in Chicago,but possibly not in LV? We ordered room service from their very limited menu for breakfast and it was average.Last but not least,our fridge ice machine would not work. It kept sounding like it was working and nothing came out. It wasn't until we opened the freezer that we discovered the ice that built up falling all over ice. On a good note the engineer came really quick and fixed it really quick. I heard a rumor they were purchased by Hilton the week we stayed and I hope this rumor is true,because this great hotel is missing a lot of things that travelers paying their rates are used to. If your ok with missing some of the things I mentioned,then this hotel is great for weekend stay,especially if you will not be spending much time in the room. If they fix a few of the quirks I experienced I will absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views...great staff...great place!”
Reviews.Author: Yid1882
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay. Great staff at the bar etc who will entertain you as long as your not rude. Nicely linked to Planet Hollywood resort for the casino and shopping mall. The views are amazing. Nice clean place. If you play your cards right, you'll get a nice upgrade for next to nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not five star”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: We booked on Booking.com and stayed four nights. Had a conference at Ceasar's but their room rate was ridiculous so we opted for PH Towers - paid $99 per night. Agree with most reviewers about the service and security - both very good. We had a studio room overlooking the pool and it was very nice. Everything was very clean (I was worried based on some past reviews - perhaps they are listening!). Major issue was like others have said - no free wireless - not even in the lobby. I believe wireless in general will be addressed within a year but PHTowers is not demonstrating a good guest experience by not providing. We were shown by the front desk where to go for free wireless (coffee shops in Miracle Mile Mall). Main point to make is that ratings on reservation and review sites are not based on independent evaluations (ie AAA Diamond) but on the average of user experience. If you are looking for a five star property - this is not it. People may rate their experience as excellent which translates to five stars but that is based on their experience and value for money. For $99, this was a very good hotel but it is not five star luxury. The amenities are nice but not top line and the bedding quality again is nice but not gorgeous, no robes in the room etc affect a luxury rating. Just my opinion, but like everyone else, my opinion matters :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Detroitjb
Reviews.Content: We got a one bedroom suite. WOW!!!! Great view. The pool area is very relaxing and well laid out. Just far enough from the real hustle and bustle but close enough that you can walk to several casinos. Nice that it is attached to the Miracle Mile. More shopping and restaurants to choose from than any other casino that we've stayed at. Staff is friendly. Line ups for check in can be long, so give yourself plenty of time. The amentities are well worth it. It has no gaming or casino, but it's attached to the Planet Hollywood Casino through the Miracle Mile.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: PG66
Reviews.Content: Wow, a suite in the PH Towers was just superb and unlike any other hotel I've stayed in. From check in to check out we had no complaints. Anything needed from housekeeping came straight away and the sheer luxury of the suite was such an experience. Absolutely spotless, great views and more than one might always need on holiday, ie, dishwasher and washer/drier though they did come in very handy. Just off the strip but great location, very quiet at night but not far from all the action of Vegas. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would thoroughly recommend and would more than happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: pyrofemme
Reviews.Content: We booked by bidding for our own price and got a studio suite for just under $90 per night. Check-in was a breeze since we arrived early in the day and they were happy to let us check in early. The room was great, as pictured here with a nice big bed, pullout couch, blackout shades, jacuzzi tub in the bathroom and mini fridge/sink. The room was clean. I noticed what everyone has mentioned about the dust but I would say it's a normal amount of dust that just happens to be very visible because of the choice in furniture. I really liked that you need to show your key to access the elevators. We didn't get to check out the pool because it was very cold when we visited in November. Location was fantastic. We spent a lot of time at Planet Hollywood Casino and The Cosmopolitan. We didn't really do any shopping or eat at the places in the mall but it was nice to have them close, especially the ABC store for water, snacks and booze. Overall the stay was very nice thanks to a great room at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: romana68
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, and perfect location, we had interconnecting rooms as there is 5 in my family, very spacious and clean. would definately recommend staying at Planet Hollywood :)

Reviews.Title: “Good but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: ilanit s
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 4 nights during October. It has very spacious rooms, for 2 people you don't have to take a suite (unless you feel like… ) We had a great comfy bed, nice soaps and a clean place. Nice big pool and the fact that the mall entrance is from the lobby, very convenient! The first room we got, we had a view to the parking lot, not the best of Vegas…. So we upgraded toe room (additional 10$ per night) to a strip view. We were there during the weekend + 1 day, and I must say that there are lots of young and noisy people during the weekend, it wasn't the nicest thing (loud, drunk and Inconsiderate). I could hear them at 3 am after they are back from clubbing or what ever. One more thing that I didn't like – if you want wi-fi you need to pay an extra. We already paid a nice amount of money, we thing the wi-fi service should be complementary. The hotel is bit dated, but good over all.

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers Westgate”
Reviews.Author: Lindamen
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the place was clean except for a big hair ball in the shower corner they missed. Other than that they were courteous and service was prompt. We had a nice view and the accommodations were very comfortable and modern and bright!

Reviews.Title: “Ok , getting dated”
Reviews.Author: seaserpent
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok, but really dark furniture in the rooms. Rugs in hallways with all the swirls are abit tacky, overall great casino and amenities but rooms are approaching a refresh

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as fantastic as before”
Reviews.Author: Nevileon
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to PH Towers. Our first time was an amazing experience (offered the Penthouse Suite upgrade during the 2010 Vegas Marathon / NFR weekend for $60 / night). That suite was pretty legendary. This time, unfortunately we were curtly told by the check-in desk that an upgrade probably wasn't available, and even if it were, it would be $150 to upgrade. He didn't bother looking, so we kept our 2 BR king suite. We ended up with a suite in the middle which faced the parking lot and had a view of a corner of the Venetian. The suites are quite nice. Reasonably recently made, the penthouse last year was amazing. The king 2BR (really a 1 BR suite with adjoining king room) was still fairly decent - projector, TV, single shower in the master bedroom (penthouse has a double-headed shower). Our room this year had a few small wear and tear issues. At some point in time, a group staying here had been quite rowdy. The front door, bathroom doors (in both rooms) had large cracks in the middle around the doorknob (like they had been slammed repeatedly). The TV speakers didn't always work and required some tweaking to keep a connection. Our safe also didn't work - it was out of batteries (two calls to security and the front desk promised a resolution when the locksmith was able to come. This did not get fixed by the end of our 4 day trip). The mall itself is nice - there are convenience in it making for easy instant parties (liquor available right there). As mentioned before, there are no discounts or perks for staying in the towers, and we found the price comparable to any of the other hotels with casinos in the basement. That said, some might find not having an attached casino (and the associated cigarette smoke) a plus. Cleaning staff were friendly when acknowledged in the hall. Our room was always tidied, and the extra pull out bed was made for us. The first day, our maid even reorganized all the miscellaneous items we left strewn about (thanks!). The security staff at the elevators were less friendly, and the methods they used to determine who to check for a room pass were somewhat arbitrary. I did not have a chance to check out the pool or the bar this trip (although last year they were both fun, although the bar was pricey on non happy hour nights). Overall: A nice hotel, although for the cost not the same steal it used to be before.

Reviews.Title: “5 star AWESOMENESS!”
Reviews.Author: Lucas_and_Nikki
Reviews.Content: Love love love! We stayed at the PH Towers for my girlfriend's 30th birthday, and got a 2 bedroom suite to share. I can honestly say it's one of the smartest decisions I've ever made, and definitely the nicest place I've ever stayed in. We had a group of friends that stayed in a 2 bedroom suite here last year, and we booked the same room based mainly on our experience with them. Needless to say it's even better when it's your room! The room itself is well designed - it's effectively two separate rooms joined by a door from the 'second' room into the main lounge / kitchen piece, meaning you have separate entrances for each side if needed. The 'master' room has a spa bath and larger bathroom, while the second room has a small kitchentte and small lounge type area. The bed is quite possibly THE most comfortable bed in the world, to the point where I wanted to buy one of my own. There's a projector in the roof of the main lounge and a screen in front of the main windows (tvs in the bedrooms, lounge and kitchen), big fridge & freezer, plus limited cooking / eating utensils. Unfortunately our room looked straight into a carpark building - we were about 3 floors away from clearing it and having a great view - but friends of ours had a 1 bed suite well up (30th floor or so) and their view was fantastic. Also, the room our other friends had last year had a great view overlooking the pool. The staff are really helpful, polite and friendly, and there was a security officer at the lift lobby so only guests with room keys (or people with guests) could go up. Given the location (inside the shopping mall) I thought this was a really great idea and reassuring to know only legitimate people could go up. The pool is really nice, although we went at the end of September and the sun disappeared behind another building by about 4pm, so it cooled down quite quickly after that. However, during the summer months I'm sure it's less of an issue, especially being warmer anyway. We didn't eat or drink on site, other than at the pool-side bar (you can't take your own drinks or food out there), so not sure what the restaurants are like, but there is a fair amount of choice in the mall to satisfy all types. Apart from the view there was nothing to complain about at all - I was gutted when we had to leave. There are so many places in Vegas to stay, but if you're looking for something a bit nicer then this is definitely worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “2 bedroom apartments”
Reviews.Author: Clarkiejan71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PH towers due to the availability of 6 fitting in the one space. Beautiful, new and all the mod cons. Tip the staff and they will tell you where to visit in Vegas for family friendly attractions. ie baby animals born .... The only disappointing fact was we had to make up the pull out bed for the kids to sleep on. But there were two choices where they could sleep so I guess it was our decision. Perfectly clean, modern and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, quiet”
Reviews.Author: GsfHollywood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just before Thanksgiving, hotel was quiet and they charged us only $10 for upgrade to a high floor (50th, which is really 40th). Got a great deal on a one-bedroom suite, full kitchen which we like so we can have snacks and cook breakfast. Walked 2/3 blocks to Walgreens for some eggs and butter, then went into 7-11 (which is closer, on Las Vegas Blvd.) and found their prices much lower! Best deal for bottled water is ABC store in the mall. Room was clean and comfortable, full living area (quality of furniture is not tops but ok), had trouble getting the TV to work. Lots of switches on the wall, one button shuts down the electrical "drapes" (very cool)!! View is STUPENDOUS, could partially see the Bellagio Fountains, down the strip and the mountains. Jacuzzi tub right next to the bed in the bedroom (strange), batrhroom was very large with double sinks and vanity and large shower stall. Bed was very comfortable. Also nice ~ they have buttons by the door for "Do not disturb" and "clean my room" (also on the TV). Staff was accomodating, and we got our 5 AM wake up call (automated) so that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Like your own condo!”
Reviews.Author: HiddenMeadows
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. It is like being in a one bedroom/ one bath townhouse or apartment. Plus you have a large spa/tub in the master bedroom! We didn't get to try it out but it sure was roomy! The kitchen had a microwave, stove top and a huge refrigerator with water in the door! Another surprise was a projector which when you pushed the button to lower the GIANT black out shade - turned it into your own theatre! We watched a movie and a few TV shows and it was fun to have such a large picture! The service was excellent. Views were stupendous! We came into town via McCarran Airport and we took a taxi to the hotel, so I cannot speak for the parking. Directly connected to the Miracle Mile of shops! OH MY GOSH, so handy to walk out into a mall with everything you can want! Even an ABC store which I haven't seen since a trip to Hawaii! We would stay here again...and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Experience”
Reviews.Author: hm86
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, and it was at the last lag of my 13 day west coast trip! I definitely had a great experience. The room was clean and a great size for 4 girls. However the location isn't 'prime' I didnt realize that there was alot of walking in Vegas and what seems close to you is actually a very far walk due to the way the streets are designed. I would prefer to stay at the older hotels where the night life is better as that was the sole purpose of my trip, to party and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Some things I wish I had known....”
Reviews.Author: Tess0247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers from November 15-20, 2011. While I had an overall enjoyable vacation, there are some things I wish I had known about this hotel and vegas in general before making my dicision. 1. This hotel does not offer casino comps. Because PH Towers is not technically affiliated with Planet Hollywood Casino & Resort (this is the timeshare, NOT the hotel), they do not offer any sort of casino comps. Is this importants? If you plan to gamble, most hotels will offer you a comp at the end of your stay based on the amount of $$ you spent in their casino. Since this hotel does not participate, there were no comps offered at the end of my stay. Since we did spend a pretty penny gambling, next time I will stay somewhere that I can get a discount when I check out based on this. 2. I'm not sure if I paid a resort fee but if I did, this did not include internet access. We had to pay an extra $40 to have internet access in our room for 4 days. Since we really weren't in our room that much, this was a waste of money. Next time, we'll use our iphones to access internet and will do it from the lobby where there is better reception. 3. I booked through bookit.com and they were offering a free upgrade for Sun-Thurs travelers. We were staying from Tuesday - Sunday. I asked if this qualified for the upgrade and I was assured that it was by bookit.com. I even called back, TWICE, and checked to be sure if this applied and both times was told yes. Of course when I checked in, I was told that I did not qualify for the upgrade. I got upset and called bookit, who told me there was nothing they could do about it, that it was a promo offered by the hotel and if they didnt want to honor it, bookit could not make them. I ended up speaking with a manager at the hotel and getting the upgrade for Tues & Wed but had to pay $40/night for the upgrade for the other 3 nights. 4. The upgrade wasn't worth it. While the room was VERY nice with a projection television and jacuzzi tub, we were NEVER in our room (being in vegas and all) so we didn't even get to enjoy the extra money we spent. Save your money - in vegas you will NOT be in your room so just worry about the bed. 5. Speaking of beds, the beds here were very comfortable. The whole set up of the 1 bedroom King Suite was comfortable. There was a nice view from the 32nd floor and we could see the Bellagio Fountains from our room. The tub was nice and (for the most part) worked well. We did have a little issue with the shower head but were able to fix it ourselves. The washer/dryer didn't work very well since it took an entire day to dry a load of clothes but that could have been user error as I've never used a machine that is both a washer AND a dryer. There was a full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, oven, coffee pot, plates, silverware, glasses and even a blender in the kitchen so this was all fully stocked. There is an iron and ironing board. The projection tv worked incredibly well and my husband enjoyed this. 6. The emplyees were not overly friendly. A little snooty actually but not intolerable. All in all our trip to Planet Hollywood Towers was an enjoyable one. We will return to Vegas again but will stay somewhere that has its own casino.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: NM72
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a great 1 bedroom suite on the 56th floor with amazing views towards the Stratosphere and part views of the Bellagio fountains. The suite really has the 'wow' factor - lots of black and red, big L-shaped red leather sofa, great kitchen facilities. Bedroom was good with comfy bed and, best of all, big jacuzzi. A great bonus, and talking point, is the electric blind in the lounge which becomes a massive projector screen. We made a movie night of this which and it was great fun. Let downs and reasons for not giving the full 5 stars are that they tried to fob us off with a studio suite when we had booked a 1 bed. Also, having just stayed three nights prior in the MGM signature, the bathroom facilities were not as nice (MGM has larger more luxurious bathroom with bath & shower plus there is also an additional shower/W/C off the lounge), although the jacuzzi in the bedroom at PH does help to make up for it.
