I also advised the staff at the desk that our bathroom/bedroom door handle had a fault which meant the door would not shut properly and they failed to attend to this during our stay. The location in the strip is spot on, right in the centre and the PH Miracle mile shopping centre is nice with some good places to go for breakfast etc too. If you're planning a trip to Vegas and want the full on Vegas experience then this place will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Big Suite, Good Location, Noisy Young Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Dean1967
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom suite in this hotel for the two us, plenty of room to relax. A couple of nights were pretty noisy with partying going on somewhere near us. The room had some problems, big screen tv had no sound, glass divider in bathroom was really loose, shower head was leaking. Advised front desk but nothing was done about it, hotel price not adjusted. Not a big deal as it did not really effect us - just didn't want to be charged for something I did not break. Hotel is in good location, centre strip with Miracle Mile shops attached, good and cheaper eating available in this mall (Earl of Sandwich, Blondies 3.99 breakfast including a beer! and other food choices). Good Experience over all but will probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Suite!”
Reviews.Author: feltqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an absolutely gorgeous 1 bedroom suite in the PH Towers for three nights. We upgraded to the 56th floor for only $10 a night and it was worth every penny! Fantastic views of everything for miles. The room was beautifully furnished with tons of room. Full sized kitchen with double fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher. Plenty of plates and cutlery, but no pots and pans. We had groceries (including wine & liquor) delivered directly to the hotel by vons.com - much less expensive and they have a one-hour delivery window, so you are not waiting around all day. Bed was very comfy. Bathroom was very cool, only problem was very low water pressure in the shower. However, the huge jacuzzi tub in the bedroom more than compensated. We loved the automatic blackout shades and the projection tv. Our friends were green with envy when they saw the room and spent more time in our room than their own across the street. The towers themselves were about a half a block (that's a Las Vegas block - which can be quite a ways) behind the Planet Hollywood Casino & Resort - and connected by the Miracle Miles Shops. This was not a problem for us, and quite frankly, I think most rooms in Vegas require a hike to the casino, pool, or outdoors, so iti didn't bother us. We liked the location and were able to get everywhere we wanted to go easily by foot, taxi, or monorail. I would definitely highly recommend the PH Towers and we will come back. All staff were helpful and friendly. Loved it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: east2009
Reviews.Content: We felt like rock stars in this hotel. We stayed here with our 8yr old son, who just loved the large projector screen he could watch tv on. The 1 bedroom suite was fantastic, with floor to ceiling views over the other hotels. Awesome especially at night time. Our view was from the Bellagio fountains / Paris Paris hotel right down to the Stratosphere hotel. Loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: allan1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time back in December 2010 when my wife and I stayed for a week to celebrate my wifes 30th birthday. This was our 2nd visit to Vegas but our first staying in PH Towers. On our first visit we knew we loved Las Vegas so decided to take up a timeshare in PH Towers so I must admit I was a little concerned at the time our trip came around as there was a number of negative reviews floating about, however, I needn't have worried. Check in was really straight forward, we even got in early at 9am and this wasn't a problem, our room was ready. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 34 floor and it was amazing. From the views up the strip to the projector tv. We didn't have any issue with noise which I was slightly surprised at as we were on the same corridor as the demonstration rooms used for the timeshare viewings, but this was never a problem Really couldn't fault the place and didn't experience any of the issues others have pointed out i.e. dirty rooms, furniture damaged, etc. THe only thing that was a slight problem (and the reason I've only rated it 4/5) was that we didn't have any maid service while we were there, however, as it is a timeshare we were only supposed to have this once during the 7 days but it didn't really bother us as there were loads of towels and I really don't care if the bin wasn't emptied. The maid staff I encountered were all very pleasant so I'm pretty sure had I asked to get the bin emptied or towels changed it wouldn't have been an issue. Also loved the fact that it is a no smoking hotel as I DESPISE having to stay in rooms that smell of stale smoke. It really is great to get away from the smokey atmosphere of all the casinos and just relax in some clean air!!! Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for all walks of life and the location right in the middle of the strip really tops it off!

Reviews.Title: “Suite life in Planet Hollywood!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal M
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the ph towers westgate . My husband and I came to Vegas for a couples weekend with friends and we had the best room and view! The suite was beautiful and clean. My husband loves all of the technical gadgets. The large projector screen that comes down as an alternative window shade. The picture was very clear on the projector screen. There is a full kitchen complete with a stainless steel refrigerator with icemake attached, dishwasher, glasses, stove, and microwave convection oven. I really relaxed after a night at the club in the in suite hot tub. The bed was so soft with a comfortable down comforter. The bathroom was wonderful as well. Large mirror double sinks large shower bug enough for two people. The location is pretty good . We were located adjacent to the Planet Hollywood Casino a short walk and in the new center strip across from Cosmopolation and Aria. We were able to walk most places and then we we were tired just took a taxi rude where we needed to go. Oh yeah when heading back to our room there was an security guard posted near the elevators 24/7 to make sure we showed our room key to gain access to our elevator to take us to our room. I thought this was nice I felt very secure. Because on Friday and Saturday there was a lot of traffic. I will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Vegas!!! Enjoyed it , enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “A modern place”
Reviews.Author: Choosy2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so modern, which I totally love and was able to roam around the Miracle Mile Shops since it is attached to the ph towers. The room was clean and comfortable and the view from the 31st floor was superb. You can see the airport and the lights at night was awesome... They do have a modern decor and I like the red and black color scheme as part of their decoration. Also the pool is a great place to drink and just relax and chill. If you are going, pay extra 10 dollars per night and you won't be disappointed. Also, when you leave dishes on the sink, the housekeeper will wash it on the dishwasher. I was so surprised she they actually did the dishes for me. Lots of shopping, drinking and relaxation makes a perfect vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “Booking here, will ruin your Vegas vacation no doubt!”
Reviews.Author: f_sphan
Reviews.Content: So my bf had to spend his 21st in Iraq so I figured for his 22bd bday, ill take him to Vegas! This was for October 27th. I booked my one bedroom suite in JULY. Totally exicted, except I never got a confirmation email. So I called back 3 days later and finally got one sent. The email stated that they took out the first night deposit of around $170. Not bad I thought. So when our trip got closer, I called October 3rd and asked if our reservation was good to go and if there were any problems. The man I spoke to, "saul" said yes its good to go. I see you have booked a stuido.....blah blah blah" I said, wait no.. i booked the one bed suite! I got a email and everything. He said there was nothing he could do since all the suites were booked up. I threw a fit and asked to speak to the manager. 5mins on hold, Saul came back and our orginal reservation somehow popped back up. Supicous???? So again, I asked for another email just in case. When we got there on Thursday Oct 27, the lady up front tried to charge us an extra $150. I asked what that was for? She said, "that's the deposit money" I said ohhh the extra $50 a night correct? Wrong! She said in order for them to book us, they needed that payment of $150 and the extra $50 a night for safety deposit which that part will be refunded. i said hold on! I have an email from planet Hollywood saying you already took $170 out in July. We have a bank statement. She said Noo, its not in their system. I asked to speak with a manager. 25 mins later, the lady comes out saying they looked through their computers again, and still couldn't find that they charged us. Once again, I asked for the mangaer. Waited another 20mins and she said there was nothing we can do except pay that $150 (on top of our $650 room). i showed her the email, ans she said she understood what it says on there but its possible that the hotel refunded the money back since we booked it months in advance. She said I needed to print a bank statement! Omg right! i only had my bank app on my phone which was not acceptable and I just totally forgot to carry my 10 pound printer everywhere I went. So i called my bank to see If there were any refunds from planet Hollywood. As I expected, NOPE! She said sorry, there isn't anything they could do. So i said, screw this. im canceling. She had the nerve to say to me, "you sure? Its Halloween weekend and we are completly booked" I turned around and asked her, " if you're completely booked, why would you guys "refund" $170 back then but still keep our reservation if you were completly booked????" She looked lost. She said, "I really don't know. I'm sorry" that was it. They did absolutely nothing. Our first time in Vegas, and planet Hollywood made it miserable. We booked months in advance for no reason, got email confirmations that apparently didn't mean crap to them and they wasted almost 2 hours of my time. We moved over to the cosmopolitan and was very pleased. So, be smart guys, i read the reviews but still booked with them anyways. Dont make our mistake! Book elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying here again, dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tara A
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd trip to Vegas and this is by far the worst place I have stayed yet. Our first room we were given was on the 5th floor with an ugly view of the parking garage it was noisy and the bathroom was dirty so we asked to change rooms, the only way we could change is if we payed to upgrade to a suite. The second room we were given with an extra cost had a false fingernail left on the coffee table and an empty beer bottle by the bed, at this point we were to tired to move agian so they just gave us a $50.00 credit to the hotel restaurant. The rooms were spaciouse but looked like they hadn't been dusted since the hotel opened and there was quite a bit of damage already to the suites. There was three of us staying in the suite and they only supplied two wine glasses, we called to have one more brought up but they said that two is all we get. Always a long wait at the concierge desk, only one lady working who was not friendly and didn't smile. We ask one of the employees in the lobby to take our picture, she acted like it was an inconvenience.The last morning of our stay our maid just walked into our room while we were stil sleeping at 9:00am, when we checked in we were told that check out was at noon, our maid showed up again at 11:00 and said that check out was actually at 11:00 and we were no where near packed and ready to leave. Lots of young partiers stay here so when you are trying to sleep you here alot of noise and music until about 3:30am in the morning. The pros: Good location, about 10min walk through mall to restaurants, coffee, casion and abc store. Cheap and tasty sandwich shop called Earl of Sandwich open 24 hours, and the Mexican restaurant called Yolos was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorpSpy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference. I found the staff friendly and the hotel clean and bright. On the plus side, the hotel is on the newer section of the strip, central to lots of activities. The exercise room was large with several nice pieces of name-brand equipment. The hotel also has a security guard always posted near the elevators and they did a very good job of checking keys to ensure that only hotel quests can go upstairs. Finally, the casino was busy but not overcrowded. On the negative side, the room is not really set up for using a laptop as I wish there was a chair to next to a table. Also, I wish the exercise room had sani-wipes to use on the equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: tombond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plant Hollywood Towers on the 32nd floor overlooking the MGM, Airport and down the strip to the Mandalay Bay. The room we had was fantastic nice and big even though it was a standard room. We got into our room to find it in darkness as the blinds where closed which kept it a nice temperature. The blinds are electric and can be opened from the button on the wall or controlled from the TV along with anything else in the room which is cool as you dont have to get out of bed to open the blinds or change the temperature on the Air Con. The bathroom is a nice size with the whirlpool tub which was nice to relax in after a long transatlantic flight or after walking around all the hotels on the strip. The hotel is attached to the Miracle Mall so plenty of restaurants and shops to choose from and also connects to the Planet Hollywood Hotel. We never had to wait to long for a lift as there is 6 elevators in the towers and they are nice and fast only taking a couple of seconds to get to the 32nd floor. I found all staff to be nice and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We really enjoyed our time at this hotel and found that 4 days was not long enough and are already planning to come back to this hotel again next year for even longer. Good Job Planet Hollywood Towers

Reviews.Title: “Nasty people @ PH TOWERS!”
Reviews.Author: joolzroz
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we got sweet talked one afternoon whilst growing the Mall @ Planet Hollywood, by 'hey, guys, how do you fancy 2 free show tickets, voucher for a meal @ PH, just for listening to our review of the new apartments, should only take 90 mins'. Well, I'm sure you know what I'm going to say next, it was the worst decision we made & could well of spoilt our holiday in Vegas. We were silly have to have got taken in but I wanted to warn people. We had a lovely tour, quite a long walk to PH Towers, sat down, spoken to by very 'hard faced' so called business people, shaparoned into the room where hundreds more people were all being pressurised into buying apartments. Initially, the young girl, in 6 inch heels, there were many all trying to walk in them & trying to look important, she was very nice, but once we said & explained very politely that we were not interested due to commitments back at home, she went to get her so called Supervisor, called CHRISTA, BEWARE, a very nasty young woman, she really turned on us, whe. We said we wanted to leave. Horrendous, so very rude in everyway..... So be careful not to get wrapped up in this scam.....hence we told them where they could stick their show tickets, we weren't that desparate! I will never stay or give PH my money after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: cleveburg
Reviews.Content: The lobby is bright, spacious and modernly decorated. Check-in was a breeze and the entire staff was friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which was as spacious and well appointed as the other Westgate properties. The decor was great and we were wowed by the great view of the strip from the floor to ceiling windows in every room. We didn't have a chance to watch the huge projection TV, cause we were in Vegas, you know. Convenient to everything, and they are adding on a huge Walgreen's with grocery, so you won't even have to leave to shop. The concierge made my spa appointment in a jiffy and was ready to get anything else we wanted. A bar charge that we hadn't made showed up on our bill, and the manager took it off and apologized. I have to give it to Westgate- their customer service has always been excellent, but they just raised it up a notch. We are very pleased with our Westgate property purchase. It's the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: ut_ragazzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the opening 2 weeks back in February of 2010. The events that brought me to Vegas were directly across the street at City Center so it made everything very convenient. Having an entrance directly into the Miracle Mile Shops is also a plus. The room design was well thought out, large in size and having a kitchen in-suite is always a plus. My guess is, that there have been many improvements made to this property since it has opened in full swing but these were my assessments at the time of our stay: 1. There was still construction dust on everything! We even switched rooms due to a noisy neighbor and the new room was just as messy. I'm hoping the rooms are now spotless. 2. Being a Westgate property, we were approached left and right to attend a timeshare meeting during our stay. I booked this as a hotel and paid standard rates so I certainly didn't expect the sales approach daily - it was quite annoying. 3. The pool was closed still which was a huge disappointment. We were also told we didn't get access to Planet Hollywood's pool, their sister property, because this was a Westgate Resort. Ridiculous actually. 4. The location on the strip is great however, the side of our room faced McCarran International so we often heard planes and their flight paths to the hotel were too close for comfort. Maybe Westgate will invite us back to re-assess?

Reviews.Title: “Great in principle , poor overall”
Reviews.Author: LeGrandeLondon
Reviews.Content: If your a group crack on . If however you've done Vegas before , want to use gambling points to reduce accommodation etc etc this is NOT the place for you . Add into pretty poor room cleaning and it's average overall . Best bit is location but there are many better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with attention to detail could be even better”
Reviews.Author: noodle1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my husband. We are Westgate owners so received a rate of about half the weekend price per room. Hotel lobby is great, unique decor and a bar as well. This is a non gaming hotel but the Plant Hollywood is practically attached to that's not an issue. Our room was the standard and very clean but upon further inspection some thing were overlooked. On and around the airvents on the walls was COVERED with dust, large clumps of it. Chips in furniture and walls hadn't been repaired. The jetted tub in the bedroom was a little scummy and required a thorough washing before use (and initially it didn't seem to work but I realized that there is a minimum fill level sensor that must be covered in water before the jets will turn on...one I filled to that level all was well). Lots of dings and scuffs in the hallways between rooms...little stuff like that that make the place seem aged even though its very new. Even in October the pool didn't have enough servers but it wasn't extremely expensive. Menu for the pool was a bit limited. TV's in each room were great and the interface to control the lights, tv, projector and such was easy to manage which was nice. And the bed was insanely comfortable!!! The hotel is very well located and close to everything and the few negatives are not enough to outweigh the great experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Vi Va Las Vegas PH style!”
Reviews.Author: Blessedon21
Reviews.Content: PH Towers is a great location it is right in the middle of the Strip and the best thing is that PH Towers is connected to a mall with wonderful dtores and resturants. The Bus " The Deuce" which is what everybody uses instead of taxi's bus stop is also right outside PH Towers. I am a Chef amoung other things so we choose PH towers for the full kitchen so I could cook the mornings we decided to sleep in. Questions just send me a msg.

Reviews.Title: “Definate WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: supergaza
Reviews.Content: Being veteran visitors to the PH over the last few years we booked the PH Towers (Westgate) after seeing a good rate on Booking.Com. All vegas rooms are fab comparing to your average hotel room but you do get the WOW factor at the towers for the same price as a decent room in any of the 4 or 5 star hotels on the strip. Our room was 5316. You walk into a 1000+ sq foot space with huge picture windows overlooking the strip. You also get an open planned kitchen / lounge that can accomodate 6 easily with huge red leather sofa's and fully equipped kitchen. (See the small gripe about the kitchen further on). The kitchen and bathroom have Flat screen T.Vs as does the lounge (42inch) and the bedroom (42inch). If that wasn't enough the huge electric blind for the lounge window converts into an 8 foot projector screen for the lounge TV and you watch via the HD projector built into the ceiling anything you want to watch on the TV ( normal TV or hotel film library...:))). Then there is the 10 foot square jaccuzzi bath in your bedroom - I kid you not. A fully fitted bathroom the size of your average lounge completes the suite. Even has a state of the art washer/dryer hidden in one of the cuphaords in the bathroom. Without doubt the best suite for the money on the strip. We paid a thousand dollers for 7 nights. WOW. Checking in and out was a breeze, the valet and taxi areas are quiter than the more popular hotels so you get real personal service. So just a couple of wee gripes: Although you get a supherb fittet kitchen with double american fridge freezer / hob / microwave there is no kettle or toaster. There is also a lack of basics like wine glasses / wine opener etc - they try hard to make you eat out! So my advice would be to take a small kettle (you can use the coffee maker if you want) and/or a cheap toaster if toast is your thing and you want to save 50 dollers a day on breakfast. The suite is so great you feel you want to eat in there sometimes. Also take you fav coffee / sugar / condiments / cereal / corkscrew as there is NO shops anywhere near the strip apart from a 7/11. Would definately book the PH Towers again for the next trip - request a room above floor 50. Amazing. You can live the champange lifestyle for the price of a lemonade room. You'de be mad not to!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with PH Westgate”
Reviews.Author: adventures2go
Reviews.Content: went to Las Vegas first time October 31-Nov 4th. Weary of bed bugs (if you've read the latest reviews on many of the Las Vegas area hotels) and we ended up being very happy with our hotel suite with jacuzzi overall. This is a very nice hotel and after being around the strip.. we had found that the best places to dine were located right in our hotel. Our room was clean, nicely decorated, with awesome views of the city. The only complaint was the remote for the t.v. didn't work very well. Otherwise, we plan on booking to stay at this hotel again. Reasonably priced, no long lines for check-in, no lines waiting for cabs like we'd seen at other hotels. Don't confuse this hotel Westgate, with the PH towers. This building in only a couple years old and we didn't stay at the PH Resort, Casino, although it is attached. Book your rooms worry free and enjoy :). Happy travelers, Mari & Steve

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location!”
Reviews.Author: Lepandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days. If you think to stay in Vegas for few days this hotel is perfect for the location! Forget about qualMty...this is not a five star quality service. First staff was extremely rood and arrogant! When we checked in I was missing my baggage form my airline and I kindly asked to give a me bell once baggage would have delivered from airline. They told me to go in the basement and have it checked by myself!!! The first morning the cleaning staff knocked at the door urging us to leave the room as they couldn't wait any longer for cleaning the room....it was 9 in the morning!!!!!! The day we left they knocked at our door 2 hours before check out telling us that we should leave the room and proceed to check out desk! And finally at check out we have overcharged on our credit the did not reverse the deposit amount on our credit card!!! Basically they charged us more money!!!! And you know what the lady at the front despot annoyed cose we where spotting that something wrong went through our credit card!! Terrible service, rude and umpolite staff. Choose this hotel only for position and if you do not really care about service. This is not a five star hotel service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: Family5Missouri
Reviews.Content: We were a little unsure what to expect with some previous reviews but found this timeshare/condo great. We had a one bedroom suite that was clean and contempory. Our neighbors were a little loud one night but otherwise no complaints. Would go again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: dcalvin
Reviews.Content: very clean, big rooms , great location easy check in and out will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for my First Time”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel was going to be nice but it was aweseome! I got a sweet deal through Priceline and then upgraded when I got there into a 1 Bedroom Suite. My jaw dropped when I walked into the room. I really didn't want to leave. :) Service was friendly and there was plenty of elevators to handle the crowds. I will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireImp
Reviews.Content: We found Planet Hollywood Towers absolutely fantastic. Our studio room was perfectly clean and came with some nice gadget extras like the automatic blind controlled through the TV and a handy kitchenette with a microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher and fridge. The bed was (very high) but exceedingly comfy. Location wise I would say it is perfect, some may argue that you have to walk through the Miracle Mile shops before reaching the hotel but to be completely honest, any hotel room in Vegas entails a lengthy walk through a huge casino anyway and this hotel misses that out. We also liked not having the casino in the hotel, it made for a very quiet stay with us rarely seeing anyone on our corridor. Although we did not speak to staff much over our stay, the security staff that checked room keys always seemed friendly. Having this 24hour security on the entrance to elevators was nice and made the place feel very safe and secure. On check in our room was moved to a more desirable floor free of charge - so if you want a higher room than first alocated, do ask, it could pay off! All in all a perfect stay and recommended to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: ELKGROVE624
Reviews.Content: The PH Towers were beautiful ! Very clean and so spacious that I it didnt have that hotel room feel. We took a one bedroom suite, had a full kitchen and a beautiful huge leather sofa with a full wall of a projection TV in our living room. There was a large spa tub in our bedroom also. I highly recommend this place. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: momof3beauties
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful. The view was awesome. The service was great. Definitely geared towards the younger hipper crowd. A little bit of a walk to the strip but not bad. Make sure you specify towers to limos and taxis otherwise you'll end up at planet hollywood hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: melinda_sharelle
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom suit and it was fantastic! lots of room, great bathroom and love the block-out shutters! Dissapointingly was asked to be quiet around 2am. I suppose if I was next door trying to sleep, fair enough, but its VEGAS! it was just 2 of us, an ipod and a small burger speaker, caouldnt have been too loud right? A really good thing was that there is security on the elevator entrance, so only people with key cards can get up to the floors. Bad thing, room service doenst last long, finished at 9pm, and our projector screen didnt work properly. nor could i call reception from the phones, but hey, who cares, we had a killer room!!

Reviews.Title: “Party central, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: crazy_rachie
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the funkiest hotels I've ever stayed in, we got here exhausted after a loooong drive from LA in our hire car in August and had an absolute ball! The hotel is clean, perfectly located (opposite the Bellagio), has a lovely pool area and the rooms are amazing! It lost one rating from me because when we arrived the disinterested staff member advised us there was no booking, anyway she managed to find us a room perhaps we got a little bit of an upgrade because the room we got looked like the one we had booked - plus the added bonus of a theatre room like projector screen and a leather L shaped couch! :) The room was fabulous we had booked a deluxe room I think and got a large en-suite with a washing machine in the cupboard underneath the sink, a jacuzzi in the bedroom area, with a large bed and chaise chair, then a separate kitchen and tv area, we could have lived there quite comfortably! This hotel is party central, it's lively, fun and attached to the Planet Hollywood Shopping Complex, heaps of shops, bars, restaurants takeaway, etc. The pool area was quite trendy, (we're 30 and felt a little old) loadsa wannabes everywhere, they even do bikini comps! There's partying in rooms all night long and you will definitely need ear plugs if you want to sleep. Needless to say we didn't get much but who does in Vegas? If you want a fun, central hotel then definitely stay here, I don't think it would suit older couples who want peace and quiet nor would it suit families but it was great for us. Also if you have a kitchen in your hotel and want to get some "normal" healthy food, be sure to check out the Whole Foods organic supermarket before you hit the main Vegas strip it's fantastic, also the shopping outlet just before you get into Vegas itself off the interstate is amazing lots of bargains there, well worth a visit! :)

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers @ $90/night.........not bad”
Reviews.Author: oakraider
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 11. Used Priceline for rooms @ $90/night. No line at checkin, but it still took a while(I think the clerk was new and we checked in a little early so it wasn't really his fault). Room was clean with a great view. No complaints with maid service. Younger crowd, nice 3 day stay. I think the regular price was around $170/night, probably wouldn't stay here for that price, but less than $100 was great. One weird thing though, I had a king size bed, but they only put queen size sheets on the bed kind of sideways, so about 1 foot of the mattress at the bottom wasn't covered with a sheet. I guess times are tough and they can't afford king size sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, younger crowd.”
Reviews.Author: sk1955
Reviews.Content: We recently ended up here on a decent priceline buy. The rooms were extremely large with a small kitchenette and comfy sleeper couch. With the City Center and Miracle Mile, there's no reason to fight the crowds and wander up the Strip. The crowd was younger here and weekend noise from the pool is distracting but its Vegas and the pool closes at seven. After staying at some of Vegas' five star hotels, this four star is fine and much better than settling for fewer stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Really!”
Reviews.Author: deedeepotts
Reviews.Content: As others have already written, we were nervous by the reviews we read regarding housekeeping, the noise level, and front desk issues, but we experienced no negatives! The Towers was the perfect place to stay for our girl get-away. Mom, 2 daughters and 2 grand-daughters. Accommodated us perfectly. So much room in our two-bedroom suite to spread out and relax. Loved having a full kitchen and the view of the pool was great. Loved the pool, as well. Checked out the regular pool at Planet Hollywood (yuck!) and were very happy we were at the Towers. We were also nervous about the walk to the casino and strip, but it wasn't that bad and the exercise was good for us! Front desk was extremely friendly and easily accessible. Loved this place and can't wait to stay here again. Hope the word doesn't get out! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times”
Reviews.Author: 1hapicamper
Reviews.Content: We rented 3 2-bedroom suites at PH Westgate Towers for our daughters 21st birthday. We were surprised at how spacious and beautiful these suites are. The decor is modern in black, red and white colors. There is a full size kitchen with all stainless steel appliances. The living area has a red leather sectional couch and chairs. Plenty of seating. The couches also convert into sleepers. The master room has a full size jacuzzi tub, king bed, chaise lounge chair and a incredible view of the Strip (not all rooms have the Strip view). The bathroom in this room is quite large. The second room has a king as well, nice bathroom with shower and tub and a kitchenette. There is also a microwave in this room as well. There are plenty of flat screen tvs with a large projector as well. What's nice about these suites is they each had adjoining rooms with separate entry if you like. When you need to take a break from having fun times, simply close off your section for privacy. These suites range from 1300 sq.ft to larger. The location I found to be convenient. Simply walk out of the towers to the Miracle Mile Mall. There you will find great shopping, good food and entry right into the casino. Valet is often full so parking can be a bit tricky. We loved this place and our daughter and her friends were thrilled! I wanted to note that once inside the suites, you can't hear any noise from the outside unless you are standing in the hallway. Parties were going on in other suites but you would never know if you were in yours. The staff was very helpful and professional. Check in is 4 but they let you in earlier if the rooms are clean. Checkout is 11am. Sharp. If the towers are booked solid the day you check out, you will not be able to extend your checkout time as so many of us were trying to do Sunday morning. No chance. However if they can accommodate later check out, they will. This place is amazing and we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the PH Towers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MinStoon
Reviews.Content: The room was awesome - clean (unlike some other reviews indicated???), comfy bed, and amazing view with the floor to ceiling window!!!! We did not hear any noise what-so-ever even though there were young people in the suite across from us. Kudos to the staff - wonderful people including the concierge!! The location was perfect for us being attached to the Miracle Mile shopping mall and situated virtually in the middle of all the action. The pool is great but drink prices are "sick" - as most places are. Pay attention to the specials - for ex: at the bar inside looking out at the pool, SKYE Vodka was buy one get second free. The bartender was awesome and whipped us up some wicked cocktail - WHEW - almost missed our flights :)) Enjoy this place, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Bigurt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at multiple hotels in las vegas and this one took the cake! For the price the value is unmatched. The one bedroom suite was HUGE and had all the amenities u could ask for. I had doubts about the location due to all the complaints in the reviews, but was not at all upset with the location. I will def be back to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Salem821
Reviews.Content: I was concerned because previous reviews described this hotel as a loud party place. I was so pleasantly surprised. The room was amazing. The staff were very nice. Our room was quiet. The property is well maintained. We were very comfortable. Beautiful views from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Gamble and shop”
Reviews.Author: judge28
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel and pool area. I liked the fact you could shop and eat right there. It was connected to the Miracle Mile Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For A Casino Property”
Reviews.Author: MinnieNewYork
Reviews.Content: I had not reviewed this property when I traveled last year to Las Vegas and my husband and I stayed there, but felt I should do it now. I was surprised by the reviews claiming it was "filthy" and housekeeping did not respond. First, I will say, the one bedroom we stayed in was perfectly clean. As one reviewer mentioned, if there was a little dust on black surfaces it is quite normal! I have black granite at home on our isalnd, and I can dust it twice a day at times. I requested an extra pillow due to a leg injury I had received which needed to be elevated before we traveled, and got it within an half an hour. This was late in the evening. Also received extra toiletries quickly when requested. As others have said, the rooms and location are wonderful. The only downside in my opinion is there is not enough scrutiny of the number of occupants in the rooms. The younger guests, especially, pile them in. This makes it noisy to others, not to mention the wear and tear on the rooms that will age it quickly. I find this is a big problem with Westgate properties.. The Disney Vacation Club properties have a better system to avoid the distruction of their properties by tracking whom is in the rooms rented. Exactly why I would not buy a timeshare from Westgate. We have encountered this problem at other Westgate properties. Of course, Security does respond to a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, trendy comfy Vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Lea_10
Reviews.Content: There have been some mixed reviews on here about this hotel but I have no complaints at all....well I suppose it was a little little bit dusty but in no way was it unclean. We had an amazing suite that we paid an extra $100 dollars but it was well worth it. We had the most breathtaking view of Paris Eiffiel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. We slept with the blinds fully open so we could see the lights of Vegas all night. Check in - despite my fears - was no problem at all. It was quick and painless and the staff were friendly. The room was big, trendy, comfy with a jacuzzi bath and a walk in shower. There was an excellent little kitchen area that came with glasses and bowls and knives and forks and one of the coldest fridges I've ever put drinks in - which was excellent for the Vegas heat after a long day (or night) on the strip. There was no noise day or night that disturbed us at all, the room was cleaned every day and the location of the hotel was excellent - we could walk to a casino, the Miracle Mile shopping mall and the strip within 5 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel - and Vegas. Crazy and surreal but so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bubs20
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and after reading the reviews on here I was worried but the hotel was great. Check in was quick, we had a 1 bed suite with a view of MGM. At first glance the room looked clean but on closer inspection it was a little dusty, I don't think there would be anything house keeping could do as the furniture was black and would make a little bit of dust look bad. House keeping came every day to make bed etc. Time share is everywhere in vegas not just PH, we were at circus circus and they were trying to sell there too. Just be polite and walk off. It's a great location and easy walking distance to the big casinos like MGM, Caesars and Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: PASCHEY1
Reviews.Content: PH Towers is the hotel to stay. Everything you need is right there. The Miracle Mile Shops, shows, bars, lounges, huge casino (of course) and plenty of places to eat. The rooms are immaculate with nice views and huge jacuzzi tubs in the 1 bedrooms. The Vegas strip has plenty of wonderful hotels, but here you have a beautiful hotel and the price for the type of rooms they have here you will definitely pay more at the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious suites in a non-smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: elysium246
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the 3 main room classes at PH Towers Westgate: (1) One-bedroom studio; (2) One-bedroom suite; and (3) Two-Bedroom Suite. The latter two are far superior to the former. The studio is just a basic room. Given you can upgrade to the 1-bedroom suite for a minimal amount more, it's definitely worth it - so you have a huge sectional couch, full kitchen, wall-to-wall HD projector screen for TV/Movies, and then a separate bedroom w/ a full-size jacuzzi tub in the room. The two bedroom suites vary in layout, and I would not recommend the end of the hallway ones as they are not as large as the two-bedroom suites that have connecting doors. It is a party hotel, but be careful. If you smoke or have too much noise, security will come and give you a warning. Now you are out your $250 non-smoking deposit. If security comes again, that will be your final warning. Just an fyi that there are a lot of parties given the size of the rooms and relative inexpensive price for the size, but you need to party within reason. As everyone else has noted, the rooms are a good 5-7 minute walk to the casino as you have to walk through the shops to get anywhere. Fortunately, there is a taxi stand directly below the lobby, so it's very convenient when wanting to head out to other parts of the city. Room service is very limited, and at select hours, but it is decent quality. I've stayed at every major hotel in Vegas, and have concluded this is the best bang for your buck if you want large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Planet Hollywood Towers - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rhymer_all
Reviews.Content: Very nice 1 br apartment. 11th floor with pool view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and views”
Reviews.Author: moomin21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and wish it was for more, it was wonderful. We paid $10 more to get a high room and were put on floor 51, we stayed in a suite which we got for $100 a night, bargain. The room was clean and very large, and we had a view over looking the strip and Paris and the fountains. I was very greatful to find a washing machine in the room as we were half way through our west coast tour and needed to wash stuff. The shower and large Jacuzzi were great and the bed was huge. My husband loved the drop down cinema screen and all the TV's in the rooms. The kitchen was stocked with dishes, glasses, and dish washer tablets, and the fridge with a built in ice machine and water was useful. The furniture was knocked about in a couple of places but It didn't make the room look bad or worn out at all. Unfortunately the couple next door had a massive argument which we could hear every word of, it sounded quite bad so I called reception and security was up in a minute. The only thing we 'HATED' about this hotel was Westgate, and the really horrible timeshare meeting we got dragged into, DONT DO IT!!!! We knew that we wern't really interested but done it to get Peep Show tickets for only $20 each. The young guy that we met was friendly and the deal was actually quite good, but when we said we would think about it other reps started coming over, the price got a lot lower and when we said we still wanted to think about it, a Horrible older male came over and ripped up the paper work in our faces and said we couldn't think about it or come back, we were gob smacked. I had to stand up from the table and demand our show tickets we'd already paid for, it took 2 and a half hrs not 90 mins like the rep stated and we didn't get breakfast or lunch. So please don't go to this horrible horrible time share, it really gave us a bad opinion of Westgate. There are lots of shops in this hotel and it was really lovely, we'd definitely stay there again, it was in a great location and had a good atmosphere. Also go and see Peep Show, im a Holly Maddison fan, and it was a fantastic show, the dancers and singing was fantastic, we were sat at the back but its only a small theatre and we still had a good view. The tickets are much cheaper from the half price ticket booths along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with nice view off the strip”
Reviews.Author: pdiaz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers for a bachelor party. We booked a 2 bedroom suite that had a huge common area connecting the rooms. The suite did not disappoint. One room had a king size bed, a couch with a pull-out bed, a min-fridge, a flat panel tv and a nice view of the pool. The other bedroom had a king size bed, a jacuzzi tub, a nice flat panel TV and a view of the pool. In between the two rooms was a common area with a huge fridge, two flat panel TVs, and a projection screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great strip location, great room.”
Reviews.Author: leolion1
Reviews.Content: Good on strip location - only a walk through the miracle mile shops to get to street. Great rooms - huge bed, big windows, kitchenette with dishwasher. Nice bathroom with good shower. Internet expensive - should be free like every other hotel in US! Good value for great hotel on strip. Have stayed at both and westgate towers are much nicer than planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: beckzmaru
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas with tons of people and everyone stayed at different hotels. But i have to say I think we won by staying at PH Towers. We had the 1-bdrm suite and it was exactly like on the website. Projection screen tv, jacuzzi tub in the bedroom, and full kitchen/dining area. I liked being able to keep a bit of food around, and my fiance liked the projection tv... and those automatic black-out blinds are amazing. It felt like our own apt. instead of staying at a hotel. We stayed from Saturday to Thursday and i am a very light sleeper and didn't have one noise complaint. We even ordered room service and they were very fast and the food was excellent. Everyone who came to our room loved it too. I think our only issue was the annoying washer/dryer combo... never seemed to do what we wanted it to do! maybe that was us. It did get a little old having to cut through the shops sometimes if you were in a hurry, but at times i actually liked having them there as we didn't have to venture out on to the strip every time we just wanted a small snack or a souvenir. So it depends.. the mall downstairs can be annoying or convenient depending on your day. Although I realized to do anything in Vegas it's going to take longer anyway because everything is huge. so add on a half an hour just to walk to a hotel that is just 'across the strip'. You need to show your keycard to even get to the elevators which is nice, and we returned to our room while the maid was still there and she made us swipe our card which she apologized for but i told her i'd rather them make sure the room actually belonged to us then to just let anyone in. With a quick and easy check-in (& checked out over the phone) and a service for holding your bags after check out... and of course the amazing 1 bedroom suite, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone.. couples for sure, girls/guys trip, or even families with children

Reviews.Title: “Completely filthy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maddie40
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying in the tower, first time was shortly after it opened. We chalked up the uncleanliness the first time to them not having worked out the bugs with cleaning department but it's gotten WORSE!!!! We found someone elses underwear in the bedroom drawer, lipstick on bathroom counter that I scraped off with my nail, lightswitch in bathroom FILTHY, that was when we first checked in. Called front desk security came up to get underwear but no one to clean. Tried calling later when back in room but on hold for half hour had to go out and front desk was lined up. Next day out early when came back noticed tub was filthy windows in bedroom had handprints and god only knows all the other gross stuff all over it, vent in bathroom was so filthy with dust looked like it was never cleaned, someones used eyelashes in the corner of the bathroom counter, door frames filthy. This was the same for outside rooms in hallways and doors to the rooms. I called and asked to speak to a manager was given a hundred dollar credit and told to come to front desk in am and someone would go look at room and deal with it. That was never done!!! Upon checkout we spoke with another manager just to express our complete disappointment and were basically told we got a hundred dollar credit be happy!!! UNBELIEVABLE!! We did'nt want anything except to have a clean room. We travelled with four other couples that had never been to Vegas before and we recommended this place. One of the couples was moved to a new room due to filthy mattress and the others couples also couldn't believe the lack of cleanliness. It's unfortunate that management doesn't really seem to care. The rooms are very nice, location is great and the pool is small but very comfortable. The location of the rooms to the pool is also a bonus and the service at the pool was awesome!!!!! We were told by our server at the pool, who we had every day, that she has heard the same complaints from MANY people!! Uncleanliness like this is completely unacceptable anywhere!!! WE have been to vegas many many times to many different hotels, as well as many other places in the world and have never had an experience like this before!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern”
Reviews.Author: hawnsteeldoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Westgate system of timeshares.We got booked there via the Priceline system. We were upgraded to a higher room by a pleasant desk clerk. Check in was swift, especially since we showed up a few hours before standard check in time. They provide a security guard to check keys when you want to access the tower elevators. The hotel is connected to the Miracle Mile Shops and the casino and Planet Hollywood Hotel . I didn't think the walk was too long. It may take a while to get your bearings. More than once did I get lost in the shopping complex. The nice thing is that you have a great selection of restaurants in the mall itself and you're not limited to just eating in the hotels. The room is ultra modern with a large flat screen tv connected to various room functions. Our basic room came with microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, and refrigerator. Bed is nice and comfortable. And the jacuzzi bathtub was nice. We were given only one rubbish can in the room. The only real complaint I can register is that if you are a gambler, and I am, and, if you are over 55, and I am , you might not like the PH Casino because of the extremely loud music played there. Seriously, it really fried my ears. I complained to the pit boss, and he told me that he lost his hearing a long time ago from the music. There was nothing he could do as the casino hires a DJ to pump the music throughout the casino bars and floor plan. I think they're shooting for a hip vibe to attract the 20 and 30 somethings... In any event, we were there at a good time of the year, early to mid October, weather is nice. Had a great time. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: HughesE
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms, pool, service, security, and miracle mile mall that connects everything. Had the convients of everything. All restaurants were reasonably priced and good hours. All the rooms had great views and very modern!

Reviews.Title: “Las vegas comfort”
Reviews.Author: icecubecanada
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Stayed mon to fri and were not bothered by noise or rowdiness. Was upgraded to high floor 1 bedroom suite for 10 dollars more. Room was cleaned each day. Pool area was great with lots of chairs available. Would stay here again as the location and ammenities in the room are great value. Bed was also very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Kanguro10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Monday 29 August to Thursday Sept 1. We booked one bedroom suite through booking.com At the time of the booking, we requested a top high floor with view of the strip and have a room ready for us by 1pm as we were travelling more than 17 hours from Australia. That did not happen. We arrived at 12.30pm a room was ready for us. Unfortunately, we were not able to upgrade for an extra charge as there were no rooms available at that time (check-in is from 4pm). However, we were more than happy with room 916 which was overlooking the swimming pool (photo) and the amenities of the room itself (photo). Check in at hotel was easy and quick (probably because a Monday at midday). Bear in mind that if you get a room with odds numbers, you will be looking at the car park at level 9 or below (which is not very appealing). Therefore, make sure if your room is level 9 or below it is overlooking the pool. The room suite has everything what you have read or expected from the Hotel website. Probably the most significant features are the Jacuzzi (photo) and the big projector (photo). It does not feel that you are in a hotel room, it feels homely. One of the pros of this hotel is the nice pool (photo). It is very lively, good atmosphere and good music to spend the whole afternoon or early evening. You can use as many towers as you wish but you can’t take your own drinks to the pool area, you must purchase them inside. Expect to pay $18/$20 for a refreshing cocktail by the pool. The Hotel is connected to the Mall where you can shop; dine in/out (breakfast, lunch and dinner)and find a lot of entertainment at all the times. As it is a huge mall, you will find your way around after checking the Mall map available at the corners of the mall. There is a Starbucks inside of the Casino and one “Earl of Sandwich” as well. There are also two ABC stores to purchase some alcohol and groceries. The room suite was clean at all the times. We only interacted with the staff at the hotel at the time of check-in and check-out and they were fine. The location of the hotel is unbeatable and you can stroll anywhere from it. You can’t go wrong. The Bellagio Hotel is just opposite (2’ away from the Mall). We paid $17 (included tips) for a taxi from the Hotel to the International airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a great value.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler99999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a two night stay through bookit.com and received a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite. We received the upgrade from the studio bedroom according to the confirm because we were staying mid-week. The desk clerk asked us if we wanted a higher floor or lower floor when we checked in. We chose the 23rd floor which is mid-way and were thrilled with the views and the amenities. We had a flatscreen tv in every room: kitchen, bath, bedroom and living room. In addition to the flat screen on the wall in the living room there was a projector on the ceiling that provided a 15 foot tv screen when the blackout shade was electronically closed. There was also a one unit front load washer and dryer which worked but to dry your clothes has a 2 and 1/2 hour cycle. The unit has to cool down before it will open which adds another hour to the cycle. The concierge Frances was exceptional in patiently assisting us with dinner reservations at Piero's (great dinner) and printing boarding passes. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: me73_08
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online through one of those discounted sites for a decent price. There were 2 couples that went, and we paid $1300 total for both rooms for 3 nights. When we got to the resort we were amazed at how posh and shiny everything seemed. My husband asked for an upgrade seeing as how were were both there to celebrate our 10th anniversaries. The man at the counter gave us a 2 room suite to share on the 50th floor. Our suite was amazing! It had a kitchen, living room/dining area, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The master bdrm and bath were gorgeous! The only room that didn't seem sound-proof was the living area/kitchen. This was the only time that we heard the people in the suite beside us. While this hotel is not directly on the strip, it's an easy walk through the mall to the casino, shops and strip. Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to use the pool. We had booked this place because the pool area looked really nice, but there was a cold-snap going on while we were there. Figures........the temperature now is supposed to be back up to 80-90. Oh well! We still had a great time. I think that next time, however, we would look to stay at New York, New York. We liked the atmosphere there better, and loved the different cafes, pubs etc that they had to offer. This is not anything against PH, just a personal preference for some variety.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - What you all complaining for?”
Reviews.Author: carole_hallows
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent from the UK and have just returned from this lovely hotel. We arrived and were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a jacuzzi suite room for $30 per night. We did and the room was fab. We could have had a party for 30 people & still had room. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in although I could have done with some step ladders to get on it. 3 tv's in the room and an amazing jacuzzi which did take us a couple of days to figure out how to use it (even getting maintenance to come up), but it was dealt with within half an hour. Yes it is a party hotel but we never had any issues with noise. There aren't any facilities within the hotel except the pool & a bar near reception, but you just walk throught the Miracle Mile Shopping Centre for bars & restaurants then into the main Planet Hollywood hotel. Recommendations for eating: - Ocean One, Blondies & the Italian restaurant opposite Ocean One (can't remember its name) which are all in the Miracle Mile. Koi & the Spice Market Buffet in Planet Hollywood. The buffet in Caesar's Palace was shocking so wouldn't bother. Breakfast at the Wynn but it was rather expensive. Just a few minutes walk from the strip but would definitley recommend this hotel to customers and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel experience EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ange953
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Well, I booked the room online through priceline and got me and my honey airfare and three nights stay for just over 600.00USD, amazing!! We got to the Hotel on a Wednesday afternoon at 2pm and got into our room within five minutes. I wish I could remember the name of the girl who helped us because she was exceptional. I do remember that on her name tag her favorite movie was Pretty Woman, and that she wore glasses and had i think brown shoulder length hair with blonde highlights?? IDK but give this girl a high five for me! She got us an upgrade for a nominal upcharge and our room was CLEAN, SPACIOUS (living room and bedroom), with a HOT TUB for two, AMAZING VIEWS of the strip (we could see the Bellaggio water show at any time), and not to mention the Queen size pullout sofa was perfect for our guests that they let us have over (for free) and even took their names so they could check in and get keys while us two were at a show. Now I have to break it down...I work in a luxury Hotel in Washington State and this stay truly inspired me to look at things in a new light. I definitely need to point out just how friendly everyone was. Every housekeeper in the hall I passed asked me how I was doing. Every concierge was exceptional. Every front desk agent was courteous and smiled at us. The bartenders were true bartenders, inside and outside by the pool. Also, the housekeepers were fast, check in at 2pm? YES, THANKYOU!! It took me awhile to be able to write this because I couldnt wipe the HUGE smile off my face. Anyone that does not have a similar experience here are either followed by crappy luck, or they are a*holes. Seriously. CONGRATS PH by WESTGATE!! You are doing it right. Soon, Washington State will know just how much because Im never gonna stop talking you up. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Womans reunion”
Reviews.Author: ade1442
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect set-up for 6 to 8 woman. Security guard by lobby elevator checking room keys. 10th floor view of strip, quiet, walkable to casinos, restaurants and the perfect size suite to visit,talk, laugh and just have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: meow7
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas, but my first and last time at PHT. I travelled to Vegas for a friends wedding, and decided on this hotel because some of the wedding party was staying there, a friend of mine has a time-share at PHT, and because I got a good deal for the trip. Check-in was quick and easy, and we even got a room earlier than expected. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a higher floor for an additional cost, but declined. We were assigned suite 1115. Upon entering the room, my sister and I were both disappointed. The room was tidy, but not clean; there was a lot of dust along all of the baseboards, and the bottom of the window. Our view was of a parking lot, but at least we could also see the Eiffel Tower :) In the kitchen, the lamp had a large pane of glass that was cracked, and the carpet was frayed in multiple places. This hotel is also very much a party place. Although we are both in our mid to late 20's, we specifically picked a place more off the strip for a bit of peace. There was one incident during our stay where some animals decided to run through the halls and bang on all the walls and doors for a half hour, as well as jump in the elevator. They ended up snapping an elevator cable, and one of the elevators was out of service for the rest of our stay. We complained about this and got a late checkout. Overall, I was just expecting more from this hotel, especially since its new. It just seemed a bit run-down, like it's seen one too many parties... I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So bad give me the Aria any day!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EvilJebus
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel which hasn't been said before, Checking in terrible so slow, Rude check in Staff who look down their noses at people. Filthy rooms a layer of dust that is horrendous for people with Asthma or any respiratory aliments. I reported this to the front desk and I'd say the place is still as bad. The rooms are poor the carpets frayed, bed way too uncomfortable, Hot tub that didn't work the list go's on and on. Never again shall I stay in this shabby chic hell hole...Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. nicely situated”
Reviews.Author: jduganmitzy
Reviews.Content: We did not encounter any of the problems other reviewers had about noise, etc, maybe because we were on the 33rd floor. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with living area, which was nice because we had 3 people in the room and one was sleeping on the sofa bed. Did have to call downstairs for sheets for the sofa bed - they are not in the room. Blackout blinds great. Actually, of four rooms booked together at same time on priceline, 3 were upgraded - not sure why the 4th one wasn't. Location was nicely situated on the strip across from Bellagio and next to Paris, altho a little bit of a walk from hotel area through shopping area to street. My only complaint is the excessive charge for the internet. While I prefer free, $10/day is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DaveyCee
Reviews.Content: It was nice to arrive at the hotel and find free parking - too many hotels have started charging for this! You enter the shopping mall and walk through to the hotel lobby, so if you have a lot of bags, it may be worth taking advantage of the valet parking. I had reserved a standard room, and was allegedly "upgraded" to a room on a higher floor - quite why a longer elevator ride means you have to pay more, I don't know, but since it was offered for the same price, I wasn't complaining. The room was spacious, clean and well equipped, with a fridge, microwave and dishwasher. The bathroom was large and clean. The view from the room was good, but I didn't come to Vegas to look out the window! Luckily, the Strip is only a short walk away. The hotel complex is good - lots of shops, restaurants and a few bars, as well as the obligatory casino. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Party Palace for Teens”
Reviews.Author: Roger2105
Reviews.Content: We arrived at PH Towers on Sunday evening September 25. The good news is the building is really spectacular, very modern. The suites are equally great, very spacious and very modern with all the amenities. Our suite was clean and well-maintained. We had no problems with the service and we were more than pleased with everything. Then came Friday. A horde of 18-year old teenagers invaded the place for seemingly no other purpose than to party for the entire weekend. In no time flat, the "kids" occupied the halls and the elevators all carrying a can of beer. The parties went on till about 6:00 AM on both Friday and Saturday night. I presume the little darlings sleep all day to rebuild their strength. This seems to be par for the course at the Westgate. I assume it's the same every weekend and throughout the summer and (shudder) during Spring break. One of the things you'll notice at the elevators is a guard that asks to see your key card. I assume this is some sort of failed attempt to control the partying. On the other hand, it all makes sense. Where else in Las Vegas can you get a luxury suite at very reasonable price where you can cram in 20 or so of your friends and party all night? If you plan on sleeping in Vegas, try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but Loud!!”
Reviews.Author: Fourkidmomma
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and the room was nice, got the 1 bed suite for the price of a standard room. Second night we, and the rest of our floor, were woken up by pounding hip-hop music. And I mean pounding, felt like I was at an AC/DC concert! Quick call to the front desk, which first goes to the main planet Hollywood desk and they transfer you back to westgate, security came up and quieted them down for a while. I called once more that night and 2 times the next before I didn't hear them again. I liked being away from the chaos of the strip as this hotel is back a bit. Some people would not like that though. The shops, Miracle Mile, are very nice. Buffet is good, get the 24 hour pass and eat at all the buffets if you like. We found it to be good value even if you are not gorging yourself every meal :) Nice view from these rooms with the floor to ceiling windows and the blackout blinds are a gift. Mattress was comfortable, nice living room and bathroom was quite big in our room. Some others are smaller. If I went to Vegas again I would stay somewhere else, just because I like to try new places.

Reviews.Title: “Sick room, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Wkstyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the westgate towers from Wednesday night to Sunday afternoon in October 2011. We booked the 2 bedroom suite. This room is ridiculous. Plenty of room, nice decor, and can't beat the in suite fridge/dishwasher/hot tub/washer dryer. Short walk through the mall puts you in the planet Hollywood casino. All this for 350ish a night. Definitely staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of September and had a wonderful experience. They put us in a room on the 39th floor which had an amazing view of the strip and the surrounding hills. The beds were amazingly comfortable and very clean. We brought up one issue with the hotel and they sent up a staff person shortly thereafter who took care of it the following day. For the price this is a great hotel to stay at and it is NOT far off the strip. You walk right through the mall to get to the strip. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Eyelashes_10
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about booking at this hotel given the ratings, but since my neice was getting married at PH we wanted to stay here. We had a two bedroom suite and I called several times prior to our arrival to make sure that our reservation information was in the system (this seemed to help). We stayed from September 28 - October 5 and overall the hotel was quiet. My Mother heard noise on the last night and found the walls to be very thin. We stayed on the 52nd floor with a view of the airport. Check in was on a Wednesday afternoon and was seamless. Within five minutes of check in we received pots/pans and linen for the pull out bed. There is no toaster or kettle in the room and a lack of dishes, but overall was maanageable. The room was nice and we really got a lot of use out of the fridge, cook top and microwave. There is no oven in the room. This is a hotel for young people and would not be one that I would have chosen had my neice's wedding not been there. Overall, I was happier than I had originally thought. I was very apprehensive about the ratings, but our experience was fine. I do recommend that you bring some Clorox wipes as we found they came in handy. There is a shortage of light bulbs and lights in the room and we didn't have a remote for the kitchen television. The pool was enjoyable, however, It is not a place for children. I heard some shocking conversations and saw some questionable behaviour while at the pool! Upon check in I had asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains and was told they didn't have any rooms with this view. Having read some of the other reviews I realize there were rooms with a view of the fountains. This is a party hotel and not one that I would visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but unfortunately not maintained”
Reviews.Author: kaykayram
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights with another couple in a two bedroom suite during the first week of Oct 2011. The majority of the two bedroom suites are the studio connected to a 1 bedroom configuration, but they do have a few units that are actually true two bedroom units(without a connecting door). The check in clerk told me they reserve these for the timeshare owners and was going to try and upsell me, but I wasn't interested. The living area was larger, but the bathroom in the 2nd bedroom looked considerably smaller than the studio bathroom. Our room was a nice size and a good value for a two bedroom suite. Unfortunately, as many previous reviews have pointed out, the place just isn't maintained. It was built as a timeshare property and has had very slow sales and it seems as if they don't have the maintenance fee income to run the place properly. In our room the shower light was burnt out, the safe was broken, and only one remote control worked. These things aren't a huge deal, but there is no need for these not be taken care of unless you are severely understaffed, which I believe they are. From the other reviews, this isn't just one room that isn't maintained, it is every room that isn't maintained! Our room wasn't filthy, but it definitely wasn't a great cleaning job. What really irked me was all the crap in the hallway from the elevator to the room. There were little bits of tissue and other little bits of trash all throughout and it was never vacuumed the whole time we were there. I did see the cleaning lady every day, but she was only one person and apparently that wasn't one of her duties. We didn't use the pool while we were there because it was cool and rainy, but the pool area did look nice. It is adjacent to the lobby and kinda like a fishbowl for everyone walking through the lobby. It seems as if it was built to attract attention and be focal point for timeshare sales. The location in the mall really didn't bother me. The casino, and the mall and restaurants just seem like an extension of the hotel. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas and most of them are so big you do a ton of walking even if they are right on the strip, so to me that was kind of a non issue. You can see the MGM, which is on the strip, from one side of the hotel and it extends farther away from the strip than PH Towers does. This is a good place to stay if you are traveling with friends. I wouldn't pick this place if it was just my husband and I, but I might return with a group again - but only if it is in the next year or so. This place is only two years old and is already looking worn. It will be a total dump in a few more years if they don't get a grasp on things soon. Also, noone called us about timeshare sales and it was never mentioned. I can't imagine anyone wanting to buy a timeshare here if they looked too closely, but maybe they actually vacuum the hallway where the sales model is! I book through Priceline a lot, but I booked this time through Southwest Vacations to get the two bedroom. The package saved us $300 on two nights for hotel and air versus booking the air through Southwest and the room through PH direct.

Reviews.Title: “Would I go back? Probably not.”
Reviews.Author: AVREssex
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for 9 days, having been to Las Vegas before we knew what to expect. What we didn't bargain for with this hotel was it is quite a "party" hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for couples, or people looking for a fun but relaxing stay. The check in process was fine, we were given the 33rd floor - one bedroom suite. Our first impressions of the room was total amazement, projector screen, lovely views of Paris, the fountains, P hollywood and more. You cannot fault the room design, the jacuzzi in the bedroom was also fantastic! BUT...... scratch beneath the surface and you find quite a dirty, worn out room. Our jacuzzi had a green line running across it, the dishwasher was full from the previous occupant (with added spaghetti) and was also very dusty along the surfaces, in particular the bedroom. I also found 3 old socks in the closet, that wasn't my husbands! We obviously complained about the dishwasher in particular and was asked if we wanted housekeeping to send someone to our room to clean the dishwasher" NO What I meant was for someone to come and empty the dishwasher of cutlery that wasn't even ours to begin with. We were assured that it would be done, we went out and came back to find that a dishwasher tablet had been placed by the side of the sink, the dishwasher had been put on and had the same cutlery still in it!!! Let's just say it stayed that way for 6 days until we really got complaining. The housekeeping staff are not that great! You have to show your hotel room key every time you go to the lifts to your room which I thought was really good. The Pool area is really quite rubbish and dirty, the only member of staff that impressed us the most was a young lady called Kayla/Macayla - she seriously was the only one that worked her butt off to serve the customer. I found that this hotel is mainly run by a lot of young people, and I think this is part of the hotel's problem. Please do not go to the pool with the intention of getting some peace, you will not get any! They play pumping music from 9am right through till close- they also have a DJ playing music at the weekends, as well as inside across from the reception. Drinks are very expensive - $8 for 2 small cola's $7 for a bottle of miller lite, you are not allowed to bring in anything from outside, not even from PH's own shop. They will search your bag before entering the pool area. So beware! Water is fine. This is very much a party hotel, I get that Vegas is fun, yes. But if you do want some relax time, this is so not the place for it. As soon as you come away from the main PH Towers reception and through to the Miracle mile shops you are harassed by various different vendors, people trying to sell you shows, and guest lists for the clubs. Spice Market buffet is great, and cheap $15 each for breakfast. Once you reach the casino, you are greeted by scantily clad girls EVERYWHERE dancing on the casino tables which is fine if your a load of bachelors, but a bit annoying when your with your partner, it's funny the once, but then it becomes a bore. I love Vegas, a lot. But next time you'll find me at the Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “Warmed up to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling133
Reviews.Content: Main issue was security which was ok. Stayed on 5th floor which is fine with me. Need a card to acess elevators but it would not be hard to find one. I was shocked how big the room was! A full kicthen ice machine in the fridge! Also a tv above the table. Then a huge couch and a LCd along with a huge projection screen!! Only 1 bathroom:( A hottub in the bedroom jets were not very powerful. Beds were nice and soft. Walls are thin can hear the next rooms easy. Parking garage was a mile away it seemed:( So we used valet. Wifi not free. Non smoking hotel! Miracle mile shops very short walk to get to. Overall I liked it. 4 night stay. More geared towards a party crowd not a family hotel but was ok for me.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have been to heavily partied in, not for couples.”
Reviews.Author: andymardon
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one bedroom suite and took the offer of an upgrade to a high floor at check in. This was worth it as we were on the 54th floor (although there are not actually that many floors, the elevator skips a few out). However, the view was fantastic and could see all the hotels south of the hotel including the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. When you first open the door and look around you are amazed by the size, the view (if you are on a high floor) and the hot tub in the bedroom! But as you settle in you begin to realise that these rooms have been heavily partied in. We opened the cupboard above the fridge to find an empty crate of Budweiser from a previous party. The TV in the bedroom did not work, the safe was broken and the ironing board was so mangled it looked like someone has been using it to play Guitar Hero. Also the hot tub did not function correctly and did not turn on. We reported this to the front desk and the lady wrote down the list of problems and said she would get someone onto it. When we returned in the afternoon we had a new ironing board but all the other reported faults were not fixed.
