Now if there are electrical faults I'm not expecting them to be done the same day but at least a message from front desk offering another room or aknowledging that someone would be along soon for each problem. But we didn't hear a thing suggesting to me that they have similar issues in many rooms. You can see why this is a party location. The rooms have a huge refridgerator, a massive projector screen, hot tub e.t.c. and if you were here to re-create the seens from The Hangover then I guess a few of these things not working would not be a huge issue. But if you are a couple wanting to acutally use some of the room's features then I would recommend somewhere else.'

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but”
Reviews.Author: lineaway
Reviews.Content: My yearly trip to Vegas included the Planet Hollywood Towers this time. I have been to so many different properties that I like to try a new one each year. My preference is quality and value. That order. This property I would have to rate as a 4 out of 5 but I had some Issues. First off we checked in on a Saturday so I didn't expect everything to go smooth with a great room and all. Had this been midweek I would have expected better. Anyway, if you arrive by car on a weekend you don't have access to valet parking, Owners Only. This was more a problem than I would have thought as trying to find a parking spot proved rather difficult in the self parking garage ( This was strike one). Next I got one of the three checkin staff who probably was the new guy. Our friends had checked in ahead of us an gotten an upgrade to a very high floor 53rd at no charge. We were offered the 5th. then the 4th then I offered to pay more and got the 20th. Then that room was taken so i offered to pay more for a 1 bdrim suite but then that was taken. I will spare all the details but 45 min later and multi attempts at finding a room I got a 39th floor room (a bit of an upgrade) and was content. I forgot to mention they lost my res for a bit (found it only after I showed a conf. letter so I wonder what would have happened if I had lost it). This would have been strike two but the room was fine and it was a weekend. Strike two, its a Long walk to the Strip and easy to get turned around. There was no strike three so this was my last real complaint. The room was nice, a bit worn but a Bedroom with a small Lv rm attached. Bathroom was nothing special. The maid kept it clean so no complaints. It had a tiny kitchen. There are multi room layouts for this property so you could end up with about anything. Views were nice but you are off the strip a bit so they aren't really as great as you would think. Pool. I didnt go as it was poor weather but the pool is right out front of the lobby and not really that nice compared to other properties. Still overall this is not a bad place. My issues were the lack of parking, Poor front desk help. Mediocre Pool. The Good: If you can keep the rate around what a hotel room costs in a 4 star, this is a great value. I didn't like the long walk through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the strip but some might like this. You will have a chance at a amazing room for a reasonable rate if you show midweek. Overall if I got a good rate I would consider staying here again, No resort fee which is good. I think that is worse than just adding to the cost of a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Doug R
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a party and you're 20 years old, this is the hotel for you. If you like to sleep at night and want to relax by the pool without getting splashed, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Locky80
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite for 3 nights from 24th September. Check in was quick and no line at 8pm on a Saturday night. Was given a room on 36th or 38th floor (can't remember) with a great view. The room definately had the wow factor that I had hoped for. After reading some reviews on here I was dubious, but my fears were unfounded. The suite was huge, spotlessly clean and serviced every day, fully equipped with fridge, washing/drier machine, huge microwave oven, dishwasher, pots, pans, utensils, cutlery, detergent. You name it, it had it. The projector screen was cool, could have watched it all night. The bed and pillows were so comfortable too. I know some people complain that this hotel is not on the strip, but really, 2 min walk through the miracle mile shops and you are right in the middle of the strip. Overall, had a fantastic stay and would totally recommend PH Towers and would definately stay again. My only issue was with the guests in the room next door. They rang security to complain about noise on 2 seperate nights. In fairness, I would agree with them if the noise was excessive, but there were only 2 of us in the room and only noise was watchin tv or if we played a bit of music through the ipod docking station before we went out for the night. I would have appreciated if the neighbours knocked the wall to keep it down, or even came to the door rather than phoning security. Seriously guys, it's Vegas, wise up! Anyway, security were very nice about it on both occassions and agreed that the noise was not excessive but that the rooms had very thin walls. Fair enough. Just make sure you whisper and tip toe at all times incase you upset any grumps that may be next door to you lol!

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers - Great”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my best friend and two daughters, none of us had ever been to Las Vegas and this hotel was booked by our travel agent. It is brilliant and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Bright and clean and lots of fun. The only slight hitch was that we had booked a quad room and this room only had one bed...however the settee pulled out into a double bed which was ok. It's a very modern, chic building and may be not to everyone's taste..but we loved it. You could walk anywhere easily - great location just off the strip with it's own mile of shops and restaurants. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Suite Life”
Reviews.Author: Bordeaux28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom king suite. It had everything we needed. A full kitchen that was stocked with anything you would need to cook or have a dinner party. A dish washer and dryer with detergent so you can clean your clothes while there. Also the sectional pulls out to a bed, which allows you to have extra guests comfortably sleep over. The view is awesome, we had a view of the Eiffel Tower. The receptionist tried to get us to up grade for a better view, I am glad we didn't we already had a great view. The living room blind turns into a huge profector screen to watch tv on. There are so many televisions in the room. One in the bathroom, one in front of the table, one in the living room, the projector screen and one in the bedroom. You can control almost anything from the televisions, the lights, the blinds etc.. I would definitely recommend this room to anyone. After staying in this suite, I don't think I will ever stay in a standard room in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSmyres
Reviews.Content: Paid $200.00 extra dollars booking thru Harrahs for a high floor room guarantee ( 17-29th floor ). Was given a 10th floor that was even with the parking garage right outside the window - so we listened to car alarms and kids racing all night every night. Absolutely the worst view ever and especially when paying extra for the view - Planet Hollywood Towers said they are not Harrahs and my reservations should not have had a guaranteed high floor. Well they did and I paid $200.00 upgrade for the guarantee and will never stay at another Harrahs in Vegas. We are from Florida and go to Vegas 2 times a year for over 10 years and this was the only bad room we have ever had and they don't care at the desk !!!! And they didn't even refund my $200.00 that I showed them Harrahs charged me for the high floor guarantee - once again they said they are not Harrahs - Harrahs needs to remove them from their site then ?????

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Vegas twice before and both times at the regular Planet Hollywood where i had great experiences. So i thought i would try out the towers....thinking it would be nice to stay in a newer hotel. In my experience with ph i've recieved a few complimentary upgrades but i knew going in that the towers wouldn't be like that. Even so we decided we would try and pay for an upgrade. I really love to look at the strip from my room, so we asked if they had any rooms that had good views of the strip. They said they did for $10 a night, which i was ok with. When we got to our room, it was a nice view of the Eiffel tower....but that's all you could see. Everything else was parking lot. To me this was not worth paying extra for. So we told them we just wanted our regular room. So they proceeded to put us on the 4th floor(lowest). That didn't bother me but the room did. The room itself was extremely beaten down. Cupboards that didn't close, walls marked up...just not very nice. But the icing on the cake was our shower. It had a horrible mold smell in it....like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Thankfully they let us change rooms to something that was in better shape and had a clean bathroom. The pool was the best part of the hotel. Very nice and a good size. My advice would be if you are going as a family or a group of 4 or more this is a good place for you. If you are a couple or smaller group, i think you can do a lot better. I just think for a newer hotel it's in pretty bad shape and will only get worse.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 1011S
Reviews.Content: I had big expectations for this place and this place blew our mind! It was clean, luxorious, money worth, Miracle Mile is in same building and the pool is awesome. Actually we extended our stay because we liked the place so much. Parking is free. Service is kind and friendly. There is a big tv in room and coffee machine with coffee beans. Bed is soft but firm - great bed overall. Only negative thing is lack of free wifi. You have to pay 19,90$ plus taxes for 3 day. We would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and noise”
Reviews.Author: RoccoDom
Reviews.Content: If you can't stand smoke then NO NOT go to Planet Hollywood. I have stayed in Vegas about 5 times now and this was my worst experience. I was on a no smoking floor, but it didn't help. It was really strong in the hall and in my room. The whole casino was filled with smoke. I thought I was being too picky but I visited 4 other hotels while I was in town and there was no noticeable smoke. Enough about the smoke, Let's talk about the screaming loud rock and roll music throughout the whole hotel and was annoying most at the elevators. The halls are dark and the wall paper has poorly glued patches all over it. And then there was the "Pleasure Pit", with the scantly clad chicks dancing on the tables in this section of the gaming area. The whole place was so pink it reminding me of Pepto Bismo. If I was 21 years old, smoked, loved loud rock music and frequented strip joints I would have been in heaven. The only thing I will say is the the staff were very nice and the bath room very roomy and clean. I paid $190 a night, but I have stayed at similar type hotels for about $40 bucks. Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Would never, never recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: maddie924
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the registration process. First, were you aware that this is a time share? If you are staying for a night or so that means that you are a second class citizen and the "greeter" at the front desk let's you know that immediately when he asks you "are you an owner"? You go to a different line and wait,wait,wait until the next available agent takes you. I was told that I was checking in too early (4PM is check in time-I was there at 3PM) and that my choice was to wait or get a low floor room over the parking lot or pay $30/ night more for a "nice room". This message was delivered by a not so nice person. The low floor room was terrible, the hotel location inconvenient and the service bad. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable & modern room, smoke free!”
Reviews.Author: Pam25049
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at PH Towers for 7 nights on Sept. 19. This was our second time staying here and both times we loved it! Everything was great. We stayed in a studio suite which is their regular room. It was really nice and the rooms are the nicest I've stayed at in Vegas. Large ceiling to floor window with an automatic shade that you can close with TV remote. We had a decent view on 30th floor of part of the strip and the mountains. Nice 42 inch TV and comfortable bed. NO bedbugs which I check for every time I stay at a hotel. It had a small kitchenette with toaster, microwave, fridge, coffeepot, coffee, dishes, corkscrew, can opener, etc. One thing that's hard to come by in a Vegas hotel room is a coffeepot & fridge and we loved having these amenities free with the price of the room. The bathroom had the toilet in a separate room with a sliding door which was great. It had a leather couch that folded out into a bed and coffee table as well. Everything was black, red and tan brown which looked really nice. Even a black toilet!! Our room was cleaned every day and it was nice and quiet. NO resort fee like most hotels in Vegas charge when you get there (Except Harrah's properties, they don't). The whole hotel is smoke free which is great because I have allergies. The location is great! It is attached to the miracle mile shopping mall which has tons of shopping with decent prices and tons of restaurants to eat at. To get to the strip you walk through the mall which takes about 4-5 minutes tops. The mall is attached to Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino as well so even though PH Towers doesn't have a casino right in it, it's a 4 minute walk to this one. There are 2 ABC stores in this mall as well which have 1 litre bottled water for .99 cents and cheap liquor. Really handy to stock up and take to the room. At other places in Vegas it can be very expensive. Some restaurants we really liked that were right in the mall and PH resort were Panda Express, Earl of Sandwich, Ocean One, Spice Market Buffet and Cheeseburger Brand. The pool was great!! Water wasn't too cold, it had tables with chairs and lots of loungers to lay on. In the pool there was 2 platform areas that were 6 inches deep where you could sit or lay around right in the water. This was great as it was super hot out! They played great music, not too loud during the week but on the weekend there was a DJ and they turned it up louder which was fun. It's Vegas! I can't think of anything we didn't like about this place. The only thing I noticed was the room was a little dusty in places that weren't cleaned often, sometimes you had to flush the toilet twice for it to go down properly and on weekends it was alot busier with people partying but it gets like that everywhere on the weekend in Vegas. These things were minor. They do have great security though and you have to show your room key every time you go to elevator or pool. This is good because it's safe and it keeps everyone else from crowding the pool that's not staying there. You are allowed to bring guests to your pool though which we did. Staff was friendly too. I would definitely stay here again for a 3rd time! Nice place!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MrJeets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased a time share at PH Towers in 2007 prior to construction. In Sept 2011, we were finally able to book our long anticipated week, since we purchased a Odd year -Floating-Biennial unit. Although the location of the Timeshare unit was fantastic, the service from the staff was unlike anything we have ever seen. In the week that we occupied the room, housekeeping never came. Upon speaking to the staff, we were informed that for Timeshare units, we would need to request services for housekeeping and that they typically clean the room on the 4th day of occupancy. Who Knew? After we requested services, the room was still never cleaned. The houskeeper stated that she had no record of the room requiring cleaning services. My wife then stated that the room needed to be cleaned whether she had a record or not since we had already been in the room for 4 days. No paper products etc...We also contacted 2 different staff members (concierge) who stated that this was not acceptable and even outrageous that this would occur and that they would ensure the room was cleaned. Never happened. Instead both of the staff members were more interested in selling us "discounted" tickets to some shows. Our concierge even tried to set up a "mandatory" meeting with us so he could put us in front of a Salesperson who tried to sell us an upgrade to our unit..Unbelievable!..Upon checkout, my wife explained our concerns to the front desk who stated " Oh well, what are you gonna do?". Based on the other reviews I have seen on this site and my own experience, I think PH Towers should seriously look into another Management group.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but don't expect to cook anything in the kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: smithvle
Reviews.Content: We had a great suite, fantastic views and well equipped with everything for a brilliant stay apart from any cooking utensils at all :) We were on a road trip and one of the reasons for chosing the suite was the kitchen so that we could have some home cooked food for a change - there wasn't a pan or utensil in sight! With so much food choice in Vegas it wasn't a great hardship but some basics would have been great. First night was noisy from an all night part in the adjoining room but overall excellent value for money and I would go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: 33xtina
Reviews.Content: We like the regular Planet Hollywood hotel and we had an opportunity to stay at the Towers when we won a name your own price bid on a travel website which gave us this hotel for less than half price!! Since we saved so much on the price of the room we upgraded from a studio to a 1 bedroom and LOVED it! Quick check in, easy to get around inside since there is no casino, non smoking rooms, easy shopping in attached mall, easy access to other hotels, fully stocked kitchenettes, awesome wall of floor to ceiling windows in living room with motorized roll up/down shades! Starbucks is a little walk thru the mall to PH hotel, but worth it after a long night out (wish they had one closer) Very clean, nice decor! The pool is exposed thru a wall of windows to the lobby and bar and pretty small. We rented an area with a lounge bed and 2 chairs for the day at the pool and we found it to be a decent price for the space and service we received. Good security at the elevators so random persons can't go up unless they are with you and the key. The bed was really comfortable and the room and bathroom were very spacious. The 1 bedroom also had a pull out bed in the living room couch which could come in handy. Food - we hit up the buffet at the new M hotel which is south of the airport about 10 to 15 minutes. It was good, includes unlimited beer and wine in the $16 lunch bufett price which was totally worth it! BBQ nachos at PBR Rock Bar and Grill in the PH mall were yummy but pass on the spinach dip. Pizza at the NYNY hotel is the best, downstairs in the middle by the dueling piano bar, eat while listening to music you can't help but know the words to! Dancing - Drais after hours is in the basement of Bills hotel about a block away and walking distance if you like house and hip hop (2 rooms). Starts around 1 am and gets busier as the night turns to morning! Love it! Overall another great visit to Las Vegas....we have decided that we will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: EC2011
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed for 3 nights in a studio plus one-bedroom suite. It was a bachelorette weekend and we loved Vegas but not this hotel. The room layout was fantastic - plenty of space and cozy. However.... the room(s): dust everywhere, leather sofa had a white sticky substance on it, no knives, only a couple of spoons and forks, not enough dishes for the four of us, refrigerator did not work and had to call engineering, both showers had almost no water pressure, the bedroom in the one-bedroom suite was hot no matter what we did to the A/C temperature setting. Customer service - the worst! The front desk called us to say they had a package for my friend and she needed to bring her ID. We immediately went down 19 floors via the elevator to see a line about 20ppl deep at the desk. We asked the Westgate timeshare reps if they could help us and they said we could call the front desk and ask. I did and they said we had to get in the checkout line with everyone else. I asked if they could deliver the package to our room since we were getting ready to go to lunch and had not planned on a 45 minute wait. They said no. I asked why they would have called us down to pick up the package under these circumstances and the response I received was, "Is there anything else I can help you with?" The housekeeping staff and engineering staff were pleasant and friendly but you can tell that the management does not care about you unless you are a timeshare owner. Even the Westgate sales rep told us this. He said the resort is managed by another company and not Westgate, but in my opinion Westgate needs to step in and put some standards in place. We will not be back to this location.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the room in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Morelli
Reviews.Content: good location, good shopping mall inside, great spacious complete one bedroom suite, with everything you need (full kitchen, tv room..)and a nice view. Nice lounge and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room!”
Reviews.Author: Brent M
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends just returned from PH Towers yesterday. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was amazing. The room is large and very modern. The room was clean, and housekeeping was good. I have read reviews saying that housekeeping was non-existent, but that was not the case for us. The projector screen and other flat screens were awesome for viewing football. It was great having a full size fridge with an ice maker, it came in very handy. The bed was quite comfortable, and the bathroom is huge! The jacuzzi is a pain in the[--] to fill, but it was nice once it was full. We also used the washer/dryer which was a very nice addition to the room. The Miracle Mile Mall is connected to this property, and you can be at the PH casino within a five minute walk through the mall. I felt safe throughout the property, and it was a great experience. I would definitely stay here again (as would my friends).

Reviews.Title: “A lively, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluemountain69
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at this hotel as we got a fairly good deal through the travel agent and because of its location. It didn't take long to get there from the airport (on a Thursday afternoon) and the short walk through the miracle mile onto the strip meant it was very central. When checking in we decided to try offering a $20 tip for a high room with a good view of the strip. The receptionist told us this is what she had given us, so we gave her the tip. Upon entering the room we were very disappointed to find we had been given a room at the back of the hotel with a view of the car park, not the strip, although it was a high room. We immediately went back to see the same receptionist since we'd given her the tip and she found us another room but said it was way down the corridor. This next room was perfect for us, it was on the 54th floor with an excellent view of the strip from the dining/sitting room, and from the bedroom we looked onto the Paris hotel & Eiffel tower. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. We found the rooms to be clean and only on one day housekeeping missed us out so we had no clean towels. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was a fairly large TV in the bedroom and in the living room. We couldn't find any info on the hotel's services or amenities in the room and that would have been helpful. The kitchen seemed ok although we did not use it except for the fridge. We could hear our neighbour's music on an evening but this didn't bother us, it wasn't too bad once the doors were closed in our bedroom and we were always too tired for it to keep us awake! Because of the central location of this hotel we were always close to many restaurants, shops & casinos. For breakfast we walked about 10 mins to the nearest Denny's. Most of the staff around the hotel were very friendly but we found that concierge was often very busy or there was no one at the desk. We tried to avoid the timeshare desk. We visited the pool pretty early in the day so always got a choice of were to sit, there was a nice atmosphere round the pool, with music and waitresses walking round to serve drinks. At the weekend there seemed to be more of a young party crowd at the pool and round the hotel. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent girl's trip location”
Reviews.Author: BrendaK27
Reviews.Content: This was the second year 10 of us enjoyed Planet Hollywood Towers. We had a 2-bedroom suite which was really a one-bedroom adjoining a studio suite which was larger than the other 2-bedroom unit. The rooms are awesome - very large living room area, large bedrooms, full kitchen. Great set up for Happy Hour celebrations before going out and lots of room in the bathrooms for getting ready for the evening. We LOVE the pool! We rented the 'round bed' platform at the end of the pool which ensured us space at the pool without being down there early. Gave us comfy loungers, bed, table with umbrella for shade...but right on the edge of the pool to take a dip in the hot sun. DJ plays on the weekend and its a fun party atmosphere at the pool. Quieter and more laid back and relaxing mid-week. We like this as we enjoy both! People have complained about the long walk to the strip....I don't know what they are talking about as its not that far and you have a great mall to walk through. The exit to the strip is in the heart of the strip. Only complaint....they don't even let you bring water bottles into the pool area and seem to be inconsistent about bringing in your own snacks/food....One time we were told 'no food' - another told we could bring in food before 11:00 a.m. Despite this, we'll probably be back for our annual trek to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: tricia95
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were huge. We had the one bedroom suite. We were able to get a great price. The living room and kitchen were a great bonus to have in vegas. The mall is attached to the hotel that was a great bonus since it was 100 degrees when we visited. The staff was great, check in was quick! The giant screen TV was very cool. Very modern hotel. Bath was a good size and the hot tube was nice. The clubs in the hotel played good music. The hotel is in the middle of everything which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Undecided?”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld33
Reviews.Content: Based on the web-site photos we were expecting a little more "class". For such a new property it is already showing some wear and tear. We had a one bedroom suite with full kitchen, living/dining room and separate bedroom which for Las Vegas is great. We did make use of the kitchen for breakfasts and snacks and the washer/dryer combo came in handy. We did see the studio suite and would not even consider staying in one as they are very small and no comparison to a one bedroom. We upgraded to a suite on the 52 floor which I would highly recommend as the views from the wall to wall windows are spectacular! There are things that we thought were just not well thought out like the HUGE jacuzzi in th bedroom that took forever to fill and the wall to wall projector screen that you could watch TV on instead of viewing just the flat screen TV but the built in leather seating was too close to view comfortably. The pool was very busy and attracted a very young crowd which we are not. This is a "time share" property and one big problem was that the Valet parking was for "owners" only so we had to drag our luggage through part of the shopping mall from the self-park. The hotel is very near the new City Centre complex so the location is great. We would probably stay there again if the same great pricing deal was available....as I now know not to have too high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, value and staff! Do not listen to the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: RianMartin
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 8 nights in September 2011. There was a party of 24 of us, with 12 of the party booked into the PH Towers. The hotel is incredible! On check in we requested rooms together, when the guy on reception discovered we were there to be married, he bent over backwards to help us out. He managed to get all of our guests close together and offered myself and my husband a nice upgrade to the 53rd floor! The views are incredible, and the rooms are out of this world. The beds are ridiculously comfortable and the hot tubs were great too! The staff were extremely helpful and the service around the pool was second to none! Thank god we did not listen to the terrible reviews of this hotel, otherwise we may have settled for somewhere else and would definately not have enjoyed our trip to Vegas as much as we did! Thank you PH Towers, for making our trip so memorable! Rian and Jon Martin :)

Reviews.Title: “could have been better for the $$”
Reviews.Author: melvin k
Reviews.Content: We recently spent ^ days at the resort, initially our room was upgraded which we tought was great! Only to get to the room after a 6hour flight to find out the shower didnt work (keep in mind this is a new resort and they are in the process of expanding to build additional towers) We call the front desk, while waiting my husband realizes the toilet wouldnt work! The desk said the only way to help us was to downgrade us back to our original reservation. we felt that after an hour of waiting for service we should be compensated and not downgraded. Once our room was changed, our experience was great. I enjoy westgate resorts and was very much turned off. We are Westgate timeshare owners and felt that the resort just was not up to par.The appearance was great, but customer service is very poor, which is why I only rate this property as average

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay at this hotel again!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennieL36
Reviews.Content: I usually do not complain about hotels when I stay there, even if they do not live up my expectations, but this one I have to complain about. We stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers in Las Vegas for three nights, and it was not what I expected it to be. At first walking into the room it looks awsome, nicely decorated and clean. But nothing really works!!! We got a 1 bedroom suite, and we mostly got this room because it had a Jacuzzi in the room, the jacuzzi did not work and we brought this to the hotels attention 2 days in a row and nothing was done to fix it. There is a washing machine in the room and we decided to do a load of laundry and our clothes we locked in the washing machine for the whole night because it mal-functioned and we had to call house-keeping to have someone come up and fix it. All of this would not have bothered me so bad, but when we checked out the last day we brought these things to the hotels attention and we were treated very rudely, and nothing was done to even compensate for the things in the room being broken!!! We paid 200.00 a night for that room and to have the amenties of that room not work, to say the least we should have been refunded something for our inconvience. Also, the atmosphere of the hotel is a very young crowd, and not that I am old, but am not into that type of atmosphere...so if you are looking for a calmer environment and amenities in a room that work, this is not the place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, the worst quality service”
Reviews.Author: 0_valen_0
Reviews.Content: Dear Trip advisor travelers here is our review of the PH towers in vegas: On our honeymoon we got a room 10 floors higher than our original reservation, so we stay at floor 26th which was a very nice gesture. When we got into the room and unpacked everything, we discover that we just had 1 glass in the room. As we were 2, we asked if we could have another glass and also coffee cups. A guy came into the room to check if there was only one glass. When he was in the room we also asked him about the noisy weaseling draft of air coming under the door. He said that it was not normal and He was going to call an engineer. After a while the engineer came to fixed it so we left the room for him to do it. We came back 4 hours later at 11:30 p.m. to find out that it wasn’t fixed and we still have only one glass in the room. We called reception again to ask if they could send us a glass as we had a very special bottle of wine to celebrate our arrival in las vegas and we couldn’t. They send us 2 plates and 2 breakfast bowls. As this was getting ridiculous we went downstairs to see if there was something they could do about the noisy weaseling draft of air as there was no way anyone could sleet with that noise. the answer we got was to put a towel under the door and that could help as there was not much they could do. they were sorry about the glass as they run out of wine glasses. We were not really happy that after over 4 hours for then to fixed they said put a towel on the floor and it may be better. We asked to get another room that we could sleep as we were really tired since we came driving all day from San Francisco. The answer we got is that they were quite busy in the hotel and no other room was available. I demand to do something about it as that was unacceptable. She went to talk to her manager and after over 10 min waiting she came back to give us another room that was not as nice as our original since the view was on the other side. We didn’t take it and asked to have one on the same side that the one we had as it wasn’t fair for us. She said, sorry no other room available as we are really busy tomorrow monday. I don’t really see that as my problem so I asked if could I talk to the manager myself, she left again for another more than 10 min. this was already 12.30 AM and we were extremely tired, and she said that there was nothing else they could do. Again I said that I would like to talk to the manager and she said that he just left, I wasn’t happy with that and said that I wasn’t going anywhere until he came to talk to me. 2 min later he was there. He said that it was really weird that we had that problem as it was something really unusual, (the girl said really quick to put a towel so I guess they have it all the time) and that he could give us an upgrade to a very nice suite. We went to see the suite and there was no upgrade, the windows were less than half of the size of our first room, and the bedroom was half of the size of our original room, there was an annex sitting room but not very useful for us. Also to move to that room we had to pack everything again go down the lobby and up again as it was in the other side of the hotel. We decided to sleep in our original room, with ear plugs. At around 1.30 AM we finally went to bed and of course we couldn’t even have a glass of wine as they were out of glasses. We still have 2 more nights at the hotel that we paid in advance, otherwise we would check out and go somewhere else. If you come to vegas I wouldn’t recommend this hotel as the service it’s not the best, However the hotel looks nice and without all the trouble it could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbys_Mum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas and a wonderful stay at PH Towers. We had a gorgeous suite on the 7th floor with a lovely pool view.Didn't really use any of the kitchen equipment apart from the fridge but it all looked excellent quality and sparkling clean, Bathroom also very nice and had super-soft fluffy towels. Bed was very comfy with a choice of four lovely pilows each!! Don't really understand some of the complaints in the reviews regarding the "massive walk" to the parking lot - it took my hubby and I under 3 minutes I can only conclude this must be excessive exercise in some peoples eyes. If you have time be sure to catch Jersey Boys at the Palazzo its the best show in Vegas! Have stayed at numerous hotels in Vegas and thought the Trump and Bellagio would be hard to beat but PH Towers is right up there with he best. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: manzyLV
Reviews.Content: we spend 7 days in Vegas and this resort was perfect. Excellent location, excellent food in mall attached and large pool. The pool was very busy and hard to get a place. The two bedroom suite was excellent - huge bedrooms. This location and property is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like an appartment on the strip”
Reviews.Author: eymar22
Reviews.Content: Loved it!!Besides the fact that its a great location, I believe it is a great value. It comes with a kitchen, living room, a table for 6, loved the projector screen. The bathroom was spacious and it has a washer and a dryer, which by the way i took advantage of, and avoided me from coming home and doing laundry. The bed was very comfortable, and the jacuzzi is right next to the bed. Floor to ceiling windows, which makes it have great views. I would so stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: mumidebba
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading negative comments, I turned up at Ph Towers with bin bags, anti-bac wipes and some trepidation. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon, were second in line at check-in and done and dusted in about 10 minutes. The first room we were offered was on floor 9, the receptionist seemed to hint that there were possibly other rooms, but they were so busy at the weekend. Then my husband mentiond that we were in Vegas for our 10th anniversary, and that we were married actually in Vegas, and suddenly there is a room on floor 34. It was an owners room, and had been converted for a disabled owner. This meant it had wider doors and a few handrails in teh bathroom - great for hanging all the towels on ! The room was as amazing as all teh photos portray - no issues with stains or leftovers from previous stays - maybe because it was an owners room ? No problems with us for housekeeping, room was cleaned every day, bins emptied, toiletries restocked, dishwasher loaded up, bedding changed etc There were a few bulbs out, but when a ftting has 4 bulbs, one being out is not going to make me write a bad review...... Bearing in mind I travelled with an 8 year old, I was a bit concerned about the party atmosphere. Firstly, this is very evident at teh weekend. Lots of drinking beer in the pool. But they didn't bother us, and anyway, during a 42 degree LV heatwave, 8am round the pool was plenty hot enough, before the partying began and the loud music started (about 10am). In our room, we heard a very small, distant amount of partying at about 1am one day and 10pm the next (well, the same one actually) but it only went on an hour max. We never actually saw anyone else on our floor the entire week we were there. All in all, there were far more good things about this hotel than bad, we had a great time there as a family and there were plenty of other people with kids. It was great being handy for the mall, ABC is ok for last minute stuff, but Walgreens out on the strip is cheaper. We travelled with Virgin, and really cant complain at all. Although next time, I think we would choose somewhere with a pool complex. GReat shopping - I would recommend buying a 3 day ticket on the Deuce bus and going out to the outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bre007
Reviews.Content: PH Towers Westgate (1 bed room 55 floor) I was there Mon-Thur (the weekend maybe a little different) ***Pros 1-The hotel is in the middle of the strip. You are close to everything or a cab ride away. 2- Connected to the mall which has two (ABC stores) Liq stores and other goodies and tolities. So if you forget something there is the mall. 3- Very nice hotel pool was not crowd while I was there 4- The rooms are spacious and have a full size kitchen and washer and dryer and a projection screen. This is a hotel/timeshare. I did not do the timeshare talk. 5- Room service was prompt and the food was good. ***Cons 1-As some may have said the housekeeping is a bit lax. Not sure if it is because it is a hotel/time share and they tend to not clean the rooms every day. The one day I did see housekeeping they were nice and friendly. So your level of housekeeping may vary. You may require a little less or a little more. If I were traveling with a group I would have required more attention (toilet paper, towels etc.,) 2-Yes the walls can be thin and I could hear the guy in the next room snoring. The snoring maybe a problem if you are a light sleeper. It was not an issue for me because after hanging out I was tried and quickly feel asleep. ***Meeting in the middle 1-Overall it is a great hotel with a good location. The staff was helpful and nice. I would stay again. I like the idea of it not feel so hotelsie (ok not a word but you understand). The full kitchen a was a big plus and save us on spending. ***Other stuff 1- Incase you do the tram/ monorail you can get a three day pass for $28 worth it. But here is the deal it is not easy to get to as you have to physically go inside Bally’s to get to it. The Paris stop is closed. 2-Las Vegas on a budget breakfast: place in the mall has 3.95 breakfast and other places that have dinner/lunch under 5.99 or less 3-The PH @Westgate is a short walk to the regular PH 4-Try to get a high floor facing the strip it is worth the upgrade 5- Find yourself an online deal 6- It’s about 3 miles from the airport Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Kim004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days and had a great time. Our one bedroom suite was clean and whilst I could see evidence that a few parties had happened previously - some wall scratches and lipstick in the mirror crevices - why do people see the need to abuse hotel rooms?, for us the suite was presented well (I like to check under things....) and our housekeeper (who we met one day) was very efficient and did clean appropriately - for us anyway. There were no problems with any of the equipment - it all worked although we are not into using hotel jacuzzis (I mean, what has been there before you???)so have no idea on that. I liked the fact that this hotel is firstly apartment style in Vegas - on the strip - extremely hard to find - and that there are no children here so the noise was minimal and the corridors, lifts and pool empty of little people. We had no problems with checking in, out or with the customer service staff - all were friendly and responsive, but do agree that the Hotel has a pre historic wifi service. Thankfully we were not relying on it to enable that to impact on our stay. I would use this hotel again without any reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Excess, Exactly What I Wanted”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: How I got to the Planet Hollywood site set the tone for the rest of my Las Vegas trip. I was waiting at baggage claim when I was approached by a nice fellow wearing a suit. He said his planned guest pickup didn't show, so he offered to drive me to the Strip for $35.00. I was tired and just wanted out of the airport, so I said yes and followed him out to the parking area. The fellow turned out to be driving a big black Hummer, which I hate as a symbol of excess, but it was entirely appropriate to begin my Vegas vacation. I was delivered right to the door of the hotel, paid my fare and a nice tip, and went to check in. Fortunately for me, I was arriving on a weekday so check-in was fast and easy. I then walked over to the bank of elevators, all the while marveling at the crazy reds, glass, lights, miles of glass, and the huge pool and cabana deck. When I entered my room I had to laugh. The decor was ultra-modern, with a zebra striped lounge in the bedroom, black, white, and chrome or red bedding, granite floors and counters, a big L-shaped couch, and a full kitchen with full sized refrigerator. The bathroom was all glass and granite, with double sinks, and the room had electronically raised/lowered shutters that blocked out the light. The view was not so good, mostly of a parking lot and the back side of other hotels along the strip, but the Planet Hollywood complex was huge and full of shops, casinos, restaurants, bars, even a couple of ABC stores from the chain in Hawaii. The location, once you found your way through the maze of the resort, was good and the exit to the Strip was very memorable. All in all, a lot of fun living a couple of days of wretched excess in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: Curt E
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, great views, amenities, but...jacuzzi tub small and dated, shower leaked, absolutely impossible to reach anyone at the front desk, concierge, house keeping or any other hotel employee, no matter what time you call. Valet parking attendants the rudest you can imagine, and get this: internet doesn't work! We had multiple rooms and it took more than an hour for a single website page to load, any time of the day or night. When we complained upon checkout they told us it's slow but trust me, it's non-existent. How is it possible that in 2011 a Motel 6 has better wifi than PH Towers? And the problem isn't with their wifi network, their ethernet is equally slow.

Reviews.Title: “One Star for the View”
Reviews.Author: Kate T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week after Labor Day. We had originally booked a Studio Suite but when we checked in, they offered a One Bedroom Suite Upgrade on a higher floor at a good rate so we decided to take it. I was especially excited for the jacuzzi! WELL...we go up to the room and the view is absolutely stunning. We walked around a bit and right next to the bed noticed a stain that was very obvious what it was. Gross. We put a towel over it for our entire stay. I decided to take a bath right away in the jacuzzi. The faucet didn't work...only the sprayer so it took forever to fill. The light in the shower did not work and the lights in the bathroom are placed oddly so you sort of do need light in the shower. That night we went out a bit and then came back with bottles of water for the fridge...we opened the fridge and OH MY GOD THE STINK! It smelled like milk had sat in there and spoiled and was never cleaned. The room stunk for a good while afterwards. Initially we would try to open the door quickly to grab the water but eventually just gave up on that. It was unbearable. Finally, we attempted on numerous occasions to order room service and were never able to. The one time we did get through, the woman gave us a wait time of close to 2 hours...really?!? Every other time it sounded suspiciously like someone was picking up and then hanging up. Anyway, my boyfriend and I don't really enjoy complaining so we let this stuff slide and then went downstairs to the front desk a day before we were going to check out to let them know about everything. The man at the desk could not have been more rude. He basically told us that because we didn't tell him earlier, that he couldn't do anything. NEVER apologized. He initially picked up a pen and halfheartedly wrote down our first complaint (the stain) and then didn't write anything else down after that (so for whoever gets this room after us....sorry! We tried to have it fixed for you.) In all: gorgeous view and would have been a very nice stay if everything had worked. Front Desk was AWFUL. Room Service was non-existent. Housekeeping clearly doesn't actually clean. My boyfriend and I noticed a bunch of smushed M&M's near the elevators on our floor on our second day. We left 3 days later and they were still there. Oh, I also love the fact that there is a couch with a pullout bed but no extra sheets/blankets/pillows. Meanwhile, I spent some time at the Bellagio and in their rooms and what a difference....no stains or smushed M&M's on their floors.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: Nels
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the PH Towers Westgate because my friend was staying at PH. I got a reasonable rate on a one room suite. The room was very large with full kitchen, washer, jacuzzi tub etc. The problem with the room was the dust. House keeping is terrible. Service at the front desk very unfriendly and valet incredibly rude. I valeted my car when I arrived and that evening when I took my car out for an hour and came back they told me valet was only for time share owners. I was instructed to drive around to self park. Service is pretty much nonexistent at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms”
Reviews.Author: guccifitme
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nites in a suite plus an extra room that was attached . We booked the stay after we attended a timeshare presentation of the same room for sale which we turned down. They offered the suite for rental so we took the offer.. The rooms were so nice & luxurious with tvs in every room . We love the leather sofa, washer & dryer , & full kitchen . We also had a concierge person to help with all our needs , part of the Westgate Tower Timeshare RSVP . The pool is nice, not family oriented though but we saw some children in the pool. It's more like a party pool, we took our 4 year old & she loved it anyways.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the location and the room size!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCarters
Reviews.Content: To me this was like having a condo on the strip. It was a great location for us because all the restaurants and hotels I enjoy are a quick walk away. Having the Miracle Mile mall right underneath you is very convenient to grab a quick lunch, some drinks and do some shopping. The hotel lobby was very modern and trendy. Our check in was a breeze; we arrived several hours before the normal check-in, however they went ahead and got us into a room. We were on the 54th floor in a one bedroom suite. As others have mentioned the rooms are awesome: there is plenty of space, comfy bed with a view, divine soaking whirlpool tub, large shower, washer/dryer combo, kitchen has full size refrigerator(which is great to have), stovetop, microwave and coffee maker. NO Blender or Toaster in ours. It is a nonsmoking hotel- so if you smoke pick a different hotel. The gym is free to use for guests which is great since most hotels on the strip charge guests a hefty price to workout. It is not the best nor the worst hotel gym. About 6 cardio machines, some free weights and about 10 weight machines. The hotel lobby bar closes early but has a great happy hour special. The pool is really nice and relaxing and the pool bar serves lunch daily! People complain about the walk to the strip, but to be honest it is no farther than walking from the back of caesar's of MGM. You just walk through the mall instead of a casino. The wireless internet that we had to pay a steep extra charge for never worked efficiently. After we spoke to the front desk about it, they removed the charge and said others had complained as well. So that would be the only negative thing I could list about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: rlewis3113
Reviews.Content: Property is showing considerable wear and tear for a relatively new place. Plenty of room but not up to 4 star rating as advertised. Similar level to Treasure Island and Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed more than expected...”
Reviews.Author: rinthecutie
Reviews.Content: Had the one bedroom suite. The room does show signs of wear and wasn't necessarily the cleanness (stains on carpet, marks on wall), it shouldn't bother the average person unless you're looking for something to complain about. Loved the jacuzzi and the projector screen made watching tv more fun than usual. Loved the microwave and refrigerator (full size with ice maker). Another thing I loved is the fact that it looked exactly like the website... Some hotels dont seem to do this, so I got exactly what I was expecting. Check in was quick and empty. Had a mix up with rooms and credit card (I was told they charged me twice, was not true, but issued me a "refund" and I ended up being charged twice after that.. Ironic) but I blame the check in guy, not the overall hotel. Have to show room key each time you head to elevators and elevator are separated by floor like at Caesars which made everything quick. We never had to wait for an elevator. The view was great and everyone we encountered there was friendly. I would definitely return to this hotel for the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: G L
Reviews.Content: Adjacent to the Planet Hollywood Hotel but connected as part of same complex. Very nice complex and still convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not On the Strip, but Situated Perfectly :-)”
Reviews.Author: Quissy8409
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PH Towers 4/29-5/2. The hotel is incredible....everything was great starting with the customer service, which is very important. The suites were beautifully decorated with a great view. Thanks PH for a making my Vegas vacation very memorable. Tip: Snagged a good deal through Priceline :-)

Reviews.Title: “nice modern Hotel with spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: mrswoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PH Towers for 6 nights and had a one bedroom suite - to be honest we were blown away by the size of the room - not only is there a full kitchen with everything you could need but also a comfortable lounge with an amazing view over the strip and an 8ft projector screen that comes down over the window which was fantastic !, in the bedroom a spa bath and again views over the strip and a bathroom with washer/dryer. As we settled in I noticed that the room was not the cleanest - all around the bed there was thick dust - I dont think it had ever been cleaned there which is pretty disgusting ! There was also marks on the walls in the kitchen which made it look a bit dirty. We paid $90 for 4 of the nights (it was more fri sat and sun as it was labor day weekend) and for the money we paid the room was complete value for money. The Hotel is close to lots of restaurants and has a real advantage in that you dont have to fight your way through a casino to get to reception like the other Hotels. A word of warning - the customer service desk try to get you to go to a time share presentation and say it last 1.5 hours in return you will get some discounted tickets to various shows - we fell for this and got discounted peep show tickets (not the best show so would avoid it as there are much better ones out there!) we ended up being over 2 hours and we were stuck with a sales person and then the manager trying to push us into buying the time share ! The Hotel is great but needs to have a look at the cleanliness in the rooms and also check things are working - lightbulbs etc etc (we had quite a few out when we checked in) would recommend this Hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: Si C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during the weekday and was indifferent. Some good and bad points. Pro's - Nice big rooms with a lot of tv's - Fridge and freezer is nice - Security by the elevators to keep non-guests out - Pool was decent - Room cleaned every morning with fresh towels Con's - Quite a trek from the Westgate towers to the casino - Shady characters lounging and roaming around - People sleeping on the lobby couches - Called room service to bring extra blanket but never arrived - Parking in the garage is a hassle - Not a classy or luxurious place if that's what youi're looking for. Did it's job but probably won't stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms,great location!”
Reviews.Author: reyno555
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend stayed here for 5 nights in august, and had a superb time, after trawling websites for hours on end we decided on the 1bedroom suite. On arrival there was only one person in front of me in the queue so was quickly checked in, We were given a room on the 26th floor looking towards the Paris hotel and the view was amazing, the room is huge. we had no problems with any cleanliness anywhere had lots of towels available, coffee maker huge fridge/freezer, was just perfect for what we wanted. Tv s everywhere and the huge projection screen was amazing, we had some friends staying elsewhere so we would always start our nights out at our room and it was perfect, plenty of space for everyone. Only minor problem i had was with the sound system, would occasionally cut out when playing music, or having the tv on quiet, seemed turning it up resolved this issue so that what we did. there was definitely an influx of younger people on the weekend , but didn't bother us and didn't seem to cause any issues. overall a great stay and definitely gave the holiday a real wow factor!

Reviews.Title: “Grand room”
Reviews.Author: UGARPh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and left on the Saturday am of Labor Day weekend. Quiet during the week but the weekend was hopping with the 25-30 year old crowd. And yes you can hear the pool noise on the 52nd floor quite plainly when it's crowded! Rooms are really nice but some maintenance issues such as light bulb out in toliet and breaker tripped in bedroom which rendered TV & lamp inoperable until fixed. Maintenance very pleasant. Took 2 calls for the fuse but on the 2nd call they came within 5 minutes! No body lotion in room but promptly furnished in abundant supply when asked. Suite was quite impressive and we will stay again. Eventhough we checked in on a Monday, we had to pay an upgrade fee to get above a garage view. it was an extra $10/night + tax. which resulted in a side view of the MGM but a great view of the airport - ask for the opposite side of the airport if you really want a strip view.

Reviews.Title: “Really lousy customer service experience”
Reviews.Author: CGTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite at the Towers to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday. As most reviewers have noted, this is like a perpetual spring break at this place. Drunks kids are EVERYWHERE, which I don't really care about, but they could be hazzardous on those 10 inch stilletos they totter around in. It's noisy before the clubs open with everyone getting ready to go out. Again, not a bother since we don't mind loud music. The room was really nice and big. We didn't have any issues with cleanliness. Beds were super comfy. We didn't use the jacuzzi that was in one of the bedrooms (our daughter threatened us with death if she heard it come on). I didn't particularily like the glass doors for the toilet room and shower as there was no stop-gap to keep you from slamming them shut. I was terrified I would smash them to pieces every time I closed them! The only gripe about the room was that they promote there are tv's everywhere in the room, but for us, there were only 2 tv's out of 4 that worked due to the fact that the remote controls laid out for them did not match the brand of the tv and wouldn't work. We tried to see if maybe they were just mixed up, but no. Then my hubby figured out the projecton tv........................but there was no sound and it did not ever work. It stinks to have it advertised, pay nearly $500 a night for a room with malfunctioning equpiment. Now, about that customer service. We arrived at 5:45 p.m. on Friday night. We were told our room wasn't ready yet, but that the check in clerk would see if they could give us something equivalent. Now, I know this is Vegas and you always run the risk of losing the better room to someone that arrives earlier, but to be told that they would "try" to get a similar room was ridiculous - especially since we'd already paid for one night! For that price the room should have been ready and waiting without any questions. When that whole thing got straightened out, the credit card machine wouldn't work, so they did something else to run the card and sent us on our way. Finally checked in, we took our first trip on the elevators which are just shy of Disneyland's Tower of Terror ride (LOL). Your ears pop and it will make you nauseous. You literally feel like you are going to float off the ground - these things are FAST. Got to the room, everyone was very excited to get our night going so we decided to eat in through room service dining. They selection on the menu isn't vast, but suitable enough for what we were wanting. My daughter called to order and.................................they told us that we weren't shown as being checked in so we'd have to pay by credit card when the server showed up. We figured it was a busy hotel, and they probably just hadn't gotten their credit card machine up and going. When the food was delivered the server spent an additional 10 minutes in the room using the phone to call "downstairs" to run hubby's cc. The next morning, once we'd all woken up we again decided to use room service as nobody felt like getting dressed and going out to eat. I called down to order this time, and was told that we weren't shown as being checked in. And when I say this, imagine a rather accusatory voice teling me this. I asked to be connected to the front desk to straighten it out. When connected I explained that we were trying to order room service and they were showing that we were not even in the stinking hotel. The front desk clerk tapped away on her computer and said that SHE had us as checked in (what a shock), and that she would let room service know. So I was transferred back to room service, where both of them got on the phone and told me that their computer systems were completely different and that we'd have to pay cash in order to eat! Never mind that we had a credit card on file and they'd taken extra money out that they told us could be applied to a room service bill (as long as we didn't trash the room, I assume). This is Vegas. How many people wake up with cash in their pockets? I don't, but lucky my husband had enough to pay without running to an ATM, so I called back and placed our order. Now on their menu it had buttermilk pancakes listed. This is Vegas where it seems like whatever you want to eat you can get it, so I asked the woman, "Can we get a fruit topping on the pancakes instead of the syrup?" She paused then said, "I don't even know what you mean! Fruit topping? What? We don't have fruit....." Oooooooo kkkkkkkkk.....bring the syrup. Which they did...with strawberries on the plates. So they DO have fruit - it's a miracle! (BTW, the food was very good, but was standard IHOP fare.) The day we checked out, my hubby called down to the front desk to do the quick check out. When the front desk clerk brought up our room charges she quoted him a price that was TWO NIGHTS price that would be charged to his cc. He reminded her that we had already paid for one night so there should only be one night left. She returned with "You checked in on the 26th and are leaving today, the 28th - that's three nights." He kept trying to explain to her where she was wrong, and ended up having to talk with a supervisor who corrected the problem and checked us out. That was the straw that broke the camel's back for us. PH Towers may be a top rated facility in Vegas, but after we left we wished we spent our money at the Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn or Encore. The service level was really bad and irritating for the price we paid and all the hype this hotel has around it. I guess when your early twenties and looking to throw a few back and party this stuff doesn't bother you, but it made us write PH off forever. We will not stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write a review. I had the best time at this hotel. I My sister 24yrs Mom and Dad both 50 yrs. Had a blast even with the age difference. We got the two bedroom suite. There was such much space. The projection Tv in the living room was a hit. My sister and I used the jacuzzi, and what better way to go home with clean clothes, theres a washer and dryer in the bathroom. Elevators move very quickly so fast your ears pop. I was on the 55th floor. The pool was very nice and checkin was a breeze. I cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: kendall924
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple nights in August and couldn't get out fast enough, you could probably see smoke coming from my shoes as I ran out of here - one night was spent with one eye open so I could rush back to the Venetian! They spent more money on their lobby than the rooms - $10 million dollar lobby, $50 rooms. It was like a scene out of CSI - the glass on the mirror was broken in the bathroom, the bathroom was DIRTY, the shower curtain was mildewy, the towels were dirty, a layer of dust was all over the room from the ledges to the couch, the sheets were TORN, bottles under the couch. You couldn't pay me enough to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: niki c
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in March '11. Stayed at Westgate property. Took out my earrings and put carefully on nightstand and visited pool When I arrived earrings gone. Reported to front desk who said they didnt handle and referred me to loss prevention who is run by a separate company. Loss Preventaion said they would investigate and to call back in a week. Of course I departed within a week but persisited in hopes of obtaining my earrings. Finally got in touch with loss prevention who said it was a criminal matter and to call LVPD to report a theft. Told them it was unacceptable and that I would be back in August and would never stay there. They told me if I during my visit in August I stopped by, their conciernce when I was there they would compensate me for my troubles. Called concierge the day before I left. They had no Idea what I was talking about. Called back loss prevention people who assured me concierge was on notice. Still no earrings by now and I had given up on ever finding the sentimal earrings. Arrived in Vegas in August, went to concierge who gave me free dinner for two at the Brazillian Staeakhouse located there. Food made me sick. Was soo horrible and old. Ruined the night. Also was embarassed because concierge forgot to put surf and turf on the voucher and waiter called manager and said they couldnt accept the voucher. Had to leave in the middle of the meal to get concienrge to issue new voucher. New concierge guy had no idea what I was taliking about. Took thirty minutes to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel if your a 20 something partier”
Reviews.Author: jagcrw
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel and for the most part clean. The influx of 20 somethings come in on friday and the atmosphere totally changes. Drinks spilled in the elevators, puke etc. If you are a big partier than the weekends here are you scene. If you are a family or want less of the party scene, stay during the week. Pool is on the smaller side.

Reviews.Title: “FIrst time OFF the Strip and will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: KevANDHayley
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas 4 or 5 times now and this was the first time we chose not to stay in one of the well know 'Strip' hotels. I think if it's your first visit to Vegas I'd still recomend staying somewhere like the Bellagio/Venetian/Wynn so that you get that WOW factor of walking into one of the main receptions.....however if you are lucky enough to be a repeat visitor then I can t recomend this place Highly enough. Not only is it still a great location, but it's such great value for money. For less that a mid level suite at the Bellaggio we got a 1 bed apt, which had it's own huge living space & kitchen as well as a huge hot tub in the bedroom. It's also attached to the main Planet Holywood property which means you are connected to the shopping mall and Casino so have the main 'Vegas' experience too! Personally if I was staying longer than 3 nights I'd always book this place over a standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL ... BUT CAREFUL WITH CLEANING !”
Reviews.Author: cathchris75
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing design hotel - upper floors bring you to a fabulous view on strip or airport - welcome was very professional - the rooms are so spacious ! incredible compared to european standards - very new hotel so equipment look very new too - the only negative point is the cleaning quality : we experienced very day a cleaning issue : the last day the cleaning lady through away our milk and wine, thinking we have moved out ! but go for it, overall it is a great experience in a super location !

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Vegas Close at Hand”
Reviews.Author: Aegis3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at PH Towers 14-20 August for our wedding anniversary. I had never been to Vegas before, and wanted to stay on the strip, and PH Towers was perfect - its at the heart of the strip, right beside Paris, and across the street from the Bellagio, Ceasar's, and the Metroplitan. It might be the best location in Vegas!! The hotel was built as private residences / timeshares, and is well appointed, although not as opulent as the Bellagio or Trump (I checked all of these out on my stay), but for downtime after a night of indulging in Vegas, it's excellent. Planet Hollywood Casino and the Miracle Mile Mall are right there, as well as the entire Strip experience, but you can also just lounge about what might be one of the most luxurious yet unpretentious and relaxing pools in all of Vegas. Security is excellent but not overbearing, and the concierge was very helpful if you are Vegas neophyte (like me). The rooms have great views, but the higher the better - get above the 15th floor overlooking Bellagio and Paris. The kitchenette was very handy, although you wouldn't want to try and cook full on meals. Save money and stock up on adult bevvies and munchies at the local ABC in the Miracle Mile so you have more bun for the fun! The staff were friendly but not pushy, and there are lots of options for food and entertainment right at your doorstep - although I also recommend you head down to the strip and see a Cirque show. Overall, I felt like the PH Towers was a very upscale oasis from which to indulge and explore Vegas - luxurious, but not to the point where an average human would feel out of place. It was quiet but cool/hip/phresh at the same time, and your Grandma won't be staying here, like she may be at Ceasar's...

Reviews.Title: “Good views”
Reviews.Author: catalan_girl
Reviews.Content: Our room was smaller but it was still quite large. It had very good views. It was very clean. The hotel resort is quite good and you are very near Bellagio or Caesars Palace resorts. The wifi access is not free. We were in a room in the 23rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fauxmoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in One Bedroom Suite at the PH Westgate Towers. The One Bedroom Suite was very nice with a small kitchen and dining area overlooking the living room which a projector TV. The King Bed was very comfortable. It seemed odd to me that the jacuzzi would be in the bedroom right next to the bed. Also odd was the black toilet and that the kitchen had a stove, but no cooking supplies were provided. We all thought this suite was much nicer than the suites at the Venetian/Palazzo and it costs a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: Trevor M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for the second time last month and for the 2nd year in a row it was incredible. We thought it was great last year but it only got better. Check-in was pretty quick. Our flight brought us in pretty early but we just slipped out to the pool to enjoy buckets of beer and the sun for a few hours until our room was ready. The bartenders at the pool bar are really fun people and they treat the people on their deck really well. Our first year we took the 2-bedroom suite which was great; this year we decided that a 1-bedroom suite was enough for us. The suite was clean and with the high-floor placement we had a great view that included the Bellagio fountains. The floor to ceiling windows and wall sized projection screen are awesome features for a hotel. The rooms are also really quiet. We had a few party people in the room beside us and we couldn’t hear a thing from them once they were in their room. At the same time we also had our music playing on our room’s sound system (mind you not crazy loud) and you couldn’t hear a thing from the hall. It does take a few minutes to get to and from the actual strip but it’s a pretty easy walk through the Mile… I am a fan of their pool. It is a lot more calm than some of the other party pools in Vegas but still has a fun enough scene making it a solid place to hang out. We normally hit up the bigger pools for the main chunk of the day before returning to the Towers to finish the off the sun. When you stay with PH you also get access to the Planet Hollywood pools as well – a big party scene on Saturday afternoon. The staff were very friendly, the building felt safe (attendant now at the elevators 24/7), for the size of the room it’s a heck of a deal, and it’s in a pretty good spot on the strip. One thing to be aware of if you plan on taking cabs back to the hotel a lot is that the light to turn in takes forever. Like we would have our cab meter run up because it took us so long to turn into the PH complex. But really, this is not a very big deal. We head to Vegas every year and I cannot wait to get back to the Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Vacation"”
Reviews.Author: yazi1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers and it was great. The rooms are just amazing. Great location.. I really recommended......

Reviews.Title: “PH Westgate Towers are a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rogerw303
Reviews.Content: Nice & Spacious. Good views of the Strip. Reasonably priced. Full Kitchen and separate bedroom make this a nice suite. Only negative is we were on an early flight from Maimi , got in at 11"00 AM and could not check in until 4:00 PM.

Reviews.Title: “decent selection, good Strip location”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The Studio Suite we had was a good size and had we stayed longer the kitchenette might have had some use (though of course without any utensils, cooking might have been something of a challenge). The rooms are nicely furnished, perhaps a little sparsely, rather like a show condo for sale (which of course as others have pointed out here is exactly what the tower is – condos that didn't sell as well as expected). The best thing was the killer view from the upper floors (for us, on the dizzyingly high 54th floor), with the Strip at your feet. The Planet Hollywood brand clearly appeals to a younger (read: barely post-adolescent) crowd, and we were conscious of being among the oldest guests there. Not a problem, they mostly behaved, though we did have to push by tipsy twenty-somethings late in the evening. It benefits from a nice location on the Strip, and is attached to a busy mall. Note: there is very little valet parking for the size of the hotel, so be prepared to grease palms, flash a winning smile or use whatever ruse you think will get them to park your car for you. Or be prepared to walk with your bags from the distant self park.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: Daniel O
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel this August and we noticed a very very very long line for the check in, it came out all the way to the mall, we had to wait about 2 hours in line to get into our room. In all my stays at hotels in Las Vegas I have never stayed in line that long. Finally we came into our room which was awesome and no complaints about that. Then when we left the hotel and came back at 1am to park our car, the valet said that the valet parking is full. So I told him I will wait, I waited 30 minutes and saw him take out about 5 cars and I went to see for myself that there was enough parking in the valet before I tell him something, there was about 15 extra spots and when I asked him if there was any parking spots available he said that they are for some kind of production crew, then I called the manager and she said it's for timeshare owners only. I don't think 15 timeshare owners will arrive at 2am in the morning so they should a least park a car for a customer that waited 30 minutes for nothing. I've been in this hotel 6 times and this was the first time I hear that. I pay for a 5 star hotel and I want my car parked at the valet because the self parking is so far that you need to come in all the way from the mall. I told the manager that I will never come back to this hotel if I don't have my car parked. She told me to never come back! So basically had to walk through the whole mall to get to my room at 2am in the morning. At the same day I called to ask for a late checkout and they told me that they can't do it, I asked for a least to leave at 1pm, the check in for another person is at 3pm so they still have 2 hours for clean up. Every 5 star hotel that I have ever been too gives a late check out. Then we had our do not disturb sign on all the time so we don't get bothered by the cleaning crew, the lady came in 3 times and opened the door with the sign on! What the hell??? what if I was walking around naked or something! So the service was horrible, I will never go there again, even though the rooms are nice and the prices are cheap, I rather overpay and go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: tiberius_nero
Reviews.Content: Having read such contrasting reviews, I was apprehensive, especially given the high price we paid. But in our case we were very lucky. The room (2 bedroom suite) was spectacular. Jacuzzi in the bedroom, pull down movie screen, TVs in every corner, ultra-modern kitchen, sofas, tables - there was so much space and so many gadgets it was a shame we didn't spend longer in the room. It was clean, quiet and nothing needed replacing / maintenance. And we were never approached by anyone trying to sell a timeshare. The view was great - Paris & Bellagio (just) in one corner and the mountains & desert in the other. It was probably a 10 minute walk from the room to the strip (via the enclosed Miracle Mile) and parking was free. Our only interaction with the PH staff was the 'airheads' at check-in and the concierge. I'm thankful that I didn't need any other assistance. I presumed I would have got better service if I was younger (or trendier). We booked via www.cityandshow.com - good price, very easy, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Iffy Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: Got the room with a Book It package for our anniversary. Very nice 1 bedroomroom with a horrible view of the parking garage.
