Asked for a higher /better view room and were moved to the 17th floor. Better but basic things overlooked ( leftover garbage and recycling left on counter. QTip on unswept floor). Get an early shower if you want better than lukewarm water.

Reviews.Title: “It LOOKS good.... but NEVER EVER stay here, please i beg you.”
Reviews.Author: RICARDO_SUEN
Reviews.Content: One sentence. This place SUCKS. I have been to more than twenty countries and this is the worst hospitality I have received so far. I would give u the pros and cons first and you can see my experience to determine if you are going to stay in this TIMESHARE property. PROS: On the strip (after a 10 mins walk on Miracle MIles Shops) Room LOOKS nice Relatively decent price ( well I could book Aria at the same price) CONS: Poor staff Poor Hospitality Poor ROOM maintenance everywhere is DIRTY. (corridor public area, even my room) NOISY neighbour (I heard Rapped music next door LOUDLY AT 1 AM) It is a five-night stay in Planet Hollywood tower and I am now on my third day. I totally would like to give this hotel a ZERO star if i could. I felt so regret that I did not listen to the negative comments in tripadvisor. Everything LOOKS nice in the room, but WHOLE PLACE DOESNT FUNCTION. I checked in on a Sunday evening and i waited for more than 30 mins, which i accepted. ( there are more than 10 check in desk with only 3 staff. Totally unstaffed hotel ) I paid $20 tips for the staff and ask for a "complementary upgrade" and he took my money and gave me a room at 26th floor. Well its a King bed studio which is EXACTLY what i booked. Okay its fine for me (even he took my money) but when i started unpacking and open the closet mirror door it ALMOST FELT OVER on me. Somehow that heavy mirror door was not even INSTALLED PROPERLY. I was kinda upset and went back to the front desk and asked for a room change. The guy apologize (which is the ONLY apologize I have received so far) and then got me a room on 52nd floor. Well the room on 52nd has better view but thats all. The room is not totally clean I found used tissue in the side table drawer. I went out for dinner and came back around 11pm and I realised there was WATER LEAKING ALL OVER THE BATHRROOM and the WALKWAY. The floor is those kinda shiny tiles so it is SO SLIPPY and dangerous. I went back to ask for a room change and a different woman staff told me she could gave me a room on 7th floor or got me an engineer to check it. Well I dont want a 7th floor room facing carpark so I waited for the engineer to come at the MIDNIGHT and HE COULD NOT FIX IT. He basically did not know where the water came from and swipe it with the towel and left. OKAY I accepted it as an one time incident but IT HAPPENED AGAIN on the second night/ third day morning. I woke up at 6am for bathroom and I JUST SLIPPED because the "magic water" appeared AGAIN. This time I went to the front desk and express my concern and the woman said nothing for apology except gave me a room on 51st floor and asked for my number to be contacted by the "manager" Well I am in my third room now and THERE IS STILL PROBLEM. I dont mind it is one floor down but there is a foot line in the bathroom felt apart. First time, i would say i was unlucky. Second time, I would say I was unlucky (twice). Third time, THIS HOTEL IS NOT WORKING.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dhaval_Jangla
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, awesome fun.. had taken a one bed room suite, the best part of the room the projector that beams and makes the room into a virtual cinema hall. the jacuzzi was also an awesome experience. looking forward to going there again. Regards, Dhaval

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls weekend getaway! We had suite 2 2 bedrooms suite which actually conneted to make it a 4 bedroom suite! It was the way to go traveling with a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: Rolfanator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the PH towers for 4 nights and found it a very nice hotel, never once have we encountered a problem with any staff , everyonw was polite and helpfull. checkin on a Tuesday 1230 arrival was 5 minutes and the upgrades offered where a super deal. Only once we had some younger people in the large room next to us having a party. It took 1 call to the front desk and security was up on the 27th floor withing 10 minutes and end of problem. the room was large and bright. We would recommend this hotel. No casino directly in the hotel which we found nice and the buffet deal at the PH was the best out of the 3 other hotels we have visted. It is usually a younger crowd that stays there but we found them all happy and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Way Cool Rooms......if you are planning to spend any time in there!”
Reviews.Author: whatalife
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend on a girls trip with a party of 8 and must say the 2 bedroom suite more than suited our group - Fun- Hip- Functional would be good descriptives, but have to agree with the Kitchen comment I have seen - why bother with a kitchen if you don't stock it with anything - including glasses for 8 people. The Good - location, access to shops and restaurants, the rooms and the decor were great. There was a washer and dryer in our bathroom and a projection TV .......seriously!!!! The Bad - lack of in room amenities such as an Ipod dock or "stuff for the kitchen." The Ugly - wow talk about people and the messes they make - we were always waiting for housekeeping and the pool area was absolutely trashed by the end of the day because they did not have the staff to keep up with the CRAZY PARTY KIDS! I would highly recommend this place if you are a young person looking for the 24 hour party at the pool and beyond, but it you are just the tinyest bit over that part of your life, this is NOT the place for you. I loved the decor and the actual hotel, but would not stay here again because I felt like I was back on Daytona beach celebrating Spring Break all over again!

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers - Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-lover3122
Reviews.Content: Just got back and had a great vacation. Booked two rooms, one for my husband and I and one for kids and friends. Rooms were very clean. You can't beat the price we paid of $115 average rate per night, plus taxes (we stayed over a Saturday night) for the amount of space you get in the room. It is huge! We loved the projection TV that displayed on the living room blinds. Loved the large floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom. The jacuzzi tub is a really great feature of the room, however the jets in our tub did not work. Had to show our room key to the guard each time we entered the elevator area leading to the towers rooms which made us feel a little more secure. My only negative comment would be that the full kitchen is basically useless except for the refridgerator to store milk for cereal or mixers for drinks. Not that I really want to cook on vacation but,they don't provide a toaster or any pots and pans at all. Wanted just to make myself a scrambled egg in the morning but I'm not sure how they expect you to cook on the stovetop without any pots or pans. Coffee pot is a one cup at a time maker (not a Keurig) and is just not very convenient. The Miracle Mile mall that you can access through the lobby is very convenient for things like coffee, sandwiches, dinners, and alcohol at the ABC store. Would reccommend "Earl of Sandwich" in the mall for a 24 hour eatery. Sandiwches are great. The weekends are pretty crazy there - lots of 20 somethings that have had a little too much to drink walking around the mall, but nobody bothered us. Room was very quiet. Never heard noise from any other rooms. Pool area is nice. You don't have to pack beach towels as they will provide them at the entrance to the pool. Pack your walking shoes because you will do a bit of walking each time you leave your room to walk out on the strip. PH towers sit behind the Plant Hollywood Hotel and Miracle Mile mall so you will do some walking.

Reviews.Title: “What happens in Vegas.....”
Reviews.Author: Lily1280
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous! Very large, perfect for entertaining, 4 tvs (including small one in bathroom), full kitchen, dining island w/seating for 6, huge (!) couch and best of all a projector on the blind that created a movie screen. Everything was automated. Fabulously comfortable bed, whirlpool tub, large bathroom (the odor from the toilet which is probably recycled water, could be a bit much - keep the door open and it's okay). A room you like coming back to. Stayed during the week and it was pretty quiet; come Fri-Sun it becomes very popular with a younger, hipper crowd....so be prepared. If you don't want that scene....stay somewhere else on a weekend visit. The location is behind the hotel on the strip but all accessible from the mall and other hotels. Loved it! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bed service!”
Reviews.Author: Jaecanada
Reviews.Content: I come to Vegas 4 times a year and stayed at planet Hollywood a few times. I thought I would stay at west gate this time. Not impressed! When I arrived on my floor there was garbage spread all over the floor by by elevators. After 24 hours garbage was still there. I called the front desk to let them know all I got was bad attitude. When I came back later that evening garbage was still there so called again. More bad attitude. When i arrived the bathtub was dirty and front desk service was bad at check in time. I would not stay here again and never recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room!”
Reviews.Author: 100809BT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in our time share for the first time. It was an awesome room, I wish we would have stayed in the room and hotel more to enjoy all the amenities. We always got everything we called the concierge for if we needed extra towels, shampoo, trash bags, etc. They resort was awesome, one of the nicest ones I have ever stayed in. The pool was definitely the hottest in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, modern and hip”
Reviews.Author: FunInTheSun0808
Reviews.Content: At first, the front desk placed at the 8th floor with no view of beautiful Las Vegas whatsoever (only the parking lot). I immediately asked them to place me at higher floor. She was hesitant at first but then put me on the 19th floor. So I was happy. The suite is classy, modern and hip. The suite is a bit small but it was alright as long as we have the fridge and microwave and of course the oh so amazing big windows! The hotel is connected to Miracle Mile which I really really liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great space! Good location!”
Reviews.Author: scogil
Reviews.Content: Very awesome rooms! We stayed in a 2BR suite and there were 7 of us and we were comfortable. Great location close to miracle mile, casinos, and other hotels. Customer service was not the greatest. We had to call twice for extra blankets and the first person told us they didn't have any blankets in the whole hotel. Room wasn't ready for us when we checked in so we had to change to the other side of the hotel but they did upgrade us to a higher level at least. Pool area was packed but very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and understaffed”
Reviews.Author: 2000neon
Reviews.Content: The issues started as soon as we arrived at the valet of the hotel with our rental car. We literally sat in our car for 20 minutes with absolutely no acknowledgement from any of the 4 valets. We finally went up to one of them who advised valet is full and we would have to use self-parking (which is what we wanted to do anyway, but it would have been nice to have received instructions on both options when we arrived, not 20 minutes later after being ignored). Walking through the lower level arrival lobby, the white leather barcelona chairs were filthy and already worn out looking (remember this is only a 2 year old hotel). Then went up the escalator to the main lobby and check-in line, which didn’t have the usual roped corrals to keep the line organized. While in the check-in line up, there were 4 staff working the “VIP/Owners” check-in desk, which was completely empty the whole 45 minutes we were waiting in the regular line. They periodically came over to the regular check-in line, asking “VIP/Owners?” to bring them, if any, to the separate check-in desk. In any other hotel, the VIP desk chips in to help the regular check-in desk when they’re not busy. Not the case at PH Towers. They literally stood around the VIP desk chatting amongst themselves with nothing to do and their backs toward the big regular check-in line. When we finally got to an agent to check-in, we expressed our frustrations with the parking issues. Her only reply was the hotel was built with only 50 valet stalls and they were already full. Not the point. We simply would have appreciated direction from the parking staff on valet and self parking options upon arrival, not 20 minutes later. We also commented on the long wait to check in. She replied telling us they had 600 check-outs and 600 check-ins that day, hence the extended wait time. A hotel this size wouldn’t have this problem if sufficiently staffed. Then we entered the elevator to go up to our room. All the elevators had some damage to them e.g. signs ripped off, floor numbers scratched off, etc. We then got up to the 25th floor for our room. The hallway walls were all marked and gouged up, the drywall with large chips in many places (again, this is only a 2 year old hotel). Finally we entered our room, which at first glance looked great, and huge. It was the 1 bedroom suite and around 950 square feet. But as soon as we started unpacking we noticed many maintenance and housekeeping issues e.g. gum stuck in the carpet in 2 places, carpet not vacuumed (potato chip crumbs all over the place), crumbs on the kitchen bar stools, bedroom drawers extremely dusty/had hairs, practically every single wall had greasy hand marks from floor to ceiling, the headboard had some kind of splash marks all over it, cupboard door for the washer/dryer combo unit in the bathroom vanity didn’t close properly. Overall it didn’t feel comfortable due to the dirty state of the room. We called housekeeping and a manager came up right away, who promised to have the room re-cleaned thoroughly while we were out, which they did, but was still a marginal job. Then finally at check-out returning our room cards at the front desk, we overheard another couple beside us also complaining about several things wrong with their room, similar to our issues i.e. dirty, things in disrepair. The front desk agent was writing down an extensive list. Need I say that we won’t ever be staying here again?

Reviews.Title: “Literally just got back”
Reviews.Author: vicky l
Reviews.Content: Where to start we were in vegas for a family wedding and i have been reading these reviews for some months its seems to have very mixed reviews , My wife and i feel that the room was amazing, spacious and had good facilities. Comparing this with other hotels on the strip it is definiately superior. The hotel pool was lively and busy at the weekend but not too over crowded during the week. This hotel is aimed at young singles and couples and i would not advise families or anyone wanting a peaceful experience to stay here. The Hotel is situated in the heart of the strip and has good access to shops, restaurants, other hotels and shows. The low points of our stay were the hotel staffs customer service as when we checked in we provided our credit card details as a deposite. This information was lost by the hotel and my wife recieved a phone call asking to provide it again. As we were on our way out my wife said she would bring it to the check in desk in the morning. When we returned we were locked out of the room and accused of not paying for the room. We were spoken to in a rude manor, embarrassed as they said infront of a que of people our card had been declined and yet the next morning the card was accepted and we payed for the room in full. After all the the confusion around the credit card we spoke with the manager, who was very helpful and quickly refunded our international calls to compensate for the mix up. Another area that lets this hotel down is the cleanliness of the rooms. We did not have our room changed and made up daily, we were left short of clean towels and the room was not dusted or hoovered for the entire stay. Dispite this we had a lovely week in the hotel and would have recommended it to friends if it wasn't for a rude, arrogant bell desk employee who gave me and my wife abuse and sarcasim for not providing a good enough tip on the collection of our bags to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: thatblondeone
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying in this hotel. As a tradition before school starts, we get a group of people together and we head on down to Vegas every August. We arrived and check in was not until 4pm, but I had called ahead to see if there was an early check in available, which they jus said it was on a first come first serve basis. We got there around 2pm and stood in line for about 45 minutes, everyone else was getting their room's then the lady looked at us and said, not ready yet. Which was fine, but she said we would have to get back in line again. WHAT A LONG LINE! She did give us a key so we would be able to go to the pool. Which did I mention is awesome! They had platforms that you could sit on and the water wasnt deep so you could stand and chill. The bar was expensive but what do you expect its Vegas. Finally got into the room, it was very pretty. It wasn't as big as I thought it would be. Oh its was a one bedroom suite. The two bedroom suite was a lot more spacious. The bathroom was pretty neat with the stalls one shower and one toilet. The bed was amazing, we found the pullout just got in the way and ended up taking the mattress out and putting it on the floor. ALOT more room that way. It wasn't too bad in price. But take it from me, don't take someone that can't handle Vegas, at which that person broke a lamp, it cost $240.00 to fix! So watch out on things. Oh one more thing. DO NOT check your bags in at the Bell desk. They take FOREVER like Two hours to get. Even if you are picking up it takes FOREVER for them to pay attention to you even though you had been standing in line at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location for Families”
Reviews.Author: KiwiFamily27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the towers in June, and had 2 x 1br apartments for an excellent rate through bookit. We travelled as a large family with myself, husband, 3 adult children and 2 toddlers under 5. This hotel was ideal for everyone, as it was modern and clean without a casino(good for younger children), but attached to the miracle mile mall and in the centre of the strip (for the adults). The suites were excellent, with kitchen, laundry, projector, jacuzzi, check in and out was fast and simple. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting somewhere clean and modern but in the centre of las vegas. The centre of the strip is a walk outside the mall. There are deuce buses to transport up and down the strip, and plenty of casinos surrounding the hotel. It is not the same hotel as planet holleywood, there is definately a difference, it is next to it, but accessable through the mall. I do reccommed going to a show while you are in Vegas, they are just amazing, we all saw cirque du soleil mystere, highly reccommend for all ages. We are definately going to go back to Vegas, and will book at this hotel for sure. Having an excellent hotel to stay in just made our trip extra enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Armed Services Stay Away - this place did not honor a Marine Corp reservation!”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: My name is Chandler and I made a reservation for a suite in February 2011 for a weekend of fun on Memorial Day Weekend 2011. I had to pay upfront for a deposit on the suite to hold and verify my reservation. The week before my trip, my mother called and verified my reservation. . When I went to check in...guess what? No suite was available and I had to go next door to the sister property. I got a small dump of a room with a sliver of a window overlooking the parking structure. I got ripped off royally and this is how PH treats their Armed Service men? No respect whatsoever. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excedeed all expectations, simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Alona27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and immediately were impressed upon arrival. The rooms are very large with very modern decor, very nice rooms. There was plenty of room for quite a few people as well. The view is amazing, the living room offers floor to ceiling windows with a projection tv when the blinds go down. Hotel was clean we, got a great view of the strip (37th floor). Everything was in working order including the amazing projector screen . It's also not true that you would have to walk through the mall to get to the hotel, as we thought the first 2 nights. They have a separate entrance that leads to the same parking lot for the mall, it's actually faster to get to your room than any other hotel in Vegas. Full kitchen was awesome and came in very handy. We really thought the ONLY bad thing thing about this place was that we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: Getaway6039
Reviews.Content: PH was our favorite place to stay in Vegas, modern, sleek and sexy is best to desricbe it, staff are amazing and best location ever.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Prime Time Stay...Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Carol-Lee-Weber
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews here and elsewhere I was hesitant to book a two night stay at PH Towers but took the chance anyway as I loved the photos and reported ammenities I saw online. This was to be a three day getaway for my 18 year old son and myself to regroup and plan for the next chapter of our lives. It's a five hour drive from where we live in California to Las Vegas (well, it's really a six hour drive for those who obey the speed limit). As we drove straight through we were anxious to get to our hotel and get settled. I found it a bit irritating that the valet service at PH Towers is reserved for timeshare owners only. It took a bit of time to figure out the self park garage but after a few trips up, down and around we realized that you DON'T have to walk through the shopping mall to get to the garage! It took about 30 minutes for us to locate a decent parking spot, roll our bags to the hotel and get to the front desk for check-in. Checking-In was rather painless. We waited for three people in line before us and it all moved fairly quick. Upon presenting my confirmation paperwork to the clerk, I asked for a quiet non-smoking room as I have terrible allergies. The clerk advised me that the entire hotel is non-smoking. I inturn advised her that I am a world traveller and know from experience that people smoke in their rooms no matter what the policy. She told me that there was a $200 fine for those who do. I responded politely and asked that she assure that the room she assigned us was clean, quiet and clear of smoke. She upgraded us from a lower floor to a fabulous 50th floor suite at no charge. Kudos to you, Ms. Clerk. The Suite: I wish I'd had my camera out when we opened the door to our one bedroom suite. As we entered, the room darkening shades automatically raised to surprise us with an awesome view. My son about dropped to the floor in awe (photo opp!). The livingroom was clean and orderly with a giant L-shaped leather sofa and two comfy easy chairs to enjoy the large flat screen TV or projection unit which shows on the 8 foot screen that doubles as a window shade. Also, an attached kitchen sporting full size refrigerator with ice/water in the door, dishwasher, microwave, electric cooktop, toaster, blender and coffee maker. Dishes, pots and pans, glassware, utensils and cleaning supplies were also provided. Dining table seats six with another flat screen TV to enjoy while eating. In the bedroom, FABULOUS furniture including super-comfy king size bed with tons of pillows, contemporary chaise lounge placed by the floor to ceiling window to enjoy the view, large spa tub, tons of drawer space, big closet and an electronic wall safe to protect your valuables when not in the room. And...another flat panel TV! In the bathroom, double sinks, lots of light, separate toilet and shower stalls and tons of towels. There's even a European style LG washer/dryer unit hidden under the vanity and yes, a small TV mounted on the wall! After all this, we did experience a few hic-ups with our room but nothing to complain to the staff about. We understand the meaning of GREEN and were absolutely okay with re-using our towels and cleaning up after ourselves for the short length of time we stayed. On the downside: In the kitchen, the dishwasher was beeping as it was stopped mid-cycle prior to our arrival. It took about a minute to figure out what the noise was but an easy fix by simply closing the door and allowing the cycle to finish. In the livingroom, no sheets or blankets on the hide-a-bed. We had to call for linens but were surprised at how quickly they arrived after phoning one time using the ANYTHING/ANYTIME button on the suite telephone. In the bathroom, the BLACK toilet (yikes, thought those went out in the 80s) was low-flow and did not flush away all toilet paper the first time. Not a big deal but a little annoying. The shower door did not fit properly so water did end up on the tile floor creating a slip-n-fall situation as there was more water than the towel that we used for the missing bathmat could soak up. Again, no big deal, just a little annoying. In the bedroom, the carpet just inside the door from the bathroom was pulling up ever so slightly and created a hazard for tripping. There was no iron or ironing board in the closet as advertised on the website where we ordered the room, not a bother for us as we were all about jeans for this trip. Lastly, there was no telephone book or writing supplies in the suite. Internet was available for a charge of $19.99 for three days. We thought it should have been included. We did not use the pool, business center or fitness room so we cannot comment on them for this stay. We did eat at a few of the restaurants in the adjoining mall and enjoyed them all. The ABC liquor store in the mall had everything we were looking for including moderately priced spirits for me and snacks for my son. The store was organized and the clerk was helpful and nice. We are not big shoppers but we did look in the windows at many of the stores and boutiques in the adjoining mall and were surprised by the number of people exiting with purchases and treasures. Certainly these shoppes must have moderately priced goods as the number of people walking around with multiple bags was surprising! All in all, our stay at PH Towers was a nice one. We didn't come across any pushy time-share sales people, loud parties, falling down drunks, nasty staff or inconvienient walks to and from parking, shopping or casinos. What we did experience was a reasonably priced hotel that stood up to our expectations and a great three day turn-around to our favorite city in the west. We will be back in Vegas soon and plan to say at PH Towers again...and hope you will, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Great Location - OK if you want to save money”
Reviews.Author: jernda
Reviews.Content: I came here for a girls weekend and the group consensus was to get the biggest room on the Strip we could find at the lowest price - and that we did. PROS: The rooms are very inexpensive but they are really nice - our girls stayed in a one-bedroom suite and it was perfect. And the location is PERFECT too - mid-Strip within easy walking distance to Paris, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan and the new CityCenter. Lastly, the casino is one of the nicest I have seen. CONS: It's a young, less-than-desirable party crowd (of course - because the big rooms are inexpensive!) Everyone at the hotel had one of those neon yellow yards of daiquiri in their hand at all times. Don't get me wrong, that is why I went to Vegas too, but I would have preferred a much more upscale experience and would have wanted to stay at Aria or Cosmopolitan. The PH Towers are connected to Planet Hollywood by the Miracle Mile shops which is great for a day, but then gets old. There are no really good eateries in the mall either. The pool was a ZOO. Don't get me wrong, it was a nice pool, had a pool bar and a DJ, but you had to fight for chairs. Overall, it was perfect for what we wanted. I would recommend the hotel for a group that wants to save some dough and be right in the center of the action. If you want a more sophisticated vibe, head over to Cosmopolitan, Aria or even Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwifruitontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers for 4 nights in June. We arrived on a Monday, so there was not much of a check in queue. We got upgraded for our room which we were very excited about to the 54th floor. The room was just amazing! It had a huge bed with jacuzzi tub in the corner and a massive TV. The floor to ceiling windows provided a great view of the strip and Vegas! The room was very clean & tidy. The bathroom was just huge and had a massive shower, huge vanity with freebe shampoos. The best feature for us was the fact that there was a washing maching and washing powder also available which was much needed after being on the road travelling for a while. The kitchen/dining area was huge with a couch, floor to ceiling windows, projector TV, plus a huge TV, full kitchen facilities including microwave, huge fridge etc. The pool area seemed to be a little on the small side for the size of the hotel and you need to get there early to get a spot. A huge plus was the proximity to the Miricle Mile Shops which were linked from the hotel. This allowed you to get to other casinos without having to walk in the heat and also provided great shops on the doorstep. We also did not get bothered by the timeshare selling-tho had been warned by friends who had stayed before not to get sucked into the freebe tickets for shows as you had to spend half a day with a timeshare hardsell. The only down side was that there was a little bit of noise on the Thurs night but as we were there midweek it was generally pretty quiet. Overall, despite some other negative reviews, we would recommend this hotel as it is a great location, has fab rooms and provides excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Party Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Sparkysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed Fri-Mon and would definitely go back. It was a noisy party scene on Fri-Sat nights but we expected it and had no problems. The rooms were very nice and we booked at a huge discount, that sure helped. The place has reasonable food prices in the 'Miracle Mile' shopping center that surrounds it and the pools was nice also. One draw back was that the hallways were not vacuumed the whole time we were there, sames chips never moved...

Reviews.Title: “Beaware! Terrible hotel and service !”
Reviews.Author: 999mikey2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be rated below 2 stars if it is not new. There are so many problems in this hotel that we cant list all in here. 1) Front desk service is extremely terrible. Even a motel 6 staff did a much better job than them. Arrived at 8:30pm at night. 5-6 people in line.3-4 staff were working, WAIT OVER 40 MINS. The line behind us are all angry customers. Staff doesnt even brother to greet and say thank you. 2) The hotel looks nice BUT it is extremely cheap made. The cabinet door is broken. The jet tub is extremely dirty. The TV doesnt shows picture clearly. The shower head is leaking water. 3) LOUD and NOISY. This is the worst part. Different people are having parties at 3:00am. YES . 3:00am morning. Hotel did nothing about it. 4) Dont think about to complain in this hotel. We saw a guy having problem with his reservation. The front desk called him to wait over 30 mins and the manger wouldn't come out until he yelled in the front desk. (we waited over 40 mins and was watching the whole drama) My advice is to stay away from this hotel. Look at the review, only 5-star positive ones are replied from the hotel management, are they real comment ???

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING room, TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: nyuszi
Reviews.Content: I loved the room here so much, I really want to stay here again. However, I'd rather go stay at a travelodge with friendly, competent staff members than ever have to deal with any of the people who work for this property. We had to wait 70 minutes to check in because they had so few people working the front desk. And this was on a Sunday afternoon, so not with the weekend rush. 2 people in our group were booked to perform in a show at another hotel and as we realized we weren't going to be able to check in and change in time, one of them went to the concierge to find out if he could get his shirt ironed. That whole process took about 30 minutes and resulted in bubkis. Then when he asked a staff member if there were irons already in the room or if he needed to put in a housekeeping request or something, she rudely said "I don't know" Really, you're working at the front desk of this hotel and you don't know if the rooms have *irons*? When we finally got to the rooms, they were phenomenal. Large 1 BR suites, jacuzzi in the bedroom and nice spacious bathroom. The shower was a little weird - they seemed to pick design over function & the water pressure sucked. But everything else was fantastic. Even the couch was more comfortable than a lot of hotel beds I've stayed on. Oh, and they had these full window shades that kept the room really dark for sleeping, even during the day. My friend didn't believe me when I woke him up at 11, that's how dark it was. Which is pretty key if you're sleeping off a Vegas night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbass0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite and the room was a great way to enjoy the trip with a group of friends. The hotel decor was very modern, upscale. On par with the Palms as far as guests. More for partying. The pool was great!! There's a huge mall that connects to the casino. Lots of late night shops (Earl of Sandwiches is great--24 hours and reasonably priced sandwiches). You can bring as many guests to the pool as long as one person has a hotel key. You always have to show your key when you go to the elevator to the room--24hour guards. We absolutely loved our stay!! Definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and location....”
Reviews.Author: Prtof5hive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for our last hoorah before school started. From the time we opened the door to our room until we left, our stay was incredible! The service was by far amazing. Besides the rooms being beautiful and swanky the service and security was amazing. On our last day we all went down to the parking lot. My husband went to go retrieve the car while we waited. No sooner did he leave, I turned around and one of my children had wandered off. I called for her and there was no answer and she was no where in sight. In a panic I fled to the front gate security and they IMMEDIATELY radioed for assistance. They had security everywhere within seconds until they found her. She was curious about the escalators so that's where she wandered to. Thank you so much!! Besides that we had so much fun, we decided to come back again and chose this hotel not only because of the security and service, but for the beautiful spacious rooms and view and the fact there's no casino and its all non smoking. Even the pool area. I would definetly recommend to everyone to give this place a try :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations - Fantastic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Johnny-Q2
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were by far and away the best we have ever stayed at in Vegas, including the Encore, Rio, and Tuscany Suites. The Planet Hollywood Towers exceeded all of our expectations. The suite itself was huge, and had a door to the separate bedroom. My wife and I stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers for 3 starting on Sunday 07/24/11. Our room was a King Suite on the 52nd floor. Our view out the floor to ceiling windows included the Eiffel tower at Paris. The lights up and down the strip at night are also a great view. Check-in was fast and friendly around 1:00 on a Sunday afternoon. As far as some of the comments on parking are concerned, it was actually a very short walk from the Self-Parking garage to the PHT check-in desk and high speed elevators, especially as compared to a typical strip property. HINT: You can enter the Miracle Mile Shops parking garage from Audrie Lane, which is 1 block off the Strip. Park on the 3rd Level, and then walk over to the Southwest corner to get to the PHTower. You don't have to walk through the Miracle Mile shops, unless you want to. The super large Projection Screen TV was very cool to have, although we didn't watch much TV while we were staying there. I could imagine watching it a lot more during NCAA Football season, or the March Madness basketball t ournament. For a screen that big, the resolution was pretty good. The kitchen had a full size stainless steel GE refrigerator/freezer, microwave, and dishwasher. There was a table for 6 with really nice chairs. I counted 5 TV's including the projection screen TV. If you can find a decent deal on-line, I think you will absolutely love this place. We got our reservation and a good price through BOOKIT.com. We will absolutely try and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: L_tween_mom
Reviews.Content: Mom came with my daughter and a friend of hers. The girlsare 12.. We loved the location and access to the strip. we had a one bed room suite. Nice king size bed and in den was a large counch that pulled out into a sleeper sofa. The girls loved the large projection tv which could be used or just watch the 45 inch flat screen in the den. Tv in master bed room and one in the bathroom. Also comes with a washer. Kitchen complete with full size refrigerator, dishwasher, stove and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the rest stay at the best!”
Reviews.Author: funtime_frankie_11
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying I can not take the credit for booking PH Towers it was another in my party. I was in vegas with a few friends and was instantly blown away by the upto date modern rooms, something I had not expected as I thought we had secured a reasonable price. Not the cheapest on the strip but so much more than I expected. The rooms were really spoltless and even smelt clean which is a great start to your holiday. Great positioning in the middle of the strip and only a short walk through the shopping area while keeping cool to the strip. Some reviews have said that there was a long queue at checkin but we had no such problem just a couple of minutes wait at most. The only problem that I encounted was a blown light bulb which was fixed in a short space of time. I must say that all the staff I spoke to were lovely and kept us entertained throughout our time there. My brother was staying here at PH Towers with us for the first time and he has stayed in alot of other hotels on the strip including some of the big names. He travels from the UK to vegas a number of times a year and has said he will be staying here next time, and I will be back next year too. If your time here is as good as ours you will have a fantastic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room but Hotel itself need improvements.......”
Reviews.Author: Oney27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in feb 2010.. The trip was a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The suite included a huge jacuzzi in the room. ceiling to floor windows in the living room and bedroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and the suite was spotless. The kitchen was huge with tables to sit around . living room had blackout drapes. there were three flatscreen tv's. one which was a nice surprise in the bathroom. We did not get to use the pool because it was cold at the time. This is a nice over all room but does not provide an intimate feeling.. only the jacuzzi. I believe this is a better hotel for a group of friends. This is a great room to splurge on at least once. Now for the Pro's and Cons Pros huge walk in shower and enclosed toilet washer/dry enclosed in bathroom huge jacuzzi in room cooking essentials Clean room big fitness center comfy bed Cons entering and leaving hotel seem to confusing at first. No room service/ restur.. not much tv channels room service someone slow( forgot to cleanroom had to make 3calls) Expensive try to go off season for a better deal!! Not to may cons but it is what you make it!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review of the PH Towers....wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: ladywp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the PH Towers. The suite was very nice! and the view out the windows was awesome. Beds were comfy. Room was clean. Maids were great! Also, so many things like the large screen TV and the fridge with filtered water were just added luxuries! However, so many other things are wrong about this hotel. Check in was a longggg wait, with only 2 employees on. We were there when the Miss America Pageant was being held, and the contestants stayed in the PH Towers. BOOOOO! These young ladies were loud, rude, drunk, annoying and barfing/passing out. Of course the hotel catered to them ($$$$ signs in their eyes). If you enjoy this environment, this is the hotel for you! One evening I arrived at the Tower elevators to go to my room, to be greeted by Police, Paramedics and tons of Hotel Security. That same night around 3 a.m. Security opened the door to our hotel room with a pass key, called out Hello till we were all awake and all answered, and then ordered us to put on all the extra security locks! To say the least we were not impressed. How safe were we? The other issues are no taxi's are ever available. No doormen work the door. They have no staff. Also the pool was honestly, awful!!! Not a speck of shade to be had, and any umbrella's they did have they took away from people and placed in the areas they rented for $$$$$. And there they sat, no one using them. The pool manager was the rudest man EVER! He took an umbrella from two elderly ladies sitting under it and was absolutely arrogant towards them. It's really too bad this hotel isn't better run and staffed. It has a great location, great potential, and so many other good things going for it. Get it together Planet Hollywood Towers!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it! Great rooms even got a free upgrade!!!”
Reviews.Author: amcken3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I couldn't believe on New Years eve we were able to get upgrades on our rooms even though we purchased a very affordable package deal! What customer service! It was a bustling place with nice shops. I wouldn't say it's a family environment (my little nephew was with us) but we still had fun and just went to more family friendly shows at other hotels. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. I prefer cleanliness to decor but our rooms had both. The room service food was not so good but there are so many things to do I shouldn't even been ordering food to my room anyway =) Planet Hollywood Towers was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoRichard
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a glorious trip to the PH Towers in Las Vegas. I read some of the negative comments after I booked the holiday and thought I would review exactly as we found our holiday and comment on it thereafter. We arrived close to midnight and were dropped off by taxi at the main entrance which required us to go up one floor (by escalator or elevator) to the main lobby (some comments had suggested that you have to walk through the mall to get to the hotel, this is simply not true). We were attended to by a very polite and helpful check-in clerk and were on our way to our room in less than 5 minutes, there was a security check and the person on duty was very polite but did ensure that only guests that were staying at the hotel were allowed to the rooms. The room was amazing, the decor is red and black but looks (and is) really high class and is definitely worthy of a 5 star rating, the electric blind was amazing and the views were great (we were on the 37th floor). We have an 18 month old son and every day of our stay we were in the swimming pool (and the spa pool too), the swimming area was very good and I was very happy to see at least 2 lifeguards around the pool at all times. The attendants on duty at the pool were very friendly and after being to the pool a couple of times they even greeted my little boy by name. I found the hotel very clean and had a wonderful atmosphere. The hotel is linked to the mall which allows you to do all day shopping, get food 24hrs a day and if you are going to the strip an air-conditioned walk along the way. We loved the Spice Market Buffet and went there very often during our stay and found that it had a great variety and was good value for money. This morning we checked out to return home and were able to do the check out on the TV, very efficient. Our stay was 5 star and we will definitely return to the PH Towers Las Vegas again. I think it is good to give feedback on positive and negative trip experiences but feel the majority of us only give negative feedback when we feel we have not had great service, I feel some of the negative criticism is unfair and would encourage more people to review this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Beware”
Reviews.Author: dillydally77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the PH Towers in July 2011. The hotel is a time share property and we were targeted by the time share staff the moment we entered the lobby. Time share people have a way of smooth talking and purposely not stating their motives up front. Think used car salesmen. Do not trust the time share people and try to politely avoid engaging in conversation with them unless of course you are genuinely interested. We stayed in a studio suite and the rooms were modern and spacious. There was a comfy king sized bed, LCD TV, living room area with a sofa and coffee table, bathroom with double sinks, tub/shower combo (the tub was jetted but it was small and the cleanliness of it was questionable) and a toilet with a sliding door to seperate it from the rest of the bathroom. Conveniently the PH Towers were connected to the Miracle Mile Shops through the lobby and you could walk to the Planet Hollywood Resort which is also connected to the mall (5min walk). The Planet Hollywood Resort is where the actual casino, restaurants and buffet were. The hotel is also centrally located on the strip across from Aria and Cosmopolitan and beside Paris and MGM. Eventhough we didn't want room service and had the 'No room service' light turned someone had clearly entered the room while we were out and cleaned our room. This happened every night. So remember to put your valuables in the safe even if you aren't expecting room service because they most likely will come in. In hindsight we probably should have complained about this because it was rather annoying. Another thing that should be mentioned is that we noticed that the general age range of the hotel guests was twenty-something. So if you're out of your twenties, which we were, you may feel a little out of place. All in all the hotel did have nice, large, modern rooms and the hotel itself is situated in a good central location on the strip and reasonably priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend staying here.”
Reviews.Author: jovanar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my friends birthday last weekend. This hotel is connected to Planet Hollywood Hotel and Casino where there is a 5-10min walk to get to Towers. When I got in to my room, there was no ice bucket, drinking glasses, nor bedding for murphy bed. I called front desk to send someone with missing stuff, and the person showed up 2 hours later bringing bag of ice... I had to repeat him again what room was missing and show him that cabinets were empty. Other than previously mentioned things, everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: qwertymcfurty
Reviews.Content: Best view in Las Vegas Room huge quick check in (at least for timeshare owners) washer/dryer unit did not work had to call maintenance fixed in 30 minutes large jacuzzi in bedroom nice but did not work (did not attempt to use until last night of one week stay so to late to request fixing pool nice but gets very crowded with 21 somethings on Friday and Saturday No smoking in pool area not enforced (unfortunately) Was told since they serve alcohol trhey would have a difficult time not allowing smoking Maid service good (timeshare only one day week) if it would lower maintenance costs can do without staff gave us us almost free tickets to Vegas shows (one just a short walk from our room) Direct access to Miracle Mile shops right on Vegas strip Room very clean but when we arrived no bed sheets for pull out bed security very good Last year stayed on 30 something floor this year on 15th. Higher floor preferred. Do not be fooled into meeting to discuss problems unless you like going to timeshare presentations without compensation (happened in 2010). In 2011 told that unless we expressed interest in upgrade this should never happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was PIMP!!”
Reviews.Author: jewelsnoel1977
Reviews.Content: The suites are something you'd think of only being in a movie! It even had a washer and dryer in it!! Flat panel TV in the living room and the bedroom. Automatic blinds. I mean, you name it, this room had it! I highly recommend this hotel if you're going to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: bossyEastTexas
Reviews.Content: So far this has been my favorite place to stay in Vegas! We stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse suite and it was wonderful. It was so quiet, no loud noise from your drunken neighbors. The room had remote controlled black out shades on the floor to ceiling windows, which we loved! We had great views, even from the tub in the master bath! The beds were fluffy and comfortable. We had a full kitchen and 2 baths. The shopping mall is at the entrance of the lobby and the pool was awesome. I can't say enough good things about this place. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, but a bit too much partying in the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Roar2
Reviews.Content: We liked it, but a bit too much partying in the weekends with a lot of noise in the night. The service where ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfy beds, friendly housekeeping staff, everything right downstairs!”
Reviews.Author: letstalktravel
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in a 2 bedroom suite. It was spacious and accommodating for 8 of us. The beds are SOOOO COMFORTABLE! I wanted to fly it home with me! The room was clean and the only glitches was we were missing one remote from the connecting room, the bathroom doors didn't lock and a few lights needed new bulbs. I loved the option of walking the shops and having everything at my fingertips. I come to Vegas to be delighted by the many options! This place had it ALL. Buffet was pricey at $24.99 (go find a $5 off coupon online) but it was good food. On the weekends the music's UP in the casino, the pretty people are out and about and the fun never stops! Well done Planet HollyWood/Westgate Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelfivestar
Reviews.Content: Beware is all I can say. Good luck getting even a room confirmation by email. I called 3 times and they never could confirm my room and they had my credit card charged for the weekend. Worst service EVER! Beware. I am a five star member with other hotels and I have never had aproblem till I contacted this group.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST HOTEL in VEGAS! I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: SynchedLogic
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the first time and decided to stay at the PH Towers because it was close to the strip and had a jacuzzi tub! That was a huge perk for us. The rooms were exactly like the pictures on the internet! We stayed in the 1 bed room suite and it had all of the amenities that a tourist could want: Washer/Dryer, Incredible Shower, a Kitchen w/ a fridge that will crush your ice (great for drinks), a microwave to warm up those tasty left overs, glasses, eating utensils, and even a dishwasher! The maid service came regularly and was so polite. She even gave us extra supplies for our bathroom. The bed was comfortable and right beside the jacuzzi tub! The living room was spectacular with modern decor and furniture....and a projector that plays your TV or movies on a big screen! After several nights of partying we stayed in one evening and watched SuckerPunch and felt like we were in a theater. You can dock you your iPhone on the station and within seconds your room turns into a club with the surround sound system. There are NO resort fees. lol The gym was nice and I was able to exercise everyday to keep the calories at bay. The gym bathroom even had showers and lockers! Planet Hollywood Towers is connected to the Miracle Mile Shops which included every kind of restaurant that you can imagine. I don't know why everyone was complaining about the walk. It wasn't that bad. It's short! And this isn't your typical kind of mall folks. This mall was EPIC. lol The best part of the PH Towers is that they have security screening the guests before they got into the elevators. LUV this. I felt safe. The pool was AMAZING. Hot crowd, hot people, a bar in the center of the hotel...a LIVE DJ...and helpful security. People were having such a great time. The staff was always cleaning and keeping things so nice. We had so much fun and would like to return soon....like, in a few weeks! We would like to stay at the Westgate because of the security, the cleanliness, the politeness of the staff and concierge, and the hip and cool crowd that this hotel attracts. I can't wait to book my next room! The only downside is that they have no promotions or discounts like some of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - REALLY IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: Monica10
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous at staying at this hotel after reading some of the poor reviews. I travlled to PH Towers from Scotland and 1 week trip. We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 32 floor. I WAS SO IMPRESSED FROM START TO FINISH. We have travelled the world and stayed and many fab hotesl but the suite is definatley one of the best by far. Whilst I appreciate that everyone is entitled to an opinion I must say that the staff were always very helpful / polite and happy. The previous review in my opinion were not accurate. I believe that some people arejust never happy. Our room was cleaned every day. The pool side food was not the best but you have a great choice of restauarants within a few mons walk from PH Towers. I also dont believe the walk from PH Towers to strip was anymore than 5 mins. To be honest it probably takes the same amount of time to walk from a room in the MGM to get to the strip. One final advice - PLease go and see Cirque de soleil KA at MGM - Its was phenominal. Welldone PH Towers for making my stay FAB.

Reviews.Title: “very impressive”
Reviews.Author: sotman
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four nights with my wife and twenty year old daughter in a suit on the 26th floor,The room had two bedrooms,two bathrooms,fully equipt kitchen and laundry,all the latest in furniture and electronics.It was well priced for a new vegas hotel and on the strip although it takes about 10 minutes to walk from your room to the strip as you have to go through the miricle mile shopping mall. word of warning this has nothing to do with the hotel but do not use the COACH GRAY LINE as a transfer from the airport as this nukelhead company drops you off in a carpark no where near the lobby,needless to say we got lost.......

Reviews.Title: “Not our best stay at PH Towers”
Reviews.Author: freebirdVT
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to PH Towers. The hallways were littered with bags of trash that timeshare owners left in the hallway. It seems to take more then a day for them to be picked up. Our next door neighbor held a very loud party late in to the night. To be expected in Vegas, but the smell of cigarette smoke seemed to waft through the ventilation system. Every time the fan went on, we were blown out with cigarette smoke. New security makes it necessary to show your room key each time you go up to the room. The staff seems to want to please, but falls short when it comes to keeping the hotel clean. The rooms are nice, convenient and we had a great view of the strip. Beds were comfortable. Rain shower is not my favorite, but some may appreciate it. Overall not a bad place to stay, but Planet Hollywood Hotel would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!amazing rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: riks79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ph towers in April for 5 nights and were blown away at how modern ,hip, clean and fun they are.....we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and wow what can i say,it had window blinds that turned into huge tv screens a hot tub in one of the bedrooms and 2 huge bathroom,it had a washing machine,dishwasher a huge american style fridge with ice machine and pretty much everyelse you would want a suite to have!!! The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels... couldnt fault this hotel,will be staying again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but it won't knock your socks off.”
Reviews.Author: cdntraveller70
Reviews.Content: Planet Hollywood has one of the better locations on the strip but I found the hotel room to be average compared to it's counterparts. Add to the fact that it's one of the newer hotels on the strip I was underwhelmed. But if the price is right, there is nothing that will blow your socks off. No "wow" factor.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome”
Reviews.Author: EvaLady
Reviews.Content: Towers is connected to miracle mile but not the casino. The room itself was very spacious. Hot tub in the master was perfect and the projector in the living was amazing. Personal host for the entire length of your stay. Rooms were mostly modern desgined but very very comfortable. Pot and pans were fairly small needs upgrading. No extra spices like worldmark. There was enough space to fit 6 people comfortably. Bathrooms in the master were just as big as the bedroom. Panoramic view in every room. Pools were closed twice during the week. Definately will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robie60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14nights and dont know why there is so many negative reviews. We are a Senior couple and thoroughly enjoyed it, even the music at the pool..We were on the 55th floor overlooking the airport,MGM,Mandalay Bay,Excaliber etc. We had binoculars with us which was great as we watched the flights coming in and taking off. The view was amazing! We were in a studio which was great for us as it had the kitchen area. A fridge is a must have in that heat. We had a car for 2weeks so the day we arrived we went to Walmart and stocked up on water,beer and wine along with other bits and bobs. We ordered a pizza carry out one night from a leaflet which was put through our door. Be prepared to wait but it was worth the wait. We had our breakfast in the room most mornings which saved money, but I must recommend the Spice Market Buffet in Planet Hollywood. We went there twice and was not disappointed..We went down to the pool area the 2nd day and there were towels on all the beds and as it was quite early thought they cant be all full already as this was a Thursday, but my husband went to check and they put the towels on the beds for the people to use which is a good touch, but a lot of people thought the beds were taken. We also took water to the pool and they have drink fountains where you can fill your bottles up. It does get busy on a Friday and Saturday but it did not bother us. As we had the car,we went away for 3days to Mount Whitney which was a good chill out time and the scenery was amazing. I work for one of the big Travel Agents back in Scotland and would definately recommend this hotel. This is our 4th visit to Vegas and hopefully, if we win the lottery, will be back for another 14nights. PS Forgot to mention, our room was kept spotless and did not have any complaints about housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, edgy and very loud”
Reviews.Author: njhoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. Loud rap and rock music plays constantly. The decor is minimalistic with glaring red, black and white colors.Seating is leather and very low to the floor. Room interior decor follows same theme. Room is spacious. Bed is comfortable. No free wi fi. Swimming pool area blares loud rap and rock. Free shaded and curtained cabanas in swimming pool area a plus.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: greyhound1Scotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 22nd of June for 14 nights. Check in was quiet and we paid the extra $10 per night for a high floor. We receive room 5432 (54th floor) The room was a mini suite, and had fridge, dishwasher, oven and coffee maker. We had housekeeping every day, and apart from one night the place was quiet. The safe in the room was the largest safe we have ever had in our many stays in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Times at PH towers”
Reviews.Author: 08lancer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first week of july, it was just me and my girlfriend, so we were looking to party, have a good time and not to complain about the service. To start with, we checked in pretty late since our flight was 5 hours late so it was close to 10pm we waited for like 15 min, and got excellent service, I tried getting an upgrade to a 1 room suite but they were all booked, however i got offered a room on the 54th floor for 10bucks extra a night and it was worthy, the view was amazing. I have no one complaint about the room, or the service, bed was confy and the room was pretty big (we had friends staying at Monte carlo, flamingo and Mandalay bay and our room was by far the best), we decided not to get room service the first two days and we just kept getting calls from the staff to see if we needed it, got it the third day and it was great. Its awesome how its connected to the mall, we found breakfast for 6 bucks a plate, cheap booze at the ABC stores, great sandwiches at Earls of Sandwich, and theres is this sports bar there called Blondies where we paid 20 bucks for all the beer we could drink and played beer pong (best deal of the trip, I think they do that every thursday) The walk to the strip is not bad, I didnt mind it, not even when I was drunk. We went to the pool once for like 30 min and it was pumping, great music lots of young people partying it up. If I had to say something bad about the hotel, it would be that I did walk by the lobby at 3pm and the check in line looked big, not sure if people had to wait long, it just looked busy. Also I read reviews where people complain about the walls, we didnt have problem sleeping any of the nights, but the lady staying beside us kept knocking on our door i guessing telling us to keep it down, but it was 10pm, not 2 so we didnt really care. We also got room service one night, and it was a bit pricey, and took long since it was coming from the PH hotel, but it was pretty tasty, awesome food. Overall a great experience, great rooms, awesome location, good service, we had an amazing time and I will for sure come back with friends and get the two bedroom suite next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hikerap
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at this hotel was not grand, thanks to the airport driver and where he dropped us off! Please ask to be dropped off at the entrance to Westgate Towers or you'll end up in the Mall entrance! Check-in was quick and painless, we arrived as everyone else was checking out, good timing! The hotel is very beautiful, young and very modern! Our room was VERY new and VERY clean! We did not have a strip view, but something close to it. Was impressed with how updated it was and my husband LOVED the big screen projector. We had a full kitchen and lots of room to spread out. The hotel pool was great, especially as the day got hotter, a little shallow for my tastes, but perfect for cooling off. I would highly recommend Westgate Towers to anyone wanting to stay in Vegas for more than the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views right off the strip”
Reviews.Author: moose0884
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PH Towers from 7/7/11-7/10/11 and it made for the best vegas trip thus far. Scott at the checkin was not only extremely helpful but also very enthusiastic about the property. We had an issue with our shower pressure at one point but it was resolved within 20 minutes of calling about it. We stayed in one of the corner penthouses facing the strip and it was much more than I imagined. It was big enough for very large groups and the full sized fridge also helped with that. The view from the master is remarkable and pictures dont do it justice. All in all PH Towers are a great deal since theyre technically off the strip but in reality just a short stroll through the shops got you to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fendi_boy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas before this one, and it's not the best, but it certainly isn't the worst. I don't understand where all the 1 Star reviews are coming from... Our one bedroom suite was massive, trendy, clean and came with some great ameneties such as Full kitchen, Jaccuzi, Cinema style projector etc. The bed was super comfortable but There were some signs of wear and tear which I was suprised about, considering how new the hotel is. We got a taxi when we arrived and when we left and we had no problems with the bell desk helping us with luggage. We managed to check in at 12pm despite a 3pm check-in time which was great. There was no line at this time, and every member of staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. I thought the location was great. Yes you have to go through Miracle Mile shops to get to the strip, but this was 5-10 mins walk maximum, It takes longer than that to walk through properties like MGM Grand. There is also a short cut which takes about a minute and takes you to Harmon, which is then just a short walk to the strip, so not a bad location at all. We spent some time at the pool which was fun with a live DJ, great party atmosphere with mainly a 20's crowd I guess. We managed to get loungers on Thursday and Friday, although it would probably be difficult on a saturday... especially when half the pool area is taken up by daybeds which were crazy expensive and mostly empty. I would stay here again if visiting with friends and there to party, but for a more relaxing or luxurious stay, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ajmagee21
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if I should write this because I dont want to many peole to find out how awesome it is here. From the early check in to the fun times at the pool we had the best time ever. We had a 2 bedrrom suite which was huge. The rooms were quiet and clean and big enough for 8 people to stay. We loved the Miracle mile mall for shopping, ABC for booze, the endless dining options as well as drink specials were aplenty. We arrived at 10 am and checked in with no problem, got to our amazing room and couldnt believe the size of it. We went down to the ABC store and bought 2 for 1 absolut vodka and mixer and started our Vegas weekend. We went down to the pool and found lounge chairs no problem and soaked up the sun for 4 hours. We then went back to our room and enjoyed the huge drop down tv screen while the women changed. we hardly ventured out of the mall area and the pool as everything you need is there. We are going back this August for another weekend and hope to find a deal for this same room so we can stay here again. Thanks for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Even calling this a 3 star hotel is stretching it! Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Bob-from-Port_Huenem
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this run-down hotel. From the outside, especially at night, it looks fantastic, but that is deceiving. First strike was driving up and finding valet parking only for "owners". Was forced/corralled to drive around and get lost for 30 min trying to find a spot to park. Turns out you have to haul your luggage through Magnificent Miles shops to even reach the front desk. There, almost an hour shot. The lobby looks like it started off as a nice concept then the money ran out - seating areas were unclean and one even had a group of what looked to be homeless men sitting around drinking cheap whiskey and gin. Arrive at the room hot and sweaty from hauling the luggage through the mall and expecting to be Wow’ed, but never happened. The Embassy Su*tes we stayed at the night before was cleaner and more upscale than this room. The bed skirt was all grey and crooked and the only piece of furniture besides the bed and sofa was a dinged up tiny desk. There were not even any drawrrs to organize gear. And the closet had an iron but no ironing board. If you want ice, prepare for a hike – ice machines on only the 5th and 50th floors, and both broken, so you’ll need to venture out to the Miracle Mile shops and buy some at the ABC store. The description said separate bath and shower. Nope. The shower/tub combo even had chunks of trim missing. Heaven forbid you should turn on the jets – you’ll just end up filling the bath water with goop that has been building up in the plumbing that is obviously not maintained. In my room, you couldn’t even turn of the jets. The switch was broken. We had to have a repairman come up to our room at 11:30PM to turn the darn thing off. Needless to say this ruined the romantic mood. Strike 2! And when I explained to a manager, she made it sound like they were doing us a favor by sending someone to fix it. (BTW, can you imagine the roar of water jets in a small hotel room all through the night? That was what we almost had to endure.) The next night we came back at 2:00AM after a fantastic show and expensive dinner to find that housekeeping didn’t bother coming to make the bed and change out towels. So after hearing the phone ring at least 30 times, I tried calling on my cell phone as if I was calling to make a reservation. An operator picked up on the second ring while I still had the hotel phone ringing in my other ear. Amazing! I guess they figure once you are there and paid your money, they can mess with you and send you on your way without ever having to talk to you. So going through the reservation line was the only way to get someone to hear. Housekeeping came up with more towels and again, romantic mood ruined. Strike 3! Again, I am so disappointed. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy! Incidentally, I stayed at the PH main hotel back in December and it was great. Must be different people running this Tower hotel. Oh yea, there was one good thing: you don’t have to walk through a casino to get to the elevators. Also, if you like blaring music from the pool coming into your room on the 25th floor, you might like this hotel. But if you try going down to the pool, you are on your own. No attendants (plenty of cocktail waitresses) so all the chairs have towels and you can’t tell which ones are free to use. Stay Away from this place! I wish I could get my money back on this one to make up for the 2 hours I spent on the phone trying to get through to unresponsive hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Missycat18
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I went a "girls only" trip to Las Vegas. One of us had been there before, but it was the first time for the other two. We stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers because it was one of the choices of our air/hotel package. I was a little leery because it is a time share sort of property. However, the place was excellent. Our room had plenty of space for the three of us, including a kitchen with microwave, fridge and dishwasher. Housekeeping was excellent and even did the dishes for us. We asked for more regular coffee and no decaf, and our wish was granted immediately. Service was good everywhere. Downsides? The drink prices, especially by the pool, were over the top ($14 for a house gin and tonic). The toilet had a bit of trouble flushing, but we figured out how to overcome that after the first day. Would I stay there again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Unprofessional and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bucklong
Reviews.Content: Complete and total disappointment. You can put lipstick on a pig ... but if you do ... it's still a pig. This property seems impressive at first. ... you walk into your room and the shade goes up automatically and the view is spectacular. After that the magic is over. The customer service is not only horrible ... it is TRULY NON_EXISTENT. I was there for 7 days on a Westgate exchange and I could not get a SINGLE servie ... no towels, no maid service at all ... and I realize when you are on a timeshare week you generally get one days maid service for the week but I didn't get that ... I had to beg a maid in the hallway to take my garbage away because I didn't know what to do with it ... they have built a 56 story hotel with only two ice machines on teh 50th and 5th floor and for 4 of the 8 days I was there NIETHER worked so I had a great time riding the elevators up and down and all around looking for ice the didn't exist. My room had a filthy dirty microrwave, lack of linens on the bed, dirty bathroom, very dirty bathtub with long black hairs all over the tub, dirty dishes in the dishwasher, never ever got maid service in over a week as an Owner, partially "sucked" hard candies found lodged between the sofa and the night stand, lack of vaccuuming in the room .. basically ... if it weren't for the fact that there were clean towels and a made bed ... I woul dhave thought that the room had not been made up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: Vegas was our second stop on our honeymoon which included San Fran and Hawaii. I'd asked our agent to book us into Planet Hollywood so was very chuffed to find on arrival we were booked into PH Towers. We had a studio suite on the 39th floor with views out to MGM and south of the strip. I honestly can't believe the negativity about this hotel. The room and cleaniness was 5*, the maid service and electronic system was fantastic. I loved us having so many towels with showering in the morning and before we got dressed up to go out in the evening. The pool was very well suited to us, comfy sunbeds, always some available and music to our tastes. It is a really young crowd hotel and I know that's why it suited us so well so I can see how others may have concerns but it was perfect for us. I wondered if the walk to PH and the strip would bother me and would I have rathered being in the main PH and the answer is no. PH Towers was a retreat after leaving the strip or PH casino to be honest. The comfiest beds we've ever slept on and although we've been to Vegas before and quite like trying different hotels I have to say we would return here in a heartbeat. Earl of Sandwich and PF Changs were regular dine outs for us at PH and the ABC store in the Miracle Mile was perfect for alcohol and other stuff to stock the fridge with and not have to walk far back to the room. If there was two tiny negatives it would be that the maid put on the dishwasher in the room for 2 glasses! Just ridiculous - could've just taken them away and given us new ones without the need for that. Also the jacuzzi bath was awesome but took longer filling it than we spent in it!! Overall a fab 5 nights, try and keep us away!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Terrible Customer Service - Will NOT return”
Reviews.Author: BRush00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I frequent Las Vegas once a year, and truly enjoy the place. However PH Towers by Westgate will not be receiving a single dime of ours in the future. The room we were assigned was 1013, a studio suite. The room itself was average, however damages abound. Chips in the cabinets, sink faucet falling out of the counter, shower head falling off the wall. This immediately put a sour taste in my mouth. While waiting in the front desk line for 20 minutes, somebody would randomly appear in the "VIP Guest" line, and walk right up to the counter. It would be much more considerate of other guests to have dedicated "VIP/Shareholder" customer service people, as well as typical guests. Sour taste in mouth continues. The Pool area is sub-par, and simply far too small for such a large building. Sour taste intensifying. This hotel is Non-Smoking. GREAT! wait, why is there smoke coming in under my door? We called the front desk Multiple times (5 times in 4 days actually) to complain about our neighbors smoking and parties. The customer "service" people I talked to were either rude, dismissive, or flat out insulting. At one point, I spent 40 minutes on hold to get in touch with a manager. I finally hung up because I have better things to do than sit on hold during my vacation. When asked if we could change rooms, the hotel staff stated that the hotel is 100% full, and there were no rooms to change to. OK, I'll buy that (simply because I cannot prove otherwise), however the hotel staff made absolutely zero effort to remedy the problem. Apparently the neighbors would be charged $200 for smoking in their room. Great! For PH Towers anyways. What about the other guests who obey the rules, and are inconvenienced? PH Towers staff would not even apologize for this attitude. So to reiterate, My wife and I will Not be returning to this hotel. Ever. Upon some further investigation, the same owners also own multiple other hotels on the strip, which we will certainly think twice about visiting also.

Reviews.Title: “A chop shop environment where service is non-existent!”
Reviews.Author: summer2me
Reviews.Content: No surprise that this Westgate property though it jas the Planet Hollywood name is no different than the rest of their time share properties where everything is based on tje # of people they can shuttle in and out of their porperty! Service is non-existent! The check in line extends for 1/4 mile and the time it takes to check in is similiar to applying for a mortgage loan. My room was cleaned only 2 of the 4 days that I was there. I had to call each day to request service and since no one answers the concierege, front desk, or housekeeping I literally had to call their main number from my mobile phone. Last but not least, I was given a late checkout until 6pm for an additional $30 and every 2 hours someone came knocking at my door to ask if I was planning on checking out! The room was lovely but the worst hotel service I have ever experienced and I travel at least 3 times per month!
