Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...well, Not so much. Would not return here.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers (Westgate) week of June 20, 2011 with husband and adult daughter (celebrating her college graduation.) Check in at the Towers was quick...no wait at all (by contrast, we accidentally got dropped off at Planet Holywood hotel. Line there had hundreds of people in it!) We had a free upgrade to one-bedroom suite, which was a very nice deal. One bedroom suite has large living room with L-shaped sectional couch (folds out to queen size bed) Two side chairs, coffee table, large flat-screen TV on wall. Full-wall floor-to-ceiling window with electric black-out shade. The shade doubles as screen for projector in case you want to watch movies. Kitchen has full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, stove-top, oven and dishes/glassware etc for 4. Personal size (one cup at a time) coffee maker with supplies; dish detergent, dishwasher detergent included. Fridge has filtered water/ice maker dispenser. Bedroom has a king-size bed, large chaise lounge, desk/extra large dresser combination, flat-screen TV, very deep whirlpool tub. Bathroom includes a washer-dryer machine (one-load box of laundry detergent included.) Bathroom amenities are nice products (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, bars of hand & bath soap, shower cap.) Place is ultra-modern, glitzy decor (lots of mirrors & polished surfaces, black/white/red color scheme, Hollywood icon pictures. We had a Warhol-like Marilyn Monroe print on the wall in our living room) Furniture in Living room & kitchen is comfortable and functional. These are meant to be time-share suites, so it's a full kitchen & living arrangement. Gorgeous view from our window (to the left was the main Planet Hollywood hotel, and just beside that we could see most of the Eiffel Tower (gorgeous to see at night, lit up) and off to the far right ...we could see planes landing at airport and also see the mountains beyond. We were far enough away there is no airplane noise, though. We had a great price on the suite (abount $130 night, booked through BookIt.com) Public Areas are very well maintained...security is good (you have to show a room key or time share owner ID to even get to the elevator hallway at the Towers) Employees are all friendly and helpful. Maid service was timely, and very helpful...asking if we needed any extra supplies. Now for the downside...noise levels not good here. You can here people walking by & talking in the hallways when you're on the far side of the suite. You can here every bit of partying in the suite next door (was a batchelor party of some-such going on one night...got to listen to the chugging music way too long. Was really thankful I'd brought my white-noise machine!) Two of the nights we were there, a family was staying in the suite above because we could here the kids both nights playing in the living room. I think we were very lucky that the Towers were not near full...most of the time we were there I don't think anyone was in the rooms on either side of us other than the one bachelor-party night. But if this place was full, the noise from other rooms could have been a constant irritant. And really not much privacy insde this suite either...none of the doors quite cover the openings...bedroom door is this massive, highly polished, 7 ft tall, 3 ft wide glamor deal...looked like a wood safe or something...very "Hollywood" looking...must have cost a pretty penny. But it had big enough gaps around the top of the door that you could see the ceiling of the next room. Same with bathroom exterior doors -- solid wood panel doors, but gaps tops & bottom. The Bathroom is decorated in black & white (toilet is black...ug. Did not care for that at all. No way to see if the thing is clean!) The bathroom is huge, with a walk-in double shower, and a separate toilet compartment. But the doors on these two areas are glass, and do not actually cover. Fan in bathroom (if there is one) is totally silent and the entire bathroom is tile so all "personal" noises are shared throughout the suite, sorry for TMI, but I think it's silly these hotels build these beautiful looking bathrooms that fail on function! Speaking of which...there's a television built into the bathroom. But you can't use the outlets in the bathroom without blowing the circuit breakers (low wattage curling iron that works fine everywhere else we've ever gone...tripped the circuit breakers in this bathroom.) There is a blow dryer in the suite which can be run on the bathroom circuit, but it was very difficult to use...cord is about 18 inches long so you have to tilt head at odd angle to use the blow dryer because cord is so short. And worst of all...the nasty sewer smell coming from the sinks in the suite. We called about it (started out as a small smell that grew worse day to day) They sent a maintenance guy. He seemed to know right away what we were talking about and said he had chemicals to put down the drains that would take care of the issue immediately. So he left to get the stuff...dumped it down & it seemed to work. He also noticed a burnt-out lightbulb & changed that while he was there. By the next day, I thought the smell was coming back, but others did not. Turns out, it was. Was bad enough the others could smell it the next day. We called again about it, but actually got checked out before anyone showed up. Don't know what the issue is with those drain pipes, but dumping some liquid drain deodorizer down them is not fixing it. The pool is nice here, well-maintained with plenty of lounge chairs, full bar and some food service at the pool bar...BUT the pool is only open from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. In other words, during the hottest part of the day when the sun is beating down. Was 90 F at 9:00 AM...and 110 F. at 3:00 PM. Hubby and adult daughter would both have loved to go swimming in the evening -- once the sun was no longer directly overhead, and the worst heat was past (though it was still in the 90s at 7:00 PM) But everthing at the pool was stacked up/locked up tight in the evenings. Obviously they want people in the casinos & restaurants in the evening, not enjoying the pool. Location of the hotel is good...Planet Hollywood Resort/Casino is directly on the Strip, next to Paris Las VEgas & across the street from the Bellagio...the Towers are connected to the main Planet Hollywood building by walking through the Miracle Mile Shops. Lots of restaurants in the Miracle Mile Shops, and in the Planet Hollywood hotel, as well as several theaters with typical Las Vegas show offerings. Bottom line is...we wanted so much to like this hotel. There's so much going for it...but in the end, the short hours on the pool, the horrible smell in the drains, the noise

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience at PH Towers!”
Reviews.Author: newlywed06212011
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful few days in Vegas, staying at the PH Towers. From the moment we checked in, we were greeted by friendly, caring staff and that continued throughout our entire stay. The front desk staff, concierge, pool staff, and any other staff member we ran into made sure to ask how our stay was going, and if there is anything they can do to make it better. Our 2-bedroom suite on the 55th floor was amazing! The pool area is beautiful with fantastic drink and food service, was buzzing with great energy and music, and proved to be a godsend with the hot, hot weather! We definitely recommend PH Towers, and will be certainly staying with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start but end up great!”
Reviews.Author: Reen_11
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Las Vegas with 4 of my girlfriends for 4 nights and stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers. When we first arrived, we were all bumped out because Allegiant's flight from Bellingham was delayed for 3 hours. ( More like cancel and we had to wait for the next plane) When we first checked in, the girl at the front desk gave me attitude when I asked if we could get an upgrade. Her response was "we are all booked out this weekend so no, no upgrade allow" even though we offered to pay. We ended up having a room on the 6th floor. The view was okay. The Studio room suite was new & not bad until we find out nothing works in our room. Our radio did not work, our closet door did not close, our bathroom door's lock was broken, so you can easily lock yourself in, and our shower could not be adjusted so 2 of my tall gf had a hard time showering. We had called twice to get a new radio, but apparently they didn't have any extra. The next morning, my girlfriend was put on hold for about 15 minutes, and 3 phone calls later we finally got upgraded to the 52 floor. The suite was way better! I also like how the towers are away from the casino. The hotel looks super nice and new, a mall is right downstairs, super convenient for anything you're looking for. I would definitely recommend to try out the sandwich place, also Cabo Wabo mexican food weren't bad either. Room service was good, pricy but good (we had breakfast and a burger for dinner) The location was great, it is in the middle of the strip, easy to travel anywhere! The pool was nice and kids were allowed in there as well, but it wasn't that big. However, there's always a taxi line up at the tower's because no one is ever working downstairs or buzzing to the taxis to let them know there's a line up. (we waited for so long when we checked out, the line up was crazy!) I stayed at the Mirage last year, but I prefer the PH towers! I feel like you can do anything inside the mall without going outside if you didn't feel like travelling to the other hotels! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: TarunM
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in las vegas by far for the price and location. We booked 2 one bedroom suites OMG the rooms have projector screens, ample room to sit around and the beds are super comfortable, The bathroom is a very good size and there is also a jacuzzi in the room. Its less than 5 min walk throught the planet hollywood mall and planet hollywood is right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaH45
Reviews.Content: If I were 20 years younger I would give it 5 stars. I have to deduct 1 star due to the loud music and young men sleeping on the sofas in the lobby. I considered booking elsewhere after reading reports of the service here. I am so happy we stayed. Checked in on the Sunday of Memorial Day weekend at 5PM, plenty of hosts at the desk. Our experience was fast and easy. There was a mix up with our reservations, the clerk checked the back office for a few minutes and everything was cleared up. I did not hear any customers complaining at check in and there were several of us there. The room was just as pictured on web site, and it is very large. The room itself is 5 stars. We were on the 16 floor, looked over the pool, toward the MGM and the airport with City Center to the right.. We were constantly looking out the window. We kept the due not disturb light on the whole week. Housekeeping left voice mails (they do that without ringing the phone) to check that we needed anything or to schedule a cleaning. We let them in on Wednesday to change beds and replace towels and a mild cleaning while we were there. They checked on us daily but we were happy just spreading out all over the room and did not want to neaten up for the maids. Concierge was very helpful with scooter and car rental. Pool was very nice, you could sit in the part that had about 6 inches of water, hang your legs in the pool and read. I spent ours there with my nook. Liked it better after the first day, I brought earplugs. This is where I realized this pool is for the young crowd. Loud music, and not my choice of music. But these young people were all considerate and well behaved. No loud mouths, and quite interesting to listen to. Location gets 5 stars. We walked to almost all the other hotels, a few a day. We enjoyed the walk through the mall in the morning (except for the loud music) but it did seem longer at night when we returned. There are a lot of hawkers at this mall trying to grab you at the kiosks and some stores. There some very interesting stores and art galleries. I think we were in ABC everyday for water, qtips, blister bandaids etc. Ate at PF Changs, Earl of Sandwich, both very good. Breakfast every morning was next door at Mon Ami Gabi, on the patio. We just loved it there in the morning. I am very happy we stayed at PH Towers this trip, it was perfect location and huge room for 6 days. I would definitely recommend with 5 stars to anyone under 40. Over that, I would tell about my great experience and suggest earplugs at the pool. We never heard a sound in our room during the night. The music is at the pool and lobby and mall. You could hear the pool music in the room Friday afternoon as it started to get busy and the party atmosphere was getting started, but we knew it closed soon and wold not go on all night. I still don't understand why there was always young men sleeping on the sofas in the lobby late at night.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: JoJobah
Reviews.Content: PH Towers was amazing. Very clean room and very polite staff. We checked in at 530pm on a Sunday and there was no line. We were upgraded to a room on the 54th floor that gave us a view of the Bellagio water show and the eiffel tower at the Paris hotel. One of the great things about this room is that it has a mini kitchenette that comes with a dishwasher, a tiny sink, fridge and a microwave/convection oven combo. It was great! we picked up a few groceries and a made a couple of meals ourselves which saved money AND calories! The walk from the hotel to the strip is NOT 10 mins as some reviews claim. We are both in our thirties and walked a normal pace. maybe took us 4-5 mins at the most. It was great because when my husband wanted to sleep in, i would go down the to the Starbucks and walk around the mall. It was very convenient being right in the mall. Drinks at the pool are expensive!!! $29 for two drinks (margarita and a pina colada), you can get them charged to the room. Checkout was fantastic! So easy. You can check out on the TV. Wifi is not free but it is at the Starbucks downstairs in the Casino. The fitness room is bright and clean, The only downfall of the gym is that there was no sanitizer for the equipment. Overall our experience was great! We would definitely go back and stay at the towers. OH yeah, one more thing... THE BEST BED EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location but that is all”
Reviews.Author: Aussie3000
Reviews.Content: Warning: Timeshare. If you are not a timeshare owner, you are treated as low priority. Long check in queues. Poor room service, at least an hour wait no matter when you call or what you order. Room service finishes at 10pm. Complimentary valet is always full unless you are a timeshare owner. We could see the valet parking area and it was never more than a quarter full. Our one bedroom suite was fantastic with one major exception. The full kitchen has no cooking utensils. No pot or pans, nothing. When we called to ask about this, we were told that they do not want us to use the kitchen. The offered to rent us cooking gear. We chose to purchase some basics from Walmart for significantly less than their rental cost. Their website does state that the cookware was not included, but hey, why have a full kitchen. Lounge suite is very comfortable. Projector worked very well and would be fantastic to watch a sporting event with a group of friends. This hotel attracts the younger guests. This is not a problem if you are one of the younger crowd, indeed you may enjoy being surrounded by drunk younger adults, however if you are more mature you may feel uncomfortable at times, particularly on a Friday or Saturday evening. If you are looking for a quality room at a good price and excellent location, then this will be a good place to stay. Just don't expect quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keryn-TRIP
Reviews.Content: stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment great facilities plenty of space would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Be advised this is a Timeshare property!!!”
Reviews.Author: ingra
Reviews.Content: If you are an owner, its a great hotel. If you were just "renting" as they called it, it is crap. The service is poor, the amenities are over rated. You are constantly asked to attend their tour to become an owner. As normal couples like we were, you will be no higher than the 5th floor, and facing the garage. Wish we would have known.

Reviews.Title: “my new FAVORITE hotel”
Reviews.Author: jshook01
Reviews.Content: Best place ever. Dont listen to all the BS complaining. Some people will always complain about something. Check-in: We arrived at 3:30pm on Thursday. I was expecting a huge line. To my surprise the check-in line was only 2 couples deep. We were being helped in less than 5min. A young lady(I will conceal her name for her protection) helped us and I decided to try the $20 sandwich trick. Gave her my id/$20/credit card sandwich and didnt say anything about it. She upgraded us from a King Studio to a high floor King One Bedroom w/ strip view. Her attitude was friendly and she made us feel very welcomed. The room: Everything you see from their website. Modern decor, lots of HDTV's, & kitchen. The bed was soft and had lots of pillows. A safe is in the closet and easy to use. The room was huge! BTW when you leave you can check-out on the TV it is supper easy and should become a hotel standard! The staff: Everyone we encouterd was extremely friendly. The maid was cleaning the Penthouse unit next to our room and let us walk around and view the room. Our room was cleaned well, towels were replaced, and my personal items were left untouched. We left $5 tip everyday with a note to housekeeping thanking them. I think its nice to be friendly to the people who pickup after your sloppy mess. We never encoutered timeshare sales people. Unless your a Vegas rookie you should know how to blow off pushy sales people. Swimming pool: Wet Republic its not. But that is a good thing. We did the pool partys Ditch Fridays, and Hardrock. At the end of the day we would have one last drink and dip at the PH Toweres pool just to relax a little bit Location: Cant beat center strip. Only bad thing is walking through the mall at 4am supper drunk being carried by your wife. That walk can feel like an eternity. Overall its our new favorite hotel. If they keep these resonable rates this will forever be our Las Vegas Strip hotel of choice. Awesome place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest review, don't listen to the negativity”
Reviews.Author: midge1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are pretty well traveled, so here is an honest review. After reading all the reviews here, I must admit that I was pretty nervous. But DON'T listen to the picky reviews. Expect a mid-range hotel, which is what I think it is. The lobby is contemporary, modern and clean. We checked in around 12:30 pm with NO line up at all. The front desk girl was lovely and offered us an upgraded room on the 51st floor (at an additional charge) which we took. The room was perfect size for us with a spectacular view. The additional charge was worth every penny for this view, we faced Wynn from the master bedroom and Paris from the living room. We had no problems with housekeeping or front desk service, however when Friday came around of course the hotel is going to be busy. Give these people a break, the hotel is BUSY, of course service will suffer a little bit....it's the weekend in Vegas, what do you expect?! The pool was fabulous and because we were there midweek it was quite and perfect, again once the weekend rolled around it got very busy. Location is phenomenal and we loved that it was connected to the mall, it was a break from walking outside because it was melting hot. All in all, this is a great value for the price. Go with an open mind and remember that these people that work in these hotels work HARD. We would definitely go back again. I would not hesitate to tell anyone to book here. *Tips: if you rent a car, park on the 3rd floor in self parking lot and to the left is an entrance directly to the lobby so you don't have to walk through the mall. Also, try the Earl of Sandwich inside the Planet Hollywood casino the breakfast sandwich is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in one place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bebebabe82
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel Excellent restaurants,shopping,just outdoor to the strip! Had a blast all restaurants were cheap n sooo yummy,definitely will be going back,ammazing Bros,the people in the room next door were crazy partying it up all night but hey its Vegas!:) loved it here

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: tarheelmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Westgate Planel Hollywood. We had the suite plus the studio. Very nice and large. Really like the modern look. Could tell from our first trip that housekeeping is not doing as well as the first trip. Carpet was wet in a large spot. Not sure what that was. Was not as clean this trip. Hair on the floor, something had ran doen the frig and not wipped off. Remote would not work. Found out a part of the TV was unplugged from wall. One missing remote. Just not the cleaning that you would expect from a 5 star. Hallways could be cleaner too. Called to report issues had to get a little up set for someone to come check. Someone very kind came in less than 10 mintes. Was there for 3 nights, housekeeping does not come by. Make sure you hang up your towels and clean up after yourself. Did not want to wash on my vacation. These things are really not that bad. Here is where the BAD TASTE comes from. Went to the time share presentation. Not wanting to purchase at all. 4 hours later we had bought at one of the Floriada properties. Only becuse I was told that an all inclusive week vacation would not cost any extra. Only the fee of the international travel and disconnected airfare. I asked this question I know 4 times. Was told yes that is all you have to pay. Out right lied to by Krista Smith sales manager. Our sales rep agreed with Krista. (Joe Dandy) Why do people feel like they must lie to you to sell a product. If what you are selling is for real it should sell it self. When I got home within 2 days I emailed Krista, twice. Do you think she took the time to answer me NO!!!!!! I made many phone calls for her to return a call to me. As a matter of fact no type of management will call you back or speak to me. Makes you think that they all do business in lies to people. Take your money and run, guess that is their motto Checked out the reviews on the property where went bought our week. ( Westgate Blue Tree) The reviews were not good at all, doesn't sound like a 5 star property that Westgate said all their property were. Another lie to us!!!! WOW. I wanted Krista Smith or someone to price out an all inslusive with air leaving from my home airport. No responce from anyone on this. Have asked this of Westgate personnal maybe 6 times. I want my money back and cancel this fraud of a timeshare. So skinny of this please don't waste your time n Vegas going to their lies of a presentation just for some show tickets. Go pay for yoru ticket yourself. Check out tickets 4 2nite. Lession well learned on my part. Have been to many presentations over the years wonder why I thought this one was different?????? All I want is to cancel this contract and leave the lies behind me.............

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE - HOTEL IS VERY UNDER-STAFFED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaded2784
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I NEVER write reviews, but I love to read them before I choose a hotel, so I figured I owed it to everyone reading these reviews to share my experience. We literally just got home. If decent service in a hotel matters to you, then absolutely do NOT stay there. This is a long review, if you don't want to read the whole thing just read points # 6 & 7. That should be reason enough not to stay there. My husband and I went for a short 2 night stay to get away and have some fun. We are a laid back couple in our mid twenties and this hotel is geared for people our age. We like to consider ourselves pretty well traveled for our age, and always stay in 4 or 5 star hotels (because we believe you get what you pay for). This is by no means a 4 star hotel. I did the Priceline Bid, typed in 4 star hotel or better for $80 a night and ended up with the Planet Hollywood Towers. I never would have chosen to stay there, but I figured for $80 a night I couldn't complain. Man was I wrong... 1. When we checked in we were bombarded by a woman trying to get us to sit in on a presentation for free dinner vouchers. When we politely declined she gave us major attitude and made checking in an annoying process. 2. When we got to our room, the smell of the cleaning supplies was so bad my husband could literally taste it in his mouth and his nose was burning. There were no cups in our room, we had to call for them, and when they arrived they were dirty! When I held them up to the light I could see lipstick marks! We found a bra next to the couch and a stash of naked hooker cards in the nightstand drawer. Gross. And the outside panel on the bath tub was completely broken, you could see all the electrical stuff for the jets inside. (I didn't complain about anything because every time we called downstairs I would be put on hold for 10 minutes before I got to speak to someone, if they even picked up in the first place. I did not want to spend my 2 day vacation waiting on hold on the phone!). 3.We really wanted to see a show, but the entire time we were there the Concierge was bombarded by people. There was only one person working the Concierge the entire time. When I tried to call down to the Concierge (about 10 times) I never got an answer. I left messages only to never be called back. We never got any information about shows and therefore we didn't see one. In my opinion a 4 star hotel should have a much more attentive Concierge staff. 4. We needed toilet paper yesterday and called three separate times to get it. Finally someone brought it up after an hour... 5. We ordered room service for some appetizers before we went out (which stops at the Towers at 2pm, and after that, they are sending it over from the Planet Hollywood) and the chicken wings were so disgusting they were inedible. The chicken quesadilla was good. I'll give them that. 6. Housekeeping barged in our room at 10:30 am this morning and yells "When are you checking out?" ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! We had the do not disturb light on!!! Checkout time is 11am!! We were naked!! Enough said on that one. 7. They shut down the elevator system at 1:00 am last night because someone had sprayed the fire extinguisher all over one of the elevators. I understand that this was out of the hotels hands, but they had NO ONE over by the elevators telling their guests what was going on. There was a crowd of drunk people (us included) that just wanted to get to our rooms and were being given no information! When we went over to the front desk to ask where the stairs were, they couldn't tell us where they were! Three different people at the front desk didn't know where the stairs were. We waited around for 30 minutes until we decided to take the second set of elevators to a different floor and then walked down 10 flights of stairs. I happened to see many disabled guests in the hotel, and I wondered how they were being taken care of in a situation like that... completely unacceptable. 8. There was no ice machine on our floor (19), we had to walk down to the 5th floor to get it, and last night it was broken. A couple good things I will say about the hotel: The rooms are kinda cute, beds are pretty comfortable, and the TVs are nice. We went and ate at Koi last night at the Planet Hollywood and it was amazing! We had a great time when we were outside the Towers ;) We ended up talking to the manager when we checked out because we wanted them to know how unhappy we were. If maybe one or two of these things happened during our stay, that would be understandable. I wouldn't be making a big deal. Not every hotel can be perfect. But the fact that it was just one thing after another was upsetting. The manager credited me back the room service charge for $60.00. That was all he could do because I had already pre paid the hotel through Priceline. That was nice of him, but I still felt that he didn't really care. He kept interrupting us when we were trying to tell him about our stay. So, overall, there are much better places to stay! We will be going back to the Wynn or the Venetian next time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWonderer
Reviews.Content: Planet Hollywood Towers Westgate was the choice of deluxe suites I chose over others on the strip due to cost and and the younger crowd staying at the hotel and we were not disappointed. 7" projector screen, a kitchen we never used, whirlpool, fantastic view, washing machine and comfortable bed and caring concierge....we were very impressed!!! Only gripe was the pool which was a little small and worse still when a certain overweight american couple decided to steal our sun loungers and then lie about it but the manager found us new seating positions and all was fine. Don't forget anything in your room because it is a long trip back from the casino but we could not fault the accommodation and will be coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: four_oneone
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed here for my bachelorette party. We were told on the phone early check in "shouldn't be a problem". We arrived at 1100 and we were told to check back at 230 pm. No problem (except sticking around), but not a big deal. We come back at 230 and I am rudely told that check in is at 4pm. As I try to explain my situation, she repeats herself in this trained annoyed voice that sounds calm and firm. As a bride-to-be I can spot this anywhere - the "nice" employee who is really mocking you, because valid concern or not they have been trained to treat you in a patronizing fashion to "let you know you are being heard" while completely ignoring your concern. Finally at 4pm I went to check in and they were not sure if there would be a room. We FINALLY get in and there are unmade beds, food in the fridge and plugged drains in the bathroom. For such a beautiful room, this was a shame. Finally the reservation was for two suites for three nights and one suite for the fourth night. The hotel ABSOLUTELY REFUSED to tell me if we would have to move rooms until the forth morning an hour prior to check out AND told me if we did check out we had to move our luggage, store it, and come back at 4pm to check in. NOT IMPRESSED. Great view and nice looking rooms but very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Colinmeager
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a party of 13 people over for a wedding, and overall the experience of the hotel was excellent. There is always an element of luck involved when staying at a hotel I guess. CHECK IN - was quick and you could up grade to the 54 ish floor for about 10 dollar a night for excellent views, but we didnt bother, as I dont spend all my time in my room, and the 4th floor facing the pool was fine. However the other way might face the multi storey car park, so get the pool, main road side! HOUSE KEEPING - They were almost gagging to clean the room, and even left messages on the phone to check you didnt need it cleaning, they knocked on the door, in the afternoon, and spoke in person on the phone to make sure we were happy for them to not clean etc, also security fixed our safe that was broken within 10 mins of calling down to the front desk. Thus very helpful staff. LOCATION - If you come to Vegas and expect your room to be almost on the strip, then you will be mistaken. Vegas is massive, and you need to walk places! 10mins approx to the strip through the shops. Taxis can be got downstairs, you might need to wait a few minutes at times though. A good tip is to get the bus tickets for $7 for 24hr travel up the strip to freemont and the premium shopping outlet, it stops outside or near to all the major hotels and if you not too rushed it saves you a lot of $. The pool at the hotel was nice, lots of towels and sun beds available etc and all NO extra cost. HOWEVER - please dont forget that we arrived on a monday, and all was quiet etc, BUT come the friday afternoon and the weekend, Vegas gets heaving, and the pool, looby hotel in general was much much busier, so if you are just a long weekend visit then you may well find longer check in and more noise etc. So a great place to stay, just busy as everywhere is, on the weekends! ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it,”
Reviews.Author: RLB23HEHE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel around 10:30am and were happy to hear that we could check in. There was no line and got up to the counter immediately which was nice. They said our studio suite wasn't quite ready but could put us in a one bedroom suite for $20/night extra. We stayed for 5 nights so we opted for that. We got a lovely room on the 51st floor witha splendid view of the Eiffel Tower at Paris next door and could watch the Bellagio fountain show as well. The room was very clean, a great size and "chic" if you will: came with a mini fridge, microwave, 3 flat screens and a jacuzzi. Throughout the 5 nights I never got woken up once at night. I must say as well that this hotel can get backed up for checking in if you happen to come at the wrong time...but so can every other hotel that I went into. Hopefully you'll get lucky. Nice thing is that YOU CAN CHECK OUT IN YOUR ROOM, right on the TV! It takes 30 seconds and you're done...so awesome. And so nice not to have to pay resort fees.. sure WiFi ain't free but thats basically what you're paying for with other hotel resort fees To get to the Strip you gottta go through the Miracle Mile which is basically a 1.2 mile roundabout mall. Takes about 5-10 mins to get to the strip depending on if you're a fast walker like myself or a senior. Really not a bad walk and scenery on the way. Best thing is you get to pass a ABC store (Mini Convenience store which sells Liquor ,souvenirs, basic food and such at great prices) and Earl of a Sanwich (best Hot/cold sanwiches for $6 ever) on your way out. Miracle Mile attaches to PH Hotel and Casino as well. All in all this a very nice hotel to stay at with a great central location on the strip. Only small complaint I have of this place is the water pressure is a bit low. Other than that I would recommend it to anyone of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I have ever had in Vegas. Skip this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cullencanada
Reviews.Content: I guess we can start at the beginning. We were suppose to stay 2 nights here and 3 nights at Planet Hollywood. My gf wanted to stay here bc of the size of the rooms which looked nice and big online. So we got off our flight from Canada on May 28 10:30am which is Memorial Day weekend so everyone knows. We knew Vegas was going to be busy. So we arrived at the hotel at around 11:15am. Waited about 20 mins the 1st time, got to the counter and before I could open my mouth, she says "Not checking anyone in until 4". So there we went downstairs to the bell man to have him hold our bags for 4 and a half hours. What do you know.. One guy working a crowd of about 50 people checking bags early. The line just to check our bags took 30 minutes. So all this will never ruin Vegas for me because I'm here to have fun with my gf and friends. So back we came at 330pm to check in. Line took an hour to get through because 1. They are slow and 2. This is a timeshare hotel we learned and every owner (which means nothing as Vegas is so cheap) gets VIP service. The line got heated after about 30 mins with people yelling and complaining at the staff about this. The staff had no answer except that this is what they are told to do. So they had 4 people working a line of about 150 people and 4 people working a line of maybe 1-3 people max at a time. The customer service is terrible. I notified the guy at the counter that I will only stay one night and stay the Sunday and 3 more nights I had booked at the Planet Hollywood Hotel right next to it. Eventually he canceled free of charge because the line was gettin too big. Rooms were nice just like advertised. Had the view of the parking garage but I wasn't even in my room until late. And to top it all off someone knocked on my door at 9:10 am to let me know checkout is at 11am. Had enough, got our stuff left. Planet Hollywood Hotel was amazing. Told them our story and the guy let us check in at 1030am even though it was a busy weekend. Upgraded us for all 4 nights for a $20 I slipped him. Amazing customer service and rooms were fantastic. Stay away from Planet Hollywood Towers... Do yourself a favor and avoid this understaffed,rude and unfriendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MrsFidge
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this hotel is brilliant. We had to wait a litle to get our 2 rooms (4pm), but we wanted 2 close together, they couldn't get them on the same floor so we had a room directly above each other and just a run up 2 flights of stairs we were at the other room (certainly better than walking the football pitch length corrider). Although we had to wait for our rooms, well, it was well worth the wait - on opening the door, the blinds automatically opened and WOW, 21 floors up floor to ceiling glass (not for anyone suffering with veretigo) actually wow is the best description for the room too, This hotel was great because it was central to everything. We would stay here again and recommend it to anyone - fantastic. P H Towers - thankyoui

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: mapleguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a studio suite May 16th room was on the 24th floor. Room was fine cleaned everyday and I had zero complaints. Pool? well they had one but 50% of the seating is cash only so the other half filled up pretty quickly. Found out after the fact that there are several other resorts that offer non-guests access to theirs for free if you want to check out some others. Went to the spice market buffet at PH, wow what a crappy buffet! overpriced and for breakfast at least, pretty much what you could get a Mcdonalds for a lot less. Mandalay bay and Paris were both cheaper and over the top in comparison. Didn't deal much with the hotel staff just at check in and check out the latter completed on the TV so very painless. When I left to find a taxi I discovered that PH towers doesn't have any waiting ala PH itself so I would just hike over to PH and grab a cab there. They both share the underground parking and it's the quickest route to get there. 25 people standing in line at check out time for a cab and one staff member frantically trying to flag down a cab on a side street didn't work out. Take the hike to PH. Other than that I'd suggest something other than a sunday check out, the elevators were jammed on sunday people riding them up since they were full for an hour going down at 11 am. The stairs got a lot of use on Sunday. Anyway I found it a good place to stay and got a good laugh at the drunk teenagers that seemed to inhabit every floor the elevator stopped at. Oh and there is no free WIFI here, every other place in Vegas apparently but not here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Studio Suite!”
Reviews.Author: nidu22
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This hotel is great! We arrived early in the morning on May 24th (around 10:30am), the desk clerk told us it was a little early to check in but she double checked the computer to see if anything was available at that time. She told us there was a suite on the 4th floor, but warned us that we would not have a view. We opted to wait. When we returned around noon, she found us a suite on the 19th floor - facing the airport, MGM, excaliber, etc. The view was great! If you are used to staying in regular sized hotel rooms, the studio will suit you fine! It was larger than the average hotel room - not really sure why I would need extra space! The room was exactly as the pictures showed. Clean, neat, and very trendy! The bed was a huge king sized bed with 8 pillows! Automatic blinds, room and maid service - all with the press of a button. You could also access all room amenities through the TV - which was pretty cool. Air conditioning kept the room very cool. The walls are thin, but most of the time you are either too tired and sleepy to notice any noise. The only time we were kept up was the Friday of the Memorial Day weekend (understandably), and we had to be up by 5:30 to catch the shuttle to the airport the next morning. It was a little annoying, but no biggie. Time share people were not as bad as some people have indicated. Just steer clear of them at the main entrances of the Miracle Mile Mall (they are wearing red shirts and will probably ask if you're married if you're there with a spouse). Just ignore them completely. The pool was great! Wish it was a little deeper, but it is great to cool off and enjoy a cool beverage! Lots of loungers....the big ones with red cushions are available for daily rental (around $50). A lot of cabanas too - but I didn't see anyone really using these as they are set back from the pool itself - and probably cost a pretty penny. If you can, bring cash to the pool bar - if you charge your drinks to your room, you will be charged a tipping surcharge on your final bill. All in all, we had an excellent stay - and would definitely stay here again! The casino was cool, but we enjoyed the NYNY casino better. A+++ - Ignore the bad reviews!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre......5/10”
Reviews.Author: Brandon016
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to be nickled and dimed at every single turn...to the point of disgust: If you don't want a room facing parking lot, you must pay upgrade fee. Oh you want to check out at noon (yeah..noon), ok that will be a special check-out fee. You want to sit in the shade by the pool, that will be a fee. Of course, expect a mysterious resort fee to be added (for who knows what) as well to your final bill, etc. The lobby is nice, but like others have said this hotel has a major problem with staff. Everyone is sleepy, non-energetic and just doing the job to get a check. No interest in helping you beyond the minimum. Definitely not refined. Prob go through little or no customer training here. The problem is the hotel is located behind the strip. Be prepared to walk 10-15 minutes to get to the strip or to the casino. Planet Hollywood hotel is a lot better location to be. No night life in hotel. Very dead. Bottom line: spend the extra $50 and stay on the strip at a real and exciting vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line! Fantastic !! Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: davidkc
Reviews.Content: First Impressions!! WOW>! Its a little tricky to find as a walk through Miracle Mile shops to get to main lobby, but thats nothing compared to what you will experience with the room. We stayed in the one Bedroom Apartment, they are massive. Full kitchen, large full floor to ceiling windows. TV everywhere, 4 i counted. Massive amount of tv channels if you decide to stay indoors, but you wont for long. PH Casino is nearby and very happening place. Large SPA next to bed, bathroom has double sinks, my wife liked this very much.. The Front desk upgraded us to the 26th floor, as we had been booked for 14th floor, he even tried to get us on 52nd floor for $20 a day extra, hotel was booked out our weekend. Its very popular for all ages, a big pool area, bar, gym, not much you couldnt want .. We also had a look at 2 bedroom apartments, these are literally massive. The rooms can be separated as well. As this is a timeshare building, a 90 min meeting and they will give you cheap tickets to shows etc, you dont have to buy into a timeshare if you dont wish, although some people did while we were there. Its very worthwhile Resort to stay.. 5 stars..

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: max_weber1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice during our Westcoast trip. First time in a One-Bedroom Suite: Just like on the pictures, real stylish and pretty new. Nice design and super-spacious. Liked the huge screen with HD projector. Second time we only took a Studio: Still super-spacious, just without the HD screen and without Jacuzzi (jetted tub instead). Bathrooms were huge, the floor-to-ceiling windows are amazing. Probably the best room deals you can get on the strip, the size is amazing compared to the other resorts, especially keeping the rates in mind! Pool was great, no outside drinks are allowed. Bothers you when you buy a soda right next to the pool entrance and then have to throw it away before you had time to open it. Soda at the pool is USD 4 ! tax & service which brings it to USD 6. Not a rip-off but expensive, alcoholic beverages very expensive in pool area. Spice Market restaurant wasn´t good, great choice? Yes, but the food quality and service was rather poor. Guess at least there you get what you pay for, more a place for families and alow-budget people (that eat there like 5 times a day with their buffet passes). NO RESORT FEES!!! Internet is not free of charge, so just take you netbook to Starbucks on the main floor. Finally: Great place to stay, not disappointed, their smaller restaurants are great though.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The staff was fantastic. We had initially booked a studio suite and decided to upgrade to the one bedroom suite when we arrived. We were blown away by the room. We were placed on the 54th floor facing the MGM. It was great! we had a projector screen tv jacuzzi in our bedroom. The room was well worth upgrading to!!! I recommend anyone stay there

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: neffaj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of April, 2011. They had a special for 30% off all suites. We booked the one bedroom suite, and got a room on the 55th floor, 2nd from the top. We started laughing once we went inside because it was ridiculous... in a very good way. The room was huge, had the best views you could hope for with giant windows, and had more modern amenities than you could count. I found myself just sitting on the lounge by the window staring for a half hour at the view. Everything was clean and very nicely decorated. The only minor drawbacks, is that parking was a little tough, it was a slight walk to get to the casino, and service at the hotel tended to be a little slow. The luxury of the hotel room though far outweighed these minor concerns. Bottom line, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else next time we go out there.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking hotel, all amenities, just not all working in our room”
Reviews.Author: Dvillelady
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, on THE STRIP, connected to the Miracle Mile of shops and restaurants. Huge busy swimming pool, which we did not use. Stunning lobby. Part of Towers is CONDO rental, which is what we had apparently. KIng bed, Jacuzzi tub, quiet hallways all night! Refrig did not work, linen not there for hide-a -bed, took three (3) calls to get that and we had to make up the bed. Only 2 coffee cups...there were three of us. Only two forks, knives etc. Room is listed at up to 4 occupants. WE will try this place again, will probably phone directly to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy93
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom suite which was more than enough room for us, the 8ft projector blew our mind and was perfect for watching sports games.....Bathrooms were big and showers were great. I will for sure stay here again when I come back. Front desk was very helpful and nice. Good job Planet Hollywood Towers!!

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable bed I've ever slept in.”
Reviews.Author: T0ny7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and comfortable. Great views, Great Location and great Value. The only issue we had was rinsing the soap off of our body. (soft water) and it got a little loud on the weekend but not enough to keep us from sleeping. The location was good attached to the Miracle mile shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet view Nice suite close to action right off strip”
Reviews.Author: BeachyBride2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with the understanding it was 4.5 stars... not really. The layout was great, it was convenient, but not right on the strip and the quality of the materials was lacking. Clean and new though it was...

Reviews.Title: “I hope you like waiting in lines”
Reviews.Author: tripdave
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it's because this is a timeshare that rent out rooms, rather than a traditional hotel, but this place just doesn't care. It took me 1/2 hour to check in at about 6 PM and more than 1/2 hour to check out at 10:30 PM. Why was I checking out at that hour, beacuse I had an early AM flight and was afraid that it would be just as bad in the early morning. I should point out that the staff was nice, they are just understaffed. My guess is that because of the ownership arrangement, they really do not care if visitors return. My second day in the hotel I left at 8:30 in the AM and returned at 9 PM to find that my room wasn't made up. It seems to me 13 hours should be enough time. And no, I did not have a "do not disturb" sign up. When I called I specifically said please do NOT come for 20 minutes because I need to wash up and change clothing. Yep, they came in 5 minutes while I was naked. When I told the chambermaid to please come back in 10 minutes, she said she's going on break and can't come back until after 10 PM. I'm serious. Want wifi? An extra charge $21 for 3 days. Come on. How many hotels in the US charge for wifi now-a-days? Like a pen or pad in your room? No luck. I like a bar of soap and the sink and in the shower. I could not get that second bar. All silly little things, but indicative of the overall feel of the place. The worst part of this property is that it offers virtually no traditional hotel conveniences. Want breakfeast? You have to walk to the attached mall and go searching for an open restaurant. Also note that it is a long walk through the mall to LV Blvd. Count on 15-20 minute hikes to most to most everything. I do not consider this convenient. My room was decorated in Hollywood decor, this is part of the Planet Hollywood complex. I had floor to ceiling windows, but it faced a roof top which was at the same level as my floor. So if any worker was on the roof, they would be looking right into the room. This might unnerve some women, in particular. The room offered a king size bed, wall mounted flat screen TV and alarm clock. The room phone is strangely not located on the desk, where it would be most useful. Local calls-$1 each.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Figglewiggle43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PH in April and while the check-in was a bit lengthy, especially since it was close to midnight, everything went fairly smoothly. The room was amazing, very spacious and beautiful. I liked the fact it came with a washer/dryer and that the soap supplies were replenished every day. The housekeeping was good, they came everyday. The worst part of the stay here were the black toilets, kinda creepy! However, the beds were very comfy and the view was great, even if it was not on the strip. The access to the mall was great, very nice mall. The pool was great for kids. We loved our stay here and will definitely come back. Oh, the other thing that did not impress me were the constant inebriated guests staggering back to their rooms through the lobby every day, but I guess you would see this anywhere in any Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the room”
Reviews.Author: wanessinha
Reviews.Content: Great room with a wonderful view and automatic curtains (trendy!). The bed was pretty comfortable, the AC was good and the bathroom was great and had separate places.(for bath and for toillet) Inside the room, there was microwave, coffee maker, dish-washing machine and everything else you need to cook if you want ( I don't). Cons: The staff was not nice, the front desk manager seemed to be doing me a favor.The room service t I only could park in the self-parking because there was no available place to park in the valet parking (too small).

Reviews.Title: “Trendy room, but it's a timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle31190
Reviews.Content: I'm a timeshare owner at PH Towers; this was my second stay there. The first time (August 2010), my friend and I stayed in the smaller one-bedroom suite through Interval International, on her account. This suite does not have a full kitchen, just a GE Advantium microwave and small fridge, and no cookware. It also does not have a projection TV. The second time, we were in my timeshare suite, which is the larger one-bedroom suite, with a full kitchen. The cookware was about the cheapest budget cookware one can get; the certainly stinted on that. Maintenance was poor; the door was falling off the dishwasher, and a few light bulbs were burned out. A call to the concierge got the light bulbs replaced, but the dishwasher was not repairable, and they couldn't replace it. Other than that, I had no problems with the suite. All the windows were floor to ceiling, and the width of the rooms; the shades were operated by wall switches (the shade in the living room doubles as the projection-TV screen.) or from the TV remote for that room. One nice feature (in both suites) is "turn the room off"; it lowers the shades and turns off the TV and the lights. Although PH Towers is owned by Westgate, it is operated by Ceasers International (formally known as Harrahs), which owns the Planet Hollywood Hotel and Casino (and maybe Miracle Mile). They staff the registration counter and the maid and maintenance services. Westgate runs the time-share presentations (from a round service counter in the lobby) and the concierge. The only maid service, though, for timeshare stays is a cleanup on the fourth day of the stay. I understand that people staying there at hotel rates get maid service daily. The location is great; next door to Paris Las Vegas, and across the Strip from the Belagio and the new Town Center. I was there for the PF Chang Rock and Roll Las Vegas Marathon, which was at the Mandalay Bay, and the walk to the race start in the morning was just the right distance for a good warm up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good service”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: We had not one, but two issues with our room and the staff solved them pleasantly and immediately. That is rare! The rooms are gorgeous and the bathrooms are lovely. I do not agree that a suite with one bed and one sofabed really sleeps 4 adults. Be careful if there are more than two of you per room and you are not a sofabed fan. Even the suites only have one bed. I like that there is no casino in the lobby of this property but you can walk easily into the PH Hotel casino. No smell of smoke up in the Towers either. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 star stay, without the 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: Abbey_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view inexpensive upgrade to higher floor. Well worh the $10.00 Went from the th floor to the 53rd floor. Concierge was great at getting us tickets to shows and wheelchair. Only downside was there were only 2 ice machines in the hotel and only one was working. Check in and out was a breeze. We were unable to use our Total rewards points from the casino as this hotel was not located within the Casino. But that was only a minor issue. This hotel is attatched to the miracle mile mall, whick makes for a short walk to the planet hollywood casino and the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary...Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vincelo2
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the late review as I have been doing plenty of travelling and will be posting various reviews of various hotels during my travel. Planet Hollywood Towers IS NOT the same as Planet Hollywood Resort. The PH Towers is the new extension and should not be confused with the resort. PH Towers Room that I stayed in is new + contemporary. The finishing is nice. PH Towers is not on the strip like the PH Resort. So they couldn't give me a view of the strip. Walking to the strip is through the "Miracle Mile shops" which it shares with the PH Resort. The shops aren't expensive and affordable. Unlike the shops in Bellagio which everything cost an arm and a leg. We have breakfast everyday in "miracle mile shops" and it's very convenient and affordable. We obtained a good rate which was approx USD150 or so and was more than satisified with what we got in return. Location is very good as it's next to "Paris" and opposite "Bellagio" which is more or less the middle of the vegas strip. The people there was helpful. The pool was absolutely gorgeous to look at. Unfortunately I couldn't give it a try as it was freezing during christmas times.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Presentation Hell - But amazing rooms on the surface”
Reviews.Author: BarryDryB
Reviews.Content: Early one morning on our first full day visit proper to Vegas we fell for the free show tickets and dinner routine. Decided 90 minutes of our time was worth the hassle. 100+ of those minutes were just hard sales pitch strewn with invalid statements. I was told a series of inaccurate 'facts' about interval international and how the swap system works. I knew they were untrue because I've been a very happy Interval member for almost 15 years. The biggest innccuracy was I was told it would be impossible to swap into PH towers because of the resort's status - fact is I got home and I can and there are dozens of weeks available over winter through to early spring. To be fair the rooms were amazing but I only had 5 minutes to look round them and the rooms we were shown were way off the scale. To make matters worse all we were actually offered was a week in Florida for $15k that was 'bought' off an employee allegedly even though I could have just about paid for the PH Towers week in cash. Funniest 'fact' of the day had to be that the interval brochure is only printed with a Westgate feature in it. I wish I had mine to hand so I could have shown him our Marriott version. So funny but so truly awful. Almost two hours passed so we walked, got our tickets to the V Theatre Variety Show and dinner. We paid $20 each for upgraded table seats and had a brilliant night out and the show was fantastic, so all in it was worth the pain in the morning. Genuinely considering a stay using an Interval Getaway but really not sure based on some of the comments already printed. I'm genuinely shocked that a business the size and quality of Westgate would keep getting the customer service and maintenance so wrong. Maybe I should just stay with Marriott given it;s in the top ten for Vegas. Any thoughts??

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: ValentinoTishPeppe
Reviews.Content: Spend your money elsewhere! First we waited in line for over 2hours just to check in at 8.30pm with an infant screaming for food. Next we find out they have over booked and are placing us in two seperate rooms not even close to eachother, (we booked a 2bedroom suite on a high floor due to baby and elderly parents staying with us). When we said that this was not good enough their response was 'well what do you want me to do? Take it or leave it!' We asked for the manager, he gave us a $100 in room voucher and promised a 2bedroom suite for the next night. The next night came, and what do you think, over booked and no room, this time I made a scene, its amazing how quick they find a room for you then!! Still not impressed at the fact that the bath tub hot water did not work and took over 1hr to fill the tub enough for my 9month old, also you get a kitchen at this hotel, but no pots and pans, if you want pots and pans you have to pay $20per day for them!! Have never been so disappointed!! Will never stay at this hotel again and will advice all family and friends to stay clear of it also.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: cape05
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for my spouse 30th birthday. We decided to go with the towers over the regular planet hollywood hotel (we usually stay at) because of the suites. The pictures were nice and it seemed to be a good deal so we hopped on it. Unfortunately when we got there it was the opposite. The staff was very rude and unhelpful. Once we finally got in our room, it had not been cleaned, stuff was broken and missing. The projector tv and all other tvs cut on and off on there own, the shades got stuck going up and down, and the tiles were broke throughout the whole place. We brought this to managements attention along with the bad customer service and they were less helpful or caring. If your going its way better to stay at the Planet Hollywood hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Rooms - Not So brilliant everything else”
Reviews.Author: smiles111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, we got a good deal $100/N for a 1 bedroom suite, cant complain about that. The rooms were really nice and modern. new and spacious even though we didnt get a chance to use it all as we spent most of our time out and about! But I have to say even for the price we payed i would have much rather stayed somewhere else! The checkin took ages as the girl couldnt get the key card for the room to swipe. Never mentioned Welcome or have a good stay. I had to ask were the elevators were and other amenites as nothing was said. and check out was much the same, it was like they didnt really care who u were just going through the drill. Also, as we first walked in a lady caught us at a desk and was helpful about were to go and come back and see me and ill give u maps and freebies for the area, so we thought great, but we went back to her after check in and all she wanted to do was sell us timeshare to the resort. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Party Central”
Reviews.Author: SoJo16
Reviews.Content: First, much love to Carlos at the front desk, who was originally going to put me on the 4th floor, but when I pouted and told him it was my first time in Vegas and I'd hoped to have a view, totally hooked me up with a 52nd floor room. Thank you, Carlos! This is a great base camp for a large group. It's connected to the Miracle Mile Mall, which contains the ABC convenience stores, which sell relatively cheap booze and mix. So whatever faults the place may have, proximity to the ABC is a huge plus. Additionally, the hotel is located smack dab in the middle of the Strip, and across the street from the glitzy new Cosmopolitan. Also no casino to walk through in the lobby, which is nice if you're already overstimulated. Pool was beautiful but drinks there were expensive. The black toilet made it hard to inspect your leavings, and it was ultra low-flow and hard to get flushed properly. Only one trash can in the suite. Views from the suites are great. I felt like the hotel had few amenities--no where handy to go for breakfast, for instance. It's also something of a hike back through the mall coming off the Strip. And it's filled with young party-goers, so if you need a lot of uninterruped sleep, probably not the best choice. Be sure to bring a jacket and lip balm. There was a constant cool dry wind that chilled me and wrecked my lips.

Reviews.Title: “Planet Hollywood Towers - Westgate”
Reviews.Author: kinger2121
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, the lobby was very bright, clean, and has great décor. My group had arrived on a Wednesday, so check in only took a couple of minutes. I was happy that the front desk did offer to upgrade my 2 bedroom suite to the penthouse for a reasonable price, but when I found out that the only difference was that the living room was a little bit bigger I graciously declined. It just wasn’t worth the money but was still pleased that the front desk did offer and I didn’t have to ask. Once up to the room, the bright, modern décor followed from the lobby. Unfortunately then we started to find some problems: light fixtures had blown out bulbs in them, yes there are multiple Tv’s in every room but remotes were missing batteries, the whirlpool tub jets did not work, and on the slide door from the bedroom to the bath the lock was missing. Later tried to call housekeeping several times, for an extra blanket, and no one even answered, had to call the front desk still took atleast 5 mins to answer then when we asked if someone could send up another blanket they said “we’ll see what we can do.” No blanket arrived that night or the next night when we called again. The pool service was awful, we had a cabana w/ bottle service the one day and then a circle bed with table and bottle service the other day, both times it took about a ½ hr to get the 2 bottles and mixers. They try and make it seem as if all the cabanas and beds are taken by putting reserved signs on them, but for those two days we were the only people there in a cabana and the other day there might have a been another 2 couples on the beds. There just are not enough pool servers for you to get your drink in a reasonable time. If you wanted a drink you were better off just walking up to the bar yourself because it took half the time. Overall for having a 2 bedroom suite I would say my stay for 6 days was mediocre, maybe because the hotel is still new(3 years old), but the service was just not there, and for other people I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to shop!”
Reviews.Author: Takemesomewherenew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PH Westgate for 4 days and 3 nights. I stayed on the 34th floor and the end of the hall in a King Suite. It was very nice. There was a separate living/dining area from the bedroom. We didn't use the space but it was a nice addition. The jetted tub was only big enough for one person (comfortably). The walls are a little thin but I was there to have a good time so I didn't mind the noise. The hotel staff were very friendly. The absolutely best part of this hotel is that fact that it is connected to a mile of shopping. The mall connects directly to the lobby of the hotel! I found everything that I needed for a night out on the town in this mall. You can even purchase adult beverages at the bars within and carry them around with you store to store. If I had to complain about something it would be the toilets. They didn't flush well. Without being too specific...it took multiple flushes to completely empty the bowl with only TP in there. Also, there is no restaurant or casino in the towers but you can walk through the mall to the PH hotel/casino if you are looking for action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Long hump to Casino”
Reviews.Author: bcflyboy
Reviews.Content: Great stay for 3 day's in April,fast and early check in. Upgraded to 1 bedroom suite on the top floor(56). The Suite had everything you would need,full kitchen, dish washer,fridge,stove washer dryer,soaker tub,walkin shower , and 5 TVs. The staff where all very helpfull and polite. The only negetive would be the walk (hump) through the mall to PH casino and to Starbucks for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Planet Hollywood Fine”
Reviews.Author: h0rsetrader
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 evenings. had a good time. the room was very clean and service was very good. the cleaning of the room was done around 9 am every day. we did have a small issue with the door handle..I called maintenance for repair but I honestly don't know if it was ever repaired. Perhaps it was repaired as we were always able to get into the room. this is the 2nd time we have stayed here and we will consider returning. We like the location, the rooms, etc. They have no resort fees but do charge you for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly moderate”
Reviews.Author: weewillie56
Reviews.Content: We arrived at check-in and agreed to a $10/day upgrade to exchange the view of the parking garage for a view of the airport and beyond. We dropped our bags in our room and headed out on the Strip. Upon closer inspection the next day, we found our room had long black hair on the bathroom floor, a dirty bathtub and ceiling air vents covered in white dust/fuzz. The black carpet did not appear to be vacuumed and after showering, we found the tub drain was clogged. We notified the front desk, who arranged to have the suite vacuumed, the bathtub cleaned and the clogged drained cleared. However, the ceiling vents were never addressed so the dust in this room remained problematic for our allergies. In fairness, we didn't have the same housekeeper each day so some cleaners were better than others, Still there should be a standard all cleaners follow. In the early morning the day after we raised our concerns, we were awakened at 4:15 am by a housekeeper talking on her portable radio while vacuuming the vacant adjoining room. Shortly after she left the suite, two maintenance personnel entered the adjoining suite and began hammering and drilling what they claimed was a broken door knob. When asked why they were there so early, one replied, 'This is a 24 hour operation. If you don't like it, you can make a complaint at the front desk.' Two enquiries at the front desk with first Kelly and then Liz resulted in a static comment, 'We are a 24 hour operation. The room has to be cleaned for the weekend.' For the record, the day in question was a Wednesday. We were there one week and at no other time did we see or hear the housecleaners before 7:30-8:00 am. We are seasoned travellers. We don't think it is too much to expect to have your room clean when you arrive and maintained throughout your stay. You shouldn't have to go looking for toilet paper or tissue. The workout room was another matter. It smelled like sewage. Beyond that, there was no water, no mats, no exercise ball, no exercise posters, bare walls and limited exercise equipment. Here again, there was no evidence of the room or the equipment being cleaned. So, although Westgate is billed as a luxury hotel, we would rate it much more moderately. The size of the room and the view were the savings grace. If you decide to stay here, don't expect a newspaper or bottled water or a fridge stocked for your convenience. We arrived in Vegas with the intentions of purchasing a condo or possibly time share, this helped us narrow our decision. We would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean your own room.”
Reviews.Author: Bobby C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers thinking that I'd be in a "newly renovated" that would be fairly clean and would provide me a decent place to rest when I wasn't out on the strip. The location is great. Centered in the middle of the strip. That's not a problem. Connected to Miracle Mile Mall. That's a great convenience that madeit easy to shop, eat, and people watch. What's even better is that they have two ABC stores located in the mall that are almost like mini-Walmarts. Big bonus with that is they sell beer and alcohol there that is much cheaper than constantly buying drinks from the bars. Pre-flight baby. That's my motto. Checking in took over twenty minutes. Got to my room and was initially impressed with the style and decor of the room. More like a small apartment since it had a full sized kitchen with very modern appliances. Fully stocked with pots, pans, plates, cups, and silverware. A tv in every room including the bathroom. Then I started to unpack and that's when I noticed some things. Bathroom counter was dirty in the corners with dirt and hair. The floor was clean in the middle but not under the cabinet area. The toilet was clean under the lid and the seat. There was some kind of crusty stuff behind the lid when you put the lid down and on the bowl area. There was the same crusty stuff in streaming lines down the front of the toilet bowl down to the floor. I'm not sure what the heck it was but I then started to clean my own room starting in the bathroom, bedroom to include the jacuzzi, living room, and finally the kitchen which was the cleanest of all the rooms. I never realized that for paying $200+ dollars a night for a room there that I would be given the bonus enjoyment of spending the first hour in the room cleaning it. The hotel overall is nice. Would I stay there again? Yes. But the next time I'd either contact the front desk or just bring my own cleaning supplies and ask for a discount for doing my own cleaning. I forgot to mention that the glass coffee table hadn't been dusted in a very long time. Not the glass on top but the surface six inches underneath and fully open to being cleaned. The dust was so think that I wrote "WOW!!!!" in it a took a picture. When I came back to the room the next afternoon naturally the dust was gone. Lucky for me I took a picture of it as a vacation momento. Not sure if I just picked a bad week since it seemed to be springbreak time with a billions young adults running around like MTV. But that's another story for another day.

Reviews.Title: “Supposed glitz & glamour outweighed by sub-standard customer service”
Reviews.Author: CHRIS425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PH Towers from 4/22-29, after purchasing a week timeshare 18 months ago. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the woman who was supposed to be our "host" for the week. Our greeting was barely a smile from all we encountered. We were never given the "welcome pkg" that other guests were toting around. When we received it after 3 days, it was instructions on how to operate the washing machine and a booklet that I could have picked up in the mall at any kiosk. We were given a room overlooking the parking lot and told that a "strip view" (that we were promised "upon availability", but was apparently not even an option), was solely available only if you "bought" the 4 BR unit. The "host" left us waiting in our room for an hour to go downstairs to "search for a room for us with a better view". Finally, I called HER and she had no idea that she even left us hanging. After 24 hours, they offered to switch us to a lower floor view of the airport. Our host said to us, "Well, you ONLY paid $999 for the week". I politely explained to her that my husband and I don't rob banks for a living and worked very hard to save the money for this vacation that we had made plans for a year and a half prior. We very unhappily stayed in our original room. We were shocked that there was NO DAILY MAID SERVICE. We were told somebody would clean the room on DAY 4, because we were OWNERS. (We purchased a 7 night time share, and I would hardly consider us "owners"). Why did others get it and we did not? Day 4 arrived, and the only thing they did was make the bed and smear up the bathroom counter. The dust was still the same dust (and then some) as the day we got there. We had to request more towels. One afternoon I called for toilet paper. When we had returned at 11pm, still no toilet paper. Repeatedly, they referred to PH Towers as "a resort" and not a "hotel", and this is what they do at "resorts". Ridiculous. I travel quite extensively throughout the world. There is always the option to check out the evening before. When I saw this on the TV at 2am, I decided to "check out", since we had to check out by 10am. My TV shut immediately shut off, and when I called downstairs, I was asked if I were leaving my room right now (2am?) and that I am offically "checked out". It took 45 minutes to get my TV service re-established. The front desk person was not very nice. Ridiculous. My husband and I are still trying to figure out how on earth they could ask us for $110,000 for a one week time share stay at this hotel. The supposed glitz and glamour of this hotel is out-weighed by its sub-standard, very disappointing service. Seems to me that the clientel is geared to people that have never traveled before and do not know a good hotel from a not-so-good one. Do not be misled by the "cool stuff" like the washer-dryer, the full kitchen, and the projection tv...How many times are you really going to use this stuff? I would have preferred they spend their money on better customer service instead of useless amenities. At the time share "presentation part 2", we were told that there are not even any units available at PH Towers, Las Vegas, and that the only thing they could offer us to purchase was in Orlando. Just what 2 retirees need...7 nights at $110,000 to see Mickey. On a good note...the bed was very comfortable. Needless to say, we will be staying elsewhere on our return to Las Vegas. I AM CURIOUS TO KNOW IF ANYBODY HAD A SIMILAR EXPERIENCE AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: mnjjjmom
Reviews.Content: Starting with check in everything was fabulous!..this is a very modern hotel with lots of red and black and white in the decor... we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 54th floor..i am not sure what room we would have been assigned, but when i inquired about the highest floor possible, the desk clerk told me that i could upgrade to the 54th floor for an extra $10/ night.. it sounded good to me! there were plenty of elavators and we got up and down fast.. everyone was helpful and courteous.. the room was amazing!! 5 tvs were in the room as well as the floor to ceiling windows in both the living room area and the bedroom.. there was a huge whirpool tub that was lovely.the shower was great with a perfect water flow and we also enjoyed the fact that there were 2 sinks..there was a full kitchen which had a stainless steel refrigerator and freezer with ice and water in the door.... the pictures on the web site were accurate.. if i was going to have a complaint it would be that the pool was not heated.. it was a bit too cool for me, but the people that worked the pool area were always friendly and the staff did a great job of making sure that there were not unocccupied chairs with towels "saving " them.. we did not have a noise problem at all in our room.. it was clean and and even the check out was hassle free... best of all..... no resort fee.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fallingleaf21
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel off of priceline and stayed with friends. The room was quite large and I loved the amenities. When you walk in the windows automatically open for you (not that the view was the most dramatic). It was incredibly convenient to the strip and other casinos. Some cons though were that they didn't have sheets/blankets/pillows for the sofa bed in the room and you had to call for them. Additionally, unlike other hotels there was no information book in the room to let you know simple things like check out time, pool, ice etc locations. Another con was that ice was only on the 5th floor but we were on the 17th floor.... Also, no floor length mirror. Another thing was that the check-in line is really longgggg. I didn't experience this since I came in at 10pm but walking through the lobby from 3pm to 8pm, the check in line was always ridiculously long. Other than that though, the room was beautiful. The bathroom was great. Kitchen had everything I needed. I saw that if you got a bigger room (1 bedroom or up) you'd get a 6 person dining table. All in all, I would come back here though.
