Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with incredible views from the upper floors and great extras in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: flyrguy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. We were upgraded to a suite on the 31st floor so we had great views and lots of extra space. Aside from the extras we didnt ancitipate, the bedroom and bathroom were very well appointed. Some of the decorations, mainly the hallways, were a little too colorful and old school Vegas but all tied together well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as well as paying room upgrade if available.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: 17andrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is priced just below the top tier for Vegas hotels and service is well below those. The service is just poor all around and you don't get the same feeling of a Vegas hotel casino since there isn't a casino in the hotel and you have to walk over the one in Planet Hollywood. This is also a younger, and partying crowd which is a good or bad thing depending on what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: Maazy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite that was so large and comfortable that I could live there. It is very spacious and luxurious, well appointed and very clean; the entire property is very clean. The location is ideal, close to restaurants, casinos and shopping. I'm very happy that I'm an owner here.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: madkat16
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this hotel, but the signs of our stay were clear from check-in. The guy who checked us in couldnt crack a smile, wasnt helpful in responding to questions, and then (and Im still furious about this) took my passport to a back room for 5 minutes without offering any explanation as to why!! Not acceptable. Then, it appeared they weren't expecting anyone in the room - there were no provisions in the bathroom. They appeared the next day after service. After arriving in the room we called housekeeping to have the sofa made up - the guy delivered sheets and left. We called again - were told they would send someone up. No-one came. We called again - same response. On the fourth call (!) we were told that it is hotel policy NOT to make sofa beds up unless we own an apartment. So it took over 90 minutes to get to that point. What kind of hotel is that!!!! We went to check out the pool (with our 7 yo) and the crew at the door asked us if we were carrying alcohol in our backpacks. Umm, child present. Same night, a group of partying boys were running up and down the hall, slamming the door open every 15 minutes - all from 7.30pm until they went out a 2am. Please hotel, maybe think about where your partying groups are located. Some guests actually want to sleep. The most pleasant experience was the truly friendly guy who collected our bags on checkout. But getting out of valet was a nightmare! One guy trying to checkin cars, load luggage and checkout cars - very bad organisation. The Miracle Mile is good although it pales in comparison to some of the other shops attached to hotels. I purely wouldn't recommend this because the attitude of the staff was below expectations. If we'd been able to sleep, it would have been a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned...”
Reviews.Author: Phuchaphly
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. These people are a bunch of slick talking salesman with no clue about what SERVICE means. Our room was dirty and despite 3 calls to have it addressed, we ended up CLEANING our own room ---yeah, we weren't compensated with another room just assurances that it would be addressed. Shower heads were so clogged we had to use the tub exclusively; hard water and all. The only positive I can offer is the shopping mall - stay at Caesars or Paris or MGM and walk to these shops. You'll be much happier. PLANET GHETTOWOOD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks Nice but Not Worth the Price for the HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: itsMe2009
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? I've worked in hotels for 11 years and the service give here was ridiculous! PRO: Very very nice decor, rooms are pretty CON'S: Took atleast 45 minutes to check in, Valet driver did not give me a ticket for my car only asked my name. I figured they put it under names? but when I came to pick up my car the valet didnt beleive my car was even there! it took 30 minutes to find my keys than my car... They refused to valet our second car because "the lot was full" but were happy to valet a small little blond who pulled up behind me. Asked for a manager and instead got security. On our 3rd day we came back to our room around 2pm to find the attendant only folded blankets in the living room and did not touch the bedrooms, kitchen, or bathroom. Took 4 hours to get someone to take our trash out and get new towels. The suite had no hot water, the jacuzzi didnt work, and there was a broken door. We called but noone ever came to fix the water or jacuzzi. For $1,500 hot water and a working hot tub would be nice... WOULD NOT RECOMMEND...

Reviews.Title: “Out of 8 las vegas hotels, 100% my favourite! AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Niamh86
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel was that it was off the strip so I was put off - BUT its at the other end of the miracle mile shopping mall which connects to PH Hotel. The resort is amazing, rooms were so new and modern, looked so brand new! I fell in love with this hotel and would HIGHLY recommend over the PH Hotel. Pool area was much nicer than PH hotel and you can still use their pool if you wanted to. Would highly highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel stay ever....woke up with bites on feet. Bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: KSteg
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and skip this hotel, or stay at the actual Planet Hollywood. I woke up with 15 bits on my feet from sleeping in their bed. I showed the manager the morning of the incident, and he only suggested that I buy some ointment. I insisted to change rooms. The new room we were given had trash and dirt in it. We changed rooms a third time only to find incessant beeping that we could not determine where it was coming from. We stayed in the room because we were exhausted from relocating. 3 rooms in 2 days, and ALL were unacceptable. The management staff were rude and unhelpful. They would not take care of our rooms even though, I was covered with bite marks that itched terribly...I have emailed the manager and director, and no one will return my calls. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and great size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tommy745
Reviews.Content: Great spot.location is right.Rooms very big.We had the two bedroom suite and it was a great value for a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Good....if your a heavy sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: Chubby81
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too sure what to expect from Vegas having never been there before so choose the PH Towers as it is in the middle of the strip. Hotel is very nice and modern, easy to get to the strip (either through the mall or just walk up the road, really it is not all that far) and pool area is lovely. We did have a few issues though, so this hotel might not be for those wanting to get some sleep! 99% of the rooms in this hotel are adjoining so whilst the walls seem to be well soundproofed, unfortunately you can hear exactly what is going on next door as the noise filters through the adjoining door. We arrived on the sunday late afternoon after a long 11 hour flight so was in need of a good sleep that evening. Forced ourselves to go get some food and came back to the room next door having a party. They soon went out and we thought that was the end of that. Unfortunately, they came back around 3am with extra people to carry on their party! Security was called who told them to keep the noise down which to our relief they did. During the week it was a bit more quiet, beware the 24 hour maid service as some of them like to put on music whilst making up rooms and we could hear every conversation through their radio. Took 3 calls down to security before they realised what was going on (they kept telling us the room was vacant). We got $100 dollars for food for our troubles, but we changed this for a late check out and this came in very handy. On the Friday the hotel was taken over by young americans who are in the mood to party (also seems every male believes he is a gangster so you get a load of attitude from them). The people next door started their party around 4pm with drinking games, but went out leaving their music blaring! Security had to go in and turn it off. After not sleeping most of the week we couldnt take any more and asked to be moved. It is worth bearing in mind that if security get 3 complaints about noise the people will be evicted, which is a good system however we didnt have the energy to put up with any more, making phone calls and waiting for security to make the long trips up to the room. We moved down 3 floors which was a bit better and managed to get sleep for the remaining 2 nights (was there 7 nights in all). We found the hotel staff really pleasant and helping. They understood about the noise as they do receive complaints from those who live at the hotel (timeshare) and we were really pleased with how efficient they were. As mentioned before, the pool area is lovely, although the pool bar is a little on the expensive side for a small can of beer. You can take in your own water, but not alcohol or food. Also, the pool opens at 9am and shuts at 6pm. The hotel do close the pool if they dont think the weather is right which was annoying as sometimes it would have been nice to sit outside for some fresh air instead of the air con. By going outside it didnt mean we were going to get in the pool but the staff wont let anyone outside even to use the jaccuzzi/hot tub. The rooms were lovely, big comfortable beds but the showers were not all the powerful. Seemed to take forever to wash out shampoo. The baths are jacuzzi but make sure the water is filled way above the jets before turning it on! Lol. Floor to ceiling windows, big tv's so would have made a very lovely stay if not the for noise. Free safe too which is a bonus! Get a fridge, miscrowave, coffee machine, toaster, plates, glasses, cutlery and dishwasher so we had breakfast in our room every morning which was nice. All in all, I think this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ONCE AGAIN EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: sdadmun
Reviews.Content: Lets begin with the first disappointment.. - I went when they first opened with a bunch of girlfriends for our first trip to VEGAS! However upon arrival there was 2 desk agents behind the counter so checkin took an ENTIRE HOUR!...all i wanted to do was get in our room change and get back down to the casinos...that wasnt happening very quickly. When arriving to the room we were very surprised of the 2 bedroom suite we booked. Very big and inviting. The LONG walk from the hotel to the actual strip was pretty annoying, but after we got the hang of it it was not so bad. The gigantic MOTHS in our guestroom after a night out was not what we expected when returning to our room after a late night out. When I called down to the front desk i was transferred about 8 times until I finally got someone who offered breakfast for us in the AM and to have someone from HSKP to come up.....Very nice I thought, but when the HSKP never came my frustration level continued. For the remainder of my evening my girlfriends and I spent our time killing bugs....GREAT VACA RIGHT!...Next morning we woke up very early to walk around and really absorb all of Vegas..upon returning to our room once again probably about 6pm to get ready for the evening we walk into an UNMADE ROOM...no beds made, no towels replenishe, and just an overall disgrace of service. We called down yet again to have someone come up. Fed up at this point that while I am trying to get ready I have a HSKP walking around trying to clean which should have been done hours ago.....Pretty much how the rest of the weekend continued....After all of this we received a COMP night back good for a year... - YEAR later arrives and I think lets try this place again with the BF..maybe it was opening year and they just went through some issues....My issues started at bookings. It took about 20 emails and 5 calls to the west coast to actually finalize this booking. The person I was speaking to would never return my emails or calls and at one point it was an absolute joke...After almost a month of trying to book a 2 night stay I finally got everything in order. Upon arrival at 12MIDNIGHT to las vegas checking in was once again another joke....The desk person DID NOT HAVE A ROOM FOR ME...he had my booking just did not have a room immediately available...R U KIDDING...it is midnight and i have flown all night and this is what I walk into. About 30 min later is when I finally got my room...(there was notes on my reservation for having an bad stay prior, but you think they gave a crap...NOPE) About 5 min into the room we receive a call from the desk person saying the manager would like to see me if I had a chance to welcome me...I though ok let them redeem themselves....So as I walked down to the lobby again to head to the casino i waited at the front desk for about another 30min until the manager came out....she shook my hand and said how may I help you?????? WHAT!!!!!! You called me here....the manager basically had no idea why i was there...yet again terrible service.... I have written so much I wont bore you anymore, but the checkout was even more horrific on this stay..... Put it this way...my last night in Vegas my Bf and I moved over to the Encore and experienced and amazing hotel with incredible service....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vegas041610
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. We were a group of three staying in a one bedroom suite. The rooms are very nice, loaded with 3 big plasma tv's and one small one in the bathroom. Also there is floor to ceiling window that turns into a huge tv when you close the curtains. It has a kitchen but some items were missing when we checked in. Called room service and they delivered the missing items quickle. Daily housekeeping. Short walk through the mall to reach the casino, roughly 2-3 minutes. Very nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: rory5
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed with this hotel more like Planet Grottywood dark and dingy bedroom poor lighting,cheap prints from the 1980,s , bedroom needed a good dusting , brownie points for the bed linen changed regularely.After an 11 hour flight we could have done with a good night,s sleep instead we were subjected to all night cacophony outside our room teenagers making noise till early hours of the morning was threatening. The security guards only seem to be bothered with what goes on in the casino. Take a good pair of walking shoes as it will take a long time to get in or out of the hotel always leading you thro the casino.beware of the booths with free show tickets they are TIME SHARE salespeople!! Plus points were the Circus Soliel show O at the Bellagio and the trips with Scenic Tours to the Grand Canyon , warning if you are 19stone plus its double the price on the plane and its very cramped . OK for a short break ie 5days

Reviews.Title: “quiet haven mid week party central at weekends”
Reviews.Author: maggiethetraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from Ph towers yesterday Beautiful Studio on the 6th floor Alonzo at front desk there when we checked in which was swift and effortlessRoom lovely partial strip view partial mountain view could see planes helicopters taking off in the distance and could see the monorail room had all we needed bed very high feet dangling if I sat on it . Vegas a bit of a shock to the senses but ph towers was aquiet haven to come back too until Friday Spring break towers filled up and it was Party central all weekend then it went back to being a peaceful haven Shops on the doorstep especially ABC stores very useful Went several trips with Avatar tours Grand canyon Valley of Fire and Los Angeles all drivers/guides friendly and Knowledgeable and the cost was great value check them out The valet station at Ph towers was easy to get too for pick up for the tours and the valets were all great guys very impressed with them all Overall our trip to Vegas was a success due to ph Towers its comfort and location and Avatar tours for the trips

Reviews.Title: “Great View and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sheriff598
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great stay for the price. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and had a wonderful view. The location is in the center of the strip and close to nearly everything. The rooms are very modern and make a great place for the after party.

Reviews.Title: “Fab room”
Reviews.Author: kimbo25
Reviews.Content: Had a two bed suite on the 55th floor. The views were great. Both sides you have views of the strip. you either face MGM and Mandalay bay area, or The Ballagio etc. The room was cleaned each day and had no problems. The beds are VERY comfy! There is no casino, but you are never far from one. The hotel is attatched to the Mall, so restaurants and bars are not a problem to find. I really recommend this hotel if you are travelling with friends as the lounge area in the room is perfect for pre-going out drinks and early morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Maiemi
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for spring Break 2011 good value for money right on the strip, nice but room service very bad in 4 day s nobody ever answare to' my call.

Reviews.Title: “Does the trick.”
Reviews.Author: colinstacktroost
Reviews.Content: Modern, roomy suites with westward views and a great pool make this hotel a great choice for people looking for a good deal. The service was fantastic and while I had absolutely no complaints, I did feel that the hotel was missing the quintessential Vegas-ness that many of the other hotels are able to offer. PHT will not disappoint, especially when they have some amazing deals, but people looking for a place with more Vegas energy would be better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed at Mandalay Bay..DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: sla315
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I spent over $1300 for two nights to stay in a dirty 2BR suite. Countertops were not cleaned, towels were left on the floor. I called guest services twice to have one of the beds made. No one ever came so essentially I slept in a dirty room for two nights. I was granted a late checkout and twenty minutes after when I had not left the housekeeping supervisor enters the room to essentially escort me out while I'm dressing. The director of PH Towers told I will not get any of my money refunded, gave me a fake V.P. name, threatened to hang up on me, insinuated that I lied when I told her I contacted guest services TWICE about the unmade bed and said that a late checkout is their standard solution for the experience that I had. For the money I paid here I should have went elsewhere. Oh and they CHARGE you to use their business center!! What a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Turned out to be a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: southernoregoniangp
Reviews.Content: Checked in March 17, 2011. We needed a one-night stay in Vegas before we got into our condo at the Grand Chateau Marriott so thought we would splurge and stay at Planet Hollywood Westgate. It was somewhere we had always wanted to stay. Got there about 9:00 pm. No valet parking available. Room was on top floor (56th) so view was awesome and at first glance thought it was going to be great. However, dishes seemed dirty. Two different rooms had parties until 3:00 am in morning. Then, to top it off, about 5:00 am heard the walkie/talkies of the staff going off. At about 5:30 am cleaning staff started vacuuming the room next door!!! Check out time was 11:00 am and when called to see if we could get a later checkout time due to the fact that we had gotten very little sleep the night before was told no. Complained to the desk clerk when checked out but didn't seem to get much response. Staff wasn't very friendly or helpful. On the other hand, experience at the Grand Chateau Marriott has been completely opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but service needs some fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: Luckybeckyblue
Reviews.Content: My sister has a time share at PH towers. She invited us to share her two bedroom suite. These are, I believe, the same rooms that are available to tourists who are just visiting and don't have a time share. The towers are very conveniently located -- connected to the PH mall and immediately adjacent to the garage. It is a very short walk to the casino. The V Theater, which hosts many shows, is only a 2-3 minute walk. Very close, easy access to City Center, Paris and Bellagio. M&M store, Walgreens, half price ticket broker, and restaurants are just a short walk south on the Strip. The rooms have great views and floor-to-ceiling windows. Awesome! There is very comfortable furniture including sofas that fold out into beds. My sister's room included a fully equipped kitchen (full size appliances, dishes, dinner table seating for 6), plus living room, and bedroom with large whirlpool tub, separate bath with washer/dryer, shower, large vanity. Our room (which can be booked separately as a king hotel room, or as a second bedroom to the suite) included a small kitchenette with microwave, mini frig, coffemaker, blender, dishes, plus a comfortable sofa, desk and chair. Housekeeping was lacking. Maybe just because this was a time share, I dunno. But we had no housekeeping service for the first 3 days. Ran out of toilet paper, coffee packets, soap, etc, and our trash was beginning to overflow. On the fourth day, our room was made up . Sheets were not changed, just made up. Used towels were replaced. The carpet was not vacuumed. A malfunctioning lamp, which we reported, was not fixed during our stay. The deadbolt on our door was broken. The closet door didn't slide properly and emitted a horrendous screech every time we opened or closed it. We were disappointed to experience these problems in a fairly new property. They charge $10 a day for wi-fi. Bummer. Nevertheless, it is a great center strip location, gorgeous floor-to-ceiling views, spacious rooms, bed was excellent -- comfortable, and lots of pillows. I'd stay again, but I hope management will work on their attention to detail and making sure housekeeping services are improved.

Reviews.Title: “Expections were met!”
Reviews.Author: bandersh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas with our two daughters ages 22 and 19. The hotel is very impressive with it's 56 floors. Upon arrival I was asked if I wanted to upgrade our rooms and be on a higher floor with a better view of the strip. I said yes. We stayed on the 54th floor in a one bedroom suite with an adjoining studio suite for our girls. We had an excellent view of the strip! The rooms were perfect! The girls could shut their door and have privacy when they needed it and we could all hang out in the living room and kitchen together when we wanted to do that. Kitchen, living room, and flat screen TVs in every room (even the Master bathroom). The master bedroom where my husband and I stayed had a jacuzzi and master bathroom had a large shower area. There was also a washer/dryer unit in the master bath. The king size beds were really comfortable. The kitchen had a tall table with 6 chairs, a microwave, coffee pot, a stove top, dishwasher, and refrigerator with water and ice maker. There were plates, cups, glasses, silverware and a few knives for chopping food. The Miracle Mile Shops connect PH Towers and Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino so you can go to the ABC Store in the Miracle Mile Shops and buy fruit, salads, sandwiches, burritos, beverages, etc. if you want to eat a meal or two in your room. We took Gray Line transportation to the hotel but we took a taxi back to the airport. I would recommend using a taxi for the entire transfer. You have to pay for the internet if you want that. The pool area was nice. This hotel sits behind Planet Hollywood Resort and you have to walk through the Miracle Mile Shops to get to the strip but it's no big deal. I liked being on the strip but not having all the noise from the strip. The only thing we heard while in the hotel were sirens coming from the outside. I didn't hear any other noise from any of the other rooms. And we were there during spring break! We loved it and would stay there again! It is a time share hotel so you need to know that - you'll be asked to become an owner. We are not owners and we do not have a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: inkedearbuds
Reviews.Content: This place is situated right behind Planet Hollywood and is literally in the center of the Strip. It's convenient to every place you would want to be. There is a bus stop at the Paris next door to Planet Hollywood if you care to explore other areas of the Strip. The dining inside is great, and the casino is the most laid back of them all. The staff were super friendly, and we never had a problem with getting anything fixed. The tub in the room was a little wonky the first night, and the front desk had it fixed for us by dinner time. We ordered room service a couple times, and it was prompt and tasty. At night, it's easy to sleep because you don't have all the noise of the Strip right up on your window. I would most definitely stay here again. We had a 1BR suite, and it was just awesome; especially if you're traveling with a group and want to do pre-drinks in the hotel room. There's a shop that serves booze and snacks in the hotel lobby, so you have everything at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back forsure”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaGirl
Reviews.Content: The girls and I had a fabulous time a the PH. Food, drinks and shopping what more could a girl ask for LOL. Room was clean and comfy!!!! and the Toykeo Teas were YUMMO pool side. We will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room”
Reviews.Author: Sweex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010 when on a one month road trip. Last minute we thought we’d stay in Vegas for one night and found a good deal on PH Towers on a third party website. There’s free parking which was great, but it was confusing as to exactly what direction we needed to head in to find the arrivals desk as the place is huge and signs misleading. We arrived late at about 1am and unfortunately had to wait quite a while until the room was available as apparently they hadn’t received confirmation from the website about our booking, although I had a reference available for them. Understandably, not what you need when you’ve been driving all day. It is a long walk from the car park from the room and the foyer was vast and noisy but guess that’s Vegas. No smoking throughout which although I understand, it would have been nice if they had at least a few smoking rooms available to cater for all guests. Major trek to go out to find somewhere appropriate to have a smoke. The best part about the place was the most important, e.g. room. We were on a high floor and were very pleased when walking in as the room was amazing- incredibly well appointed, comfortable and glamorous. The décor was cool, bathroom awesome and there was a red leather sofa and kitchen area, which was great. Our room had a wonderful view of the city and we could see the airport from our room which we really liked. Overall. a truly fabulous and cool room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: murmess
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place that's centrally on the strip then this is as good as any hotel. It's got great sized rooms (especially if you're going with a large group and need space but also want to keep the group together) and everything you need can be found on the miracle mile strip which you get access to from the hotel's lobby. Loved the ease of going downstairs and being able to walk to restaurants/shops/bars but also appreciated the fact that the Towers had no casino and pretty tranquil compared to the other hotels on the strip that were more active with gambling and crowds. I'd give the hotel a solid 8/10 and location 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Long Walk”
Reviews.Author: LeftNWrite
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing! The moment we walked in, the motion sensor set off the automated blinds and the room was filled with natural light. The view was a little disappointing as we were facing the west and we got a view of a parking lot and the back of the Paris from the living area. The view from the bedroom was better, with a view of Henderson, but no glitzy Las Vegas lights. Very nice bedding and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on in a long time (which was excellent, since I threw out my back during the trip). The bathroom was very nice, with a very deep tub with a set of jets. The kitchenette was very nice but a little dark. We only stayed a single night so we didn't have much of a chance to use anything, but all the dishes were nice and clean. There's a nice looking pool next to the check-in counter, but we didn't end up swimming that trip. The whole lobby has a very nice ambiance that is stylish rather than classic. My one complaint about our stay was that we had to walk from the check-in desk at Planet Hollywood Hotel to the check-in desk for Planet Hollywood Towers, which was a pretty good distance when you're carrying luggage. The staff were very nice, we just got misdirected by a valet who thought we wanted something else. Security was also very nice when they let us back into our room after check-out, as I thought I left my iPod in the room. Would stay here again if it weren't so pricey now. We got a special deal because the towers were new. But if you're willing to pay, definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but”
Reviews.Author: AngelBears
Reviews.Content: PH Towers Westgate We arrived at about 1am on the morning of the 18th Feb 2011 for a nine night stay and were instantly upgraded which was a nice welcome because we didn't do anything to expect it.  The room was on the 26th floor and was North/east facing, about midway up and at the back of the tower but we still had a view of the Paris Eiffel tower and even the Bellagio fountains and were fortunate with this kind of view I think. The rooms were clean when we got there and were kept clean by the maids throughout the stay. We were happy enough with the rooms for what we paid for.  The front desk wasn't a great help, rarely saw anyone at the concierge desk if you needed anything. When we asked for the best way to get to the outlet malls we were told by taxis but choosing that option would have been about $50 each way and when we found out there was an express bus right outside that would take us there for $7 each return we were shocked at why they wouldn't suggest that to us. Taxis by the way are extortionate in Las Vegas, especially in the evenings  The location was very good, no more than $15.00 from the airport including tip which in moderate traffic is about 10-15min drive. Our top tips: 1. Take the express bus located right in front of the Paris/Bellagio to take you up and down the strip. It's final destination is at the cloths outlets on either end, this is the best way to travel on a budget. 2. Enjoy the Bellagio fountains over a meal in KOI Japanese restaurant, access through the casino in PH. You can request the seats if you get there early or make reservations. 3. $1 blackjack and roulette only in the Sahara, expect to pay minimum $5 anywhere else on the strip. 4. You can get free shows if you are approached by the timeshare guys in PH miracle mile shopping center. You can bargain for the shows you want, really push them, and all you have to do is spend 90mins viewing a couple of there properties. Handy if you're on a budget... 5. There's free wifi in the restaurant Ocean One located in the miracle mile shops. There isn't free wifi in the towers but the price isn't too bad,  just remember to only use one device or you'll be charged for any extra that you hookup.  We had great weather on the strip until the last couple of days when it got really windy and cold but no rain. We flew to the south rim for the day which was absolutely bitter cold but beautiful and enjoyed fantastic weather at the hoover dam on another day.  We would recommend it for it's value but overall it's not the best quality inside, certain elements brought the place down but because it's all so new, it can get away with it but I'd say that the rooms are not going to age very well! Already our bath was falling apart, the toilet didn't work great and the table was very flimsy. The bed and couch were very nice though, which are two important elements for a comfortable stay and the massive windows they have installed provide marvelous views and plenty of light.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels on the strip!!! Will def. stay again”
Reviews.Author: matthew92595
Reviews.Content: Was Hesistant at first when I booked this hotel because of some of the bad reviews. But I got a great deal on a one bedroom and for the price I could not pass it up. And it turned out to be a great decision. Got to the hotel a few hours early and they happily checked us into our hotel room early.. there was no wait to check in and for only $10/night they upgraded us to an upper floor and we had a great view. The room was amazing and especially for three young guys it was an awesome room to have a party in because of the full kitchen. Our kitchen was fully stocked with dishes and utensils and even a blender. The room was very clean and the bathroom was huge and included a washer/dryer which came in handy. The living room had a very comfortable large couch that was also a fold out bed. I know some of the reviews said they didnt clean the rooms but ours was cleaned every day of our trip. Also we called down to the front desk a few times for extra things and they were so helpful and nice and responded very fast. The room is quite amazing and has huge speakers and curtains that are automatic. There are tvs everywhere and I think we counted 5 total in our room. We had a view of the strip and at night it was amazing. We loved the location of the hotel because it conncects to the miracle mile shops and is right in the middle of the strip which is convenient. The beds were very comfortable even the fold out one in the couch. We had three guys in a one bedroom and there was plenty of room. The bathroom had a huge granite stone shower and seperate area for the toilet. The room had mirrors everywhere which was very helpful when your trying to get ready. Parking was very close, just park on the 3rd level as that connects you right into the hotel. Overall our experiece was one of the best I have ever had in Vegas and will definately stay at this hotel again especially for the price. Its totally worth it and the rooms are so awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wretched Service and Filth”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravler0000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased a one week stay w/ PH Towers after attending a Timeshare meeting a year ago. When we arrived to our room we discovered that it was filthy. There was rotten food in the frig. Hair in the tub and old soap in the bathroom. We complained of course, and had to wait an hour before a housekeeping supervisor approved our room change. The next room was also Filthy. Long Hair was every where. We finally had some success w/ our 3rd room although we had to have the jacuzzi cleaned because there was dirt in it. Whenever we needed pots or towels it was a two hour wait. I even had a house keeper refuse to come get my towels. I was instructed to leave my wet, dirty towels out in the hallway. The gym is beautiful but has no security. Any one can access the elevators since there is NO SECURITY! Usually the person bringing your supplies had an attitude. Despite filling out Several complaint cards no complaints were addressed. Remember, these peolple are trying to sell us a time share. The accommodations looked beautiful but the stay was horrendous. We spent the next week at the Vdara and Loved it! We Also Love the Venetian. My advise DON’T DO IT! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice new hotel, mostly good, some bad. . .”
Reviews.Author: jsn550
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of January. On our previous stay in Las Vegas, we were suckered into attending a Westgate Resorts Timeshare presentation and actually enjoyed it. . . we bought a Vacation Traveler Package which is basically a trial run to see if you'd like a time share. We thought it would be fun to stay in this hotel with our timeshare since it is brand new. Because of this, we were treated like owners, which I think is where you get treated better. We were allowed to check into our 1 bedroom suite about 3 hours early, which was great. First impressions of the room were great. It was very modern with many amenities that were excellent and that we didn't expect. The blinds are all automatic and the living room window converts to a movie screen with projector. . .it would have been even better if there was a DVD player hooked up to it. . . The kitchen was fully stocked with all the dishes we would need. The bed was great and the jacuzzi tub was awesome. Because it's a time share, housekeeping doesn't come everyday, at least that's what we were told, the truth is, we were there for 3 nights and housekeeping didn't come at all. Our garbages were overflowing and we ran out of clean towels. The suite had a washer/dryer machine in it which we used but it really didn't work very well and none of our clothes would dry properly. There is a large block of elevators that are super fast. We were on the 34th floor so we took the first set of elevators. They were actually very scary. For a brand new hotel, the elevators made all sorts of creaking and weird noises that made you think it was going to plummet at any given moment. They also went so fast and stopped so fast that it felt like you were going to vommit nearly every time. . . not so nice. By the end of our trip we were just grateful that we wouldn't have to ride those elevators again. We were told that, because of the vacation package we were on, we'd have to meet quickly to sign a paper saying if we wanted to buy a timeshare or not. They said it would be a quick "yes or no" answer. Up to this meeting, they treated us like royalty but we were in no position to actually buy a timeshare. We went to this meeting where they repeatedly pressured us for about an hour and a half until we nearly stormed out of the room. The timeshare price went from over $100K down to $6K. Pretty funny! They even got rude with us after a while. . . I don't even know how many times I actually said no in that meeting. . .it was a lot. So after wasting a bunch of our time we finally got out of there. They stopped treating us like royalty and our view of the hotel changed at that point. We realized that it really wasn't for us. It was nice that it was non smoking and non gaming. The location, connected to the miracle mile shops, was also really convenient. The hotel room was way too big for 2 people to stay in. It would have been better suited to a group of people. We spent most of our time in the bedroom part (which is actually the size of a normal hotel room). I would recommend this hotel to groups of people who need lots of space. If you were going to party in your room, then this would be great since there was a fridge, sink, cups, etc. We won't stay here again. There are lots of great hotels in Vegas for cheaper than this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: 911_Mommy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed January 31st - February 4th, 2011. We loved it! There were only 2 problems. The employees trying to sell time shares and the horribly stiff bed. We were asked EVERY time we walked through the lobby (no way around it) if we were staying there by employees attempting to sell time shares. It made us uncomfortable, but we ignored them and kept walking every time. The bed didn't have a comforter, so until I noticed the blanket in the closet, I froze. Also, the bed was so hard that we slept terribly the entire vacation. The good points...LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! Mid-strip is the best! You do have to walk through the Miracle Mile, but it's short and totally worth it. In fact, we enjoyed walking through it each day to the strip, casino or restaurants. It was nice to be so close to an ABC store, too! Our room was modern, fun and had amazing views! We were facing the north side of the strip and had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. We had booked the studio suite thinking it was just one room, but it wasn't. We had a living room with a couch, large tv, closet and kitchen. In the bedroom we had a king size bed, large tv, hot tub, mirrored closet doors (helpful!) and large bathroom. The shower was a stall, but beautiful with glass tiles all around and a wonderful rainfall showerhead. There were two doors to the bathroom accessed from the living room and bedroom. The roll down window shades were great blackout curtains and I loved that they were set to a control on the wall. We loved the Planet Hollywood Casino. The ambiance, the people, the machines, the staff, etc. were great! As for food, I would absolutely recommend Earl of Sandwich. Our favorite new fast and easy restaurant in Vegas. Planet Dailies was ok, but I wouldn't recommend it. Our favorite slushy is in the Miracle Mile at the taco place and they'll refill ANY cup. Try the Moonshine. The pool and hot tub were closed, but it was WAY too cold to enjoy the pool anyway. The hot tub would have been nice, though. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “PH Westgate Towers WAS Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeniapa
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying in this hotel, because of some bad reviews, boy were those people wrong. We came up the escalator to the lobby wer immediately greeted and directed to the front desk. We were able to check into our one bedroom suite 5 hours early. The suite was fantastic I could not have been happier. The TV projects onto the floor to ceiling windows providing a fantastic way to watch the Superbowl!!!! The bed was great, the full size stainless steel fridge provided convenience, we were able to go the the ABC store in the Miracle Mile shops and buy some Diet Coke and beer to have readily available!!! The casino is nice I love the Miracle Mile shops they provide cheap eats (Pampas steak house offers a fantastic steak and egg breakfast for $5.99. Earl of Sandwich is great for a late night snack!!!! This place is incredible, great location in the middle of it all on the strip!!! I cannot imagine staying anywhere else!!! I LOVED IT

Reviews.Title: “They've got work to do”
Reviews.Author: Sistahdreamer
Reviews.Content: Eight family members arrived late Sunday, January 23, 2011. My brother has a timeshare with Harrah’s and this is one of their properties. He actually owns a 2 bedroom but got it upgraded to 4 since he was bringing along his siblings and nieces. Driving in to Las Vegas at night is exciting with all the lights coming at you. We left our car with the valet in the garage and headed to the check-in. This went smoothly and we were advised as to how the Towers worked. The room is initially clean and it will not be cleaned again for 4 days but if you need anything, like more towels, just let housekeeping know. Our suite was at the end of a very long hallway on the 35th floor. The 2 bedroom suite has 2 other rooms that adjoined to it. Opening these rooms made the suite a total of 4 bedrooms. One was a standard room with a pull out couch and the other adjoining room was a one bedroom studio which had a sitting room with it. All in all we had plenty of space for 8 people. The main room in the suite was decorated. Red, white and black with a Marilyn Monroe motif, which included floor to ceiling windows, a projector and screen for your viewing pleasure with a fully appointed kitchenette. The long sofa in the room was red leather. Not quite my taste, but as my family kept reminding me, ‘this is Las Vegas, and everything is over the top’. We were told during out trip that we had over 2,500 square feet of space with all the rooms we had attached. I will admit, we were not climbing over each other with 4 bedrooms and 4 bathrooms. But that’s where the fun ended. The room was dirty and dusty. I believe nobody had stayed in these rooms for weeks. The automatic shades in one room were not working. It actually took engineering to have to come to take the device apart to get it to work. You don’t want the early morning light coming into your floor to ceiling windows in the morning. The night we checked in we had 3 maintenance people in the room. Housekeeping needed to come to supply soap, towels, sheets for the pull-out sofas and toilet paper. Slow drains and standing water in sinks needed cleaning. Dust was everywhere and it appears that the last people who stayed in the room were part of a golf tournament, evidenced by the 2 golf balls that were under chairs when we got there and remained there upon our departure. We were promised that housekeeping would come and clean but they never did. Other than the room itself, the hotel was a fun place to stay. It was connected to the Miracle Mile Shops and the Casino and we barely spent much time in the room. The Concierge was helpful and there were plenty of places to eat. After a while you got annoyed making the walk from the Towers to the Casino. It get’s tiresome. Would I recommend this place? I’m not sure yet, we have lodged our complaint and am awaiting its resolution.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: PhilipWei
Reviews.Content: Not sure what a few people here are complaining about. When I went here I had a great stay. I will start with us first off having a terrible travel time with Allegiant Air and a whole gong show of mechanical issues with the plane having to be redirected and having to return to GFK and losing a day. However it got better. Once we arrived at PH Towers at the downstairs valet to the hotel sure enough there were the prostitutes there, but not a one of them said a word or annoyed us our entire stay. It seems security might have been around a bit more as my girlfriend was asked at one point to show her keycard to security to verify she was staying there which is a plus since it meant they were cleaning it up a bit. Anyways, where was I. When we got to the desk we explained our joyful begining of the trip to our deskman and he gladly upgraded us free of charge to the 56th floor 1 bedroom suite vs the regular room we were otherwise getting. The view was quite nice and we got to see half the bellagio fountains which was better than the alternative which would have been overlooking the parking lot and been a terrible view. While we were there housekeeping asked us a couple times if we wanted more towels and what not but we declined and were content simply having it uncleaned for the 4 days we were staying there. As for cleanliness the rooms were clean and we had no issues, but for a single day there was an odd odor almost like a mildly backed up toilet. Not entirely sure what the hell it was, but the smell was gone the next day. Also in addition to this one night while we were trying to get back up to our room on the last night we stayed the hotel elevators stopped working for whatever reason for about 10 minutes. Not sure what happened but we were able to catch it from the 2nd floor (3rd on the elevator listing, banquet/convention floor) Other than those two little issues I would say it was a great stay and because of it and its perfect location would very likely stay again. And being the second time I have stayed in Vegas this beat my previous stay at the MGM by a mile. There is an entirely different story but would not recommend MGM

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrispmoto
Reviews.Content: Great location, parking was great (dont listen to the people who said bad parking, they didnt know where the parking is). A few small glitches, but all was handled quickly, had equal problems in other places too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suite!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaChinoHills
Reviews.Content: I had read the mixed reviews before we stayed and was a little nervouse because my husband and my friend's husband can be really picky..... Well, it didn't start exactly perfect. The valet parking was "full" so we had to park our own car which is not a big deal specially since the parking garage is attached to the lobby entrance and if you get a good spot is actually just as close or closer than using the valet. The problem was we had about 6 bags that we had to carry in ourselves..... But this is as far as any dissapointment came in. There was no line to check in and it only took a minute. Then we were off to our 2 bedroom suite. It was only on the 6th floor which I thought would be a boring view, but it wasn't. When we walked in we couldn't believe the room, it is amazing and huge with two separate bedrooms and the view!!! Floor to Ceiling Windows in every room overlooking the pool!!! We all travel a lot and we all agreed that this is the best room we've ever stayed at. We loved it. So we got the guys to start unpacking and me and my friend walked downstairs to look for the ABC Store I had read about here because we wanted to get some snacks, alcohol and drinks. Well the ABC store is in the mall that is actually attached to the lobby of the hotel (no walking outside). It was literally a 2 to 3 minute walk and they have everything there and the prices are reasonable (750 ml Sky Vodka for $19.99, pretty good). Well, that's when I realized, if I forgot earrings or shoes, I can just walk downstairs and buy anything I need from this huge mall not to mention endless food selection and entertainment. Definitely one of the best Vegas stays!

Reviews.Title: “Rent out of tiny Condo rooms they can't sell”
Reviews.Author: jonwiggs
Reviews.Content: The PH Towers is different from the main location. If you book here prepare to park in their "Mall" parking and hoof your own luggage for 15 minutes just to get to the check in desk, the lobby of which is right in the mall. They do have Valet parking for the Towers, but only 80 parking spaces for all 1200 rooms as the Valet told us; it's full 24 hours a day. They over charged me twice, and the desk never answered the phone in the evenings if you need anything. The recorded message tells you to check the hotels reference book in the room. Guess what, they don't have one, something an associate at the lobby desk admitted to me later. There was 1 roll of TP in the whole room for our two day stay, still no one answering the front desk phone or operator line. Having to pay to use the internet for each day and each device is real nickle and dime crap. Overall the rooms are nice, I can't complain about that. However, the management does not have it's SHI* together at all. And your hounded right in the lobby when you leave and enter about attending their sales presentations to buy a condo there. Honestly this place seems like a vehicle to make some cash and use as a high pressure sales vehicle because they can't sell their damn condos.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A TOTAL RIPOFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: RtstcGtrst
Reviews.Content: First off, I booked the 1 bedroom suite well over a month ahead of time. I was really excited, especially since it was a beautiful room and it was under a promotion price for only $205 for the night. WELL, when me and my mom went to check-in, they ended up telling me that the room wasn't even available. Like, WTF, I booked this thing A MONTH ahead of time!!! And you're telling me it's not available?! And so, they ended up downgrading our room and giving us a "free buffet" to make up for it. We went to the room and it was SO MUCH SMALLER than the room I paid for. Not to mention, we had a wonderful view of... THE PARKING GARAGE. I was SO disappointed. It was almost impossible to use my cell phone in that place since there was absolutely no service. It's like they do that to make you use their in-room phone and get charged for it. Oh, the lock to the bathroom was broken, and I had to fix it myself. Later that night, I had a few friends come over for a few hours. We had drinks and wanted some ice. Our floor didn't have any. Apparently, we found out we had to go to the 5th floor just to get some ice...FAIL. Around 12am, either security or the manager came in to kick all my friends out since our music was loud. Well, wtf, the least they could do is WARN US and tell us to turn it down instead of straight up kick them out. A few minutes later, OUT OF NO WHERE, the guy tells me and my cousin we're getting evicted. WOW. What a waste of money!!! OVER NOTHING!!! The next day, guess what? I was charged a HUGE bill. Apparently, the table was broken in the room and we were charged... $900?!?! A TABLE IS NOT WORTH THAT MUCH. 3 days later, they charged my card another $300 with no reason as to what the heck they kept charging me allll that money for. Such a waste of money and my time. Never even got that "free buffet" since they never even told us how to get it. ugh. I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE AGAIN AND I SUGGEST YOU DON'T EITHER.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay, few flaws”
Reviews.Author: vettegirl1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on location and price. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite for $30 a night a true bargain. We were put on the top 56th floor looking at the strip and eiffel tower. The room was huge with a full service kitchen, hot tube,and movie projector. Overall the room was very hip and modern. The furniture in the place looks great, but is very cheap when you really look at it closely. The water pressure was very very low in the shower. The washer/dryer was a nightmare to use and didn't even dry our clothes properly. Also the cabinet fell off the hinges for the washer and dryer. The bed did not have comforter, just a blanket and sheet so we were pretty cold at night. The location is excellent as you walk right into the miracle mile shops, and the lobby is beautiful. Overall it was a nice experience, but would only stay here if I had the one bedroom suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything, but poor communication”
Reviews.Author: kimchicowboy
Reviews.Content: The ph towers westgate was a great value and a great location. I booked a studio suite for $109/night, which was the best price for a 4.5 star hotel on the strip. First, I took a red eye flight and arrived at the hotel at 7:30am. They were great and allowed me to check in immediately. Second, I asked what upgrades were available, and a larger studio suite with a separate living room and jetted tub was only $10/night more. totally worth it! Third, it was super clean and the staff was very friendly. The only bad part was getting the buffet of buffet deal too work. Upon check in, the front desk staff rolf me how to get it. Later that evening, I called the front desk to confirm the information. My pay of 4 take a can to the rio and turns out that both staff at the ph towers gave me the wrong info. w head back later and I talk to another man at the front desk. He tells me I got the wrong info and told me how to get the deal. Turns out he was wrong, too. Luckily, things worked out, but it was a big hassle at each buffet we went to. Other than that, my group loved the hotel and I did really well on their black jack tables!

Reviews.Title: “decent location, nice size room, bad maid and desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Jarred W
Reviews.Content: The location was good. The room size was awesome, and a great value overall for the price. And, even though the lobby always seemed busy and full of crowds, the room was completely quiet. However, the people at the front desk were just weird, and the maid staff came late and couldn't even figure out how to open the door (we were happening to walk back to the room around 3pm when she was trying to get in). Oh, and the giant sexy jacuzzi tub (which was right in the room) was broke.

Reviews.Title: “True Vegas High Rolling”
Reviews.Author: sillyamiga
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom suite on the upper floors overlooking the strip. We were lucky enough to get a view of part of the Bellagio fountains. I'm still in awe of our room! Full kitchen, washer & dryer, dishwasher. Projector screen on the windows that double as shaded. Unique furniture. Hot tub in room. Giant bathrooms w/shower and toilet separated. Definitely stay again. Valet service excellent at getting you a good deal on transportation. Connection to Miracle Mall Shops was great! Little disappointed in Concierge - limited in how much they'll do for you or get you deals. Disliked having to pay for internet or having a free business center.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Bad Reviews - Stay Here! you wont be sorry!!”
Reviews.Author: erwk05
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in PH towers 2 bedroom suite for 6 days over new years period. I was initially concerned about staying here after reading some of the other reviews, we had tried to call earlier to request a higher room as we wanted to be able to see the fireworks for new years. We were told we would have to wait until checkin to see what was available. We got a room about half way up on 25th floor the room was everything I expected and more. It was a notch below our skylofts experience for a much smaller price tag. we hd 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms a large lounge with projector, full kitchen, dining room a laundry in the main bathroom (took us a while to find it). we found it to be a great size for two couples. There were only a few down sides but bthey were only minute. The first was the scary lifts as mentioned in prior reviews, none of us ever had a problem with the lifts but they did sound scary and were often out of order – our first time in the lift the alarm was going!!! The second was a loose cable on the back of the sound system in the room, meaning sound would cut in an out at times, although alot of the time we just used the tvs in our own rooms anyway. The timeshare people are at the information desk – they tried to collar us with the promise of free show tickets but we knew it was timeshare presentation so we just said no thankyou and we had no other problems. There are no bellboys etc at this hotel as they are part owned apartments but that didnt really worry us. I would definitely recommend PH Towers to anyone, its nice and close to everything on the strip but not noisy like the strip hotels can be. Ignore the bad reviews and go here you wont be sorry :)

Reviews.Title: “The best for the money, for sure”
Reviews.Author: mrcoury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, the rooms are super good and quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great View!”
Reviews.Author: bssskins
Reviews.Content: The prior reviews pretty much said it all. We paid $148 a night for a suite on the 53rd floor on a Friday and Saturday night. As far as I can tell that's a great deal in Vegas! There was no line to check in, we actually got into our room early, about noon on a Friday. Noticed no smells or any problems in the corridors. Everything seemed new and modern. The TV projecting on the blinds was way cool as was the two person jacuzzi. Also, only had one lady at a desk ask if we would like to talk to her about something (timeshare I'm sure) but we just said no thank you and didn't even slow down. Other than that, no hassles. It was nice being attached to the mall, lots of eating options and we bought drinks that the ABC store to keep in the room. Beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GoLeafsGO2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, clean and most of all, smoke free as there is no casino attached to it. The rooms are modern and clean. The only drawback was that the beds and pillows were not the most comfortable that I have ever slept on. The service was good and the staff very polite. I would definitely go back to this hotel. There was no free Wi-Fi, would would have been a bonus but there seems to be no free wi-fi in Las Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone that doesn't like these suites is crazy!”
Reviews.Author: EricS12610
Reviews.Content: I've come to Trip Advisor many times over the years but have never posted anything. I felt inclined to do so this time after our recent trip to the PH Towers after reading some of the past reviews. I'll cut to the chase... I live in Southern California and come to Vegas 7-10 times a year and have stayed in almost every big hotel in the city. We LOVED the PH Towers! The 2-bedroom suite was awesome. Incredible views, great beds, tons of space, great showers and tubs...and the 8+ foot HDTV was incredible for wildcard weekend. You can't beat the location on the strip and it's a short walk from your suite to the Miracle Mile shops or the PH Casino (which is highly under-rated and one of the most fun casinos around). Anyone that would complain about this place is a whiner who either had a uniquely poor experience or would complain about anything. Believe me...I'm sane and rational unlike some of the people on this site. PH Towers is great!

Reviews.Title: “Room 2326 - Quiet oasis in the midst of CES chaos”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: After waiting in a taxi line that snaked around the airport building for hours, got to hotel. Was apprehensive based on other reviews, but check in was smooth, the room was mostly in good order and the hallways were not as dirty as others have found. The elevator area is like a wind-tunnel and a friend on 50th floor had to put towels under door to keep lamp shades from swaying in draft. Very spacious room and bathroom, including a huge couch and coffee table, and a Jacuzzi whirlpool tub in the bathroom. Toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and lotion plus shower cap (thanks to the management for not making me call downstairs to ask for one). Liked this place because it is quiet/no casino and totally non-smoking! If you want to be in the action, it's a short walk through the attached mall to attached Planet Hollywood Casino. I would definitely consider staying here again on a future trip because of location -now a short walk across street bridge to new Cosmopolitan Hotel and City Center complex and the non-smoking/low key atmosphere. The pool looked nice, but was closed for winter/too cold anyway unless you are a member of the Polar Bear Club. The info desk in lobby had helpful staffers that provided maps of Strip area, shopping options in the adjacent mall as well as nearby to hunt down some items I needed. Wireless access could be purchased for $19.95 for 3 days, a better deal than by the day, but still a rip off considering that many hotels provide it free. No resort fee charged since room rates were jacked up (3X to 4X the usual rate) for CES. Room had a microwave, Fridge and dishwasher, plus dishes for two people which was great to make breakfast in the morning. Skipped the overpriced hotel gift mini//mart and went to the ABC store in attached Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile shops for bargains - fresh pineapple, hard boiled eggs, cereal and sodas/water to provision the room for 3 days at CES. The housekeepers must not read English because I left several notes asking for feather pillows (the foam pillows in room were plentiful but very hard/uncomfortable), and the lamp was broken/always on and unable to turn it off or unplug it due to broken switch and plug being behind a built in cabinet. Pulled out bulb and then had to drape towels and my coat around lamp base (also illuminated) to darken the room. On Day Two of stay asked front desk to send engineering to fix it, and upon return the lamp was at last turned off. Great blackout shades are electric, but hard to adjust if you want some light in the room. My minor issues with this hotel: the hallways were somewhat shop-worn with dings/dents and scrapes to door ways and hall areas that could easily be fixed. There was a bit of trash/litter left that stayed on 23rd floor most of the day...guess nobody checks. I did hear adjoining room guests coming in late in the hall, but loud drunks are loud drinks. Also heard water running in adjacent rooms and a shouting match from upstairs guests that could be heard in the bathroom. Didn't need earplugs to sleep with the heat fan on high. It is a 15 minute hoof to the nearest monorail stop at Ballys Casino. Monorail is for tourists only and not much use during large events because it is too small, holds few people, and requires a schlep to the bowels of casino hotels to get on/off. Did use it to go to Convention Center on two days and lines were long, not enough machines to buy tickets. Due to long taxi lines and quirky entrances/exits for cars in and out of casinos, suggest wearing comfortable shoes and walking the strip if you have a trip of 15 - 20 minutes which was faster than waiting in cab lines and then shelling out $15 to go a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning..”
Reviews.Author: texaschick87
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 23 Dec-26 Dec. I purchased two rooms and we arrived the evening of the 23rd around 8pm, and we were still able to get rooms.. one floor difference.. with great views from the 53rd and 54th floor facing the strip. Rooms were clean. Bed was comfortable. Did not have to wait more than a minute or so for the elevators.. Staff very friendly. Only things I didn't care for was 1) Pull out sofa did not have linen on it, and linen was not available until room service brought it up .Not too fun at 3 in the morning when you just want to get to bed. 2)Pillows are terrible. With that said, I still will be returning.. the hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Rooms are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elle054
Reviews.Content: Walking along the strip don't get suckered into "The Visitors bureau" near the M&M shop..The "discount show tickets" to go look at a new hotel and let others know about it is complete rubbish. I did ask "is this TIMESHARE? and was answered NO!" What a lie.. We sat for three hours in a room at "Panet Hollywood" with young children and were hounded by "ROB" to buy timeshare and spend quality time with our young children. We repeatedly said 'no' not interested and he got so angry and P'd off with us. We answered honestly and he kept pushing. I will never stay in this hotel now because of the horrible time we went thru and the disgusting antics and tricks to buy a timeshare... NOT IMPRESSED!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: robert1956
Reviews.Content: what do you look for in a studio aparment holiday, well the towers have it all central 5 star furnishing just great value and so clean, staff very helpful cant wait to go back igive it 11 out of 10........ Bob and jaki from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: Bradley03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I go to Las Vegas about every other month. It's our little getaway. We look around at the various resort/casinos to compare prices and availability before we book - we don't just dive right in. Since we were bringing 2 friends with us we decided to book the penthouse suite - but when we called to book we were told that if we booked the 2 bedroom suite instead, when we arrived we could "upgrade" to the penthouse for only $50 more per night (cheaper than if we booked the penthouse that moment). We were assured that there would be a penthouse available - seriously, I asked the woman at least half a dozen times if she was SURE there would be a penthouse available. She said there would be, "without a doubt" - verbatim. Awesome! (we thought). When we arrived we were very impressed. The check-in lobby area was beautiful. So beautiful that I didn't mind waiting 15 minutes in line to check in. When it was our turn we went through the usual check-in stuff and told the clerk we'd like to upgrade to the penthouse. After clicking around on his computer for a bit the clerk told us there weren't any available. "You've got to be kidding" - my words, verbatim. After double and tripple checking we gave up and the clerk assured us that our 2 bedroom suite was still very nice, still very roomy, and that we'd be satisfied with it. We weren't - and because I'd be here all night if I wrote about each way we were not satisfied in detail, I'll just list them here: - The 2 bedroom suite is not actually a 2 bedroom suite. It is a 1 bedroom suite that is linked to a basic studio suite. - The master bath is a shared bath (1 door in the master bedroom, 1 door in the living area). - "all day" room service is not actually 24 hour room service. Yeah, I don't get it either. It doesn't list their hours on the menu but we called at 11pm to order a late dinner and we were told they were closed. - The wireless internet is not free (which is okay, I guess) but you have to pay $9 per DAY for EACH DEVICE that connects to it! In our case: 4 smart-phones + 3 laptop computers = nearly $70 per day. We assumed it was just $9 per day for unlimited devices because we have had to do it that way in several hotels...but not at this place, and at check-out time, BOY were we surprised. - The walls are paper-thin. Especially in the bathrooms where the acoustics are better. I could hear people talking (very clearly!) the entire time we were there. - We were kept awake by the click-clack-click-clacking of people walking in the room above us. We were on the 22nd floor but it sounded like these people were walking on tile...not carpet. It was that loud. - The beds are covered with 2 sheets and 1 thin blanket, even in the winter when it's freezing! And don't bother calling down to get another blanket at night because no one will answer the phone. We called 3 different times between the hours of 12 and 4am. Ring...ring...ring...nothing. - Although we were told we'd have a great view, our view was of the parking garage. 22 floors up...but still of the parking garage. - Watching TV while winding down at night was very frustrating. Click any button on the remote and only 4 or 5 seconds later will it actually register on the TV. - the silverware in the kitchen was dirty. - the washer/dryer combo in the master bath wouldn't open. The door was locked and it wouldn't budge. We're a very technologically inclined group but even this was beyond us. Tried calling down to the front desk to get maintenance up to fix it...and guess what? Ring...ring...ring...nothing. In short, my boyfriend and I must have said "We seriously should have stayed at [a different resort]" at least a million times.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: EnidW
Reviews.Content: Planet Hollywood Towers is big and beautiful to look at. The rooms are spacious and modern but the walls are thin, so if next door are pumping out the tunes till all hours of the night it will keep you a wake to. Be careful of the time share don't be shy to say no all the time. The three mile shops inside are great but save your dollars for the outlet stores at each end of the strip they are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Things have apparently improved..”
Reviews.Author: janiss79
Reviews.Content: We did not have any of the bad experiences people have posted about on here from last summer. They were very friendly and efficient at check-in, and our room was totally fabulous. The room was very clean, and I am VERY picky about cleanliness. Our room was cleaned every day and the bed was very comfortable. We were on the 54th floor and had spectacular views. The staff was very friendly. We were unable to access the pool as it was too cold, but it looked beautiful. Loved being able to walk directly into the the Miracle Mile Shops and have a variety of restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: awesome_world2010
Reviews.Content: My favourite thing about this hotel is definitely the location (connected to Miracle shops and very close to Paris). We stayed in a studio which has basic room rize (not big sized, but not too small either) and it has nice Hollywood/Marilyn Monroe theme. Our room was facing a cark park and Paris' Eiffel tower, which was OK... the window curtain was pretty cool! The front desk service was not the best because she didn't seem to be happy to be there, but it did not affect our stay overall because I enjoyed the room and the location anyway. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay...”
Reviews.Author: NoDoubtFan82
Reviews.Content: for the most part I really enjoyed my stay at the westgate towers. We arrived the day before christmas eve to an empty valet stand, we waited about 5 min until I ran inside and found someone that worked there and asked if there would be a valet attendent. He said he should be back in a few mintues. we waited for about 15 min and then a guy saw us parked with the car running and ignored us. another car pulled up and he went to help them, i got out of the car and let him know that we had been waiting to be helped, his answer was "if you want help you have to get out of the car." Umm hello the car is running and were waiting by the sign that says "valet drop off" how are we to know he works for the valet? on a good note check in was very easy, offered us an upgrade, but we declined. Our room was very nice for a studio. the projector screen for the window was awesome, we had good sleep since it kept the light out. Location was great, right in the middle of the miracle mile shops. plenty of places to eat. rooms were clean, maids left us more towels and shampoo when we left a note asking for more. Back to the valet service the following day, when we came back to park our car the valet attendent said valet was only offered to timeshare guests. why didnt they tell us that the day before? he let us know we can self park in the garage and to park on the 3rd floor to have direct access to the lobby. parkling was easy, but i wish we would have known we wouldnt be offered valet service. I was expecting to be hounded for a timeshare, but we were not approched once which is nice. check out was also very easy. had a great stay, but valet could use some work.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location, missing the little things to be a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: CoachJSin
Reviews.Content: I love the Planet Hollywood Complex....Always my first choice for location. I Booked through a travel site that had a great deal for $287 total for 3 nights, including a Saturday stay. It was a perfect value to try out the new towers. At arrival, Valet was FULL and only available to timeshare owners. Studio room was on the 4th floor and overlooking a roof top, not very vegas like. Ice machines were only located on the 5th and 50th floors (yes, only 2 floors). Breaker tripped and had to wait 30 minutes for maintenance to arrive to finish getting ready, they had enter the next room just to flip the switch. Some light switches didn't work properly. Looked like there was a missing picture on a recessed wall. Had to avoid the timeshare people in the lobby like the re-occurring bum asking for change. However, the room was clean and had some neat features (floor to ceiling windows with automatic screen). Love the access to the miracle mall shops.

Reviews.Title: “It's a fake hotel”
Reviews.Author: capitaldoon
Reviews.Content: The best part of the stay is walking into your room and seeing how beautiful your room is. THe worst part is evertyhing that followed. Cliffnotes of our experience - - We showed up 4 hours early because of our flight in - they were abl;e to check us in early (so I guess there were 2 good things about the hotel). Got 2 stuidos with a nice view of the airport - some hotel basics (mouthwash. ice machines) were non existant - new hotel but all the vending machines on the floors are broken - Front desk was generally unhelpful - we asked 3 times about outlet malls and we got looks each time like we were speaking another language. My friend also went to friont desk to see if they had tampons as all the stores were closed early in the morining - she was told to go to a convenience store - Getting harassed by their staff in selling timeshares (the higher floors are condos) - Conceirge didnt do anything I couldnt have done myself in getting show/dinner tickets - Room Service closed at 10 pm - they shut the power off for 2 hours for an electrical upgrade one night we stayed there and gave us a mini glowstick per hotel room and told us not to use the elevators - As previous posters have said it is not a very secure hotel.. very easy access in and out and front desk looks other way (they way its setup they dont even really see whos coming and going)

Reviews.Title: “Good Time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kmjr2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed a total of 6 nights at the hotel and had a great time. I stayed in a One Bed room Grand. I had all the full amenities, washer, dryer , dish washer , microwave , Jacuzzi and projection TV. I am an owner at this resort , but was a little worried about the previous bad reviews from other tripadvisors reports. This was my first stay. 1. The check-in was fast and easy 2. The room was clean with plenty of towels 3. The floors was quite and sleeping was not a problem 4. The Lounge KOI was great 5. The location was right across the new Cosmopolitan Hotel on opening night 6. The exercise room was clean and with plenty of machines The only problem I had was a beeping noise in the room when I checked in , but the staff told me to make sure the dish washer door was fully closed. When I closed it , the beeping stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Prostitutes”
Reviews.Author: Drjeffboyre
Reviews.Content: As far as I know prostitutes are illegal in las Vegas, and I shouldn't have to deal with 3 sexually harassing me, saying things I can't even put on here. This was the first, and last night i stayed in the hotel simply because this reason. If you have a husband or teenage boys I would highly recommend staying somewhere else, because the 3 hookers that talked to me doesn't even include the multiple that came up to me in the casino when I was minding my own business at the slot machine. In my opinion, as a paid guest I shouldn't have to put up with anything of these sorts. When I confronted the woman working the front desk, she simply Made me feel like an idiot by saying that there is nothing she can do and shooed me off to my room. So if you're looking to pay for sex this is the place to go! If not I would say look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We trusted our wedding weekend to them - and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: bradynut
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about slow elevators and rude front desk employees, I was somewhat nervous about what we'd find when we arrived for our 10-10-10 wedding weekend. I'm happy to say we never waited on an elevator for more than a minute or two, and the front desk folks were helpful and friendly. Our friends (2 other couples) were booked on different reservations, and the front desk was still able to get us rooms close to one another, even though the hotel was full all weekend. Our view was great, the room was very clean and the decor was hip and funky. It's a bit of a long walk to the strip, but that's the case with nearly every large hotel on the strip. We would definitely stay there again!
