Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY MARVELEOUS”
Reviews.Author: caduncan1951
Reviews.Content: 2 BR Suites are great. Very roomy, lots of TV's, comfortable beds, and other seating. View not so good. Website needs to correct that. However, all in all perfect place to stay. With 2 couples spliting the price actually cheaper than each couple staying in a King Room at the pricer Hotel/Casino's. You walk out of the Towers into the mall, shop till you drop, or you can go direct to the Casino, or the strip. Lots of food and beverage courts along the way. Hey Planet Hollywood Casino not so shabby either. We got lucky, hit 3 jackpots, unheard of in Vegas? Think anyone, any age, would enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love PHT!”
Reviews.Author: bgbstg17
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at PHT. We originally stayed here in February 2010 and we decided to come back in December. I had absolutely nothing negative to say in February but now there were some aspects that I did not enjoy. For one, the brand new rooms we enjoyed in February are showing some signs of wear and tear. In some places the dry wall is cracking off the walls and some shower tiles have cracks in them. Also, the plumbing in our room wasn't the greatest and there were often water puddles around the toilet and residue left in the bathtub. We were actually moved to this room from another because we had found pill casings with a mysterious white powder in them. Also, the housekeeping was a problem. After waiting 5 hours for someone to clean our room we had to call housekeeping to ask for someone to come up. This forced us to change some plans we had had for the day. However, everything else was fantastic. The customer service can't be beat. Whenever we called the front desk for something it happened. Also the rooms are absolutely incredible. For the price you pay you get a full kitchen, living room, 4 flat screen tvs, a projector that makes the pull down shade into a huge screen, a jacuzzi bath in the bedroom and a full bathroom. Unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on expedia for a great price. It was just perfect. It is located on the strip and very near the tower. The view from the room was fabulous. Rooms were big clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and courteous. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Hustlers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: doledolo
Reviews.Content: While this resort is fresh and new, the people that work here are nothing more than huslters. They constantly harass you to buy into their timeshare. They lure you in by telling you they will give you a comp night or free tickets to shows or dinner, or even casino credit. DONT BUY INTO IT!!!! A family member of mine is actually an owner and the perks just arent that wonderful. I do not necessarily recommend this property if you are looking for a relaxing stay. It is everything but... The resort gives you a feeling of luxury but when you enter the room, it is poorly cleaned by the housekeeping staff. We found dust all over the counters like nobody had been in the room in weeks. The framing around the bedroom door was loose, bleach was left behind in the washing machine, which ruined a shirt of mine, and las but not least the advertsement card sitting on the kitchen bar that listed different things to do in the area had a nasty looking off-white stain on it that was missed by housekeeping. Very disappointing. As a hotel manager, I would be extremely unahppy with the performance of the staff. Not only are the PH staff hustling you in the resort, but they are also in the miracle mile mall as well as the casinos. Telling them "NO" does no good!! I tried to just ignore their offer and the response i got was "Oh its like that?" I ended up having to be rude to them and say "YES!!, It is like that now leave us alone"

Reviews.Title: “*~*~ WE REALLY ENJOYED OUR STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAlyssia1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here (Nov 19-21) we stayed here for my Sisters Birthday and we all really enjoyed ourselves!!! We stayed in the One Bedroom Suite! Our room was spacious and it was even nicer then I thought it was gonna be! It was roomy it had a full kitchen with a dinning area. And we loved the bedroom and the jacuzzi ! The bathroom even had a flat screen TV in there!!! We were located on the 14th floor and had a really nice view. Also when we were getting checked into our room the front desk was nice and very friendly. I work for Starwood Hotels and I've stayed at several propertys over the years. BOTH STARWOOD AND NON Starwood Hotels and this is by far one of the nicest hotels Ive stayed at!! I would def stay here AGAIN!! Oh and Ive also stayed at Planethollywood Several times. I knew these are connected and Planethollywood is REALLY NICE TOO BUT I LIKE PLANETHOLLYWOOD TOWERS BETTER AND ITS NEWER!!!! :) Oh and I also got a GREAT rate because I booked it on one of those online sites and got the room for really cheap!!! Which was also another plus!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent property”
Reviews.Author: jessietan
Reviews.Content: Very new, clean and luxurious property. Excellent view on the high floors, ours was 33rd. There is everything in there - executive suite, you name it you have it. We could cook, but then again who goes to Vegas and cooks. There is the shopping miracle mile and Earls sandwich 24 hours on the premise. Casino is different from the rest on the strip, check it out. Bus stop is right outside the shopping centre, lots of eateries and entertainment around. Location of this hotel on the strip is just great. Would definitely recommend this excellent venue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Resort!”
Reviews.Author: c44me
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at PH Westgate Towers during Thanksgiving weekend. We experienced excellent check-in. We had originally booked a studio, but thought we enjoy the extra space of a 1 bedroom suite. The upgrade is minimal, and it provides lots of space. The facilities are almost new, and you can't beat the location. The inroom projection TV is awesome for movies and sports. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Great Steal”
Reviews.Author: DarylQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome aesthetically. The rooms are very comfortable and depending on the room you pay for it has an awesome view because of its location. It is in the middle of the Strip making it easy to go everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: InnPet
Reviews.Content: We have received number renovation. When we have seen it - we have fainted! Up-to-date design in black-red tones. In a sleeping room of the huge sizes of the jacuzzi, surrounded with mirrors and light. My skin has been treated kindly by a soft bed. I haven't felt such comfort even in MANDALAY BAY. Complete kitchen with the huge refrigerator. И. The screen on all four windows from a floor for viewing of programs from a projector. People, it should be worried!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but it wasn't without it's faults”
Reviews.Author: karen1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in early November 2010 (including Veterans’ Weekend). On arriving at the front entrance we were greeted by two attendants who asked if we wanted our bags checking but we declined and said we would take our own. They directed us to the escalator/lift and said we needed the first floor. We arrived at an empty check in desk and were greeted straight away by a lovely smiley lady called Deborah. She checked us in within about 5 minutes and we were off to our room. We had booked a one bedroom suite and she offered us an upgrade to a high floor with a view for an extra $10 per night. We accepted and were given room 5317 on the 53rd floor. There were 6 lifts but only 4 of them went to the high floors. There was never a wait for the lift and we always managed to get from the lobby to our room within about 2 minutes. Our room was fabulous. A sitting room/dining room/kitchenette with a separate bedroom and separate shower room. The view was great too. Not a full strip view but we could see the Eiffel Tower and part of the fountains at Bellagio to our left. Straight ahead we could see the Strip skyscape and to the right we could see over to the mountains and the city. The bed was huge and super comfortable. We had a Jacuzzi bath in the bedroom which hubby used once. The kitchen featured a slim line dishwasher, one cup coffee percolator, fridge freezer with ice maker and water dispenser and a microwave. The bathroom featured a full size washer/dryer which we used several times. There were TVs everywhere and telephones in the bedroom, lounge and toilet. In terms of amenities, we received a small bottle of washing up liquid, a couple of dishwasher tablets, two packs of coffee and a pan scrub in the kitchen. In the bathroom we got a small box of washing powder, hand soap, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion and a shower cap. Apart from the coffee, the amenities were not replenished or replaced for our whole stay but that was of no consequence to us as we had taken our own. We were NEVER approached by timeshare people in the week we stayed and always found the staff to be courteous, polite and helpful. We needed to get a new room key and the young man who dealt with us was just lovely. On checking out we were asked if we had enjoyed our stay and if we would be returning. I once asked the cleaning staff if we could have a couple of extra sachets of coffee and he obliged with a smile. We had room service one morning for breakfast and it arrived exactly when we were told to expect it. It was good and wasn’t outrageously expensive either. We didn’t find the walk to the casino to be too far. We could be out of our room and on the casino floor in 5 minutes. If we wanted to get onto the Strip we could get out through a side door onto Harmon and again be at the Strip in 5 minutes. As for the facilities at the hotel, we ate in Planet Dailies on the casino floor one night and enjoyed our meal, we had breakfast one morning at the Pampas Brazilian restaurant and we also bought late night sandwiches from Earl of Sandwich. We found the slots to be pretty tight at Planet Hollywood and the cocktail service wasn’t the best, particularly on Veterans’ Weekend when the place was absolutely packed to the rafters. That didn’t bother us too much as we did most of our gambling at other hotels. You really could stay at Planet Hollywood or the Towers and never leave the hotel if you didn’t want to though. Now, if I had to complain about any aspect of my stay it would be on the housekeeping side. I should mention first of all that all the surfaces in the rooms are made of black granite which is notoriously difficult to keep clean. I am not sure what we were entitled to expect from housekeeping but every day the beds were made with clean linen, the towels were replaced and the wash basins in the bathroom were wiped out. On two days the maid filled the dishwasher with some glasses that we had left on the counter and on the other days they were left for us to wash up ourselves. Apart from this I don’t really know what else was done because as the week wore on the room became more and more dusty and the bathroom floor in particular didn’t appear to have been swept because there was a build up of hairs on the tiles by the end of the week. The floor to ceiling windows had handprints on them all week from before we arrived. The counter tops in the bathroom never seemed to be wiped down because my cosmetics and personal items were always in exactly the same place I left them and there were still water stains on the granite. However, unlike some previous reviews, we always found the corridors, elevators and common areas to be spotless and we never witnessed plates or any other items left in the hallways. On another note, we rented a car for the week and had heard bad reports about the valet getting full very quickly so we always self parked. This was sometimes problematic as the car park got very full and we never managed to park on a lower level than 5 which involved a walk up and downstairs to the hotel. If convenient parking is important to you then I wouldn’t recommend staying here. I would stay at PH Towers again if I was looking for a good sized suite in a good location. The housekeeping thing was a minor irritation but certainly wouldn’t be a deal breaker if I was choosing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor Party!!!”
Reviews.Author: SkiBum95490
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PH Towers November 5th to the 9th for a bachelor party. There were a total of 4 of us there and we booked a 2 bedroom suite. Check in was my only complaint at this hotel. It took us over an hour to check in. But let me tell you this, it was WELL worth that wait!! We got to the room with a lot of expectations, but this place KNOCKED my expectations out. The view was AWESOME (as you will see below). Room service was great. We are there for a bachelor party to remind you, so we would sleep from 6am until like 3pm and start drinking all day. The 2 bedroom suite has a full kitchen (let me tell you that you will need to bring pots/pans if you want that option, but you're in Vegas...order a pizza or go out to one of the THOUSANDS of restaurants there). The kitchen was great for our hotel drinks. We had several handles of alcohol that all fit in the fridge. The kitchen was great for holding snacks and mix-ins for the drinks. The front desk staff was awesome! Very friendly/outgoing. They answered all questions! The location is BOMB! Basically in the heart of the strip! I am very excited to say that I will stay here on all future stays. Be advised that check in is at 4pm, I would recommend getting there either around 3 (to see if early check in is OK or maybe 5-6).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: tcunder
Reviews.Content: The PH Towers is located adjacent to the Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino and across the Strip from City Center. We loved the view from one (30th) of the lower floors. Must be amazing from the upper floors. Valet parking is limited because of the PH Resort and Casino and the Miracle Mile Shops but once you figure it out, self parking is not a problem. The rooms are spacious and very quiet. The beds are awesome. We will stay here again and hopefully it will be the time of the year that we can enjoy the beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here cheap - spend your time in other places”
Reviews.Author: asmirnov
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because of relatively cheap offer for 5 star hotel (i guess they were kind of promoting themselves). So for the price i paid it was a good stay, as room it self was new and good but: 1) roomservice was rather poor - they did not have some stuff from menu and they did not even had a simple black tea! 2) poker room (i play only poker, so cannot judge for the rest) - rather empty, so sometimes was tough to find table to play. 3) girls that serve drinks in casino are VERY old - so it does not inspire you to see them in what they wear.... 4) shows and perfomances are way below what you see in Bellagio, Wynn or even MGM 5) no free wi fi so all in all - if you find a bargain stay here, but spend you time in other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room...Some Staff Could Care Less About Service”
Reviews.Author: stingah88
Reviews.Content: First of all, this place is gorgeous and the location cannot be beat! The room we had was a studio and was just perfect! We were allowed to check in at 8:00am, we just did not know that would mean our cleaning of the room would be compromised, otherwise we would have waited until normal check in time. I read the many reviews of this resort before staying this weekend and encountered a few of the similar problems. I'll get to the problems in a minute. I want to address the concern many had about the walk to the strip. First of all, puuulllleaze!!! If you have special needs, this concern is understandable, but people, Las Vegas involves walking if you wean to get around and see the different casinos and attrctions that it offers. It takes less than 10 minutes that it takes to get to the strip, if you are out of breathe after that, then hire a driver to see the city. Now to the problems: We left our room in the morning 7:30am, flipped on the "make up room" switch and the maid showed up while we were back in the room at 5pm to clean it. Not cool. I am no neat freak either, but c'mon, you had all day to clean the room! Second, I went to make myself some coffee in the coffee maker and there was a dirty filter in it...yuk! Third, I opened the cabinet to see the dishes and there was sugar or some substance all over the plates. We let the bald African American gentleman at the front desk know about these issues, and he had a real nonchalant and unprofessional attitude with us. Left a sour taste in my mouth, as I work in a hotel and had someone brought these issues to my attention I would have been very embarrassed, apoligetic, and would have compted something to make up for it. Would I stay here again? Yeah I would, but I hope they hire those with a professional demeanor at the front desk and replace the ones that are lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMystique
Reviews.Content: PH Towers is the best! My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights in May and 3 nights in October and loved it both times. In May we had the regular room, which was more than sufficient- but in October we payed the small price to upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite, and it was money well spent!! It was very large with just about everything you could think of- fridge, microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer combo machine, 4 flat screen TV's, projector and jacuzzi tub! In both of the rooms we stayed in one complete wall was glass- nice views of the other hotels. The blinds could be drawn and provided total darkness in the room- we slept great! The beds are very comfy and plush. We had stayed at Planet Hollywood twice before and loved the location which is why we decided to to try PH Towers, which is also connected to Miracle Mile Shops. It is very convenient as there is lots of good shopping right there and a nice selection of restaurants in the Mall. We pretty much love everything about both PH and PH Towers- super modern and great location! Being right in the middle of the Strip is great- you can easily walk to either end. The one other bonus to PH Towers is that there is no Casino there you can just walk out the door to catch a cab or through the lobby to Miracle Mile- no huge smokey Casino to get lost in! I am headed back to Vegas next month for the Rock and Roll Marathon- going to stay at Mandalay Bay where the race starts and ends- I will be missing PH for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Style and position”
Reviews.Author: lamington_jones
Reviews.Content: Booked the PH Towers through Hotwire which gave us a good rate and then gave us some money back because our room turned out not to have a washing machine. (I didn't realise it was even meant to have one!) When we arrived, a staff member took us all the way to our room and showed us every nook and cranny which was both nice and annoying. It was probably an attempt to hook us into timeshare but we resisted that. The room was excellent: very new and modern with a little kitchen along the wall which we had no reason to use. We loved the big window and automatic blinds, the artwork and the red sofa. There was an excellent gym in the complex and a pool which looked great but we didn't use. The only gripes we had were that we never got our promised daily newspaper and water and there were glasses and plates on the floor in the hallway that weren't picked up for our entire stay. This made it a bit annoying when we were hit with a $15/night service charge at departure. The location is great. You do walk through a long shopping centre to get anywhere, but we enjoyed that and of course ended up buying a few things along the way. PH also had a car hire outlet attached which was very convenient since we were off to drive through the desert to Palm Springs for the next leg of our holiday. Tips for the area: Bill's Gambling Hall and Saloon, down the street a bit, is the best! $5 blackjack tables with great drinks service and entertainment featuring Big Elvis. And a popular mexican restaurant at the front of the PH complex (Cabo Wabo?) had slightly disappointing food, but was worth it for the fantastic cocktails and to watch people go by. We liked P F Changs too, near the PH casino.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a good stay”
Reviews.Author: MLE_1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio at the Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers for one week in October. The room itself was comfortable and clean. There was even a pullout couch, so it really could accommodate 2 couples all together (though that would be tight) or at least an additional person. The views are very nice, even if you – as was the case with us – are not on the Paris side. The floor-to-ceiling windows really make any view appealing. The building and adjacent area with all of the Miracle Mile Shops and restaurants was really wonderful. It is possible to stay here, go out every day, and not even leave Planet Hollywood -- not that I would recommend it. But really, there is a ton to do. Also, things in Vegas seem close to one another but they are not. It is tempting to stay in the self-contained PH Westgate Towers environment, but please get out there and see some of the strip. The lounge areas downstairs were comfortable and had a sleek design. We did not try the bar, but there is a happy hour with two-for-one drinks. The pool was very nice and always clean. The one thing we noticed was that by midday, half of the pool was in the shade. So choose your chair wisely. Cabanas are also available but for some ridiculous price of either two or three hundred dollars. No thanks. We booked our room via a friend who traded his timeshare for this room. We didn’t realize that we would be in for a sales pitch. That was the one thing that kind of annoyed us. I understand they want to make a sale, but they were relentless. From the moment we checked in – seriously, we hadn’t even put our bags down – a representative was at the door to welcome us/schedule a “survey” meeting (aka the sales pitch.) When we said that we did not want any sales meetings, she got a little borderline belligerent which started us off on the wrong foot. Here we were excited to be in the sunshine for a week, and that was how we were welcomed. We got over it, but she kept calling. That aside, our experience staying here was mostly positive. The few negatives: Cleaning is done only every four days. That includes trash removal and restocking of essentials like toilet paper and towels! Yuck. Who wants leftover food and other garbage sitting in the small trash barrel for that long? When we requested additional towels we did get them after a pretty long wait, but the point is we got them. The kitchen area had plates, glasses, silverware, and a dishwasher. However, there was no dish detergent for either hand washing or the dishwasher itself. A very small thing but a little odd. There is $5-per-use business center downstairs where you can print boarding passes and surf the Web as my friend described it "at the speed of dial-up AOL." (Or you can pay some ridiculous fee for wireless access...) A non-essential perk: I rented a car to take a side trip from Vegas and there is an Avis on-site at Planet Hollwood. This made it super convenient to get away – I didn’t have to go back to the airport to pick up the rental. The positives did outweigh the negatives, and I would stay here again. Rooms in Vegas are not hard to find, so if you can get a good deal, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “40 and Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jmvon
Reviews.Content: I planned to celebrate my 40th birthday in Vegas with 12 friends. I was initial impressed with the customer service I received while planning my trip and getting details about the room accommodations which end up being a 2 bedroom suite with a connecting common area. The great customer service continued when I checked in and was greeted at the desk by Jolie. I went up to my room, on the 20th floor, and was so shocked to find one bedroom – I immediately went back down to the front desk and prepared myself for an intense argument when Jolie called me over to the counter because she saw the disappointment on my face – I told her that I planned this trip over 6 months ago and requested two bedrooms, she very professionally advised me that I had rooms 2003 AND 2005 and to go to the other side to unlock the door. HAPPY FACE again. The room was great!!! The view was great!!! Since this was my first time to Vegas, I had no plans and played it by ear. We decided to go see Circ de Soli and with assistance from the concierge service were able to get 5 tickets 3 rows from the stage at balcony price. The staff was friendly and I could just go on and on. The night prior to my departure I asked Jolie for a late check-out and without missing a beat it was provided. I viewed a lot of the hotels while in Vegas, the Caesar, the Venetian, the Beligio, New York, New York and the MGM and I have to say that none of them have the complete package like PHT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Room Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mtrancher
Reviews.Content: Would I stay again? Absolutely! The Westgate towers are connected to the Miracle Mile Shops which are connected to the Planet Hollywood Casino. The towers do have their own entrance which is one flight down from the lobby via elevator or escalator. You can get a cab, limo or shuttle right there. True the Valet attendants don't come off helpful until you ask, but as soon as I did they were great. So, check in -- simple and fast with very courteous clerk, she even went to the manager twice trying to upgrade my room to their largest 2 bedroom suite. (I had booked a studio king.) I ended up with their smaller 2 bedroom suite for a modest fee. While she wrangled with the manager I listened to others check in and didn't notice any "attitude" coming from any of the clerks. They all seemed more then willing to help their customers. The room was great. Large living room with a sectional sofa, floor to ceiling windows, large dining and kitchen area, good sized second bedroom, master bedroom on the corner with two separate views, and a huge master bath with jacuzzi tub, separate large shower and separate water closet. Can't comment on needing extra towels ever because there must have been 10 of each size already in the vanity. The bed was comfortable and had three different styles of pillows to choose. There were tv's in each bedroom, the living room and the master bath. The living room had a 42" plasma and a projection tv which used the window shade as the screen. If you want to watch TV in Vegas, this is the room to do it in. It also included a DVD player, never used but then again I didn't come to watch TV. I will say the channel selection isn't great but I've never stayed in a Vegas hotel with great TV channel selection. I did find it odd the bathroom TV had different channels then the rest of the TV's. Maid service was excellent. The first day I never saw the maid but she cleaned everything, emptied the trash and put the dirty dishes in the dishwasher and ran it. The next morning as I left the room she down three rooms and asked if I would like service immediately, that morning she did all the above but left extra coffee and straightened my snacks and drinks left on the bar. Zero complaints about the maid service. Didn't use the pool and the weather kept it less crowded. but it looked nice. I think there are as many chairs available as can be for the area around the pool. Guess if you want a lounger on busy days you'll have to get there early. Didn't use room service, but it's available. There also was a flyer from a nearby pizza service. The kitchen is stocked with glasses, plates and silverware but that's it. No utensils, pots or pans. The refrigerator has ice and water in the door and is a full sized side by side. There wasn't an ice machine on the 51st floor, but with the ice maker in the fridge, I never ran out. I think the studio king rooms have a small dorm type fridge so staying on a floor with zero ice could be a problem. Water pressure was very good but deceptive because the shower has a 'rain' shower head which is designed to let water fall over you, not shoot at you. The jacuzzi tub was nice and like many residential style tubs, the jets don't pound you so you won't get a super massage. The walk from the towers to the strip takes ten minutes, and you are across the street from Aria and the Bellagio. The walk to the lobby of the Bellagio takes fifteen to twenty minutes. max. I thought this was a pretty good location on the strip. The only thing it was lacking was a monorail stop. All the good things said, yes of course there are some quirks. The room only had three trash cans, doors weren't hung plumb so the master bedroom door swung shut on it's own, the kitchen cabinets weren't all straight, the dishwasher wasn't secured under the counter so with the door down it would tip forward a bit, and yes the toilets are low water flush so sometimes it takes two flushes to clear them. So I didn't give them 5 stars, I deducted one because people like everything to be outstanding; still for the money paid and the quality of service and room type, it makes this place a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not one good thing to say about PH Towers”
Reviews.Author: Nik714
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. Starting with the "full" vallet the second we got there to the absolute WORST customer service to the non working escalators/elevators and non working toilet in our room! Not to mention the most rude, unprofessional, amateur staff I have ever come across. Put it this way, I wouldn't even stay there for free if they offered!

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jewelstofind
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a mall and you have to drag your luggage through the entire mall. It is a real pain. I have no idea who invented that, but I personally did not like it at all. The service was great and the people were very nice. The rooms are decorated very nicely. There is a fridge that you can put your own drink and food in. The first day we did not even get room service. We called for extra towels and they sent ones up with holes all over in them, which should have been in the garbage. Once the maids did come all they do is change the towels and make the bed. They do not dust, vacuum, or wipe the bathroom down. The magazines in the room were expired. Someone must have slammed the door throughout the night at least 20 times. I went out to the pool and all of the chairs were taken and there was no place to sit. You had to pay $150 to sit in one of the gazebos. If you want to find a cab and you go though the mall, you have to wait for about 10-15 minutes. The first morning my husband took a shower and the drain was so clogged with someone else’s hair the tub just filled up and hair floating everywhere. Gross! We had to call the plumber. They also charge your credit card $50 a day for incidentals and you don’t get credit for it until 10 days later. There is a dishwasher in the rooms. At first I thought it was kind of neat, then I realized- Who wants to do dishes on vacation? A large bag of garbage sat in the hallway for an entire day before someone can and picked it up. Overall it was a pain to get to, nothing special, and no room service. I would not stay here again if it was FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms...no housekeeping for Westgate owners.”
Reviews.Author: aedepatie
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 days at PHT. We had a studio on the 37th floor overlooking the airport/MGM. The view was amazing. As most have written the room was beautiful. The beds were really comfortable and decor was modern but warm. We loved the floor to ceiling windows and the motorized shade. That said..we are owners at Westgate Lakes in Orlando and traded our time for Vegas. Along with being hasseled to buy more time at PHT there wasn't any housekeeping. We were told on the 4th day, because we were westgate owners, we would get service and talked three times to the front desk and talked twice to the manager. They all said they would do something about it.....NOTHING was done. The manager was very apologetic and nice and assured us we would haveour room done. We were out of towels, there was no place to put our trash, and we had no toilet paper. Then at check out, I spoke to the front desk about how unhappy we were and he told me that because we are owners we do not get housekeeping at all for seven days and the manager didn't know what he was talking about. I asked how much would it be per day to receive it (other Westgate properties offer this option) and he said that they didn't offer it at all. So, for owners, I agree with a previous review...make sure to to get extra toilet paper, find out where to put your trash and call for towels before you run out. Unless you stay for two weeks I guess you will never see your room cleaned. Also, our refridge was broken..they did nothing about that. As far as location, I found the walk through the mall to get to the casino or the strip a little annoying. I like being able to be right in the action. Also, at the PH casino, they were charging $9.00 for a very small drink....We have stayed on the Strip before and don't remember the drinks being that expensive. All in all, we had a great time and didn't let the lack of housekeeping ruin our trip...we will probably stay there again due to the value...we only paid a fee for changing timeshare locations. I just wish we could have paid the extra for the housekeeping like the other Westgate properties and someone had followed up on our 5 requests...

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as anticipated but could definitely improve.”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive when booking after reading all the negative reviews but decided to go ahead. In the end I was pleasantly surprised and glad to have given it a try. There were a few hiccups but could overlook them generally in the light of other good points. 1. There were some mention of long queues at reception, but when we arrived on a Saturday afternoon, we were the only ones in line. Checked in immediately. Never noticed queue longer than 4 or 5 throughout our stay. 2. When we checked into our room there were still dirty crockery & cutlery in the dish washer. This is bad! We put in some detegent and started the machine ourselves rather than call housekeeping. 3. The bench tops in the kitchenette and the bathroom were made from black marble. From my experience this is a very hard colour/surface to keep clean. There were always watermarks on the benches even after the room has been made up. This shows the cleaning & polishing by housekeeping were below standard. 4. The black coloured toilet hides dirt and you wonder whether it has been cleaned properly. 5. As reported before, there were alot of noisy college type youngsters during the weekend, but it quieten down during the weekdays. Most likely these type of guests must have left by then. 6. We had a studio apartment with modern fittings and a Hollywood theme. The size was reasonable with a long couch, work desk & chair, HD flat TV, wardrobe, kitchenette and bathroom with a spa bath. The king size bed and pillows were very comfortable. Our room was on the 50th floor facing north. The floor to ceiling window gave us a spectacular view of the Strip day & night. We could see the Paris hotel's Eiffel tower and a bit of the Bellagio's fountain. 7. The lobby opens directly onto the Miracle Mile's shops. There's no casino to walk thru and that is definitely a plus for us. But if you need to gamble the PH casino can be accessed from the Miracle Mile with a 5 minute walk. There's a couple of ABC store amongst the shops which is good for getting drinks, food and other supplies for your apartment. 8. Being located along the centre Strip it is very near to other attractions like Bellagio and the new City Center development opposite. Overall it is not perfect but with some really attractive advantages, it is better than staying at a simple hotel room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved PH Westgate Towers!”
Reviews.Author: swshrd
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel and loved every minute of it! The studio room was beautiful, clean, quiet and had a stunning view of the Strip! The location was outstanding as it is connected to the Miracle Mile of Shops and it is a short walk through the Mall to the Strip. Nice pool area too. Best of all, it is completely smoke-free! What a wonderful oasis to come back to after an evening in the casinos and bars! We will definitely stay here again next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: seans66
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was nervous after some reviews and the price of the hotel when I booked. It was not something that I had heard of before being out to Las Vegas once a year for the last four or five years, but I knew it was a new place and I wanted to take a shot at it. I have to say it was exactly what I was looking for. The price was reasonable compared to other higher end hotels (hard rock, palms, paris, etc.) and provided a unique look that was very attractive. We took an upgrade to a one bedroom suite for $30 per night when we arrived and it was worth it. The place was very large with more room than we needed. Both rooms had floor to ceiling windows so make sure you get a room high enough up to get a view. WE kept the windows open all night to look at the strip from our bed. We didn't use the kitchen area so I can't comment on that, but there was a projector with a 100' tv (using the shade covering one of the windows) that was fantastic. The decor is as depicted on this and other sites. Very hip place to stay. As far as the walk some people have complained of - you do have a good 5 minute walk into the casino through the mall, and then another few minutes onto the strip, but it hardly ever felt like an inconvenience. The Planet Hollywood casino is very hip too, so it is great having your hotel a few minutes from a great casino/bar/restaurant area. Room was clean, staff was friendly. I can't complain, I really cannot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a getaway with friends.”
Reviews.Author: RWC43
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review, but after reading the reviews of this hotel (which led to some anxiety before leaving for this hotel) I felt I should. I have come to the conclusion that some people (who probably write a lot of reviews) will find something to complain about no matter what. This trip to PHT was a golf trip for 6 guys. We picked the hotel because of the suite availability and the cost. Upon check in (Wed. eve) there was only one person working the front desk. I guess I could complain about that, but a 5 minute wait is no big deal. She even put us on the 53rd floor, 3 rooms together. The room was as wonderful as all the reviews have said. So I will just leave it at that. The service was tremendous. There did seem to be two distinct maid services though. While the first 2 days the room was "only" made up and new towells provided, on the third days shoes were alligned in the closet and dirty clothes were placed in a plastic back for convenience. It felt like walking into home. The people working there were great, The door men remembered us and got us limos/escalades so that all 6 of us could ride together to dinners and shows (we arranged our own golf transportation). They also negotiated the fare for these rides. The hotel's location is great. Yes, there is no casino in the hotel, but you can get to Planet Hollywood casino in less than 10 minutes walking through the mall. And yes, ther hotel loby does not "empty out onto the strip", but you can get there the same way. And quite frankly, you will get there as fast if not faster than from other hotels' lobbies. All in all this was a great location that I would recomend to anyone as well as return to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: angelab52
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 12 girls for a bachelorette party and rented a 4 bedroom suite through a timshare. The room was great! The views were amazing with floor to ceiling windows throughout all of the rooms. The showers were good, we didnt have any problem with the water pressure. The beds were really comfy, and there were lots of them. The pullout couch wasn't that great so we took turns sleeping on it. There was a big living room with a big couch attatched to the kitchen that had everything we needed. They supplied us with many towels and there was maid service every day. There was buttons in each room to put the shades up or down, so the room got really dark. The pool was nice, but cold. It was really windy while we were there, and a few of us got knocked into the pool by flying chairs. One girl was bruised pretty bad, but they were quick to make it up to us. You can't bring drinks into the pool area, you have to buy everything from the pool bar. One frozen drink costs $12, so sitting around the pool all day adds up in a hurry. The pool wasnt as busy as some of the pools in Vegas, but I like it that way. That being said, I wouldn't choose this hotel for the pool, it's no MGM, but it works. There are no restaurants in the hotel, but there are some in the miracle mile shops and at planet hollywood. The walk isn't too long, no longer than 5 minutes. But it does get annoying when you have to do it 5 times a day. Especially by the end of the night in your heels. Overall this hotel is nice. The rooms are great. But I have stayed at Planet Hollywood resort and Casino, and much prefer staying closer to the action. Just taking an elevator to the strip, or to the casino, or for breakfast, is more convenient, than walking through the mall each time. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a big group, so that you can stay together. Being a group of 12 girls, have a room that we all stayed in was extremely convenient. No phoning each other, to see what we were going to do today, just wake up, talk and leave, then meet back in the room. But if you want to be in the middle of it all, this isnt the place for you, it was fairly quiet. Oh, and we used Red Carpet VIP for our big night out. They were great! There was a long line through the casino for the club we were going to and even a long VIP line, but they go us in within minutes and took us to our table where we were treated like royalty the whole night. They delivered on everything they promised us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Modern and Upscale Luxury in the Heart of the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: docsurglace
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas with friends for a fun getaway during the "off peak" time (Sunday - Wednesday). WOW!!! We had a fabulous time at the Planet Hollywood Towers at Westgate (PHT). We stayed in a suite which was fantastic from head to toe. The furniture and decor were all very modern and chic, with a FULL kitchen and spacious living room area with leather couches (one that pulls out into a bed). The highlight would have to be the all automated home living system that controlled the room temperature and drop down screen (to cover the floor to ceiling windows!) so that you could watch HDTV from the wide screen projector. Fabulous! The bathroom was also exceptional. There was a large walk-in shower and plenty of mirror and counter space to get ready for a night out on the strip. If hot tubes are your thing, head to the master bedroom and you'll find a large tub with jets surrounded by mirrors on two sides which was very relaxing to soak in after a long day of shopping and gambling. The views from the living area and bedroom were also great, especially at night when the strip is lit up at night! Overall, the hotel room was clean and quiet (no loud partying to disturb you.) One of the best advantages of PHT is its location -- in the heart of the Las Vegas strip, and the hotel is connected to the Miracle Mile Shops. The only downside to PHT (if I could be nit picky) is that there is no casino in this facility. The casino is located in the Planet Hollywood Hotel which is connected to PHT via the Miracle Mile Shops shopping mall. But, this was actually a good thing for my friends and I because we did not want to be bothered with all of the hustle and bustle of a loud casino in the lobby of our hotel. So, if you are looking for a hotel that has the convenience of having their casino directly attached, then PHT is not the best place for you to stay. However, if you don't mind a taking a short stroll through the mall to get to Planet Hollywood hotel and casino in order to gamble, then I would still recommend staying at the PHT. The only thing that would make PHT absolutely perfect is if they offered FREE wireless internet. You had to pay $9.99 for 24 hours of access. Or you use the two computers located in the lobby (to print out airline boarding passes, etc.) for a fee (I believe they charged $5.00 for 10 minutes of internet usage.) :0( In my opinion, hotels should provide free wireless internet, but PHT hasn't caught on to this idea just yet. Regardless of this, my friends and I still had a great time staying at PHT and would certainly stay here again the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: stace_t2
Reviews.Content: We booked in to PHT for 2 nights and were a little unsure about what to expect. we booked the one bedroom studio room, when checking in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade for an extra $10 a night, which we decided to do and are so glad we did. The room was gorgeous, on the 27th floor with a view of the strip we could see the bellago fountain, the eiffel tower all which looked amazing at night! Celing to floor windows, spa in the bedroom, also having a kitchenette (dishwasher, microwave oven, fridge) was very helpful in making the stay a bit easier to stick to the budget! the room was very clean, staff were very helpful, it was so good we decided to extend our stay for the rest of the week. We also got the room for $100 p/n on booking.com which was bargin. All rooms are non smoking as well which suited us. the comments about walking through the mall to get to reception, wasn't a big deal at all, probably no longer than the line to check into somewhere like caesars palace haha all in all fantastic hotel, had a great stay would reccomend to my friends for sure, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, center-strip and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Court_IL065
Reviews.Content: My husband had never been to Las Vegas, and we has some vacation days to use. We chose to go to Las Vegas from Chicago because it is only a 3.5 hour non-stop flight, and I knew that 3 days/2 nights in Vegas in plenty of time. Afterall, there is something to do at any hour of the day. We stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers because my friend recommended it to me. The hotel is new and very modern. The pool was nice and we loved that it was located in the middle of the main Las Vegas strip. The hotel is also connected to a mall and the original Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive drinks”
Reviews.Author: lorryEngland_Uk
Reviews.Content: stayed a week ,the cleaning is only done on the 4th day if u stay in a timeshare apartment ..reading other reviews yes there should have been two towers but i was told the ressesion hit when building so plans to build other tower is at a later date and i looked for t he sandy beach bit too. location is great near shows in miracle mile and lots shopping,the pool is nice but didnt really have time to use plus heat wave made it inpossible to sit around the pool ,the cabanas i thought would be free to use cost 150 dollars a day upwards according to days of the week i stayed in a hilton hotel and they dont charge to use the cabanas the drinks very expensive one cocktail and a beer 19 dollars ....if the rooms were kept cleaner and if they told where to get rid of rubbish we had rubbish in our room for days...its a great place if they kept it cleaner its a new building but will be ruined if maintenence its forth coming........

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again...”
Reviews.Author: mmt876
Reviews.Content: Went on an impromtu vacation with the hubby & kids for 2 nights. Reserved a King Suite & was upgraded to a 1 Bedroom King Suite at check-in. Read mixed reviews and didn't know what to expect, but when we opened the door we were pleasantly surprised at how NICE everything was. Trendy decor. The room consisted of everything you need for a comfortable stay & more. A full-size kitchen, comfy leather sectional w/ a pull-out sleeper, flat screen tv & a projection screen. Underneath the bathroom counter you'll find a washer/dryer--talk about convenience. Bedroom was just as nice as everything else. The kids loved "swimming" in the jacuzzi. We had a wonderful view of the strip. Loved that this is a smoke free hotel. Self-parking was easy to find & close. Loved having the Miracle Mall right below. Regular room is probably not as grand. The Bedroom Suite is pure luxury. Had a great family vacation. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and spacious”
Reviews.Author: prin6wilcox
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the PH Towers by Westgate! The decor was very nice and the suite was huge! We all felt at home and comfortable, not like being in just a hotel. There are many places to eat and shop nearby, and if you walk out through Planet Hollywood you walk right out onto the strip. We had a great 2nd visit to Las Vegas. My husband and family were very impressed with our location and little apartment style suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting trip: fun, friends, shows, excitement!”
Reviews.Author: EmmyLance
Reviews.Content: Planet Hollywood Towers was wonderful!!! Excellent service, upgraded from studio to 1 bedrom suite at check-on for $30 a night and sooooo worth it! Wonderful views, service, clean and luxurious. Did to timeshare tour and received 2 tickets to a show (Vegas-the Show) which was great and a buffet dinner in the casino. Worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Room! Unbeatable Price/Perfect Location/Not 1 problem!”
Reviews.Author: febe41
Reviews.Content: I'm in awe after reading some of these reviews. Some people seem to get on the internet and complain about the slightest things or want something for free because it was their travel agencies fault things weren't booked right. It's rediculous for anyone to write negative about this place- It's gorgeous, it's totally inexpensive in comparison to anything in Vegas and the location is great! We stayed for 4 days on the 36th floor 2 bedroom suite. Our room had a peice of the "red"part of the tower as a separate "look out" which was amazing. Full kitchen suited all our needs, even the pull out bed was comfortable. The decor is top notch and all the electronic shades that black out the place were highly needed, since there are awesome floor to ceiling windows with views for days (that view hurts the eyes at 7am-hence the shades!) We ordered room service with the onscreen menu and it arrived in less than 25 minutes, was fresh and delcious! It was so nice to have a hotel room with a 8 person dining table for all of us to enjoy a meal in -suite! I will definitely return to this place, and have already referred friends to it. The price we booked it for was amazing. The not-so-nice reviews on this site had me a little apprehensive as well as the low price I paid, but I felt like I robbed them! Thanks PH Towers- we'll be back next spring! OH- we also went to the pool one day and rented a round-couch/lounger for $50 the entire day. It was directly pool side and we had the best waitress, Amanda! 1 Negative- wifi was 9.95 a day- kind of a bummer but I was on vacation so it was by no means a deal breaker!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be demolished off the Vegas Strip entirely.”
Reviews.Author: araxi29
Reviews.Content: Guest services and valet are the rudest and most unorganized people I've ever met. They were first going to charge my credit card for someone else's room, had I not noticed in time the charge would've gone through. Our friends went through quite the obstacle trying to get the bellhop to transfer their bags from the PH Resort Casino where they were staying over to PH Towers where they had a room for the second night of their stay in Vegas. Guest services said it wouldn't be a problem and would only take a few minutes, instead it took 2 hours to get the bellhop to bring their luggage over. Then when we were heading out to an event we had some additional items for bellhop to carry out for us and they never gave us a ticket. So we had to wait for the guy who took our stuff down to vouch for us that our stuff actually belonged to us while it was his fault that he never gave us a ticket in the first place. This place is unorganized, and their service folks are just plain rude, and their valet is very careless. Our friends drove 4 hrs from LA with personalized wrapped gifts in their car. Before leaving the car with valet they checked the gifts to make sure everything was still in tact and everything was still in place. When they later picked up the car from valet they opened the trunk and found that one of the gifts had broken. When we complained to management during checkout they said that it was our fault for not complaining right away when all these things happened. We truly didn't expect the manager of the Westgate Towers to be just as rude as it's employees. Take my word for it, we've stayed in several hotels on the strip before, and none treated us so poorly as Planet Hollywood did. I was fooled in reading the reviews from other folks. I read mostly good reviews and was fooled into getting a room here, but take my word for it, do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “First stay in my timeshare..... very nice.”
Reviews.Author: prince043
Reviews.Content: I bought my timeshare 2 years ago when visiting Las Vegas and this past week was my first official stay. I bought a 1 bedroom deluxe and am able to go every 2 years. To start, my check-in was very fast, and when we got to the room everything looked very nice. It has a living room, efficiency type kitchen, beautiful king size bed, jet tub, and shower and sink area. Everything was in working order when we arrived and that was a huge plus. The view is great and each room has floor to ceiling windows which are fantastic. The only opportunity that I had was I had originally priced a 1 bedroom grand timeshare and did not want to spend that amount of money so I was told that the deluxe was basically like the grand however the stove was not full size and the eatting area was smaller. There is no dining area and the oven is a micowave/ convection. I feel that a got a very good price on the deluxe model however I have learned to make sure I physically see the actual room I would be getting should I want to upgrade. Secondly, I did receive a welcome from a person that worked there who came up to the room with some discount coupons and basically wanted me to upgrade and take the tour again. She was my contact person if I needed anything. After I said I wasnt interested in upgrading I never heard from her the rest of the week. All in all Im satisfied with my purchase and learned a lesson from it. If you stay there however be sure and ask for more soap and toilet paper at the beginning of your stay. Finally, I did use the pool and fitness room and liked them very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnieChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: The Towers is all non-smoking which is great break from the smoke filled casinos. The suite kitchenette allowed us to save money on breakfast every morning. A "Doggie bag" or leftover take out was never wasted. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountain and the Eiffel Tower. The only downside was that they skipped a day of housekeeping. An air conditioned walk through the Miracle Mile shopping center leads you right to a bus stop with ticket vending machine for the Gold and Duece Line . The only downside was that they skipped a day of housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Absolutely love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Starwalker82
Reviews.Content: This place is a home away from home. Kitchen, living room, 2 bedrooms, jacuzzi tub, projection screen TV, everything. Absolutely no complaints. We had a view of Bellagio fountains, Paris, Wynn, The Eiffel Tower and the strip from our room. We were on the 37th floor and were very pleased. We ate at Pampas Brazilian Grille in the Miracle Mile Mall, don't waste your money! We also toured with Adrenaline ATV Tours in the Valley of Fire, it was awesome! We will definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Christie_C_D
Reviews.Content: Contrary to most of the reviews for this hotel, we thought it was amazing. We went for a 30th birthday celebration and stayed in a two bedroom suite with a few of our friends. It was the perfect location on the strip, plenty to see and do. Our room was fabulous...well worth the price. Full size kitchens, king size beds, jacuzzi tub, projector screen the size of the living room and as a bonus the entire hotel is smoke-free! Fantastic. So perfect for a group of friends! We absolutely will go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazing rooms but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: amh01
Reviews.Content: We took a road trip through Vegas to the Grand Canyon with my in-laws and two small children. We rented a two bedroom suite that was absolutely amazing. The beds were very comfortable, and the jacuzzi tub and projection tv were very cool, especially for my kids. The service, however was sub-par. The dishes in the kitchen still had food caked on them, and one of the drinking glasses was broken. We were told upon arrival that if we turned on the maid-service light that our room would be cleaned, beds made and towels replaced. We left the room on the first day and flipped on the light for maid service when we left. Upon returning to the room that night, we noticed that no one had been there to clean. We needed more towels so I called and requested some and no one ever came by. Same thing happened the next day and by the thirdd morning when we compained again, we were told that they do not provide maid service for 4 day stays and that we were to wash our own towels. We loved the room but I would never stay there again because the service was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, poor service”
Reviews.Author: MamaS51
Reviews.Content: Everything written about the view and location are true, but the adds state" full kitchen with high-end stainless steel appliances that will give travelers a hint of home, while creating a sense of celebrity living". Well, my home comes with cooking untensils that let me cook like a celebrity! Our whole reason for staying was because we wanted the kitchen to help us save money and keep from dining out as much. Unfortunatly pots and pans are only for "property owners" and not for all guests! We spend 1.5 hours argueing the point, but ended up spending over $50 @ Target purchasing necessary tools just to cook breakfast! Management was rude......and very inconsiderate.

Reviews.Title: “High Above the crazy strip....”
Reviews.Author: Ny1Chad
Reviews.Content: Everyone calm the eff down. This place is awesome. Its in the middle of a great mall and a 3min walk to the center of the casino. The rooms are crazy fun, with projector screens that act as shades. Its like having your own apartment the entire time. I highly suggest it. Bathrooms were my fave.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel despite the MINOR quibbles”
Reviews.Author: EpochFail
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit wary of staying here after reading numerous negative reviews here on TA and at many other places but I found a pretty good deal on booking.com (do yourselves a favor, if you stay here, use a website like booking. they have better deals and more availability than the hotel's site. not sure why but there you go) so I figured why not. We decided on a 1 bedroom suite and we were extremely glad we did. If you want the best experience, get that room or the 2 bedroom. It was exactly as pictured; full kitchen with dishes, silverware, cookware, blender, dishwasher, full fridge and freezer. there is a small combo washer/dryer in the bathroom which was VERY useful as we were there for 5 nights and that allowed us to pack lighter. the shower is one of those 'rain-style' ones which we loved. oh yeah, the jacuzzi in the bedroom was key after long days of walking up and down the strip. not to mention the 4 wall-mounted lcd tvs and the projector which displays on the shade over the living room window. an excellent room to be sure. I must say that there were a couple of minor issues: a piece of the jacuzzi was broken and when we checked in, they thought we had booked a studio room at the 1-bedroom rate. both of these issues were fixed VERY quickly. we called the front desk a few times (the jacuzzi and a couple of questions about the function of the washer/dryer and tvs) and they had people come up in less than 5 minutes. all staff were very nice and courteous to us at all times. housekeeping was very flexible when we asked them to come back later and always asked us if there was anything else we needed. also, keep in mind that the internet costs $$ (wired and wireless). I found that a bit annoying but that seems to be the standard among hotels now so I can't blame that on the PH Towers. all in all this is an excellent hotel and the fact that it's connected to the Miracle Mile shops (a whole bunch of cool restaurants and shops along with the main PH casino; Planet Dailies is an excellent choice for breakfast). Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be at the PH Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, trendy hotel with projection screen TV!!”
Reviews.Author: mom-of-aj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Las Vegas hotels and we try many of them out to see which one suits our needs the most. This was our first stay at Planet Hollywood and has become top on our list. We chose the towers because we like to stay in a suite/apartment style room with a lot of space. We really enjoy having a kitchen too. We checked in very late (near midnight) and we booked a lower floor room at a cheaper rate. When I spoke on the phone to the front desk attendant I asked if I could request the highest floor possible in my rate range. She said that I would have to do that at check in so I didn't have high hopes when we checked in so late. But when we arrived we were the only ones checking in. When I made my request the front desk attendant (Gerard? I think) said he would set me up so we wound up getting the 52nd floor with a beautiful strip view!! We booked a one bedroom suite and the minute we walked in we were in awe! We walked in to a modern, trendy furnished room with three huge floor to ceiling expansive windows in the den and in the bedroom too for a total of six! There was a fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, a red leather 8 person sectional sofa, a dining table set for six and a huge TV! The bedroom had a huge bed and TV, a desk, the huge windows and a large spa tub. I wasn't too thrilled with the tub being in the bedroom but I got over it quick! The bathroom was large also with a doorless shower, lots of counter space, a TV and a washer/dryer. The only thing I didn't like about the bathroom is that it only had one sink. The best part by far was the remote control shade that came down over the curtainless windows. The shade in the den acts like a screen for the projection TV that is mounted in the ceiling! My husband was in heaven watching ESPN! It was definitely cool! The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The maid always left us a huge amount of towels. The only complaint I had to tell the front desk was that our bathroom sink leaked a little and the safe in the closet didn't work. This hotel will definitely get a return trip from us. We especially like how it is centrally located on the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: talesfromthecrib
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and we loved everything about our stay. From the lovely room with the great view over the Strip to the location, the casino and the lovely shopping mall and spice market buffet. Would book this hotel again if we ever come back to Vegas, without a doubt. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dogkids
Reviews.Content: Booked package through American Airlines. Saw mixed reviews, but our experience was great. Room design was very contemporary, clean and well kept. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: TinaGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week holiday in the US from Australia and spent five nights at the Planet Hollywood Towers. I was somewhat worried having read some of the negative reviews, but am so pleased that they did not make me change my mind about staying here. Right from check in everyone we dealt with were lovely. We had booked a two bedroom unit and at check in were offered an upgrade to a larger room for $100 extra per night. We declined this - but maybe we got the upgrade anyway as our rooms were huge. We were on the 55th floor (5526/5524) and the views were incredible looking out over MGM, NY NY, Excalibur and Luxor. The rooms were very luxurious with all the mod cons and our teenagers loved the gadgetry - especially being able to watch movies/tv on the projector screen. Beds were extremely comfy and had no problems with anything in our rooms not working. There was no bedding for the sofa bed, but rang through to housekeeping and it was brought up to us within 10 minutes. Housekeeping staff were wonderful and did a fantastic job - especially having to clean around two teenage girls who had spread makeup and clothes over every surface. They were quite happy to return when we weren't ready for them the first time they came as well. Only two problems - could never get valet parking as it was always full - even on the quiet nights at the start of the week. However, we soon sussed out that parking on level 3 (3B) gave us direct entry to the PH Towers lobby. Second issue was that one evening our lift mulfunctioned and became stuck between the 55th and 54th floors. We could not get any response from the emergency call number so had a panicky 10 minutes before we managed to get the lift to return to the 55th floor. Were very wary of the lifts after that. When we advised the front desk staff of our ordeal they were extremely apologetic and called the Manager for us. He was terrific and immediately had the lifts tested and followed up with the service department as to why they did not respond to our emergency call. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - especially those travelling with teenagers. Pool area, access to Miracle Mile Shops and hotel facilities made this a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great!”
Reviews.Author: Inkstain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a 1-bedroom studio. Upon check-in I asked if a complementary upgrade was possible and the woman replied "we don't do that here". I know that's not true, because I've seen it here on TA. But whatever. That was a long shot to begin with anyway. The room we got was actually pretty great! It was a little on the small side, but I found it to be snug and cozy. We were on the 50th floor, so we had a spectacular view of the strip. We did not experience any of the problems that other guests seemed to have. We didn't really see the staff much, although they did call up to our room to tell us to they had a welcome packet at the front desk, which had coupons and things for us. That was nice. We were aware of all the things that seemed to put off other guests, like the $100 deposit (tip-- if you put it on a debit card, it takes 5-7 days to release the hold. If you put it on a credit card, it releases within 24 hours.) Also the walk through the mall was not that big a deal and the ABC store had beer for $1.99 as opposed to $10 at the hotel bar. Anyway, the alcohol is free in the casino, so why pay for it at all? Overall, it was a great trip and a wonderful hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel & Location, Service needs work.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Labor Day, 3 guys. Friend made the mistake of booking 3 guests, so it cost us $20 extra per night. The ridiculous thing is that they knew there are only 2 beds available (king & sofa-bed). There is no 3 bed option, so why charge more for 3 people. They are still working on notifying booking sites about the bed situation. If you're coming with friends & don't mind sharing 2 large beds, book for 2 & bring 4. The woman at the desk was smug, tried to up-sell us for a larger room with no bed fix, & no sympathy. Plus, she didn't tell staff to put bedding on the sofa-bed, so we had to wait 20 minutes @ 4 am! The manager later rebated some $ for the issues. The rooms are spacious, clean, & comfy. Nice tv with full cable, tables, mini-fridge, bar sink, coffee pot, microwave. No free internet. The pool scene is okay, & the furniture & bar in the lobby are cool & convenient. It's a good stay for couples or friends, just check the sofa-bed for any sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1976cac
Reviews.Content: We are Westgate owners, and i have to admit after reading some of the reviews on here before our holiday i was very nervous about how clean our suite would be. Well i need not have worried!! We were on the 33rd floor,. and the views were amazing. I went round everywhere in the suite before we unpacked to ensure the place was clean, it was except for a price tag that had been left on the kitchen table, no big deal. The service we received was good, especially from Francis in the concierge dept who booked us a trip to the Hoover Dam. The bed was very comfy as was the sofa's and all the tv's and projector worked just fine. We did not use the washing machine or dish washer, as we were on our holidays, but they both looked fine! My only tiny complaint would be the shower, it was lovely and big and the water was hot, but there wasn't much pressure. Washing my hair took longer than usual, but it gave my husband the chance to have an extra drink while he waited for me to get ready. The pool was really nice, drinks were overly priced, but i think that's pretty much the norm for pool bars. My only complaint with it was there was no shade until about 4pm, for a fair haired English girl like myself i could have done with some shade before then!! We had some trouble on our last couple of nights with noisy neighbours who were partying from 3am-10am (not sure how they lasted so long!!), it was Labour Day weekend, we went down to reception and advised them of the problems, and they moved us to a higher floor straight away with no problems, which was quieter. I know some people on here have complained about the walk from the hotel through the mall to get on to the strip, we timed it one day and it took us exactly 7 minutes, not too long at all in my books. The mall has some really nice places to eat. Overall we loved this place and can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice but is a long walk to Las Vegas Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: latitude2222
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which was a nice surprise! The bedroom was wonderful and the bed very comfortable. It was quiet and the large windows made for great views of the area.. From the descriptions that I had read, I thought that the towers were much closer to the hotel.. The taxi let us out at the hotel instead of the towers. They said that they have had problems, with the taxi's not knowing that there was another check in area. It is a very long walk to the hotel from the towers, which we had to make a couple times a day. The towers is a nice accommodation, but I would not stay there again due to the location, it was just too far from the hotel and Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Larifer
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the luxury suites as a treat and it was fantastic. There was a jacuzzi next to the king size bed, a washing machine, a dishwasher, a fridge with an ice dispenser and TVs in every room. The dining table had 6 chairs around it and a low sofa set next to the window. The window blind became a projector screen for the main TV (there was one in each room including the bathroom!). We arrived a few hours early to drop off our bags and they let us check in early. We were on a fairly low floor so they upgraded us and as we were only stayin for one night charged us half the normal upgrade price. It was a lot more expensive than the other offerings in Vegas at the time but nowhere near the amount it would cost anywhere in Europe for a similar standard of hotel. Great if you have money to spend and want somewhere really nice to stay that can be a "home away from home". The location is good too, right across from the Bellagio and next to Paris. You do have to go through the mall to get to the hotel entrance which might be a hassle for some people but this means that the lobby is nice and quiet (the casino is also in the mall). Definitely worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional and smoke-free!”
Reviews.Author: 1sttimevegas
Reviews.Content: Was very apprehensive about staying here after reviews that have been posted. I am so glad they were wrong. Our room was amazing and the views were incredible - just like the pictures on the internet. Smoke free is a plus since when you leave a casino you smell like you've been smoking 24 hrs a day. Location was great and there are many choices for food. Concierge was very helpful so don't hesitate to use them. Hotel was very quiet and nice to have a peaceful refuge in the midst of such a hyper city. Take some time to chill in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews - this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: Westworld_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept 2010 - visiting Vegas with 3 friends. Two bedroom suite overlooking the pool on 8th floor (rms 820/822). Not sure what all the fuss is about over cleaning, the rooms were clean and housekeeping came when we were out. The 2 bed suite was a bargain on Tripres and cost us $800 inc all taxes for two nights, loads of positives: - two superb bedrooms, both with baths, lounge area with full length projector and full kitchen was amazing. If you want to go to Vegas and cook (?) then sure it's not a full kitchen, but fridge with ice maker was all we really needed! Pool is nice for laying out - the bar is pricey, but everything is nowdays in Vegas. Would say that this place is more for a younger crowd (we are in our mid 30's) we were there over Labour Day weekend and there were a few parties going on in the rooms. I would recommend P H Towers if you want very cool rooms, central location and hip scene. If you want upscale quiet and refined - stay at Signature. I have only one negative! The Valet was always full so we had to self park - but hey if that spoils your trip to Vegas then go to Blackpool!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: edscma
Reviews.Content: I have been to alot off hotels but this one was definently a 4 1/2 star wonderful rooms projector screen monday night football on a huge screen full kitchen washer an dryer, one bed room suite was awesome

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andersok
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas at the beginning of April and PH Towers had just recently opened. There we few to no review but we took a chance anyways. We booked 3 x 2 bedroom suites. When we got there we asked about the 4 bedroom suite as there were only 5 guys. Well, it turned they could offer us a better rate on the 4 bedroom suite than the set of 2 bedroom suites and we would have enough beds (including one pull out) for each guy to have their own room. We got to the suite to find out it had 3 entrances and was about 1500 sq feet. Maybe more. One way or the other it was a huge space. A full kitchen, insuite laundry, hd projector screens, full fridge, a couple mini fridges, huge bedrooms, a living area, a dining area, the list goes on. It provided privacy for those who wanted it and a communal area to gather before going out. It was mid strip and close to all the action. Everyone enjoyed their stay thoroughly and we'd easily return in a heartbeat. Check in was fine, service to the room a little slow, super clean rooms, cool decor. We felt like movie stars in this huge suite and we recommend it to any group going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “3 different rooms, 2 different floors, all dirty. Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtrvlr50
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time in a timeshare property however this is my first experience with a dirty one. I can't believe that they would begin to try to sell the tower to me after moving me into rooms that were not clean. The rooms were clearly not cleaned beginning with the floors not being vaccumed. One room had a huge hair ball in the jacuzzi including the ring. I complained the the woman that show me the first room and she acted like she did not notice the filth at first, all of a sudden she saw what I saw. They moved me to the next room. It was more of the same without the hair ball this time. The 3rd room was being cleaned by the supervisor when I moved again. She did clean the windows and another woman wiped down the counters. The supervisor did not wipe off the white cream that was on the sofa nor did she vaccum the floor after I pointed the two things. I asked for additonal cleaning products so I could clean to my satification. Thank God that the sheets were clean. It was hard to sleep because someone had been in my room because things were rearranged. Security was unable to explain why anyone would have been in my room after checkin. It definately not to clean or drop anything off. The explanation for the rooms was the help. My suggestion is to hire better help that take pride in there jobs, this is a new property for heavens sake. I don't expect to clean someone elses dirt when I go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved PH Towers!”
Reviews.Author: jeschism
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas at least once a year for the last 10 years with a group of friends. This year, we decided to stay at the Planet Hollywood. I was late booking my trip, so by the time I went to book the regular PH, the rate was much higher than I wanted to pay. So I found the PH towers. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, but I am so happy we ended up staying there! It was MUCH better than the rooms at the PH. Our room was beautiful, clean, had an amazing view, and I loved having a little kitchen and living room. The decor was very hip and vegas and not cheesy hotel room. Also, as a guest at PH (either regular or towers) you have access to both pools, and the pool at the towers was MUCH better. We had a great time hanging out by the pool.
