I read a lot about how Towers lobby isn't in the casino and you have to walk through the Miracle Mile to get there, but I actually really enjoyed that. The PH towers lobby is beautiful, and it took less than 5 minutes to walk to the casino. If you take a taxi home at night, it will drop you off right in the lobby, so that was never an issue for us. I would absolutely recommend the PH towers to anyone, and we'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than many reviews would have you believe.”
Reviews.Author: Scez79
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with check in. Our room was probably the most basic of all room types with an average view and we weren't on a very high floor but the room was still very nice and spacious with a huge window. I wasn't that impressed with housekeeping, when we first got into our room the bathroom looked a bit dirty (water and soap marks on the basin etc) and bottles left in the fridge, the microwave was dirty but not a huge problem for us. There was no remote for the tv which controlled everything so we called reception and they very promptly brought one up, we then discovered there was no bottle opener which we thought there should be (there were plates, glasses, cuttlery - so surely a bottle opener would be reasonable), not sure if the rooms were supposed to have one or not but they brought us one up in around ten minutes which we were impressed by. The pool seemed pretty small considering the capacity of the hotel. It felt like a very long walk to the casino or exit onto the strip. On our last night we went to enquire about a late check out which they offer, the guy on reception was having problems with his computer and advised us that none were possible as it was going to be at capacity tomorrow, I had great trouble believing this as it was to be a Tuesday morning and even on the weekend when it had felt ten times busier than it did the next day when we came to check out, the hotel still wasn't at capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Believe the bad reviews! This place is FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Luvmonkey9
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews we were very worried about the hotel, but we found none of it true. I spoke to the people behind the desk about the horrible reviews online and they stated that things have drastically changed since they first opened. At first they did not have enough cleaning staff and many things were going wrong, but now everything is working well. I couldn't agree more, this hotel is GREAT. 6 of us paid to stay in 3 studio rooms. When we went to check in we found out that they had no rooms side by side. We didn't want to be seperated so we asked if there was something they could do. For 30$ extra a day 4 of us upgraded to a higher floor with side by side rooms that were twice the size of a studio. I'm talking jacuzzi in the room, projection screen tv, 5 other flat screen tvs, pull out sofa that is a king size sleeper, full kitchen with dishes and all appliances, dining table etc etc... After arriving in our two new rooms we were blown away. I have been to vegas a few times and this room was ridiculous! It was great, but then we were told by the nicest hotel concierge that for only $20 more a night we could stay in a giant two bedroom suite with panoramic views and it is even better then the first upgrade. We gave it a shot. And it was the best thing we ever did. The room was unbeleivable. It was bigger than our 1100 squre foot appartment. Everyone who came back to party from other hotels couldn't beleive our room. It was like a penthouse suite on the 52 floor. Corner panoramic floor to ceiling windows, jacuzzi tub facing the view that fits 3, two complete bathrooms with double rain shower heads, washer and dryer. I can't begin to explain how great this room is. If you are wondering the room number it is 5234. It's nice when you go away with friends or a larger group that you have a place to relax in or party in where you don't have to sit on someones bed. This two bedroom suite was great for all of that. As for the actual hotel, I loved the location above the mall. It was easy to get around, lots of shops and restaurants, close to the center of the strip. Everyone who worked there was very friendly. We called to get extra towels and they came in 10 minutes. The room was clean. The fridge had an ice maker and a dishwasher. Cons that I can think of are: Small pool area We are in our early thirties and late twenties. I did not see many older people or young children at this hotel. I would definetly say it is meant for a 20-40 crowd. But it wasn't like a cancun spring break crowd either. It was young and hip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cali_sd
Reviews.Content: I and 3 other friends stayed at the towers the week of aug. 13 2010 and after reading some of the reviews stating the room was not clean I was a little scared to be in the same situation. As we arrived at the hotel, the check in was fast and simple, we went up to the room and were amazed, very clean, spacious and comfortable. The only problem we had was with the projector, we didnt have a remote for it so we called the front desk around 11am and no one came up to the room. We called again around 5pm and 5 min. later someone helped us out, but besides that little issue the hotel was amazing. All the appliances worked perfectly, fridge, stove, microwave. I recommend it to everyone and I would gladly stay there again. Oh for the projector if you want tp watch movies bring your own dvd player. We had music playing all day and night and never had complaints. The hotel is located right next to planet hollywood and there's an inside mall to walk around. Great price and location for the suite.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: londonkellyrich
Reviews.Content: very good location great staff and dont forget to play in the casino for free drinks !

Reviews.Title: “Some truth to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: vacationalot2010
Reviews.Content: We did not get the room thats shown on the website thats for sure! What was called a suite was just a room with a beer fridge and microwave first of all. In all the research I did about the hotel prior to booking I never once saw any pictures of a room this small/average. Our room had a parking garage view which we were told about at the time of check in. We were offered to upgrade for $40 US/night more but we declined. The main thing is the room was keep clean by housekeeping no problems there and the bed was super confortable. The desk staff were friendly and kind and we reported on 2 separate occasions that the room safe would not accept a new code/lock. I do believe the front desk staff did inform maitenance and gave us a 20 min eta each time however the maintenance guy never once showed. On holiday you are not about to wait all day to see if he does either. The first time we waited an hour felt that was reasonable. The second time we just laughed when maintenance didn't make it in time frame given. I feel like this hotel isn't what it planned to be perhaps during better economic times so things have been cut back such as the pool is not how it is shown on website either. And you do have to dodge the sales people in the lobby trying to get you to hear about timeshares. We stayed at MGM Signature last year and as I read in previous review once you've been there yes you are spoiled! What you see on their website for your room is what you get no suprises. All in all PH towers wasn't horrible but I won't go back either. Oh and they wouldn't/couldn't print off my boarding pass the day before I left I had to go all the way to the Planet Hollywood hotel. Staff there felt sorry for me and waived a $5 (?) fee...it was free at MGM Signature and anywhere else I've stayed...that says alot right there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for Vegas fun”
Reviews.Author: SunSurferDevon
Reviews.Content: After reading review we booked PH Towers for a 5 night break (including a weekend) in August, we were looking for a suite so we could have some space, somewhere close to the strip without breaking the bank. This is a fantastic hotel, we were booked in fast and went straight to our 11th floor room, or should I say rooms. The suite was at least twice the size of any of the rooms or suites we had stayed in the US in the three weeks of our vacation. The master bedroom had a huge double bed, a single relaxing day bed and a large Jacuzzi. There was a double mirrored wardrobe (closet in the US) with a safe, iron and ironing board. The room was well decorated, well lit and the view from the full height windows was fantastic. The lounge area had an L shaped sofa that pulled in to a sofa bed, it also had a wardrobe and other storage, the teenagers had so much space they did not know what to do with it. They particularly enjoyed dropping the blinds in the evening and watching a movie – cinema style using the in room projector onto the huge screen. Also in the main room was the full kitchen (no pots or pans) including a dishwasher and full sized fridge and water filter/ cooler /ice maker. There was seating for six at the high level table. The bathroom was also a good size with a TV (one of 4 in the suite) had a double sink unit, plenty of storage, a washing machine / dryer (very useful after 2 weeks away) a walk in shower and WC cubicle complete with telephone. We had a fantastic time at this hotel and despite it getting very busy at the weekend we did not have to queue for anything or wait for anything. The swimming pool is a good size and when it was not too busy we used the full 30 yards to swim in and cool off. At the weekend in the afternoons the pool was full of people standing cooolng of - so dont expect to swim then. We were invited to a time share presentation – the offer of free show tickets to tempt us – we would have gone if we were without the children, but if they had come along they would have nagged us to sign up! This hotel would really suit those who don’t want people fussing over them all the time, want some space to spread out and want be central to the strip without being in a casino all of the time. We would definitely go back again, with or without the children.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: bmazy
Reviews.Content: We waited 2 hours to get our room. The room was dirty and it smelled bad. The light in the bathroom was out and never fixed. It's full of college kids and very loud. The hallways were hot and smelled like smoke. The casino is very far. You have to walk the whole mall to get to the casino. The pool was extremely small and always full. We were not impressed at all. You have to walk a lot to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: te071788
Reviews.Content: It was Memorial day weekend when we checked in they were extremely busy. Beautiful rooms were over shadowed by their half baked attempt to keep things stocked and cleaned. The week after Memorial day was much better. Another problem was the access to the strip yea the hotel it is connected to is on the strip but you have to go the the miracle mile mall and it is located directly halfway thru so it is a 1/2 mile away from the strip no matter which way you go. The valet guys were somewhat careless they drove really fast in the valet area. Overall I believe that my stay was ok but would have been better if it was not such a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Manager does not care”
Reviews.Author: rhodylan
Reviews.Content: Our family had a good time at the resort except for one issue. We booked a package through southwest that included a free coupon book. the clerk said it was not on his computer,so we spoke to the manager.All we wanted was what was promised. It turned ugly as he said it was not the resorts mistake.The book was something that could be picked up by anyone on the streets, so i don't know what the big deal was.We got the book, but they were acting as if it was a favor.I have read others getting upgrades, so i cant understand the big deal made over a coupon book!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare experience”
Reviews.Author: GrannieDiva
Reviews.Content: We purchased a vacation package from Westgate Resorts, thankfully not a time share. Upon arrival our designated host did not meet us when he said he would, in fact it was a few days before he finally met with us. The units are beautiful. That is where the good part of the experience ends. Westgate Towers does not have a housekeeping staff of their own, they "share" the staff with Planet Hollywood Hotel. Due to this fact getting anything you need is a nightmare and can take anywhere from a few hours to a few days to get what you need. There was no toilet paper when we arrived in our unit and we waited several hours before we were able to get some. When we requested a roll of paper towel the housekeeping person asked if that was something we used to shower! When they finally did deliver we got two rolls of toilet paper instead of paper towel! The pool is only open until 7:00 PM, I'm not sure what is up with that. The toilet did not flush on the first try, it usually took 3 flushes to get just toilet paper to go down. The washer/dryer is European and all in one unit. Trying to figure out how to operate that was a journey in itself. There were no instructions for that or the microwave. Our sleeper sofa had no bedsheets at all and when we requested some it took over two hours for them to bring them to our room. When my husband opened one of the cabinet doors in the kitchen it came off in his hand, he had to repair it with his pocket knife. There is no shuttle service available. The walls are tissue paper thin and you can hear everything going on in the room you share a wall with. On a positive note the bell staff is super friendly and was extremely accomodating and timely. I'm not sure what the rest of the staff is earning but as far as I'm concerned it is too much for the service they provide. Needless to say we did not purchase a time share and decided to go with another company instead.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service, VERY disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: alestou
Reviews.Content: To start with the Planet Hollywood Towers website is VERY deceiving. We booked the King Studio suite and the website confused that with the one bedroom suite. We were under the impression that we would be getting a washer/dryer, and a larger room than we did. Upon our arrival we found old moldy food in our fridge left behind from a previous guest, it took housekeeping about 45 to come up and clean this up. The bathtub was also filthy with dirt and hairs. We left housekeeping a note and a tip, asking them to clean the tub. They took the money, but did not clean the tub. Also there were no ice buckets in the room. It took over 1/2 hour to finally get an ice bucket sent up to the room. The ice machine 25 floors up was broken, and when we wanted bottled water in the middle of the night the vending machine was also broken. We told the staff this multiple times, but the ice machine and vending machine both never got fixed for the rest of the time we were there. Overall we got the impression that the staff could have cared less about us, and whether or not we were happy. The hotel is also quite a walk from the main strip (probably about 10 through the miracle mile shops). I will never stay in a Planet Hollywood hotel again. PH should be embarrassed about the service/cleanliness that they failed to provide!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place To Stay, Can't Wait To Go Back.”
Reviews.Author: NorthurnMonkey
Reviews.Content: Due to our later than planned arrival on a Saturday, they were all out of the studio suites we had booked, so after a few minutes waiting at the reception desk, the chap came back with the news that they would have to upgrade us to a 1 bed suite !!. What a great start to the holiday !!. When we got into our room, we couldn't believe our luck. The room was amazing, a kitchen/living room with 2 huge flat screen TV's, red leather couch (that we later discovered was also a pull out bed), table with seating for 6, full size fridge/freezer, microwave oven + hob, and the crème de la crème was that then you lowered the blind over the floor to ceiling window's, it turned into a screen for a projector so you could watch TV on a huge screen !!. The bedroom too was great, a huge bed, another huge TV, and a hot tub !!. The bathroom was equally well equipped, with a large shower, his + her's sink's, a washer/dryer and a small flat screen TV !!. This was one of the best room's I've ever stayed in. The only minor gripe with the room was that all the flat surfaces are black so they end up looking very dusty/dirty pretty quickly and for a newly built hotel in Vegas, there are no balconies unless you have a suite at the very top of the building. The other minor thing that annoyed us about the hotel was as others have said, was having to walk through the miracle mile shopping centre every time you wanted to get to the strip, which added 10 mins each way to your journey. The pool area, was a pretty good place to hang out, with nice tunes playing through the loudspeakers, although this might not be to everyone's taste. The food and drinks at the pool bar are pretty $$$ too, and they don't like you taking in your own either as we found out. The pool is also very shallow, only 3tf deep -deep enough for standing and chilling out in, and having a bit of a swim, but not for anything more. The valet parking was showing as full for our whole stay, but was available to the time share owners, but not regular guest's, which even on a weekday one would have thought it would have been available so we had to use the self park, which was a bit of a treck through the shopping centre to get to the lobby - although we discovered on the last day, a side exit straight into the self park, that was next to the lift area, which isn't very clearly signed where it goes to from the car park and is only accessible by stairs, so no good for those with luggage or mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with a View...”
Reviews.Author: james309
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great experience at this hotel (once we finally found the parking). The hotel is located in the center of the strip and has a wonderful mall that caters to anything imaginable. Upon arrival the only problem that needs some attention is the signs that could help clarify where the hotel, casino and resort are located on the property. The service was good, especially at check-in /reservations desk. Room service was excellent. Our room was on the 7th. floor and it was great, especially the floor to ceiling windows, overlooking the pool area that unfortunately closed too early (7:00PM)... "How about at least till 9:00PM?" Also, if you want internet, you are going to have to spend an additional $10.00 (that seems to be the norm in Vegas). Besides some the before mentioned concerns my family and I had a wonderful experience at this hotel property. I think the best part is that the Planet Hollywood hotel towers are totally separated from the casino. This makes for an excellent environment for family's with children, and prevents that awkward feeling when the family has to exit through the "adult only" casino alley's...

Reviews.Title: “Horrified stay at Westgate Planet Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AXCruiser
Reviews.Content: When we checked in and ran into a staff at the hallway, he already mentioned this floor is not supposed to be opened and wondered why we are checked in to this 4th floor. This was a bad sign already. Then when we stepped into our room, there was a rotten smell from the air-conditioning. We thought the room might not be used for a while and that's why it had strange odor. Hence the smell might go away if we let the air conditioning ran for a while. Well, although it became mild, the rotten smell stayed the whole time. While waiting for the luggage to be delivered from the bell desk (which took an hour), we discovered the room was not even cleaned with dirty bathtub and sink. The biggest surprise was the in room safe deposit box with an used woman's bra still inside. We thought the house-keeping would be taken care of these issues but they didn't do anything at all. In fact they skipped one day's cleaning without any reason at all and tried to storm into our room the next day while we had the DO NOT DISTURB light on. The third day of our stay we saw a dead bird lying outside the window. We called the front desk to have someone to remove it but it turned out our request was ignored and we had this dead animal accompanied us the whole time. We thought with the special rate we were getting for a suite from Vegas.com and travelling with 10 baggages, we tried our best to bear the situation. The final night of our trip was the time of my life. At 5am in the morning I was woke up by a bang of noise and saw a white shadow wrapped by a bathrob staring at the in room safe inside the closet where the bra was still lying inside. I have every reason to believe why the hotel staff we first went into said the floor was not supposed to be opened was for the reason that it was haunted! I made a complaint to their front desk manager. Although he kept apologizing, his attitude was totally not sincere and it seemed to me that he had gone through these complains numerous times and won't do anything about it. I won't stay there again even for free!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what all the complaints are about!”
Reviews.Author: audilim
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel when seeing it on sale on Vegas.com before I read any reviews about it. I was disappointed when I checked Trip Advisor and saw all the horrible things people had to say about it!! This of course made me weary about staying there, but since the hotel was already paid for, I made the conscious decision to decide for myself how I felt about the hotel...and I'm glad I did! I don't know what all the fuss was about. Yes, the check in was separate from the Planet Hollywood Hotel registration, and a bit of a walk through the mall--but it wasn't so bad!! I voiced my concerns of the reviews I'd read to the hostess and she assured me that most of the complaints likely came from people who'd stayed in the time share rooms--we, however, were in a HOTEL room which are cleaned on a daily basis. We got to the room, and I was impressed. The king studio suite had a kitchenette, a bathroom, a plush bed and a sitting area with a floor to ceiling window! I checked everything out (after reading complains about cleanliness), and everything was great! Also, having read about security issues from prior guests, I made the decision to use my luggage as a safe to keep everything and lock it up which worked out well enough for me--not that I even think anyone would have taken anything anyway, after seeing the rooms after they'd been cleaned. Spent time at the pool, which was nice. It's 3 1/2ft at its deepest, but I wasn't there to swim so that was fine :) Great location on the strip, extremely comfy bed--NO complaints!! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertsing!”
Reviews.Author: World_Travelor_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Planet Hollywood Towers from July 30-Aug 2. We chose this hotel based on the websites facts and the pics. The websites advertising for this hotel is false. There isn't two towers, nor are they building a second one, according to the check in staff. The pool is hardly a "tropical oasis" as described on their website. There is NO sand around the pool and NO small circular hot tub which are in the pictures. The pool was over crowded and was only 3 feet deep. The pool drinks were overpriced! $12 for a small margarita and $7 for a can of warm Budwiser :( Check is was quick. They were sold out of the studio suites, so we got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. It was amazing! Very happy with the room, but unfortunately, everything I read about the cleanliness of this hotel on Trip Advisor was true. The garbage can still had garbage in it, the bathroom sinks weren't clean and the soap wasn't replaced. We called down to the front desk and asked to change to a clean room. The 2nd room was still amazing, just less dirty. It had hand and boob prints on the windows that over looked the strip as well as greasy hand prints all over the mirror that surrounded the jacuzzi tub, as well as a bit of soap scum in the shower. Hmmm, what does the cleaning staff do other than make the bed? The room itself was awesome! It had a kitchen with staneless steel appliences and a huge family room with shades that roll down with the push of a button. The shades then can be used as the TV. So, it's a floor to ceiling TV, very cool! The bedroom had a very comfortable king sized bed with another fantastic view of the strip. It also had a jacuzzi tub beside the bed. You can watch TV from there or look out at the night life :) The bathroom had a washer and dryer in it... very convienant! This hotel has a long ways to go before I would ever stay here again. To many kinks to work out. If you don't mind the false advertising and a dirty room, then stay here, otherwise, stay somewhere else till the hotel is a bit older and had time to figure their issues out...

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: david_gracey
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on the basis of some reasonable reviews, the pictures of the hotel, the fact it was relelatively new and the fact I was able to get a good rate. When I arrived I was informed I had been 'upgraded' to a room of equivilent size on the 50th floor. It turned out the upgrade was anything but. The room was a 'disabled access' room which did not have a bath or even a desk for me to do some work. The shower was barely adequate, could not be moved any higher than 4ft and the washbasin had no plug. I was too tired to complain having just travelled 20 hours so collapsed on the bed and fell asleep. Next morning I spoke to the manager who in fairness apologised and then allocated me another room. This was a one bedroom suite and was very spacous. During by 5 nights there I heard no corridor noise whatsoever - surprisingly quiet. It was very clean with good maid service. The problem is that it is not in the most conveneint location. The casino is a 10 minute walk from your room through the mall and the swimming pool is not as big or as nice as any of its competitors. So all in all I would say it is a good hotel but unfortunately not great. I would probably try somewhere else the next time I am in LV.

Reviews.Title: “With all the hotels in Vegas this is not the place.”
Reviews.Author: ddawg255
Reviews.Content: We stay in Vegas several times a year and like to try out different resorts, we wont be staying here again. We did get a great deal on our room and stayed July 25th and 26th. We valet and checked our luggage at Planet Hollywood. When we went to check-in the line was extremely long. I notcie a sign that mentioned Westgate Towers and sent my wife to inquire if we were in the right spot. They sent us upstair to a different location to check in. When checking in at the Towers I mentioned we had valet and check our luggage and then were sent here after see a long line at check in at Planet Hollywood. The registration clerk mentioned that it was a good thing we didn't wait in that long line. We were then sent to our room, sixteenth floor end of the hall. expecting to walk in to a great room in an new hotel this room was dirty and hadn't been cleaned. Back down to the registration desk. Our next room was on the 19th floor it was nice but still not extremely clean. The shower curtain was gross and there was a hair in the tub but we stayed in this room. The room has a Kitchenett but it's not much. We had some drinks to keep cold so we put them in the freezer and they never froze. We didn't try out the toaster or microwave but they looked as cheap as the mini-fridge. I called down to the bell desk for luggage and was told that it was checked in at Planet Hollywood and not at the Towers. I didn't realize, and nobody mentioned, that Planet Hollywood and Planet Hollywood Towers are two seperate holets. Needless to say it took 3 hours and 3 phone calls to get our bags. There is no ice machines on the floors. We were told ice would be delivered to our room; It never came. Most of the room controls are on in the TV and it was very slow to react. The pool looks a lot bigger in the pictures than it actually is. For my money the Aria was much nicer, much better managed place to stay. It was quiet but i don't think it wasn't very full.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, crap service”
Reviews.Author: kstst3
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite for a girls trip to Vegas. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the room looked exactly like it did on the internet. The electronic room blinds and projector tv were awesome. The hotel was dirty and our room was dirty (there was a pistacio in the corner when we arrived and still there when we left 3 days later) and the customer service was non-existent. Our toilets both had issues flushing and we ran out of toilet paper daily, but despite multiple calls to the 'anything, anytime' number, no one ever responded to fix the toilet or bring more tp. We also called for an extra blanket one night, four times, and no one ever responded. For a 4.5 star hotel, this place was lacking the basics, a working toilet, toilet paper, blankets and a clean room so although the room was very nice, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Tre28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in the Phase 2 tower and it was perfect. Great floor to celing windows, numerous tv's, beautiful kitchen kitchen and bathrooms and the decor was modern and hip. Beds were super comfy with high quality linens and more than enough towels for everyone. Great central location on strip...close to everything. Well worth the slurge for my 40th birthday celebration!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: craigh72
Reviews.Content: First off we are an owner. The service was great. Appreciated the personal representative. The room was perfect. Location and parking convenient. This is not a hotel! It is a timeshare property. We bought into Westgate because we live on the East Coast and their many properties there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: motherof6
Reviews.Content: Contrary to what so many reviewers are saying, our experience at Planet Hollywood Towers was fantastic. I will say at the outset that we are timeshare owners and were treated as royality. Our plane landed at 9:30 p.m., but it didn't matter; our host Kelly was waiting for us. After a breeze of a check-in, he escorted us to our condo and showed us around our home for the next week. Wow! Granite counter tops, sumptuous red leather sofas, and beds that invite snoozing well into late morning. And...the VIEW! You have breathtaking views of the strip and the mountains. Get up early, hit the automatic shades across your 10 foot floor to ceiling window, and watch the sunrise. The tower is mid-Strip within walking distance of anything a person might want to do in Vegas. The pool is large and there was always a party going on, but everyone was respectful of families. We did have a problem with the AC in the second bedroom and someone came within 5 minutes to fix it. When the problem reoccurred, a repairman came even though it was late at night. and that took care of it. We highly recommend Planet Hollywood Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJimmy
Reviews.Content: Mot sure what's up with all the negative reviews .. this place was totally awesome! Early check in (4 hours early) was a breeze. WE also had a late check out. Excellent customer service at front desk on both check in and check out. Room was really "suite" and funky cool. Pool was great. Nice leisurely walk through the Miracle Mile shops and you're there ... we've stayed at other hotels on the strip and had to walk just as far to get to our room. Planet Hollywood casino has really come along nicely .. had a blast there. Centrally located on the strip and you're close to everything. Only one issue .. the air conditioning wasn't working in our room when we arrived, but maintenance were there in less than 20 minutes to fix it. Again GREAT customer service. Elevators were quick. All in all, very impressed and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rotting food in microwave: Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: expat123
Reviews.Content: My husband checked in, and half the lights in the room didn't work. Somebody did fix them the same day, but when I checked in the next day, the safe didn't work. Yeah, security came and looked at it the same day, but DIDN'T FIX IT. Two more calls to request a fix were ignored. The third morning, we went to use the microwave for the first time and found A PLATE OF ROTTING PASTA in the microwave. The guy at the front desk, after telling us that "problems happen," grudgingly comped us $50 in room service for finding rotting food in our room. The next night, I discovered the giant towel I'd packed for my 6 day rafting trip in the Grand Canyon had disappeared with housekeeping -- apparently PH Towers probably won't be able to find it because "it is white." Really?? STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. ANYWHERE ELSE. I recommend the Golden Nugget, where service was great, even if the check-in line was long.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a bachelor party!”
Reviews.Author: darindcox
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 two bedroom rooms at the PH towers and they gave us one huge connecting room with 4 beds and 4 sofa beds which was awesome. There were 12 of us (no extra person charges) so we had plenty of places to sleep. Watched the World Cup final on the 15 foot projection screen tv which had an awesome picture. We had the do not disturb sign on the whole time so I have no idea about the service. One room wasn't cleaned until 7pm but they let us know it would be awhile when we checked in. We had a door get stuck and the maintenance man was there in 5 mins and fixed it. Loved the pool area but the drinks like everywhere in Vegas are outrageously priced. Only thing that I didn't like was that some of the pictures on the website weren't real pictures, there aren't any waterfalls, sand, or blackjack tables in the pool area. I would go back for sure

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: awoods
Reviews.Content: Like most (all) hotels in Vegas this one exists to serve the massive casino downstairs. The rooms are OK, in a tired eighties way. The massive buffet restaurant in the basement reputedly does 7 meals a day - and if you really want to become obese you can sign up to all 7 for $35 a day - and eat far more than is good for you. We only ate there once for breakfast - that was enough. The rooms and all the common areas are kept in a sort of casino twilight. That said there was nothing you could really object to, everything worked and looked reasonably clean. Unless you are into Las Vegas, and what it offers (sex, gambling, drinking and shopping) you probably will not go, if you are into those things I suspect it is as good as many and by no means bottom of the pile. It is worth wandering around the mall that surrounds the hotel - and catching the artificial thunder storm - it really sums up the excess that LV does so well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but customer service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: travel_reviewer44
Reviews.Content: We had booked three separate 1 bedroom suites for 1 week, May 19 to 26. Arrived at the hotel just before midnight, and there was no line up so check in was fast. We got 3 rooms right next to each other on the 30th floor. We were given no information about the hotel and amenities, but was informed that there would be a $50 deposit for incidentals (but didn't explain what that meant). As there were 3 adults staying in one of the suites, we called housekeeping at 1:00 am to bring some sheets, blankets and pillows for the pull out sofa. They said they would be right there. I called again at 2:00 am, they apologized and said they would be right there. They never did show up and the guest on the sofa bed had to use towels to keep warm. The next day I went to the checkin counter and asked them to have someone send up sheets and blankets for the pull out sofa and I told them that we never received them the night before. We got them within the hour. We also called from another of our rooms for sheets and blankets to make up another sofa bed, but they sent up 3 sheets and no blankets. Instead of calling housekeeping on the phone, there is a line that is for anything/anytime, and this line was much better than calling housekeeping. The housekeeping was sketchy. Some days our rooms didn't get cleaned and we had to call. Called them around 4:00 pm one day and they showed up around 10:00 pm, so we went out then. When we returned, the housekeeper had turned on the dishwasher and there was water and suds all over the kitchen floor. I called the anywhere/anytime line and they had someone come to clean up in about 10 minutes. (It leaked again a couple of days later). The carpet in the hallways needed to be vacuumed more often. The water pressure in the shower is very weak and the water does not drain quickly enough in the sinks, so they always look dirty. The washer/dryer takes forever. The decor of the room is really nice and the projector screen feature was awesome. However, because of the material of the headboard, dresser, counters, etc and all really dark, the dust is very noticeable. The light over the dining table had beer stoppers on it, so I don't think the rooms ever get a really good cleaning. As some of these suites are for time-shares, they were well equipped with dishes, utensils, etc. Each room had 2 bottles of water and coffee but we didn't know if we would be charged for drinking them or if they were part of the $50 incidentals. We had to ask. They are free. Incidentals mean that if you order room service, etc. After 2 days, we went to the customer information desk to ask about shows and she mentioned that there was an information package that we should have received when we checked in. It contained a PH Towers mug, information on how to operate the washer/dryer and a map of the area, etc. This is where they try to get you to the time share seminar. I am single and was with my sister and her husband. When she found out that I was single, she totally ignored me then did the hard sell to my sister and husband. If you spend 2 hours at a seminar, they give you show tickets for 1/2 price. They resisted. The location of the hotel was good. Had to walk about 10 minutes through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the casino but that was no big deal. The pool area was also very nice. We went shopping at the Premium Outlets and cost about $20 in a cab. The day before we checked out, the manager of the hotel was going around asking for feedback. As the hotel only opened in December, there still seemed to be a few kinks to work out. I told him everything (especially not receiving blankets) and he had heard that from someone else as well. He did apologize but we were never offered any kind of discount for our inconveniences. We did receive a very good deal on the room when we booked, as it is still a fairly new hotel. Not sure if we would stay there again, as I am sure you can get a good deal at other hotels as well. Overall, it was a really great vacation and the biggest issue was housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Scorpio78
Reviews.Content: First, we read the reviews and were wary of the service, valet, and cleanliness. We were prepared for the fight. Booked on the phone and told the gal that we read lots of bad reviews but she was very friendly and helpful. We pulled up for valet which had a sign saying it was full but we weren't sure where to go to check in and unload luggage because of taxis and other cars. At least five valets were standing around ignoring us even though we needed help. We gave up and went to self park and hauled our bags through the mall to check in. Front desk staff(Kelly) was extremely nice and we immediately complained about valet which she apologized for-made no excuses but said she would call and talk to them about it. We requested a high floor and she gave us a room on the 52nd floor! We had the 1 bedroom king suite since we were traveling with our 14 y/o and the room was amazing!! We had a view of the north strip, could see the Bellagio fountain. However, the bedroom window was dirty-oh, simple handprints would have been tolerable but it was pretty obvious that this was the print of an amorous couple using the window for support and the beautiful view as their foreground. NOT pleasant but we checked the rest of the room and the cabinet door for the washer/dryer was broken. We immediately reported those items to the front desk staff who were apologetic and said they would have it taken care of. We left for dinner and a little gambling and when we returned the door had been fixed but the window was still not cleaned. Called the front desk fairly irate and forcefully requested housekeeping ASAP. Within 2 min we had a call saying they would be there in 5-10 min and about 2 min later they arrived. He cleaned all the windows very thoroughly and made sure we were satisfied before leaving (we tipped him even because we were so impressed by him). The rest of the stay was WONDERFUL-quiet, great views of the fireworks (we were there for the 4th). We are already talking about our next stay there and want to take friends! Summary: We were there 03-05 Jul 2010. Prepare for problems (we even took Lysol in case) but as long as you follow up when there are problems, the rooms are WELL worth these minor inconveniences. TV controls most everything in the rooms-takes some getting used to because there are delays. Modern, comfortable, convenient to shops and The Strip. I 100% recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with this resort”
Reviews.Author: mindelicato
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were very impressed by the hotel. There are no smoky casinos’s to walk through and the entire resort is smoke free. It's a very contemporary hotel and it is very clean. We were given a room on the 29th floor. There were already signs of some wear on the doors since they are black and I wonder how hard it would be to give these things quick touch ups. The room was spacious but there were lights that didn't work. After talking with some other guests we found this was a common theme. For a newer hotel this just seemed odd. The TV is setup to control parts of the room like lights and temp. However the controls are very slow and getting up and manually making the changes is faster. We 1 guest complain on the elevator their door fell off when they checked in. Then another complained they were checked into an occupied room. We used the pool and on Monday we were checked by security just to get to it. They made sure we didn't bring any drinks in not even a coke that we bought from their mall. What was nice about that is then they had no bar service or way to get a beverage of any kind in 100 degree heat all day at the pool. Security was not very nice about this policy. On Tuesday we decided we wouldn't bring anything to drink since we couldn't the day before but then noticed a sign that said no alcoholic beverages. However they weren't letting you bring in anything so they could force you to buy the overpriced drinks at the pool. On Tuesday unlike Monday they searched our bags. We can bring in 10 bags into our room without being searched but one pool bag is a security threat. I was amazed by the lack of style and class for this type of place. On Thursday I couldn't get a signal to save my life on my cell phone in my room. So I had to use their phones to make a long distance call. It did last about 60 minutes. Well, I checked out and noticed that 1 call to a US number cost me $169. You can buy unlimited plans for nothing and businesses pay hardly anything. Nothing on the phone to indicate they are about to empty your checking account if you use this service. When we checked out the attendant asked how our stay was and I told her. MGM Signature was way classier, who wants to be harassed just to use a pool, why would I want to buy a vacation package from them? , and that they really took advantage of the guests on domestic long distance. I got a sorry and have a nice day. I guess that is why they ask. No I would not stay here again. MGM Signature is across the street and much classier and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay for a kitchen you can't use?”
Reviews.Author: JYRR-TX
Reviews.Content: First off, the one bedroom we stayed in was very nice and so was the pool area. However, we were in Las Vegas for a 10 night stay and wanted to cook in our room part of the time. So, when I say the 1 bedroom at the Towers advertised a "Full kitchen with high-end stainless steel appliances" with a fridge, range, etc. we went ahead and booked. (Their web picture also shows what appear to be cooking utensils in the background!) However, when we got to our room and started looking for pots, pans and cooking utensils we did not find any. I called the front desk and was informed that only "owners" were supplied with cooking utensils and pots and pans. I asked then why did their web site advertises a full kitchen and why was there a range top and plates and and silverware, etc.? If I could not cook here, I would have booked elsewhere. He said he agreed and he was new and did I want to speak to a manager. I said yes. That was around 4PM. By ~6PM we had not heard anything back so I called again and went thru the whole rigamarole again - and I said the manager had never called - even though their computer indicated I had spoken to him (???!!!) She said she understood my issue and would have housekeeping send up the requested items. We went out to dinner and got back ~7:30PM - no pots, pans, etc. I visited the desk in person this time. The gentleman assured me he would get right on it since someone had told me they would be delivered. We went to a show and got back ~10PM - still nothing. I called again and this gentleman birddogged the problem until we got the requested items ~ 11:45 PM. Other than this initial hassle, our stay was really great. The room was very nice, the pool though small with minimal shade areas had multiple depths for all. The location is excellent. The blackout blinds and noise reduction in the rooms work quite well. As far as recommending to a friend - depends on whether they are wanting kitchen facilities beyond a coffee maker and microwave/fridge or not. Because, why pay for a 'full service kitchen' that you can't use!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere, don't let positive reviews trick you”
Reviews.Author: danbodenstein
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel stay I have had in vegas. The rooms are dusty. Customer service is terrible. They are rude, and slow. The elevators are slow and in many cases you have to wait a long time. We actually took the stairs once instead of waiting. The hotel is not ON the Strip. You have to walk down a street or through the mall to get to the Strip or the casino. There are no instructions as to how to use the TV control, or room controls. There was no iron in the room, and no pad or pen. The walls are paper thin, you can hear conversations, TV's in the next room and in the hallways. There was a constant odor from the toilet. The toilets are black so you can't see if they are clean. The microwave/convection oven was dirty. There were limited dishes and utensils. The pool is 3.5 feet deep, throughout the pool. There is no coffee house in the hotel, you have to go through the mall (Miracle Mile Shops) to the casino to get coffee. Don't be fooled by the free dinner and show tickets, it's a timeshare sales pitch. Save your money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the negative reviews put you off!”
Reviews.Author: JPAngel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Vegas with 2 friends back in March 2010, pretty soon after the hotel had opened for business. We got a great deal on the rooms and were then upgraded to the suites which were absolutely fantastic - basically an apartment of about 250 sq ft with kitchenette, living room and bedroom complete with jacuzzi!! I mean, what else would a group of Brits want from a Vegas hotel? A win or two would have been nice... So the hotel itself is (a very pleasant mall-based) 20 min walk to the PH casino and the strip, but we found this to be perfect as it gave you a chance to get away from it all if you wanted. There was no hotel restaurant (at least none that I was aware of) but we did some self-catering (cereal, bowl + milk = breakfast) or ate out, for which the choices are endless. We were delayed coming home for a day and were put up in Treasure Island for a night and all I can tell you is that the two hotels don't compare for style, comfort and views - PH Towers wins by a mile. If the two hotels were a hand in blackjack, then TI is a 17 (close, but you'd still be nervous), whilst PH is more like a 20 (confident that you're on to a winner)!

Reviews.Title: “Great room... service was ok... Overall FUN”
Reviews.Author: longbui82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Wasn't expecting too much since they had mix reviews. The valet was ok, had to wait while they were helping other drivers, but would be nice to get some acknowledgment or let us know if valet was full or not. Check in was quick. They offer an upgrade for $50 more. I tried to see if I could get less but the rep lied and said they were fully booked. (What a lie, checked in on a Monday and throughout our 3 day stay, I think we were the only one on the floor) I took the upgrade since we booked the room cheap and also heard that the one bedroom is like night and day compared to the studio. And wow, what a difference. The room was hug, I love the layout and design. There was a full kitchen with dishwasher, stove, and full size fridge, a dining table, sectional sofa, jacuzzi in bedroom, washer/dryer, TV in each room, and a projector TV on a screen that comes down and covers the whole window. That's 4 TV and a projector TV. I was enjoying the world cup throughout the room everywhere I was sitting at. The only thing was that there was no pots and pans. When I called, the girl said it was for owners only. Told her the what's the point to have kitchen with no pots and pan and her reply was for us to buy one. Not being too surprise from reading other reviews, we just ended doing that 24 hour buffet. (which is a great deal if you start at dinner time. for $34 you get dinner, breakfast, lunch, and dinner again is best deal in vegas) Yes, there was no instructions how to use the projector but very easy to figure out. But I can understand if you're not tech savvy. We were able to enjoy an in room movie and felt like we were at the movie theater. Screen was crisp and clear. Of course I'm the one enjoying the TV and projector, but wife loves the fact that there was a washer and dryer. Again, no instructions but easy to fig out. She love the fact that she doesn't have to do laundry when we get home. Came with clean clothes, go home with clean clothes. She also loved the jacuzzi. Very relaxing after walking all day on the strip. The over all was a great experience. We're actually planing to bring our family back soon but will be more prepare this time around. Just don't expect too much from their service there and maybe one of them will surprise you. I just enjoyed our room. Great place to stay at

Reviews.Title: “I had to clean my own toilet. This place is not worth the savings.”
Reviews.Author: squirrel911
Reviews.Content: I chose the place based on location and price. I figured they would have worked out all the service issues for a new hotel. Not a chance. Our room was DIRTY. Hand prints everywhere. Broken furniture. The housekeeping staff in totally untrained. After we checked in, I saw that our toilet was still soiled from the last tenant. REALLY soiled, do you understand? I also noticed that the sheets (which are terrible quality) had big black marks on them. I went to the front desk and nicely asked for my toilet to be cleaned and for the sheets to be changed. I came back to my room after dinner and a show and the attendent had left new sheets on the bed for ME to put on the bed. And the toilet was not cleaned. So I had to do it myself in order to use it. This was my first time to Vegas and I will never stay here again. The front desk staff was very unprofessional. I visited other hotels, Bellagio, Ceaser's, Aria, The Hotel, now those are fabulous places. PH Towers is absolutely not worth saving $50 a night. Other notes: There is only one tower, because they did not build the whole hotel; there is not a white sand beach at the pool, don't believe that BS; and no food service, you have to walk 10 minutes to get a cup of coffee. Bottom Line, Westgate, the owner of the property, has no business being in the Vegas market.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: travel4_10
Reviews.Content: This is not a safe place to stay. Our room was broke in while we were out to a show. We called security to file a report for the stolen money. The security guard told us that when he arrived at our room and the door was shut that it was not locked. Shortly after another security guard came and told us the same thing and he repeatedly tried the door and got the same results. The security guard tried to download the information from the safe and found that the system was not working properly and the last information was a month prior to our incident. We have tried to contact the security at this facility everyday since the incident in early June and get no answer. We leave a message and get no response. My advice is to stay away from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: kauinca
Reviews.Content: PH Towers is in a terrific location on the strip - walking distance to everything! The lobby opens directly into the Miracle Mile Shops (terrific shopping!), which is very convenient for dining etc... As this was a last minute trip, and not planned by me, I can't comment on front desk service or reservations as I didn't deal with any of that. That said, the room was modern, well laid out and comfortable, and had a fabulous view from the wall of windows with an automatic shade. The style is very Hollywood, with a picture of the Hollywood sign on one wall and a lit up Oscar on the other - take a peek at the pictures others have posted of their rooms. However, as mentioned by several other reviewers, cleanliness was a bit lacking. There were several locations in the room that needed dusting badly, and there was someone's old dirty sock in the closet! When maid service came in the morning, I asked them to come back later, but late that night when we returned to the room we found they never came back to clean - disappointing. Toiletries were of average quality, the black toilet was kind of weird - but maybe that's just me... If you need to pick up bottles of water, snacks, suntan lotion, that forgotten toothbrush, etc..., there's an ABC store (yes, the Hawaiian ABC!) in the Miracle Mile - much less expensive than other shops and more convenient than walking on the strip to CVS or Walgreens (which are nearby). All in all, PH Towers is a nice property in a great location. There are so many places to stay in Vegas, that I'd have to say that my returning to PH Towers would be commensurate with the price of this vs. several other Vegas properties in which I would be more inclined to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - poor upkeep”
Reviews.Author: karkev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of their grand opening price. Nice pool(no shade though). Rooms and lobby very nicely decorated. Cleaning is definitely very lax. First suite they gave us had a dirty sock in the tub and the sinks in the bathroom had not been cleaned after the previous guest. Didn't unpack and asked for another room. The second one was much better. However, the carpet in the hallway was never vaccumed the 4 days we were there and there were room service glasses outside the doors of rooms and one door even had a burned pancake on the handle the entire time we were there(which we took a picture of). Hate to see what it's going to look like a few years from now if they don't improve their cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSCOTT249
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I had $5000 stolen & 2 credit cards may 29. The hotel confirmed house keeping had been in the my room by the key authorization report and camera's systems. The hotel said they would assist the police in questioning there staff, but had no intentions of REIMBURSING OR COMPENSATING ME for the money or items stolen. As I left the hotel a young lady on her honeymoon was at the front desk crying that $500 and her laptop had been stolen from her room. I REPEAT DO NOT STAY HERE!!! YOU ARE NOT SAFE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: hiljayc
Reviews.Content: After reading very mixed reviews for this hotel I was apprehensive, but expected it to either be really great or really horrible. Luckily it exceeded my expectations. My boyfriend and I went to Planet Hollywood Towers with two of our friends. We chose the Planet Hollywood towers, as we have stayed in both the MGM Signature, and the Planet Hollywood. We liked the room size and design of the MGM Signature, but the atmosphere of the Planet Hollywood cannot be beat! From start to finish everything was awesome! We parked in the self parking, and when were parking we saw the entrance to the lobby right next to the parking lot, and headed to check in. Check in was a breeze, we requested a north facing room on a high floor, after reading other's reviews. When I hear we were only on the 12th floor I was a little bummed, but when we got to the room the view was great! Also, the room was awesome. We got settled right in and tested the projection screen, it was very easy to use, so don't know what people who had problems before had difficulty with. The room was clean, and had everything we needed, except it was missing sheets for the pull out couch. We called housekeeping, and they answered the phone immediately, and brought us a set of sheets, and blankets within a few minutes. I did notice a very small amount of wear and tear in the hallway, but it is Vegas, and party goers are rough on the property, there was nothing too extreme. There was a small amount of dust around the edges, but it was quite obvious the floors had been vacuumed recently. The last night we took advantage of the hot tub in the room, which was amazing! I will definitely stay here, it was amazing. Also if you stay here you should check out Holly Madison's Peepshow, I was a bit apprehensive as it is a burlesque show, but the boys in the group really wanted to go (for obvious reasons), and I am so glad that we did! What a great show!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geemiker
Reviews.Content: The PH Towers by Westgate is a new trendy hotel next to the older Planet Hollywood resort, formerly the Aladdin. We've stayed here for about 7 days and the overall feeling was prefect in this place. Rooms are nicely decorated and very comfortable. The view from our room was also very nice and overlooking Las Vegas. We didn't used any of the hotel facilities like room service or otherwise, so I can't give an opinion about that. The only thing not functioning yet during our stay was the business center and since we had a large annd heavy box to be shipped we needed to carry this to the Mezanine level of the older Planet Hollywood resort. Besides this the overall stay was perfect and I would recommend this place to everyone traveling to Las Vegas. If you are a smoker, avoid this place since it a non-smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LagunaBeachMV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a few friends, it was a great find. The rooms very awesome, with great facilties and best of all a Huge Projection TV to watch the World Cup Soccer on. Next time I visit Vegas with my children, I will definately stay here, although I just wish the pool area was more child friendly. Only issue was no room service, but otherwise staff were pretty friendly and we were very happy with the room. I just walked down into the main hotel for coffee and bagels in the morning, so was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best things are location and floor to ceiling windows”
Reviews.Author: FCTraveler044
Reviews.Content: If location and view are the most important things to you, then PH Towers might be your spot but I've stayed at many LV hotels and this doesn't even make my top 75%. The hotel was marketed as 4 1/2 stars and a suite. Well the Studio room is the same size as any other room you'll find on the strip only significantly more expensive. Trump has similarly marketed rooms but are much, much nicer in quality and design. They seem to have a problem keeping the utensils clean. The silverware was a nightmare when I pulled it out to use it. I left it out and fortunately the maid staff did clean it and put it away but why was it that way to begin with? The main level of the resort is empty. People don't hang out or congregate there. It's almost sterile. Fortunately the MIracle Mile shops are attached to the hotel. I did like the bed but am not big on black toilets (how do you know if they are really clean?) Also, some of the hotel's own branding was poorly executed--can we talk peel and stick decals in the elevators to advertise your property? Really tacky and they are already being chipped away. You could do much better for your money elsewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “SAVE YOUR MONEY! BETTER OF STAYING AT THE IMPERIAL PALACE.”
Reviews.Author: catshea5
Reviews.Content: They are complete frauds. The room that we paid for was not what we got. The rooms were dirty upon arrival. One of the shade were broken and we had to have an engineer come out. The room was constantly like an oven. Their HVAC setting were all off. The so called fully stocked kitchen was a joke. They did not even have a bottle opener. When we called to ask for one they said they could not provide one for us and the more expensive rooms only got one. And to top it all off, I just checke my credit card and they charged me $120 more for what we paid for. Oh yes and the pool is a JOKE!!! We tried to rent a cabana and soley for the misters. They tried to charge us $350 (full price) for a cabana with no misters. We told them that made no sense to charge us full price and there execuse was the misters had been broken for quite some time and they still charged full price. DO NOT GO THERE! I am getting ready to report them to the BBB. This is far from over.

Reviews.Title: “Modern large condo room great if you are staying with friends..not perfect though”
Reviews.Author: NMF
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was very hesitant about my stay here. So I guess I was expecting the worst when I checked in. But I was plesantly surprised we arrived early at 12 and walked up the escalators someone met us there and asked my name, sent me straight to the desk to check in. Check in smooth. Went to room, not the best view not the worst 14 floor. The room wasn't completely clean, you could tell no one had been there in awhile dust, fingerprints, tub not real clean. But nothing very bad. The room itself was wonderful, the TV's the 2 bedrooms and baths. Much better than a hotel room. The kitchen was great to , we had all appliances, blender for drinks etc... It took a bit to figure out the projection TV and washer/dryer (European style). Great couch to hand out with friends and table, ordered in one night. We were there 3 nights, our floor was quiet. Never heard another person or noise at night. We cleaned up ourselves the 1st day, 2nd day housekeeping came and did a good job, cleaned up the bedrooms and bath left what we needed. I liked that the condo was quiet, good location to walk to casino and mall but not in the casino with all the noise and people in the lobby. On the negatives: The pool is not the one in the photos, they even had a large sign in their lobby with a big pool with sand etc around it with a tagline "best pool in Vegas" Now Open" asked the guy where is this pool..he acted like he did not know what I was talking about, I showed him the 6ft sign and he said" oh that one must not be finished yet!" Pool that is open is small, no food to order, no shade and when it was 110 needed some. Umbrellas they did have all blew into the pool and hit people as they were not weighed down. Staff acts like you are a teenager, they want to check your purse before entering to see if I had alcohol in it!!! Like it was a party pool in college??? Rude. If I was a owner would be really offended. Hallways need cleaned Valet is a mess!! no direction, pulled in twice and they directed us in the valet line then we unloaded and they said it was full?? why did you tell me to pull in the line then?? OH sorry go self park. Could use some info book in the room..ie room service, control directions, info about the property etc.. Better cleaning of the rooms Stay away from the timeshare sales. I am a travel agent and I have sat through info presentations at Wyndam and Hilton. They one guy Chuck tried to tell us we could get three nights free and dinner, and show tickets if we sat through the presentation. When I went back and talked to another guy he said that was ridiculous!!!!! and you could get $100 in credits. IF you want more info make sure you talk to the company directly not the sales guys, they do not know what is what. I tried to get some other info for clients and they didnt have any info. said check the website! Just do not sign anything on site. Seemed to be a young party crowd on the weekend, I think the price point is too low and is bringing in the young partiers. I feel bad for owners of this property, if could be a great modern upscale resort if they fine tuned some issues. I haved stayed in probably 13 hotels in Vegas, and this was the best room for the price. Since it was all new and had 1000 sq feet. Just needs some work on false advertising and not trying to scam people into their timeshares.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE PH WESTGATE TOWERS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lamcee1
Reviews.Content: This resort is a real tragedy. The Westgate Towers is the newest addition on the strip, but already has a reputation of poor quality and service. The building is beautiful, location is great. It is inside a nice mall with great food, casino, shows, parking garage, and walking distance to most everything. When I first arrived they lost my reservation after flying 5 hours! I booked it through Interval International and they failed to provide me with a correct confirmation number and booked it under the wrong name. This was not PH's fault, but we were there for 2 hours trying to figure it all out. My God! I had all the paperwork confirming everything. Instead of focusing on solving the problem, for 2 hours they focused on who's fault the error was. They should have simply accomodated me and sorted it out later. They were actually NOT going to give me a room and I would have been stranded in Las Vegas! The staff were distracted, unorganized and ghetto. They gave me a room. Later I spoke with the manager because I wanted an upgrade after all I had been through. The lack of customer service continued, DANA, the manager, said she would look in to what happened (once again with the blaming and finding out whose fault it was) did not call me back after two days! Finally, I went to the front desk and raised HELL and the shift manager (Tonita Mack) and desk clerk had more courtesy than apparently their manager because when I raised hell they went on and on about how it wasn't their fault (again) but gave me the upgrade. They admit there were "too many hands in the pot" when it came to reservations but would accomodate me. Finally!! Why did it take 3 days for someone to understand good old fashion customer service. But the saga continues. The upgrade we got was not cleaned, projector was broken, chairs had black dust and dirt on them, hand prints on the shower doors and walls, tub had a ring of dirt, and the shower knob came off!! How can a place that has just been built already be a dump? We stayed on the 56th floor which apparently housekeeping doesn't get up to that often. The hallways were filthy, the same cups and glasses left in the hallway stayed the entire week I was there. Laundry detergeant stayed on the floor the whole week. When I called housekeeping they half cleaned the room leaving dirty q-tips on our floor and a remaining dirt circle around the tub, glass stains on the counters. The projector guy was awesome, he came right away and fixed it. Yea for the maintenance people!! The pool was nice, cabana's seemed nice. If you are the first one to rent one you get a discount, $250 for the day. To summarize, I say it's a tragedy because it appears PH bit off more than they could chew. The furniture and equipment is lovely but requires high maintenance and they just don't have the staff to clean it, all 56 floors and keep it in order. Here are some tips for the resort and the area for folks on a budget: 1. Best deal is a 1 bedroom with a FULL kitchen at PH (but I suggest you stay somewhere else!!!) 2. If you buy drinks, water, snacks, Walgreen's is within walking distance, the snacks in the mall is overpriced, Walgreen's open 24/7 3. You can do Vegas with or without a car, just be prepared to walk a lot regardless 4. PH has their own garage, awesome deal if you do have a car, garage parking is free in Vegas, heavy traffic starts Thursday nights, after 6pm forgetta bout it 5. Valet parking nice at different hotels, it's worth the few bucks, especially if you are trying to catch shows on time 6. ABC store cheapest souvenirs in mall, also some off-strip stores cheapest if you have a car 7. Need a quick outfit- Ross's is just off strip and huge, get a nice outfit cheap 8. Awesome shows- any Cirque Soleil show is amazing (Mystere was great) and if you have the money, see "O" at the Bellagio!! Wayne Brady is funny also. They also have a schedule of shows in little books in the lobby of PH. 9. PAY NOTHING REGULAR PRICE: there are discount kiosks on the strip and the concierge desk that offer coupons for food, shows, tours and stuff 10. SPA? A Touch of Las Vegas will come to your room or pool side or save and go to them. There place isn't much to look at from the outside but they are super nice and professional, 702-871-0899. The french toast dipped in creme is delicious at the restaurant in the PH casino, food is good at Harley cafe, cheap burgers at In and Out Burgers off the strip, sbarro pizza is in the mall, order a whole pie and not by the slice if you are really watching dollars. Vegas has so much more, you have to keep coming back and back. I hope this helps a little. Remember what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas so live it up, no one will ever remember you when you go home so make an a** out of yourself!! Lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spectacular Suite, Everything I had anticipated, however”
Reviews.Author: Catherine D
Reviews.Content: What a great location, close to Bellagio, Paris, Miracle Mile Shopping and Planet Hollywood Casino. My husband could not believe the size and oppulence of the suite. However, it wasn't so clean when we arrived. There was a smelly bowl of food left in the microwave, the toilet floor was not too clean,the kitchen bench and dining bar/table needed a good wipe over and I suspected the room had not been thoroughly cleaned before we arrived. Made a call to housekeeping and they responded within a few minutes, microwave and bathroom floor was cleaned. Next day I went to reheat my coffee in the microwave and the suspect bowl of food was still there!! When we returned to our room later in the day the housekeeping person was cleaning our room and I pointed out the bowl of food which she immediately removed, saying she thought we had left it there (not her fault). There were hairpins all over the dresser in the bedroom which stayed there our entire stay, a stray battery on the floor which didn't belong to us. Despite these small anomolies the bed linen/towels were all clean and housekeeping did clean our room every day of our stay. I rang maintenance for help with the washing machine and they could not have been more helpful. We actually enjoyed coming back to our room to enjoy some quiet time away from the strip and take in the spectacular views. Our complaints were only small and if you stay there and have the same a quick call to the service desk should get things fixed for you. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location. Few teething problems need sorting out.”
Reviews.Author: FuManStu42
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal by booking through an owner and it was worth every penny. That said, I am not sure I would pay the official PH price for it when other main strip hotels are available but the room was big and well kept. We had a large and smaller suite, which had a connecting door. The suite was of a very high standard and apart from some problems with the remote controls for the TV (which were eventually solved by forcing the hotel to swap the remote!), all was good. The (larger) kitchen had far more in it than we needed and the fridge had a good ice maker. You could easily go self-catering in these apts, as a lot of people seem to do there. The huge electric blind failed once in the smaller room and it was fixed while we were out. If it had happened as you wanted to sleep, this would have been a problem. There were a few little things which showed this was a new build which hadn't bedded in yet but nothing that would put me off staying again. The maid service was terrible but this wasn't a real problem for us. We were on the 21st floor and there was one cart with two staff for the whole floor. They only got to us very late in the day so if we were in and had DND on, we got no service. The smaller room got cleaned once and the larger room didn't get done at all. We only really needed the bins doing but there was no way to arrange that. The pool area was good but the pool was so cold (when the air temp was 30c/90f!) that most people just kept to the loungers or used the Jacuzzi (which was top!).The location is perfect and although it's a fairly no frills place, the accommodation was very good. If you only need a room and don't care about room service etc, there are no problems with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, comfortable room. Pathetic amenities and service.”
Reviews.Author: DACSANDERS
Reviews.Content: We cancelled reservations at Aria to stay at the PH Towers Westgate because the pool looked so fantastic. Was informed by reservations that the pool shown on the website was the pool at PH Towers (it is very confusing how Planet Hollywood has their 2 properties separated). Upon check-in, when we asked the Front Desk about the pool not looking like the one in the picture, the Front Desk Represented asked me to clarify "which picture did you see? "The one on the PH Hollywood Towers website," I replied. I was then informed that the luxurious pool in the brochure was "not finished" and that the picture on the website is an "artist's rendering". Waited for 40 minutes to talk to Front Desk manager about the fact that website is different than what you actually get at PH towers. Also, rented a cabana for $75 (because they aren't "finished" yet with tv, elect, etc.), however upon arrival at pool was told that cabana rental was $250. I informed the cabana rental folks that I has specifically talked to "Lorena" about the cabana rental when I called PH a few days prior. I was told a young lady in the cabana rental area that she had never heard of "Lorena". Nice. Housekeeping tidyed up room, but left no towels. Ice maker did not work and it took Guest Services 90 minutes to bring extra ice to room. This hotel will drive you nuts because everything is like total disorganization. It seems that staff are not properly trained and no one really knows how to handle all of the problems. Its a complete cluster. Not a pleasant stay at all. I would never stay here again and I wouldn't even think about buying a time-share there. At least until the next millenium when they get all the kinks of their operation worked out. I think we would have had a more restful time at the Las Vegas Travelodge!!! Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room But Many Problems!”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac613
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the PH Towers from May 22nd to May 25th (3 nights). We booked a regular suite and paid extra for an upper level room. Here was our experience: Things didn't start out well because when we arrived (drove from So. Cal.) there was a sign that said "Valet Parking Full". As we drove to find self-parking we noticed a lot of empty spots in the Valet Parking area so drove back and stopped to ask for help. Finally a Valet person walked up and said "I suppose I can fit you in". Went up to check in and there were two lines. One for hotel guests (us) and one for owners. There are about 10 terminals behind the desk but there were only 2 people working them. Any time there was an owner in line they took them first. Even though there was only about 2 people ahead of us it took about 30 minutes. I realized when she gave me the room number 21-XXX that something seemed not right since I had paid for the upper level room but I couldn’t remember how many floors there were so I thought we’d just check it out. Went up to the room and realized there were I think 56 floors. There’s two banks of elevators for something like 3-28 and 29-56. Since 21 wasn’t even in the second bank of elevators it sure didn’t seem like it should be considered an “upper level” room! Went into the room and it was much smaller than we had expected. The kitchenette was extremely small with mini-everything. The view was facing the airport with not a whole lot to look at. The jucuzzi tub was in the bathroom and was pretty small. I think two people in there would have been pretty cramped. We have stayed frequently at the Signature and their junior suites put this one to shame! Since we felt that we didn’t get the “upper-level” room that we paid for I tried calling the Front Desk- never got an answer. Tried again and finally was switched over to Guest Services who said that they can’t help and I had to talk to the Front Desk. So finally we packed up and headed back down to the Front Desk. After waiting in line about another 30-40 minutes we were told that anything above the 15th floor is considered “upper-level”. Also, since the PH Towers sits sort of sideways to the Strip they considered every room a Strip view so would not change rooms based on view. The view we had towards the airport is South-Strip. The better view towards Paris, etc., is North-Strip view which is much better. After asking what my options were they offered to upgrade to a 1-bedroom North-Strip view for an extra $50/night which I begrudgingly took. This room was on the 50th floor and the difference was like night and day! The 1-bedrooms are huge and beautiful.
