The kitchen is large, big table, sectional sofa, and this one has the projector TV (although had to call Guest Services who sent someone up to show us how to use it). There are a lot of fancy controls in the room and absolutely nothing explaining how to use any of them. There is definitely a separate closed off bedroom. The bathroom has two doors where you can enter from the bedroom or the living area. What’s very different about this room is that the Jacuzzi tub is actually in the bedroom itself and not in the bathroom (more on that later). The bathroom has a separate shower with rainhead that has extremely low water pressure! The toilet is in a stall-like thing with a frosted glass door but it’s not a full door (doesn’t go to floor or ceiling) so there’s really no privacy if someone else is in the bathroom. About the Jacuzzi tub- we used it fine the first two nights. Very romantic that you can sit and see out the window (over the bed) for the Vegas lights, however, the last night we were there the GF was in it and turned the jets on and, for whatever reason this time, the jets shot water straight up in the air and literally flooded the bed!! We had to have maid service come up and change all of the bedding at 1:30am. The maid was actually a real sweetheart about it and she showed up fairly quickly. Pros: - Location- Great walking downstairs and being right in Miracle Mile for restaurants, etc. - Jacuzzi tub was great but be careful (make sure jets are not pointing up!!). - Great views from floor to ceiling windows - Projector TV was awesome though never really used it- it’s Vegas! Cons: - Lines at Front Desk are very slow - Junior suites not very big - Valet Parking should never be full! - Water pressure is terrible in shower -Need to flush toilets multiple times - “Upper Level” rooms can sometimes not be very high (above 15) - Only nice pool day we had the pool was packed. Can’t imagine what it would be like if they build the second tower. - No privacy in toilet stall if someone else in bathroom. - Construction seems pretty cheap all around!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Alot of Work”
Reviews.Author: afastudent
Reviews.Content: I am an owner of Westgate resorts and i stayed in suite 3016 and 3018 of Planet Hollywood Towers. So i've just checked in and i'm heading up to my room when i notice the doors in the hallway have rubber pieces falling from the top of the door. The in my room there are broken shelves in the bathroom, the sink drains VERY slowly, the TV shuts off and turns on when it wants and the room service never comes! The second night at 2 AM the TV turns on blasting when im sleeping. Then on the first night room service comes at 11 PM when my family and i are sleeping. The place isnt even fully built. There is only one tower out of two and the pool is half done. The pool was freezing cold and only 3 1/2 feet deep. The staff was very helpful in solving these problems and were very friendsly.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than it should be for a reason”
Reviews.Author: bbblaw
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about the hotel when I got a 2 bdrm suite for 356/nt, but I figured: new building, owned by Harrahs, plenty of room for us and our kid (with grandma down the hall to babysit nights), it'll be great, right? Nope. Despite ordering a crib in advance, we get it delivered to our room several hours after we check in. Room service? How about a chicken wrap (seriously, that was about it, even the bell hop told us not to bother). Great news, though, we have a full kitchen... Only no pot/pans (which won't come up often, but if you're going to have a full kitchen, I mean, come on - when we called down to ask for some, they we very rude and and evaded the question before finally saying, they don't have any). It's now 6pm the next day, and we've had our "please service this room" button pushed since 11 am, and we got back to, yup, you guessed it, nothing. I'm going to leave it on to see if they notice it at all this trip. The pool? It's crowded, and the smallest in town. The staff? With the exception of one bell hop, pretty surly. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again, it's just not quite cheap enough when there are so many better options on the strip these days. If you do stay here, I have one suggestion, at least make sure you're not where I am, the 4th floor, with a stunning view of an alley and the parking structure 30 feet from your window-and all the lovely drunkards parking and screaming all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, no ice sucked”
Reviews.Author: iownrocks
Reviews.Content: Loved the accomodations, loved the location, brand new had to wash all the dishes still had tags on them. Very disappointed when went to get ice there were no ice machines. Had to order through room service which took over an hour. Other than that it was a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raquelle179
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PH Towers by Westgate with my husband and 2 young kids for 5 days. We booked a 1 bedroom suite. At first, I read all the negative reviews and got nervous of our non-refundable stay at the PH towers. However it was overall a very good experience. Hotel was clean and very new, got a great view of the strip (17th floor). Everything was in working order including the amazing projector screen that my husband got a kick out of. The pool was amazing as well, small but not busy like other Vegas pools. It's also not true that you would have to walk through the mall to get to the hotel, as we thought the first 2 nights. They have a separate entrance that leads to the same parking lot for the mall, it's actually alot faster to get to your room than any other hotel in Vegas. Full kitchen was awesome and came in very handy.. The only negative thing i can say is that the sofa bed didnt come with any sheets or extra blankets so we had to get it from the main bed Overall thought, we love this hotel and would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience - well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Mallard448
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-day outing with the guys for our annual trip to Vegas. We've typically gotten a couple of standard rooms at various hotels on the Strip in the past, but decided to make a change to the PH Towers and get a 2-bedroom suite instead. Booked the room directly through the PH Towers site, and was given a 30% discount for Grand Opening special. I was slightly nervous based on reading some of the reviews of prior guests, but I can honestly tell you that our stay and experience was a great one. We arrived on a Wednesday morning, and breezed through check-in. Since the hotel is fairly new, they are still training the staff, so you might have to exercise some patience; but the people that took care of us were very friendly. I also asked for an upgrade to a room with a better view, and they were more than happy to provide to us - and even recommended that we take a room with a North view of the Strip. Upon getting into the room, it was all it was supposed to be - generally clean, no broken amentities, etc. The view of the Effiel Tower and northern Strip was great! The five flat-panel TVs, as well as the floor-to-ceiling projection screen , were awesome - we took some time away from the tables to watch some MLB and NHL, and it felt like we were sitting right up against the boards. The room did have a washer/dryer combo as well, but it does use steam clean technology, so make sure you aren't washing jeans. Also, we did receive maid service daily here - beds were made, towels refreshed, and garbages emptied - unlike some of the other previous reviews. Pool was clean, and never too crowded, even when the weather was 85-90 degrees every day. Finally, the walk to the casino from the hotel is relatively short - only about 5 minutes through the mall. Considering the amount of walking you will likley do in Vegas anyway, it's really not that bad. Plus, the hotel is in a great spot on the Strip - centrally located - which gives you walking options in either direction. Only a few minor issues to bring up during our stay: 1. As mentioned above, room was generally clean. We did find one toothpaste cap under one of the dressers, but otherwise fine. The hallway carpets sometimes appeared dirty, but I think that is mostly due to the dark colors in the carpeting. 2. There was a slight mixup upon checkin with the name on the room (it was registered under one of my buddies' names, even though my cc was on the room already), but they found our reservation using the confirmation number I was given and apologized immediately for the confusion. 3. You are not allowed to bring your own drinks to the pool - we were turned away one day, and told that we had to buy drinks from the pool bar only - $7 cans of beer, $12-15 drinks. 4. The water pressure in the showers were non-existant, so prepare accordingly. The water pressure in the sinks and tubs were fine, though. 5. If you are checking in on the weekend (Friday/Saturday), be prepared to wait - the lines were extremely long when we walked through the lobby. Overall, we had a great experience at the PH Towers - it's a great value for the price, and the location can't be beat. Looking forward to booking again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Liked alot!”
Reviews.Author: Scott7301
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried from reading some of the reviews on this property,But once my fiance and i arrived we had zero issues.I originaly had a studio sweet booked,but was upgraded to a one bedroom at no additonal cost,room was very nice,clean and looked like it had hardly been stayed in.Had a 42 inch flat screen tv in the living room and bedroom,nice leather couch with a hide a bed,comfortable king size bed with 7 pillows,large bathroom,and a nice kitchen with mini fridge,dishwasher,convection microwave and a full set of dishes!Loved the push button blinds,and the floor to ceiling windows.Had a decent view,was on the 28th floor with a partial view of the Bellagios foutains.Customer service was very good,and was never pressured into a time share purchase tour.Great pool area and lobby,and not a very far walk to the strip,or PH casino,great food and shopping at Miracle Mile Mall.I will be staying here anytime i return to Vegas and would recommened to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superior View; Inferior Room”
Reviews.Author: brenagain
Reviews.Content: A three word summary of this hotel is "bait and switch." Why did I choose this hotel? After staying at the Signature, I wanted a better view with all the kitchen and space of the aforementioned property. I did some research on the hotel by reading trip-advisor reviews and searching the PH Towers web page. However, I did not catch some of the details that mattered to me as the wife of the man on a business trip. Summary of stay Arrival: This experience was a let down from the beginning. We drove up the awkward approach to the valet and the staff just stood there. We got out of the car and started to walk toward the valet staff (four people standing at the desk and no other cars around) and one man took a couple steps toward us, stopped, and commented "are you staying here?" After we said "we are trying to check in," this man started to walk toward us. I thought that we may not have had a new enough SUV to get appropriate attention. The odd thing about the arrival was that the valet staff was just talking among themselves and seemed to view our automobile as a non-entity until we started to approach them on foot (which meant we had already been out of the car and opening the back doors before we started to walk toward the valet staff). The Room (so much to say): On the negative side, I didn't catch the fact that all suites are not as described in the main page on room descriptions. The main page claims that King Suites have a separate shower and spa tub. However, my room as a single jacuzzi tub that is the shower (see photo). The photos I saw show a double jacuzzi tub and my room has a single jacuzzi tub (customer service says no rooms have double jacuzzi tubs). I didn't catch the fact that the upscale stainless steel appliances in the room do not include a toaster and a blender (when I asked, the first time, for the toaster and blender, I was told that if my room didn't have these appliances, I wouldn't get them. Toasters and blenders were only in time share rooms. HOwever, when I went to the front desk, I was told that a request for these appliances would be put into the system but no guarantee). Before bed - around 10pm, I got the toaster and blender (which I use). I didn't see that the "kitchenette" is really a glorified wet bar with a smaller than the bathroom sink. Although the room has a dishwasher, I feel guilty using it for five dishes but I have to because I don't have another way to do dishes due to the tiny sink. I didn't catch the fact that the room is smaller than the other aforementioned hotel and really is the same size at a hotel room at the Las Vegas Hilton. I didn't catch the fact that the pillows are all foam. I almost always get one feather pillow or a really flat pillow at the hotels we stay in. In this hotel, there were many pillows but all foam and rather thick. I called and requested a feather/down pillow but got none despite being told that I would get that down pillow within a few minutes. Moreover, when we walked into the room, it smelled like a chemical. I can't identify the smell exactly but it kinda made me feel ill the whole night. The smell was so bad, for me, that I wanted to leave the room as soon as possible. In fact, we did leave the room soon after arriving and stayed gone for hours. When we came back, the smell was still there and it wasn't until the next day that I adjusted to the smell and felt okay. There is a strange humming noise coming through the air system that makes the room sound like an airplane in take-off. Given we are on the 52nd floor, I haven't been in a high rise business tower that continually sounded like a plane in take-off, with that high pitched hum that gains intensity as the plane accelerates, and it was a bit disturbing because I started thinking about 9/11 when trying to fall asleep due to the air-system noise and the background plane noise from the airport. I actually thought that this hotel is high enough to get hit by a plane from the airport - should something go wrong with a plane. I have never had any fear thoughts in high rise hotels anywhere in the U.S. or Europe. Also, there are no dresser drawers for our clothes and no closet kit in the closet so we can't put away clothes. Even a typical hotel room has a dresser for clothes. We have a desk and a couple drawers in the nigh stands. These little things about the room matter and I don't want to stay here again and my neck hurts after not getting a flatter pillow. On the positive side, the bed is comfortable. The view is spectacular. The carpet is nice. The room is decorated nicely with swank artwork. Although we have an adjoining door, the room is quiet and I only heard a few doors slamming last night. The Customer Service: The customer service is not good. I read someone, on tripadvisor, write that the customer service staff had a snobbish European attitude and I'd say that this vibe is alive and well among most of the front desk staff and the phone staff. When I first called "anything/anytime" line, I was told to call the operator and ask for a supervisor to get answers to my questions about the room. When I called the supervisor, which in itself was an intimidating call because I didn't want to call a supervisor to ask basic questions about the room, I concluded that the appliances I needed weren't going to be an option because I wasn't a time share owner. When I verbalized my conclusion to the "supervisor" by stating "so, I guess if the room doesn't already have the toaster and blender, I'm not getting these things" and the reply was "this is correct." However, when I went to the front desk and asked for these appliances and explained someone on the phone was quite rude when I asked about these appliances, a friendly woman said she would put in the request. One out of five interactions with the guest services here was good. The View: The reason why I chose this hotel was because the room at the aforementioned property, which was supposed to be a strip view, looked at the PH Towers and I figured the view to be had was from the PH Towers. I was not let down by the view. I did ask for a room with a view of the Belagio fountains and was told "there are no rooms with a view of the strip from this hotel." Then I was asked which side of Vegas I wanted to see from my room. I chose to get a room with a view of North Las Vegas. When I got to my room, it wasn't dark and I did see that I could see some water from Belagio and the Paris Eiffel Tower. I was surprised, when we got back to the room after sun-down, to see that we had a great view of the Belagio fountain and water show and an expansive panoramic vegas view from the 52nd floor. Fabulous view and I can't say enough about the view but I wouldn't have guessed the view was special based upon the front desk clerk with a crappy attitude and I didn't see how special the view was until sun-down.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you can put up with hit and miss service.”
Reviews.Author: TheCameleer
Reviews.Content: Tidy rooms and fantastic views from our 51st floor room. We had great service at the front desk on check in and check out (as did friends of ours) but consistently poor service from the concierge during our stay. Our overall impresssion of the hotel was positive but we felt it was not as polished or as organised as it should be. Competitive room rates ensured we were not too unhappy with our lot and we would recommend to friends (conditionally).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Johnny00Drama
Reviews.Content: First, background info: 26 year old male, annual trip to Vegas with the guys, although this year it turned out to only be two of us. Last year we stayed at Encore but wanted something more centrally located this time around. To be fair, we received an unbelievable package price through Orbitz for this property. I was in no terms expecting what we received at Encore last year, either in service, room quality, amenities, etc. We paid a total of $348 for 3 nights, including tax, for a 1 bedroom suite and full size car through Hertz for 4 days. I could have spent $50 more and stayed at Vdara or Encore, but we wanted to try something new and the 1 bedroom suites looked pretty cool. Check -in: We arrived at the hotel around 10:30 am on a Thursday morning and were allowed to check-in early, +1. It should be noted that there was only 1 check-in person working at this time, and never more than 2 that I could see during my stay. This meant extremely long lines for those checking in during peak times, which pretty much started Thursday afternoon and continued through Saturday. Room: We were given our 1 Bedroom Suite on the 30th floor looking North, with a view of the Eiffle Tower, plus some parking garages, etc. Room was probably 800 sq. ft. by my accounts. Overall, the room looks really, really cool, but is done on the cheap for sure. The kitchen was nice, stocked with dirty glasses, plates, and silverware, didn't bother to call for them to be cleaned since we wouldn't use them. The living room had a very large, and comfortable red sectional sofa, which also had a sofa sleeper. Our room also included a washer/dryer combo, with supplies for it in the kitchen, but we never used it. In room safe had plenty of room for my Macbook Pro (15.4 inch) Canon G11, money, wallets, etc. The bed was comfortable by my standards, not up to Wynn/Encore, but better than I expected. The sheets and pillow cases, however, were extremely low quality. The pillow cases felt almost like sandpaper and looked like they had been bought used, in bulk, from the GoodWill. The HD projector was pretty cool, until it broke, at which point they offered to move us but we declined as we had several other Plasmas in the room. The door to the master bedroom was also broken, i.e. not put on correctly, and would not shut. It took two maintenance guys to resolve this, and took them about an hour to arrive after calling. These guys are being working to death, so go easy on em. The whole time they were trying to fix our projector/bedroom door, both of their radios were going off non-stop for fixes in other rooms. For close to 40 minutes we started to understand how cheap the finish work was on this place as the calls just kept coming, and coming, and coming, to fix stuff in guest’s rooms. Based on my travel history, I will typically stay in a higher end property due to nicer mattresses, shower, service, and property amenities. This room met my needs in almost every area, except for the shower. At first glance, you are wowed. It is a hugely beautiful, tiled, walk in shower with a rain-plate head and sitting bench which may have been able to fit my extremely petite girlfriend, but even she would have struggled. They must have the most restrictive flow regulator on these heads as the water barely came out at a trickle. The faucet emitted about 4-5x the water pressure of the shower, so, ladies, I suggest doing your hair in the sink if you don’t want to take a 45-60 minute shower here. Pool: really loved the pool area, great chairs, and sun almost all day. Music volume was nice and not too in your face like some properties. They also had a nice selection of cabanas, which had their own Plasma, but I did not inquire about the price. Parking: Garage is attached to this property, unlike the Planet Hollywood, with a direct side entrance to the PH Towers. This made for quick in/out during our stay. The valet service here was also quick and friendly, although they will not let you call down in advance for your vehicle (turned out to be a moot point however since they were really fast in bringing the car around). As my review is titled, this is really a mixed-bag property. If you want a really large, and superficially nice room mid-strip, with a great pool and very little customer service, this is for you. If you are comparing this property to Venetian/Palazzo, Wynn/Encore, TheHotel, etc, it does not stack up. If you can get it for a steal like we did, however, its faults are easy to overlook for a short 3-4 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: travel10Canada
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We were upgraded to King suite the room was huge, loved having the extra space and kitchen was great for snacks. More of a younger hip crowd staying at this place. Would stay again really liked the lobby and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on strip nice Studio unit Dont expect perfection but PH towers worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: reefxyz
Reviews.Content: Bad things: -my studio had a connecting door so the wall was thin and could hear my neighbors easily, can hear them playing drinking games and blasting music and coughing etc. maybe different unit without connecting door could be quieter. -black toilet doesnt flush well you'll need at least one courtesy flush, -water pressure in shower is weak but rain shower head would be good if pressure was better, -cleanliness is good but not immaculate some hard water stains in bathroom smudges here and there but nothing major, daily housekeeping service may be hard to get if you wake up too late -my dishwasher was never used before so it still had the pieces of styrofoam and cardboard inside as it was brand new i didnt use it anyway, -automatic blackout drape machine didnt fit the window correctly too long and didnt go up all the way but it did block out the sun. -bathroom amenities were unimpressive they also gave laundry detergent in the room but my studio unit had no laundry inside. -if you dont have a big budget maybe not the best choice shops and restaurants are not too cheap minimum bets in PH casino $15 blackjack -doesn't have TNT channel for watching NBA playoffs - sound system for Ipod is alarm clock -no luggage racks -no bathmats in bathroom used hand towels instead - glass cups provided should be washed before used normal rule for any hotel glassware -PH buffet line was 45 minutes to be seated every morning go early I guess... -some rooms must not be completed saw some other rooms on my floor without signs and wires hanging out of walls Good things: -excellent location within Miracle mile shops, short walk to many restaurants and PH casino -earl of sandwich $6 good sandwiches open 24 hours next to sportsbook -planet dailies restaurant at PH hotel good menu selection PF changs is good too take out if too long to wait -never had a taxi line, not usual long taxi lineup they press a button to put on a light that signals passing taxis -employees were nice, had reserved a studio lower floor, but was given higher floor no charge from friendly front desk agent, easy to get taxi and used bell storage. the concierge and guest services were ready to help if needed but I never talked to them -arrived early sunday morning to check in, only had to wait until 1pm for room to be ready -42 inch wall mounted flat screen about 45 TV channels with a few music channels -couch pulls out to a bed, a king bed studio room could easily sleep 2 couples. -bed couch carpet appliances everything was brand new -never harrassed for timeshare sales and concierge left silent prerecorded messages daily didnt visit them though - mostly younger crowd 20's-40's with many attractive people by the pool lobby and throughout PH casino as well -got a cheap rate through expedia paid at booking and since nothing was charged to the room checkout from TV phone or inperson took 30 seconds. -I didn't pay a resort fee even though I heard there was one. but $50 daily authorization on your card not an actual charge unless you do room charges -had basic dishes and utenils soap sponge and dish rack good for reheating leftovers or preparing microwave meals, ample size fridge went to nearby ABC store to get drinks and snacks -room actually had its own fire extinguisher first time Ive seen this maybe not a good idea if some drunks get their hands on it -towels and linens very fresh clean and soft -no hairs in bathroom - had a nice strip view facing north could see paris and part of bellagio fountain wynn golf course and saw some nice sunrises from my room -7 pillows! -shaving mirror inside shower and by sink -shower tub had some jets never used it though -lobby was very clean but room corridor was not that clean -automated do not disturb light -interactive TV can check room bill get weather information and hotel info -can earn Harrahs Total rewards credits at PH casino Overall its was good and if I can get a good price again under or around $100/night I would stay here as a first choice. I had a blast here and the location is excellent. I can see how there could be some bad reviews though, I seen other guests complaining about things but I after reading reviews before I wasn't expecting to have perfection anyways and had my expectations exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!!!!! Bad customer service! Will never stay again!”
Reviews.Author: wingkie
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed in the Towers for 3 nights. We were totally disappointed. pH Towers by Westgate is a timeshare property and is not designed to be operated as a hotel, therefore, the service was horrible and housekeeping was very inexperience! pH Tower does not live up to a 4* hotel expectation!!!!! Pros: 1. Good location (center of the strip) 2. pH Towers is closer to the parking structure unlike the pH hotel (you can even park on 3rd floor and take the side door to enter the Tower 3. Spacious Room Cons: 1. Bad housekeeping (our room was left unlocked after the service!!!!!! We called to front desk trying to report the case and were on the hold for 15 mins and nobody answer it. Front desk ignored our complain and transferred us to Security. Security then told us they will inform Housekeeping! THAT’S IT???? No apologies were made or whatsoever!!!!!!!) 2. Concierge and front desk never answer the calls. 3. The tower was opened in Dec 2009, however, cabinets were totally beat up already. They were either falling apart or missing a scew on the hinge. (see picture attached)

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: Desarae42
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to start. I have read reviews before I went on this trip because this hotel just opened. I was a little sacred because there were so bad one's. When I checked in there was maybe two people in line before I knew it i was checking in. It took maybe 10 min. lady was really nice. When I opened the door to the room the room was NOT clean? I was a little confused because it was only a one bed room. We found someone who worked there to help us because we were thinking we were in the wrong room but not it just was not clean. In 5 min the maid with the manager were in my room cleaning and asking if there was anything they could do. The maid really cleaned up and after she was done the room smelled like bleach. I found out that the front desk did not answer the phone but they had this anytime/anything bottom on the phone and they picked up fast. The walk to Plant hollywood really is not a far walk. Maybe 5 min if you walk the right way. if you walk all the way around it could take a good 15 min. But the Hotel does have taxi's that will pick you up at the hotel and take you where ever you want to go. I will be staying here every time i go to vegas!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: Enya
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom suite from April 16-18 and had a wonderful experience. The beds, sofas, and lounge chair are all very comfortable and I love the black out shades! Our room, 2334, has a great view of Paris' Eiffel Tower. We luckily missed the four hour wait to check in (whew!) and guest services were on the ball when we had a maintenance issue. We even got a late check out of 2pm. I did utitlize the kitchen for breakfast on Sunday (If you aren't a timeshare owner don't expect any dishes, pots, pans, utensils, glasses, etc. We got lucky and our kitchen was stocked but we were prepared in case it wasn't. And there is no oven but their microwave oven was confusing and I guess it could possibly act like an oven). We relaxed at the pool Saturday afternoon and one of the pool guys brought us 5 lounge chairs since we couldn't find any open ones. I will definitely stay here again and am already thinking of coming back in September!

Reviews.Title: “What are you guys talking about, this place was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Big-Jones
Reviews.Content: We arrived and I was greeted by a guy with a clipboard while I was waiting in line. He highlighted my name and moved on, I appreciated this courtesey..what if I was in the wrong line? After a very fast check in process I walked into the most amazing room I've ever seen. I felt like a high roller. 2 bedrooms off of a main room. This place was HUGE with a great view. We were there for a bachelor party. This room slept 6 with no problem and would easily sleep more. Watching the masters on a massive HD projector can't be topped.. I can see this place in a few years needing some serious help because it isn't very old and a few issues came up (missing cabinet in the kitchen, toilet was a little testy) but hey THIS IS VEGAS not the ritz carlton in Park City. I go to vegas at least 2-3 times per year and you can guarantee I'm staying here every time. Perfect location, unbelievable prices and HUGE rooms. I certainly can look over a broken handle or a little slow response for this kind of room at this price. I wasn't asked about a time share once the whole time we were there either. I acutally expected it and didn't get it. It was a little chilly by the pool but service was fast and very nice. The cabanas will be great when the season comes.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to love it, but it missed the mark”
Reviews.Author: amadowns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a 1 bedroom king suite with a fantastic view of the strip. The room was clean and nice and would be great with the exception of a few issues I just can't get past. There were no welcome or instruction materials on how to use any of the amenities - had trouble getting dryer to unlock my clothes, the projector was awesome, it just took a long time to figure out how to use it with the remotes (one of which didn't work on any of the TVs). Room service is only available through the TV which was temperamental and the toilet didn't flush well... at all. I realized these were likely issues that come with a new property, so they aren't a big deal in the whole scheme of things. Upon check-in we were waiting in line with several other guests and a gentleman from guest services walked up to us, no one else, and asked us if we were checking in. "Yes" I smiled! He asked for our name and I gave it to him, while he looked back at my husband (who is sometimes mistaken for an NBA player). He found my name on his list and said thank you. He then promptly walked away not help us, or anyone else who was in line. As he shifted back in his guest services chair, he whispered something to the other people he worked with that were standing around the table and carried on at his empty guest services desk people watching. Are you kidding me? We evidently aren't VIP's, thanks for the reminder. This didn't just put us off, but those around us waiting too. The pool is sub-par for Vegas, the toilet paper was sandpaper and Suave would have been an improvement over the shampoo & conditioner provided, which guests come to rely on with today's TSA restrictions on liquids/gels. PH Towers went cheap, and it shows. I would not recommend paying full price for a room here - discounted rates are even tough to justify. I really wanted to love it, I'm a reasonable person, they just have some work to do. They have a good canvas to work off of perhaps they'll figure it out before they earn a bad reputation. Building the second tower might depend on it.

Reviews.Title: “PH Towers.......Great location, nice property........But customer service needs work!”
Reviews.Author: JDBROWNSUGA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PH Westgate Towers by myself April 23-26th. I know the property is a few months old and you would think the kinks would have been worked out by now. When I checked in I was not told anything about the property. I had to ask about the pool and other amenities. My room was on the 52nd floor. As I exited the elevator and walked to the very end of the hallway I noticed that the carpets needed vacuuming. There was also a plate with a serving of ranch dressing on it, which remained there until Monday AM when I checked out. Gross! My room was nice but my automatic shades were broken. I called to have someone fix them but that never happened my entire stay, even after asking several times. The bathroom sink drained extremely slowly. I asked for that to be fixed as well but of course no one ever came. I did have housekeeping everyday but all they did was make up my bed and wipe down the bathroom counter. They never vacuumed or emptied my trash. I had to put my trash can in the hallway for it to be emptied. The beds and pillows were too hard for my liking. But there was a mini fridge, dishwasher, microwave and dishes in the room. That was a great plus! The location of the hotel is great! And the easy access to the Miracle Miles Shops is unbeatable. There is free wifi at the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf inside the Shops. The pool was nice as well. It seemed as though it never got shaded. They play music and have a bar where a daiquiri is $10. I did see people bring in their own drinks that were purchased at the Fat Tuesdays in the Shops. Those frozen drinks are larger, stronger and cheaper. A taxi to the airport during no traffic was $10 and the taxi and valet attendants are very nice. Overall the property is nice and is in a great location…..BUT the service is terrible!!!!! This is a time share property so I don’t know if that has something to do with it or not. I’ve stayed at a number of properties on the strip (Monte Carlo, Treasure Island, Riviera, Luxor, Trump, etc.) and they all have some minor issues. I would probably return to PH because of the location and suites but hopefully by then they improve their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Visited during Grand Openig; Great Location, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: aas6681
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I stayed at PH Towers over New Year's eve weekend, which was the weekend of the hotels opening. Overall, the experience was good. Pros: Location-Center strip; Can't beat it! Room- Overall the room was nice: big windows, comfortable bed, nice furniture, nice decor Hotel Common Areas- Pool, Lobby, Hallways, Bar area all sleek, modern, and tasteful Price-Great Value for the location and the room quality Cons: Service- After calling the front desk a number of times on our first night regarding house keeping, they finally sent someone up around Midnight! Front Desk-Disorganized and Chaotic Bathrooms: Little small, and not a fan of black toilets I want to give this place another try given that I visited the first weekend it opened. Stay tuned for another review...

Reviews.Title: “Just don't ask for anything”
Reviews.Author: vacationx2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well appointed. The one bedroom Kind suite had everything i needed. There was a large projector TV but the sound system was just pieced together, and rather sad. The staff at the front desk was polite, but not very knowlegable. When I asked the man at guest services to confirm my flight was ontime prior to departure, he said he could not. I asked where that service was provided and he just stared at me blankly. I eventually walked him through the internet and how to use the website at United.com. He acted very put out the entire time. Do not call for a wake up call, they are late, and act very put out to provide the service. Also, don't expect housekeeping to show up, or even do anything with a sence of urgency. My room was never cleaned during my stay. By they time they were getting around to it (after 5PM) I was busy getting ready for the evening. Overall it was a very nice room, but the staff was very unwilling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms, great views, just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: cms531
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 night/4 day stay in Vegas - I booked through Priceline book your town price and ended up with this hotel. At first I was a little nervous about staying here b/c so many people said it was "so far" off the strip - well those people must weigh 500+ pounds because it was literally RIGHT off the strip! It was a short walk either through the mall or you could go out the side and then right now the street - it wasn't even a block away. The good: -Room was very large -Nice view -Was very dark and quiet at night which is exactly what my husband and I wanted for sleeping. -Right off strip but just far enough off that you get a little break from the hustle bustle -Connected to a great mall for shopping and food etc. -Casino is located in PH so just a 2 minute walk - I actually liked this the most b/c unlike most hotels on the strip when you walk through you hear the constant ding ding ding of the casino whereas here you only enter the casino when you actually want to gamble -Nice pool area -Amazingly comfortable bed!!!!!! Bad: -Check in took awhile which was a little annoying - they need more people working the front desk at peak times -Pool needs more chairs - they get taken so fast on the weekends -A lot of little kids in the pool area on the weekend - fine during the week though We didn't have any issues in which we needed extra service or anything so I can't comment on that but our room was always clean and we had a great stay. Also right now Harrah's is running a promo - for $30 you get access to all 7 of their buffets (PH, Rio, Paris, Caesar's, etc) for 24 hours...so basically we bought it one night at 8pm and used it for dinner, breakfast, lunch and then dinner again - all for only $30! Would strongly suggest doing that - great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelerlo
Reviews.Content: Room was GREAT! Word of advice make sure that when taking the taxi or shuttle that you advise you are staying at the Westgate Towers of Planet Hollywood otherwise you will get dropped off at the wrong hotel. Service desk agent who checked us in was far from giving a great customer experience she was rude and did not care to hear nothing I had to say without interuppting me. Check in time is 4pm I got there at noon as I had an early flight. When I went to check in she stated no rooms available but I could upgrade to a 1br ste for an addtl $50 night or I could leave my bags with the bell hop. I was ok with that but she was just rude about it so I requested a manger and he more than accomodated us by getting us into a room. I am will not let one rude service person ruin my stay but I do beleive that they need to probable show the video Give Them The Pickle which is a customer service video. The room was great my sister stayed at the Aria, another friend staed at the Venetian and the Palazzo and their room and ambiance could not compare Another complaint is that the projection tv did not work and was not repaired while I was there I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Was weary after reading some reviews but found PH Towers to be fine...”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_722
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a one bedroom suite and were quite pleased. I was expecting much worse based on prior reviews but was pleasantly surprised by the comfort, size and location. Pros: Location-nearly perfect. Size-the one bedroom suite was roomy and comfortable. Kitchen-very well equipped and the table was great. PH is definitely marketed for the young and hip crowd and I was concerned about possible hall noise and noisy neighbors. While in our room, we heard virtually no noise. No real cons, just some nit picky things: Valet was always full. A bit tacky. Fake palm trees and flowers in the lobby. Color scheme and decor in room were not to my liking but that is purely personal taste and did not take away from the comfort or functionality of the room. I absolutely hated the jacuzzi in the bedroom. Much better had they designed it to be included in the bathroom as opposed to 2 ft from the bed. The front desk staff could have been a little friendlier. Housekeeping was perfectly satisfactory as far as cleaning our suite, however the hallway carpet could use some serious attention. Horrible almost non usable complimentary toiletries. We liked it here very much. It wasn't a property we definitely HAVE to book when we come to Vegas, but if there's a good deal we certainly wouldn't hesitate!

HotelInfo.Name: Elara, a Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel - Center Strip
HotelInfo.Address: 80 E. Harmon Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89109 (Formerly Planet Hollywood Towers)
